Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֛ק שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בֶן־דָּוִ֖יד עַל־מַלְכוּת֑וֹ וַיהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַֽיְגַדְּלֵ֖הוּ לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: Solomon son of David took firm hold of his kingdom, for the L<small>ORD</small> his God was with him and made him exceedingly great.
Transliteration: vayitechazek shelomoh ven-daviyd al-malekhutvo vayhovah elohayv imvo vayegadelehu lemaelah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל לְשָׂרֵי֩ הָאֲלָפִ֨ים וְהַמֵּא֜וֹת וְלַשֹּׁפְטִ֗ים וּלְכֹ֛ל נָשִׂ֥יא לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל רָאשֵׁ֥י הָאָבֽוֹת׃
Translated: Solomon summoned all Israel—the officers of thousands and of hundreds, and the judges, and all the chiefs of all Israel, the heads of the clans.
Transliteration: vayomer shelomoh lekhׇl-yisherael lesharey haalafiym vehamevot velashofetiym ulekhol nashiy lekhׇl-yisherael rashey haavvot

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ וְכׇל־הַקָּהָ֣ל עִמּ֔וֹ לַבָּמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּגִבְע֑וֹן כִּֽי־שָׁ֣ם הָיָ֗ה אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה מֹשֶׁ֥ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Then Solomon, and all the assemblage with him, went to the shrine at Gibeon, for the Tent of Meeting, which Moses the servant of the L<small>ORD</small> had made in the wilderness, was there.
Transliteration: vayelekhu shelomoh vekhׇl-hakahal imvo lavamah asher vegivevon khiy-sham hayah ohel mvoed haElohim asher ashah mosheh eved-yehovah vamidevar

Hebrew: אֲבָ֗ל אֲר֤וֹן הָאֱלֹהִים֙ הֶעֱלָ֤ה דָוִיד֙ מִקִּרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֔ים בַּהֵכִ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּוִ֑יד כִּ֧י נָֽטָה־ל֛וֹ אֹ֖הֶל בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: (But the Ark of God David had brought up from Kiriath-jearim to the place which David had prepared for it; for he had pitched a tent for it in Jerusalem.)
Transliteration: aval arvon haElohim heelah daviyd mikireyat yeariym vahekhiyn lvo daviyd khiy natah-lvo ohel viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וּמִזְבַּ֣ח הַנְּחֹ֗שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ בְּצַלְאֵל֙ בֶּן־אוּרִ֣י בֶן־ח֔וּר שָׁ֕ם לִפְנֵ֖י מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּדְרְשֵׁ֥הוּ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה וְהַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: The bronze altar, which Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur had made, was also there before the Tabernacle of the L<small>ORD</small>, and Solomon and the assemblage resorted to it.
Transliteration: umizevach hanechoshet asher ashah vetsaleel ven-uriy ven-chur sham lifeney mishekhan yehovah vayidereshehu shelomoh vehakahal

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ שְׁלֹמֹ֨ה שָׁ֜ם עַל־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיַּ֧עַל עָלָ֛יו עֹל֖וֹת אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: There Solomon ascended the bronze altar before the L<small>ORD</small>, which was at the Tent of Meeting, and on it sacrificed a thousand burnt offerings.
Transliteration: vayaal shelomoh sham al-mizevach hanechoshet lifeney yehovah asher leohel mvoed vayaal alayv olvot alef

Hebrew: בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֔וּא נִרְאָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים לִשְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ שְׁאַ֖ל מָ֥ה אֶתֶּן־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: That night, God appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask, what shall I grant you?”
Transliteration: valayelah hahu nireah Elohim lishelomoh vayomer lvo sheal mah eten-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לֵאלֹהִ֔ים אַתָּ֗ה עָשִׂ֛יתָ עִם־דָּוִ֥יד אָבִ֖י חֶ֣סֶד גָּד֑וֹל וְהִמְלַכְתַּ֖נִי תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Solomon said to God, “You dealt most graciously with my father David, and now You have made me king in his stead.
Transliteration: vayomer shelomoh lelohiym atah ashiyta im-daviyd aviy chesed gadvol vehimelakhetaniy tachetayv

Hebrew: עַתָּה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים יֵֽאָמֵן֙ דְּבָ֣רְךָ֔ עִ֖ם דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑י כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ הִמְלַכְתַּ֔נִי עַל־עַ֕ם רַ֖ב כַּעֲפַ֥ר הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Now, O L<small>ORD</small> God, let Your promise to my father David be fulfilled; for You have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.
Transliteration: atah yehovah Elohim eiamen devarekha im daviyd aviy khiy atah himelakhetaniy al-am rav khaafar haarets

Hebrew: עַתָּ֗ה חׇכְמָ֤ה וּמַדָּע֙ תֶּן־לִ֔י וְאֵ֥צְאָ֛ה לִפְנֵ֥י הָעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה וְאָב֑וֹאָה כִּֽי־מִ֣י יִשְׁפֹּ֔ט אֶת־עַמְּךָ֥ הַזֶּ֖ה הַגָּדֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated: Grant me then the wisdom and the knowledge to lead this people, for who can govern Your great people?”
Transliteration: atah chׇkhemah umada ten-liy veetseah lifeney haam-hazeh veavvoah khiy-miy yishefot et-amekha hazeh hagadvol {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֣ים <small>׀</small> לִשְׁלֹמֹ֡ה יַ֣עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ הָיְתָ֨ה זֹ֜את עִם־לְבָבֶ֗ךָ וְלֹֽא־שָׁ֠אַ֠לְתָּ עֹ֣שֶׁר נְכָסִ֤ים וְכָבוֹד֙ וְאֵת֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ שֹׂנְאֶ֔יךָ וְגַם־יָמִ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים לֹ֣א שָׁאָ֑לְתָּ וַתִּֽשְׁאַל־לְךָ֙ חׇכְמָ֣ה וּמַדָּ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּשְׁפּוֹט֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִמְלַכְתִּ֖יךָ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: God said to Solomon, “Because you want this, and have not asked for wealth, property, and glory, nor have you asked for the life of your enemy, or long life for yourself, but you have asked for the wisdom and the knowledge to be able to govern My people over whom I have made you king,
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim <small></small> lishelomoh yaan asher hayetah zot im-levavekha velo-shaaleta osher nekhasiym vekhavvod veet nefesh shoneeykha vegam-yamiym raviym lo shaaleta vatisheal-lekha chׇkhemah umada asher tishefvot et-amiy asher himelakhetiykha alayv

Hebrew: הַחׇכְמָ֥ה וְהַמַּדָּ֖ע נָת֣וּן לָ֑ךְ וְעֹ֨שֶׁר וּנְכָסִ֤ים וְכָבוֹד֙ אֶתֶּן־לָ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ לֹא־הָ֣יָה כֵ֗ן לַמְּלָכִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְאַחֲרֶ֖יךָ לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־כֵּֽן׃
Translated: wisdom and knowledge are granted to you, and I grant you also wealth, property, and glory, the like of which no king before you has had, nor shall any after you have.”
Transliteration: hachׇkhemah vehamada natun lakhe veosher unekhasiym vekhavvod eten-lakhe asher lo-hayah khen lamelakhiym asher lefaneykha veachareykha lo yiheyeh-khen

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה לַבָּמָ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּגִבְעוֹן֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם מִלִּפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: From the shrine at Gibeon, from the Tent of Meeting, Solomon went to Jerusalem and reigned over Israel.
Transliteration: vayavo shelomoh lavamah asher-vegivevon yerushala͏im milifeney ohel mvoed vayimelokhe al-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֣ף שְׁלֹמֹה֮ רֶ֣כֶב וּפָרָשִׁים֒ וַֽיְהִי־ל֗וֹ אֶ֤לֶף וְאַרְבַּע־מֵאוֹת֙ רֶ֔כֶב וּשְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּנִּיחֵם֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב וְעִם־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Solomon assembled chariots and horsemen; he had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses that he stationed in the chariot towns and with the king in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayeesof shelomoh rekhev ufarashiym vayehiy-lvo elef veareva-mevot rekhev usheneym-ashar elef farashiym vayaniychem vearey harekhev veim-hamelekhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־הַכֶּ֧סֶף וְאֶת־הַזָּהָ֛ב בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם כָּאֲבָנִ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת הָאֲרָזִ֗ים נָתַ֛ן כַּשִּׁקְמִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־בַּשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: The king made silver and gold as plentiful in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars as plentiful as the sycamores in the Shephelah.
Transliteration: vayiten hamelekhe et-hakhesef veet-hazahav viyrushala͏im khaavaniym veet haaraziym natan khashikemiym asher-vashefelah larov

Hebrew: וּמוֹצָ֧א הַסּוּסִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִשְׁלֹמֹ֖ה מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וּמִקְוֵ֕א סֹחֲרֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ מִקְוֵ֥א יִקְח֖וּ בִּמְחִֽיר׃
Translated: Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and from Que; the king’s traders would buy them from Que at the market price.
Transliteration: umvotsa hasusiym asher lishelomoh mimitserayiim umikeve socharey hamelekhe mikeve yikechu vimechiyr

Hebrew: וַֽ֠יַּעֲל֠וּ וַיּוֹצִ֨יאוּ מִמִּצְרַ֤יִם מֶרְכָּבָה֙ בְּשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת כֶּ֔סֶף וְס֖וּס בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמֵאָ֑ה וְ֠כֵ֠ן לְכׇל־מַלְכֵ֧י הַחִתִּ֛ים וּמַלְכֵ֥י אֲרָ֖ם בְּיָדָ֥ם יוֹצִֽיאוּ׃
Translated: A chariot imported from Egypt cost 600 shekels of silver, and a horse 150. These in turn were exported by them to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of the Arameans.
Transliteration: vayaalu vayyvotsiyu mimitserayiim merekhavah veshesh mevot khesef vesus vachamishiym umeah vekhen lekhׇl-malekhey hachitiym umalekhey aram veyadam yvotsiyu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה לִבְנ֥וֹת בַּ֙יִת֙ לְשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וּבַ֖יִת לְמַלְכוּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then Solomon resolved to build a House for the name of the L<small>ORD</small> and a royal palace for himself.
Transliteration: vayomer shelomoh livenvot vayiit leshem yehovah uvayiit lemalekhutvo

Hebrew: וַיִּסְפֹּ֨ר שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה שִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ אִ֣ישׁ סַבָּ֔ל וּשְׁמוֹנִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ חֹצֵ֣ב בָּהָ֑ר וּמְנַצְּחִ֣ים עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: Solomon mustered 70,000 basket carriers and 80,000 quarriers in the hills, with 3,600 men supervising them.
Transliteration: vayisefor shelomoh shiveiym elef iysh saval ushemvoniym elef iysh chotsev vahar umenatsechiym aleyhem sheloshet alafiym veshesh mevot {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֶל־חוּרָ֥ם מֶלֶךְ־צֹ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עִם־דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֔י וַתִּֽשְׁלַֽח־ל֣וֹ אֲרָזִ֔ים לִבְנֽוֹת־ל֥וֹ בַ֖יִת לָשֶׁ֥בֶת בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Solomon sent this message to King Huram of Tyre, “In view of what you did for my father David in sending him cedars to build a palace for his residence—
Transliteration: vayishelach shelomoh el-churam melekhe-tsor lemor khaasher ashiyta im-daviyd aviy vatishelach-lvo araziym livenvot-lvo vayiit lashevet vvo

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֩ אֲנִ֨י בוֹנֶה־בַּ֜יִת לְשֵׁ֣ם ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֗י לְהַקְדִּ֣ישׁ ל֡וֹ לְהַקְטִ֣יר לְפָנָ֣יו קְטֹֽרֶת־סַמִּים֩ וּמַעֲרֶ֨כֶת תָּמִ֤יד וְעֹלוֹת֙ לַבֹּ֣קֶר וְלָעֶ֔רֶב לַשַּׁבָּתוֹת֙ וְלֶ֣חֳדָשִׁ֔ים וּֽלְמוֹעֲדֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לְעוֹלָ֖ם זֹ֥את עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: see, I intend to build a House for the name of the L<small>ORD</small> my God; I will dedicate it to Him for making incense offering of sweet spices in His honor, for the regular rows of bread, and for the morning and evening burnt offerings on sabbaths, new moons, and festivals, as is Israel’s eternal duty.
Transliteration: hineh aniy vvoneh-vayiit leshem yehovah elohay lehakediysh lvo lehaketiyr lefanayv ketoret-samiym umaarekhet tamiyd veolvot lavoker velaerev lashavatvot velechodashiym ulemvoadey yehovah eloheynu levolam zot al-yisherael

Hebrew: וְהַבַּ֛יִת אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י בוֹנֶ֖ה גָּד֑וֹל כִּֽי־גָד֥וֹל אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ מִכׇּל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The House that I intend to build will be great, inasmuch as our God is greater than all gods.
Transliteration: vehavayiit asher-aniy vvoneh gadvol khiy-gadvol eloheynu mikhׇl-haElohim

Hebrew: וּמִ֤י יַֽעֲצׇר־כֹּ֙חַ֙ לִבְנֽוֹת־ל֣וֹ בַ֔יִת כִּ֧י הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וּשְׁמֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לֹ֣א יְכַלְכְּלֻ֑הוּ וּמִ֤י אֲנִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶבְנֶה־לּ֣וֹ בַ֔יִת כִּ֖י אִם־לְהַקְטִ֥יר לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Who indeed is capable of building a House for Him! Even the heavens to their uttermost reaches cannot contain Him, and who am I that I should build Him a House—except as a place for making burnt offerings to Him?
Transliteration: umiy yaatsׇr-khocha livenvot-lvo vayiit khiy hashamayiim ushemey hashamayiim lo yekhalekheluhu umiy aniy asher eveneh-lvo vayiit khiy im-lehaketiyr lefanayv

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה שְֽׁלַֽח־לִ֣י אִישׁ־חָכָ֡ם לַעֲשׂוֹת֩ בַּזָּהָ֨ב וּבַכֶּ֜סֶף וּבַנְּחֹ֣שֶׁת וּבַבַּרְזֶ֗ל וּבָֽאַרְגְּוָן֙ וְכַרְמִ֣יל וּתְכֵ֔לֶת וְיֹדֵ֖עַ לְפַתֵּ֣חַ פִּתּוּחִ֑ים עִם־הַחֲכָמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר עִמִּי֙ בִּיהוּדָ֣ה וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵכִ֖ין דָּוִ֥יד אָבִֽי׃
Translated: Now send me a craftsman to work in gold, silver, bronze, and iron, and in purple, crimson, and blue yarn, and who knows how to engrave, alongside the craftsmen I have here in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom my father David provided.
Transliteration: veatah shelach-liy iysh-chakham laashvot vazahav uvakhesef uvanechoshet uvavarezel uvaaregevan vekharemiyl utekhelet veyodea lefatecha fituchiym im-hachakhamiym asher imiy viyhudah uviyrushala͏im asher hekhiyn daviyd aviy

Hebrew: וּֽשְׁלַֽח־לִי֩ עֲצֵ֨י אֲרָזִ֜ים בְּרוֹשִׁ֣ים וְאַלְגּוּמִּים֮ מֵֽהַלְּבָנוֹן֒ כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יָדַ֔עְתִּי אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ יֽוֹדְעִ֔ים לִכְר֖וֹת עֲצֵ֣י לְבָנ֑וֹן וְהִנֵּ֥ה עֲבָדַ֖י עִם־עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Send me cedars, cypress, and algum wood from the Lebanon, for I know that your servants are skilled at cutting the trees of Lebanon. My servants will work with yours
Transliteration: ushelach-liy atsey araziym vervoshiym vealegumiym mehalevanvon khiy aniy yadaetiy asher avadeykha yvodeiym likhervot atsey levanvon vehineh avaday im-avadeykha

Hebrew: וּלְהָכִ֥ין לִ֛י עֵצִ֖ים לָרֹ֑ב כִּ֥י הַבַּ֛יִת אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י בוֹנֶ֖ה גָּד֥וֹל וְהַפְלֵֽא׃
Translated: to provide me with a great stock of timber; for the House that I intend to build will be singularly great.
Transliteration: ulehakhiyn liy etsiym larov khiy havayiit asher-aniy vvoneh gadvol vehafele

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה לַֽחֹטְבִ֣ים לְֽכֹרְתֵ֣י הָעֵצִ֡ים נָתַ֩תִּי֩ חִטִּ֨ים ׀ מַכּ֜וֹת לַעֲבָדֶ֗יךָ כֹּרִים֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׂעֹרִ֕ים כֹּרִ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אָ֑לֶף וְיַ֗יִן בַּתִּים֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף וְשֶׁ֕מֶן בַּתִּ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: I have allocated for your servants, the wood-cutters who fell the trees, 20,000 kor of crushed wheat and 20,000 kor of barley, 20,000 bath of wine and 20,000 bath of oil.”
Transliteration: vehineh lachoteviym lekhoretey haetsiym natatiy chitiym makhvot laavadeykha khoriym esheriym elef usheoriym khoriym esheriym alef veyayiin vatiym esheriym elef veshemen vatiym esheriym alef {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר חוּרָ֤ם מֶלֶךְ־צֹר֙ בִּכְתָ֔ב וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה בְּאַהֲבַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ נְתָנְךָ֥ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Huram, king of Tyre, sent Solomon this written message in reply, “Because the L<small>ORD</small> loved His people, He made you king over them.”
Transliteration: vayomer churam melekhe-tsor vikhetav vayishelach el-shelomoh veahavat yehovah et-amvo netanekha aleyhem melekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ חוּרָם֒ בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַן֩ לְדָוִ֨יד הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ בֵּ֣ן חָכָ֗ם יוֹדֵ֙עַ֙ שֵׂ֣כֶל וּבִינָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְנֶה־בַּ֙יִת֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וּבַ֖יִת לְמַלְכוּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Huram continued, “Blessed is the L<small>ORD</small>, God of Israel, who made the heavens and the earth, who gave King David a wise son, endowed with intelligence and understanding, to build a House for the L<small>ORD</small> and a royal palace for himself.
Transliteration: vayomer churam varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael asher ashah et-hashamayiim veet-haarets asher natan ledaviyd hamelekhe ven chakham yvodea shekhel uviynah asher yiveneh-vayiit layhovah uvayiit lemalekhutvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שָׁלַ֧חְתִּי אִישׁ־חָכָ֛ם יוֹדֵ֥עַ בִּינָ֖ה לְחוּרָ֥ם אָבִֽי׃
Translated: Now I am sending you a skillful and intelligent man, my master Huram,
Transliteration: veatah shalachetiy iysh-chakham yvodea viynah lechuram aviy

Hebrew: בֶּן־אִשָּׁ֞ה מִן־בְּנ֣וֹת דָּ֗ן וְאָבִ֣יו אִישׁ־צֹרִ֡י יוֹדֵ֡עַ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת בַּזָּֽהָב־וּ֠בַכֶּ֠סֶף בַּנְּחֹ֨שֶׁת בַּבַּרְזֶ֜ל בָּאֲבָנִ֣ים וּבָעֵצִ֗ים בָּאַרְגָּמָ֤ן בַּתְּכֵ֙לֶת֙ וּבַבּ֣וּץ וּבַכַּרְמִ֔יל וּלְפַתֵּ֙חַ֙ כׇּל־פִּתּ֔וּחַ וְלַחְשֹׁ֖ב כׇּל־מַחֲשָׁ֑בֶת אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִנָּֽתֶן־לוֹ֙ עִם־חֲכָמֶ֔יךָ וְֽחַכְמֵ֔י אֲדֹנִ֖י דָּוִ֥יד אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translated: the son of a Danite woman, his father a Tyrian. He is skilled at working in gold, silver, bronze, iron, precious stones, and wood; in purple, blue, and crimson yarn and in fine linen; and at engraving and designing whatever will be required of him, alongside your craftsmen and the craftsmen of my lord, your father David.
Transliteration: ven-ishah min-venvot dan veaviyv iysh-tsoriy yvodea laashvot vazahav-uvakhesef vanechoshet vavarezel vaavaniym uvaetsiym vaaregaman vatekhelet uvavuts uvakharemiyl ulefatecha khׇl-fitucha velacheshov khׇl-machashavet asher yinaten-lvo im-chakhameykha vechakhemey adoniy daviyd aviykha

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה הַחִטִּ֨ים וְהַשְּׂעֹרִ֜ים הַשֶּׁ֤מֶן וְהַיַּ֙יִן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣ר אֲדֹנִ֔י יִשְׁלַ֖ח לַעֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: As to the wheat, barley, oil, and wine which my lord mentioned, let him send them to his servants.
Transliteration: veatah hachitiym vehasheoriym hashemen vehayayiin asher amar adoniy yishelach laavadayv

Hebrew: וַ֠אֲנַ֠חְנוּ נִכְרֹ֨ת עֵצִ֤ים מִן־הַלְּבָנוֹן֙ כְּכׇל־צׇרְכֶּ֔ךָ וּנְבִיאֵ֥ם לְךָ֛ רַפְסֹד֖וֹת עַל־יָ֣ם יָפ֑וֹ וְאַתָּ֛ה תַּעֲלֶ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: We undertake to cut down as many trees of Lebanon as you need, and deliver them to you as rafts by sea to Jaffa; you will transport them to Jerusalem.”
Transliteration: vaanachenu nikherot etsiym min-halevanvon khekhׇl-tsׇrekhekha uneviyem lekha rafesodvot al-yam yafvo veatah taaleh otam yerushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּסְפֹּ֣ר שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה כׇּל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הַגֵּירִים֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַחֲרֵ֣י הַסְּפָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְפָרָ֖ם דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑יו וַיִּמָּֽצְא֗וּ מֵאָ֤ה וַחֲמִשִּׁים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Solomon took a census of all the aliens who were in the land of Israel, besides the census taken by his father David, and they were found to be 153,600.
Transliteration: vayisefor shelomoh khׇl-haanashiym hageyriym asher veerets yisherael acharey hasefar asher sefaram daviyd aviyv vayimatseu meah vachamishiym elef usheloshet alafiym veshesh mevot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ מֵהֶ֜ם שִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ סַבָּ֔ל וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף חֹצֵ֣ב בָּהָ֑ר וּשְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת מְנַצְּחִ֖ים לְהַעֲבִ֥יד אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He made 70,000 of them basket carriers, and 80,000 of them quarriers, with 3,600 supervisors to see that the people worked.
Transliteration: vayaash mehem shiveiym elef saval ushemoniym elef chotsev vahar usheloshet alafiym veshesh mevot menatsechiym lehaaviyd et-haam

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣חֶל שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה לִבְנ֤וֹת אֶת־בֵּית־יְהֹוָה֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בְּהַר֙ הַמּ֣וֹרִיָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִרְאָ֖ה לְדָוִ֣יד אָבִ֑יהוּ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵכִין֙ בִּמְק֣וֹם דָּוִ֔יד בְּגֹ֖רֶן אׇרְנָ֥ן הַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: Then Solomon began to build the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where [the L<small>ORD</small>] had appeared to his father David, at the place which David had designated, at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Transliteration: vayachel shelomoh livenvot et-veyt-yehovah viyrushala͏im vehar hamvoriyah asher nireah ledaviyd aviyhu asher hekhiyn vimekvom daviyd vegoren ׇrenan hayevusiy

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּ֠חֶל לִבְנ֞וֹת בַּחֹ֤דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי֙ בַּשֵּׁנִ֔י בִּשְׁנַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֖ע לְמַלְכוּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He began to build on the second day of the second month of the fourth year of his reign.
Transliteration: vayachel livenvot vachodesh hasheniy vasheniy vishenat areva lemalekhutvo

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הוּסַ֣ד שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה לִבְנ֖וֹת אֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים הָאֹ֡רֶךְ אַמּ֞וֹת בַּמִּדָּ֤ה הָרִֽאשׁוֹנָה֙ אַמּ֣וֹת שִׁשִּׁ֔ים וְרֹ֖חַב אַמּ֥וֹת עֶשְׂרִֽים׃
Translated: These were the dimensions Solomon established for building the House of God: its length in cubits, by the former measure, was 60, and its breadth was 20.
Transliteration: veeleh husad shelomoh livenvot et-veyt haElohim haorekhe amvot vamidah harishvonah amvot shishiym verochav amvot esheriym

Hebrew: וְהָאוּלָ֡ם אֲשֶׁר֩ עַל־פְּנֵ֨י הָאֹ֜רֶךְ עַל־פְּנֵ֤י רֹֽחַב־הַבַּ֙יִת֙ אַמּ֣וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְהַגֹּ֖בַהּ מֵאָ֣ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֑ים וַיְצַפֵּ֥הוּ מִפְּנִ֖ימָה זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: The length of the porch in front [was equal] to the breadth of the House—20 cubits, and its height was 120. Inside he overlaid it with pure gold.
Transliteration: vehaulam asher al-feney haorekhe al-feney rochav-havayiit amvot esheriym vehagovah meah veesheriym vayetsafehu mifeniymah zahav tahvor

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ הַבַּ֣יִת הַגָּד֗וֹל חִפָּה֙ עֵ֣ץ בְּרוֹשִׁ֔ים וַיְחַפֵּ֖הוּ זָהָ֣ב ט֑וֹב וַיַּ֧עַל עָלָ֛יו תִּמֹרִ֖ים וְשַׁרְשְׁרֹֽת׃
Translated: The House itself he paneled with cypress wood. He overlaid it with fine gold and embossed on it palms and chains.
Transliteration: veet havayiit hagadvol chifah ets vervoshiym vayechafehu zahav tvov vayaal alayv timoriym vesharesherot

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֧ף אֶת־הַבַּ֛יִת אֶ֥בֶן יְקָרָ֖ה לְתִפְאָ֑רֶת וְהַזָּהָ֖ב זְהַ֥ב פַּרְוָֽיִם׃
Translated: He studded the House with precious stones for decoration; the gold was from Parvaim.
Transliteration: vayetsaf et-havayiit even yekarah letifearet vehazahav zehav farevayiim

Hebrew: וַיְחַ֨ף אֶת־הַבַּ֜יִת הַקֹּר֧וֹת הַסִּפִּ֛ים וְקִירוֹתָ֥יו וְדַלְתוֹתָ֖יו זָהָ֑ב וּפִתַּ֥ח כְּרוּבִ֖ים עַל־הַקִּירֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: He overlaid the House with gold—the beams, the thresholds, its walls and doors; he carved cherubim on the walls.
Transliteration: vayechaf et-havayiit hakorvot hasifiym vekiyrvotayv vedaletvotayv zahav ufitach kheruviym al-hakiyrvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ אֶת־בֵּֽית־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֔ים אׇרְכּ֞וֹ עַל־פְּנֵ֤י רֹֽחַב־הַבַּ֙יִת֙ אַמּ֣וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וְרׇחְבּ֖וֹ אַמּ֣וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֑ים וַיְחַפֵּ֙הוּ֙ זָהָ֣ב ט֔וֹב לְכִכָּרִ֖ים שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: He made the Holy of Holies: its length was [equal to] the breadth of the house—20 cubits, and its breadth was 20 cubits. He overlaid it with 600 talents of fine gold.
Transliteration: vayaash et-veyt-kodesh hakodashiym ׇrekhvo al-feney rochav-havayiit amvot esheriym verׇchevvo amvot esheriym vayechafehu zahav tvov lekhikhariym shesh mevot

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁקָ֛ל לְמִסְמְר֥וֹת לִשְׁקָלִ֖ים חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים זָהָ֑ב וְהָעֲלִיּ֖וֹת חִפָּ֥ה זָהָֽב׃
Translated: The weight of the nails was 50 shekels of gold; the upper chambers he overlaid with gold.
Transliteration: umishekal lemisemervot lishekaliym chamishiym zahav vehaaliyyvot chifah zahav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ בְּבֵֽית־קֹ֤דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים֙ כְּרוּבִ֣ים שְׁנַ֔יִם מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה צַעֲצֻעִ֑ים וַיְצַפּ֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: He made two sculptured cherubim in the Holy of Holies, and they were overlaid with gold.
Transliteration: vayaash veveyt-kodesh hakodashiym kheruviym shenayiim maasheh tsaatsuiym vayetsafu otam zahav

Hebrew: וְכַנְפֵי֙ הַכְּרוּבִ֔ים אׇרְכָּ֖ם אַמּ֣וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֑ים כְּנַ֨ף הָאֶחָ֜ד לְאַמּ֣וֹת חָמֵ֗שׁ מַגַּ֙עַת֙ לְקִ֣יר הַבַּ֔יִת וְהַכָּנָ֤ף הָאַחֶ֙רֶת֙ אַמּ֣וֹת חָמֵ֔שׁ מַגִּ֕יעַ לִכְנַ֖ף הַכְּר֥וּב הָאַחֵֽר׃
Translated: The outspread wings of the cherubim were 20 cubits across: one wing 5 cubits long touching one wall of the House, and the other wing 5 cubits long touching the wing of the other cherub;
Transliteration: vekhanefey hakheruviym ׇrekham amvot esheriym khenaf haechad leamvot chamesh magaat lekiyr havayiit vehakhanaf haacheret amvot chamesh magiya likhenaf hakheruv haacher

Hebrew: וּכְנַ֨ף הַכְּר֤וּב הָאֶחָד֙ אַמּ֣וֹת חָמֵ֔שׁ מַגִּ֖יעַ לְקִ֣יר הַבָּ֑יִת וְהַכָּנָ֤ף הָאַחֶ֙רֶת֙ אַמּ֣וֹת חָמֵ֔שׁ דְּבֵקָ֕ה לִכְנַ֖ף הַכְּר֥וּב הָאַחֵֽר׃
Translated: one wing of the other [cherub] 5 cubits long extending to the other wall of the House, and its other wing 5 cubits long touching the wing of the first cherub.
Transliteration: ukhenaf hakheruv haechad amvot chamesh magiya lekiyr havayiit vehakhanaf haacheret amvot chamesh devekah likhenaf hakheruv haacher

Hebrew: כַּנְפֵי֙ הַכְּרוּבִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה פֹּרְשִׂ֖ים אַמּ֣וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֑ים וְהֵ֛ם עֹמְדִ֥ים עַל־רַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם וּפְנֵיהֶ֥ם לַבָּֽיִת׃ {ס}
Translated: The wingspread of these cherubim was thus 20 cubits across, and they were standing up facing the House.
Transliteration: khanefey hakheruviym haeleh foreshiym amvot esheriym vehem omediym al-rageleyhem ufeneyhem lavayiit {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ אֶת־הַפָּרֹ֔כֶת תְּכֵ֥לֶת וְאַרְגָּמָ֖ן וְכַרְמִ֣יל וּב֑וּץ וַיַּ֥עַל עָלָ֖יו כְּרוּבִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: He made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarn and fine linen, and he worked cherubim into it.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hafarokhet tekhelet vearegaman vekharemiyl uvuts vayaal alayv kheruviym {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַשׂ לִפְנֵ֤י הַבַּ֙יִת֙ עַמּוּדִ֣ים שְׁנַ֔יִם אַמּ֕וֹת שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְחָמֵ֖שׁ אֹ֑רֶךְ וְהַצֶּ֥פֶת אֲשֶׁר־עַל־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ אַמּ֥וֹת חָמֵֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: At the front of the House he made two columns 35 cubits high; the capitals on top of them were 5 cubits high.
Transliteration: vayaash lifeney havayiit amudiym shenayiim amvot sheloshiym vechamesh orekhe vehatsefet asher-al-roshvo amvot chamesh {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ שַׁרְשְׁרוֹת֙ בַּדְּבִ֔יר וַיִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָעַמֻּדִ֑ים וַיַּ֤עַשׂ רִמּוֹנִים֙ מֵאָ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֖ן בַּֽשַּׁרְשְׁרֽוֹת׃
Translated: He made chainwork in the inner Sanctuary and set it on the top of the columns; he made a hundred pomegranates and set them into the chainwork.
Transliteration: vayaash shareshervot vadeviyr vayiten al-rosh haamudiym vayaash rimvoniym meah vayiten vashareshervot

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קֶם אֶת־הָֽעַמּוּדִים֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַהֵיכָ֔ל אֶחָ֥ד מִיָּמִ֖ין וְאֶחָ֣ד מֵֽהַשְּׂמֹ֑אול וַיִּקְרָ֤א שֵׁם־[הַיְמָנִי֙] (הימיני) יָכִ֔ין וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשְּׂמָאלִ֖י בֹּֽעַז׃ {ס}
Translated: He erected the columns in front of the Great Hall, one to its right and one to its left; the one to the right was called Jachin, and the one to the left, Boaz.
Transliteration: vayakem et-haamudiym al-feney haheykhal echad miyamiyn veechad mehashemovl vayikera shem-[hayemaniy] (hymyny) yakhiyn veshem hashemaliy voaz {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח נְחֹ֔שֶׁת עֶשְׂרִ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אׇרְכּ֔וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה רׇחְבּ֑וֹ וְעֶ֥שֶׂר אַמּ֖וֹת קוֹמָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He made an altar of bronze 20 cubits long, 20 cubits wide, and 10 cubits high.
Transliteration: vayaash mizevach nechoshet esheriym amah ׇrekhvo veesheriym amah rׇchevvo veesher amvot kvomatvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם מוּצָ֑ק עֶ֣שֶׂר בָּ֠אַמָּ֠ה מִשְּׂפָת֨וֹ אֶל־שְׂפָת֜וֹ עָג֣וֹל ׀ סָבִ֗יב וְחָמֵ֤שׁ בָּֽאַמָּה֙ קוֹמָת֔וֹ וְקָו֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים בָּאַמָּ֔ה יָסֹ֥ב אֹת֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He made the sea of cast metal 10 cubits across from brim to brim, perfectly round; it was 5 cubits high, and its circumference was 30 cubits.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hayam mutsak esher vaamah mishefatvo el-shefatvo agvol saviyv vechamesh vaamah kvomatvo vekav sheloshiym vaamah yasov otvo saviyv

Hebrew: וּדְמ֣וּת בְּקָרִים֩ תַּ֨חַת ל֜וֹ סָבִ֤יב <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ סוֹבְבִ֣ים אֹת֔וֹ עֶ֚שֶׂר בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה מַקִּיפִ֥ים אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם סָבִ֑יב שְׁנַ֤יִם טוּרִים֙ הַבָּקָ֔ר יְצוּקִ֖ים בְּמֻצַקְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Beneath were figures of oxen set all around it, of 10 cubits, encircling the sea; the oxen were in two rows, cast in one piece with it.
Transliteration: udemut vekariym tachat lvo saviyv <small></small> saviyv svoveviym otvo esher vaamah makiyfiym et-hayam saviyv shenayiim turiym havakar yetsukiym vemutsaketvo

Hebrew: עוֹמֵ֞ד עַל־שְׁנֵ֧ים עָשָׂ֣ר בָּקָ֗ר שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה פֹנִ֣ים ׀ צָפ֡וֹנָה וּשְׁלוֹשָׁה֩ פֹנִ֨ים ׀ יָ֜מָּה וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ פֹּנִ֣ים נֶ֗גְבָּה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פֹּנִ֣ים מִזְרָ֔חָה וְהַיָּ֥ם עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְכׇל־אֲחֹרֵיהֶ֖ם בָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: It stood upon twelve oxen: three faced north, three faced west, three faced south, and three faced east, with the sea resting upon them; their haunches were all turned inward.
Transliteration: vomed al-sheneym ashar vakar sheloshah foniym tsafvonah ushelvoshah foniym yamah usheloshah foniym negevah usheloshah foniym mizerachah vehayam aleyhem milemaelah vekhׇl-achoreyhem vayetah

Hebrew: וְעׇבְי֣וֹ טֶ֔פַח וּשְׂפָתוֹ֙ כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה שְׂפַת־כּ֔וֹס פֶּ֖רַח שׁוֹשַׁנָּ֑ה מַחֲזִ֣יק בַּתִּ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים יָכִֽיל׃ {ס}
Translated: It was a handbreadth thick, and its brim was made like that of a cup, like the petals of a lily. It held 3,000 bath.
Transliteration: veׇveyvo tefach ushefatvo khemaasheh shefat-khvos ferach shvoshanah machaziyk vatiym sheloshet alafiym yakhiyl {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ כִּיּוֹרִים֮ עֲשָׂרָה֒ וַ֠יִּתֵּ֠ן חֲמִשָּׁ֨ה מִיָּמִ֜ין וַחֲמִשָּׁ֤ה מִשְּׂמֹאול֙ לְרׇחְצָ֣ה בָהֶ֔ם אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה הָעוֹלָ֖ה יָדִ֣יחוּ בָ֑ם וְהַיָּ֕ם לְרׇחְצָ֥ה לַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He made ten bronze lavers for washing; he set five on the right and five on the left; they would rinse off in them the parts of the burnt offering; but the sea served the priests for washing.
Transliteration: vayaash khiyyvoriym asharah vayiten chamishah miyamiyn vachamishah mishemovl lerׇchetsah vahem et-maasheh havolah yadiychu vam vehayam lerׇchetsah lakhohaniym vvo {s}

Hebrew: וַ֠יַּ֠עַשׂ אֶת־מְנֹר֧וֹת הַזָּהָ֛ב עֶ֖שֶׂר כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֑ם וַיִּתֵּן֙ בַּֽהֵיכָ֔ל חָמֵ֥שׁ מִיָּמִ֖ין וְחָמֵ֥שׁ מִשְּׂמֹֽאול׃ {ס}
Translated: He made ten lampstands of gold as prescribed, and placed them in the Great Hall, five on the right and five on the left.
Transliteration: vayaash et-menorvot hazahav esher khemishefatam vayiten vaheykhal chamesh miyamiyn vechamesh mishemovl {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שֻׁלְחָנוֹת֮ עֲשָׂרָה֒ וַיַּנַּח֙ בַּהֵיכָ֔ל חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה מִיָּמִ֖ין וַחֲמִשָּׁ֣ה מִשְּׂמֹ֑אול וַיַּ֛עַשׂ מִזְרְקֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב מֵאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: He made ten tables and placed them in the Great Hall, five on the right and five on the left. He made one hundred gold basins.
Transliteration: vayaash shulechanvot asharah vayanach vaheykhal chamishah miyamiyn vachamishah mishemovl vayaash mizerekey zahav meah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ חֲצַ֣ר הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים וְהָעֲזָרָ֖ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֑ה וּדְלָת֧וֹת לָעֲזָרָ֛ה וְדַלְתוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם צִפָּ֥ה נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: He built the court of the priests and the great court, and doors for the great court; he overlaid the doors with bronze.
Transliteration: vayaash chatsar hakhohaniym vehaazarah hagedvolah udelatvot laazarah vedaletvoteyhem tsifah nechoshet

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיָּ֗ם נָתַ֞ן מִכֶּ֧תֶף הַיְמָנִ֛ית קֵ֖דְמָה מִמּ֥וּל נֶֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: He set the sea on the right side, at the southeast corner.
Transliteration: veet-hayam natan mikhetef hayemaniyt kedemah mimul negevah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ חוּרָ֔ם אֶ֨ת־הַסִּיר֔וֹת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָק֑וֹת וַיְכַ֣ל (חירם) [חוּרָ֗ם] לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בְּבֵ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Huram made the pails, the shovels, and the basins. With that Huram completed the work he had undertaken for King Solomon in the House of God:
Transliteration: vayaash churam et-hasiyrvot veet-hayaiym veet-hamizerakvot vayekhal (chyrm) [churam] laashvot et-hamelakhah asher ashah lamelekhe shelomoh veveyt haElohim

Hebrew: עַמּוּדִ֣ים שְׁנַ֔יִם וְהַגֻּלּ֧וֹת וְהַכֹּתָר֛וֹת עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִ֖ים שְׁתָּ֑יִם וְהַשְּׂבָכ֣וֹת שְׁתַּ֔יִם לְכַסּ֗וֹת אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ גֻּלּ֣וֹת הַכֹּתָר֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: the two columns, the globes, and the two capitals on top of the columns; and the two pieces of network to cover the two globes of the capitals on top of the columns;
Transliteration: amudiym shenayiim vehagulvot vehakhotarvot al-rosh haamudiym shetayiim vehashevakhvot shetayiim lekhasvot et-shetey gulvot hakhotarvot asher al-rosh haamudiym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָרִמּוֹנִ֛ים אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת לִשְׁתֵּ֣י הַשְּׂבָכ֑וֹת שְׁנַ֨יִם טוּרִ֤ים רִמּוֹנִים֙ לַשְּׂבָכָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֔ת לְכַסּ֗וֹת אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ גֻּלּ֣וֹת הַכֹּתָר֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: the four hundred pomegranates for the two pieces of network, two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two globes of the capitals on top of the columns;
Transliteration: veet-harimvoniym areva mevot lishetey hashevakhvot shenayiim turiym rimvoniym lashevakhah haechat lekhasvot et-shetey gulvot hakhotarvot asher al-feney haamudiym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמְּכֹנ֖וֹת עָשָׂ֑ה וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּר֥וֹת עָשָׂ֖ה עַל־הַמְּכֹנֽוֹת׃
Translated: he made the stands and the lavers upon the stands;
Transliteration: veet-hamekhonvot ashah veet-hakhiyorvot ashah al-hamekhonvot

Hebrew: אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם אֶחָ֑ד וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֥ר שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֖ר תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: one sea with the twelve oxen beneath it;
Transliteration: et-hayam echad veet-havakar sheneym-ashar tachetayv

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠סִּיר֠וֹת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֤ים וְאֶת־הַמִּזְלָגוֹת֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כְּלֵיהֶ֔ם עָשָׂ֞ה חוּרָ֥ם אָבִ֛יו לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה נְחֹ֖שֶׁת מָרֽוּק׃
Translated: the pails, the shovels, and the bowls. And all the vessels made for King Solomon for the House of the L<small>ORD</small> by Huram his master were of burnished bronze.
Transliteration: veet-hasiyrvot veet-hayaiym veet-hamizelagvot veet-khׇl-kheleyhem ashah churam aviyv lamelekhe shelomoh leveyt yehovah nechoshet maruk

Hebrew: בְּכִכַּ֤ר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ יְצָקָ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בַּעֲבִ֖י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה בֵּ֥ין סֻכּ֖וֹת וּבֵ֥ין צְרֵדָֽתָה׃
Translated: The king had them cast in molds dug out of the earth, in the plain of the Jordan between Succoth and Zeredah.
Transliteration: vekhikhar hayareden yetsakam hamelekhe vaaviy haadamah veyn sukhvot uveyn tseredatah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לָרֹ֣ב מְאֹ֑ד כִּ֛י לֹ֥א נֶחְקַ֖ר מִשְׁקַ֥ל הַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
Translated: Solomon made a very large number of vessels; the weight of the bronze used could not be reckoned.
Transliteration: vayaash shelomoh khׇl-hakheliym haeleh larov meod khiy lo nechekar mishekal hanechoshet {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְאֵת֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֶ֨ת־הַשֻּׁלְחָנ֔וֹת וַעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִֽים׃
Translated: And Solomon made all the furnishings that were in the House of God: the altar of gold; the tables for the bread of display;
Transliteration: vayaash shelomoh et khׇl-hakheliym asher veyt haElohim veet mizevach hazahav veet-hashulechanvot vaaleyhem lechem hafaniym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמְּנֹר֞וֹת וְנֵרֹֽתֵיהֶ֗ם לְבַעֲרָ֧ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֛ט לִפְנֵ֥י הַדְּבִ֖יר זָהָ֥ב סָגֽוּר׃
Translated: the lampstands and their lamps, to burn as prescribed in front of the inner Sanctuary, of solid gold;
Transliteration: veet-hamenorvot veneroteyhem levaaram khamishefat lifeney hadeviyr zahav sagur

Hebrew: וְהַפֶּ֧רַח וְהַנֵּר֛וֹת וְהַמֶּלְקַחַ֖יִם זָהָ֑ב ה֖וּא מִכְל֥וֹת זָהָֽב׃
Translated: and the petals, lamps, and tongs, of purest gold;
Transliteration: vehaferach vehanervot vehamelekachayiim zahav hu mikhelvot zahav

Hebrew: וְהַֽמְזַמְּר֧וֹת וְהַמִּזְרָק֛וֹת וְהַכַּפּ֥וֹת וְהַמַּחְתּ֖וֹת זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר וּפֶ֣תַח הַ֠בַּ֠יִת דַּלְתוֹתָ֨יו הַפְּנִימִיּ֜וֹת לְקֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים וְדַלְתֵ֥י הַבַּ֛יִת לַֽהֵיכָ֖ל זָהָֽב׃
Translated: the snuffers, basins, ladles, and fire pans, of solid gold; and the entrance to the House: the doors of the innermost part of the House, the Holy of Holies, and the doors of the Great Hall of the House, of gold.
Transliteration: vehamezamervot vehamizerakvot vehakhafvot vehamachetvot zahav sagur ufetach havayiit daletvotayv hafeniymiyyvot lekodesh hakodashiym vedaletey havayiit laheykhal zahav

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁלַם֙ כׇּל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה {ס} וַיָּבֵ֨א שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה אֶת־קׇדְשֵׁ֣י ׀ דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֗יו וְאֶת־הַכֶּ֤סֶף וְאֶת־הַזָּהָב֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים נָתַ֕ן בְּאֹצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: When all the work that King Solomon undertook for the House of the L<small>ORD</small> was completed, Solomon brought the things that his father David had consecrated—the silver, the gold, and the utensils—and deposited them in the treasury of the House of God.
Transliteration: vatishelam khׇl-hamelakhah asher-ashah shelomoh leveyt yehovah {s} vayave shelomoh et-kׇdeshey daviyd aviyv veet-hakhesef veet-hazahav veet-khׇl-hakheliym natan veotservot veyt haElohim {f}

Hebrew: אָז֩ יַקְהֵ֨יל שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה אֶת־זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְאֶת־כׇּל־רָאשֵׁ֨י הַמַּטּ֜וֹת נְשִׂיאֵ֧י הָאָב֛וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְֽהַעֲל֞וֹת אֶת־אֲר֧וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֛ה מֵעִ֥יר דָּוִ֖יד הִ֥יא צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Then Solomon convoked the elders of Israel—all the heads of the tribes and the ancestral chiefs of the Israelites—in Jerusalem, to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> from the City of David, that is, Zion.
Transliteration: az yakeheyl shelomoh et-zikeney yisherael veet-khׇl-rashey hamatvot neshiyey haavvot liveney yisherael el-yerushala͏im lehaalvot et-arvon veriyt-yehovah meiyr daviyd hiy tsiyyvon

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּהֲל֧וּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ כׇּל־אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֶּחָ֑ג ה֖וּא הַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
Translated: All the men of Israel assembled before the king at the Feast, in the seventh month.
Transliteration: vayikahalu el-hamelekhe khׇl-iysh yisherael vechag hu hachodesh hasheviiy

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ כֹּ֖ל זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ הַלְוִיִּ֖ם אֶת־הָאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: When all the elders of Israel had come, the Levites carried the Ark.
Transliteration: vayavou khol zikeney yisherael vayisheu haleviyim et-haarvon

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֤וּ אֶת־הָאָרוֹן֙ וְאֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְאֶת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֥י הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּאֹ֑הֶל הֶעֱל֣וּ אֹתָ֔ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: They brought up the Ark and the Tent of Meeting and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent—the Levite priests brought them up.
Transliteration: vayaalu et-haarvon veet-ohel mvoed veet-khׇl-kheley hakodesh asher vaohel heelu otam hakhohaniym haleviyim

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה וְכׇל־עֲדַ֧ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הַנּוֹעָדִ֥ים עָלָ֖יו לִפְנֵ֣י הָאָר֑וֹן מְזַבְּחִים֙ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יִסָּפְר֛וּ וְלֹ֥א יִמָּנ֖וּ מֵרֹֽב׃
Translated: Meanwhile, King Solomon and the whole community of Israel, who had gathered to him before the Ark, were sacrificing sheep and oxen in such abundance that they could not be numbered or counted.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe shelomoh vekhׇl-adat yisherael hanvoadiym alayv lifeney haarvon mezavechiym tson uvakar asher lo-yisaferu velo yimanu merov

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ הַ֠כֹּהֲנִ֠ים אֶת־אֲר֨וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶל־מְקוֹמ֛וֹ אֶל־דְּבִ֥יר הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים אֶל־תַּ֖חַת כַּנְפֵ֥י הַכְּרוּבִֽים׃
Translated: The priests brought the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Covenant to its place in the inner Sanctuary of the House, in the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim;
Transliteration: vayaviyu hakhohaniym et-arvon veriyt-yehovah el-mekvomvo el-deviyr havayiit el-kodesh hakodashiym el-tachat khanefey hakheruviym

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֤וּ הַכְּרוּבִים֙ פֹּרְשִׂ֣ים כְּנָפַ֔יִם עַל־מְק֖וֹם הָאָר֑וֹן וַיְכַסּ֧וּ הַכְּרוּבִ֛ים עַל־הָאָר֥וֹן וְעַל־בַּדָּ֖יו מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: for the cherubim had their wings spread out over the place of the Ark so that the cherubim covered the Ark and its poles from above.
Transliteration: vayiheyu hakheruviym foreshiym khenafayiim al-mekvom haarvon vayekhasu hakheruviym al-haarvon veal-vadayv milemaelah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּאֲרִ֘יכוּ֮ הַבַּדִּים֒ וַיֵּרָאוּ֩ רָאשֵׁ֨י הַבַּדִּ֤ים מִן־הָאָרוֹן֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַדְּבִ֔יר וְלֹ֥א יֵרָא֖וּ הַח֑וּצָה וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The poles projected beyond the Ark and the ends of the poles were visible from the front of the inner Sanctuary, but they could not be seen from the outside; and there they remain to this day.
Transliteration: vayaariykhu havadiym vayerau rashey havadiym min-haarvon al-feney hadeviyr velo eirau hachutsah vayehiy-sham ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: אֵ֚ין בָּאָר֔וֹן רַ֚ק שְׁנֵ֣י הַלֻּח֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּחֹרֵ֑ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ עִם־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: There was nothing inside the Ark but the two tablets that Moses placed [there] at Horeb, when the L<small>ORD</small> made [a Covenant] with the Israelites after their departure from Egypt.
Transliteration: eyn vaarvon rak sheney haluchvot asher-natan mosheh vechorev asher kharat yehovah im-veney yisherael vetsetam mimitserayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י בְּצֵ֥את הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים מִן־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כִּ֠י כׇּל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים הַֽנִּמְצְאִים֙ הִתְקַדָּ֔שׁוּ אֵ֖ין לִשְׁמ֥וֹר לְמַחְלְקֽוֹת׃
Translated: When the priests came out of the Sanctuary—all the priests present had sanctified themselves, without keeping to the set divisions—
Transliteration: vayehiy vetset hakhohaniym min-hakodesh khiy khׇl-hakhohaniym hanimetseiym hitekadashu eyn lishemvor lemachelekvot

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֣ם הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֣ים לְכֻלָּ֡ם לְאָסָ֡ף לְהֵימָ֣ן לִ֠ידֻת֠וּן וְלִבְנֵיהֶ֨ם וְלַאֲחֵיהֶ֜ם מְלֻבָּשִׁ֣ים בּ֗וּץ בִּמְצִלְתַּ֙יִם֙ וּבִנְבָלִ֣ים וְכִנֹּר֔וֹת עֹמְדִ֖ים מִזְרָ֣ח לַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְעִמָּהֶ֤ם כֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לְמֵאָ֣ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֔ים (מחצררים) [מַחְצְרִ֖ים] בַּחֲצֹצְרֽוֹת׃
Translated: all the Levite singers, Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun, their sons and their brothers, dressed in fine linen, holding cymbals, harps, and lyres, were standing to the east of the altar, and with them were 120 priests who blew trumpets.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim hameshoreriym lekhulam leasaf leheyman liydutun veliveneyhem velaacheyhem meluvashiym vuts vimetsiletayiim uvinevaliym vekhinorvot omediym mizerach lamizevecha veimahem khohaniym lemeah veesheriym (mchtsrrym) [machetseriym] vachatsotservot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כְ֠אֶחָ֠ד (למחצצרים) [לַמְחַצְּרִ֨ים] וְלַמְשֹׁרְרִ֜ים לְהַשְׁמִ֣יעַ קוֹל־אֶחָ֗ד לְהַלֵּ֣ל וּלְהֹדוֹת֮ לַיהֹוָה֒ וּכְהָרִ֣ים ק֠וֹל בַּחֲצֹצְר֨וֹת וּבִמְצִלְתַּ֜יִם וּבִכְלֵ֣י הַשִּׁ֗יר וּבְהַלֵּ֤ל לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב כִּ֥י לְעוֹלָ֖ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְהַבַּ֛יִת מָלֵ֥א עָנָ֖ן בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The trumpeters and the singers joined in unison to praise and extol the L<small>ORD</small>; and as the sound of the trumpets, cymbals, and other musical instruments, and the praise of the L<small>ORD</small>, “For He is good, for His steadfast love is eternal,” grew louder, the House, the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, was filled with a cloud.
Transliteration: vayehiy kheechad (lmchtstsrym) [lamechatseriym] velameshoreriym lehashemiya kvol-echad lehalel ulehodvot layhovah ukhehariym kvol vachatsotservot uvimetsiletayiim uvikheley hashiyr uvehalel layhovah khiy tvov khiy levolam chasedvo vehavayiit male anan veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכְל֧וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים לַעֲמ֥וֹד לְשָׁרֵ֖ת מִפְּנֵ֣י הֶעָנָ֑ן כִּֽי־מָלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The priests could not stay and perform the service because of the cloud, for the glory of the L<small>ORD</small> filled the House of God.
Transliteration: velo-yakhelu hakhohaniym laamvod lesharet mifeney heanan khiy-male khevvod-yehovah et-veyt haElohim {f}

Hebrew: אָ֖ז אָמַ֣ר שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אָמַ֔ר לִשְׁכּ֖וֹן בָּעֲרָפֶֽל׃
Translated:
Then Solomon declared:
“The LORD has chosen
To abide in a thick cloud;
Transliteration: az amar shelomoh yehovah amar lishekhvon vaarafel

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֛י בָּנִ֥יתִי בֵית־זְבֻ֖ל לָ֑ךְ וּמָכ֥וֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ֖ עוֹלָמִֽים׃
Translated:
I have built for You
A stately House,
And a place where You
May dwell forever.”
Transliteration: vaaniy vaniytiy veyt-zevul lakhe umakhvon leshivetekha volamiym

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֤ב הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶת־פָּנָ֔יו וַיְבָ֕רֶךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכׇל־קְהַ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עוֹמֵֽד׃
Translated: Then, as the whole congregation of Israel stood, the king turned and blessed the whole congregation of Israel.
Transliteration: vayasev hamelekhe et-fanayv vayevarekhe et khׇl-kehal yisherael vekhׇl-kehal yisherael vomed

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר בְּפִ֔יו אֵ֖ת דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑י וּבְיָדָ֥יו מִלֵּ֖א לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: He said,“Blessed is the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, who made a promise to my father David and fulfilled it. For He said,
Transliteration: vayomer varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael asher diver vefiyv et daviyd aviy uveyadayv mile lemor

Hebrew: מִן־הַיּ֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֣אתִי אֶת־עַמִּי֮ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ לֹא־בָחַ֣רְתִּֽי בְעִ֗יר מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לִהְי֥וֹת שְׁמִ֖י שָׁ֑ם וְלֹא־בָחַ֣רְתִּֽי בְאִ֔ישׁ לִהְי֥וֹת נָגִ֖יד עַל־עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: ‘From the time I brought My people out of the land of Egypt, I never chose a city from among all the tribes of Israel to build a House where My name might abide; nor did I choose anyone to be the leader of my people Israel.
Transliteration: min-hayyvom asher hvotsetiy et-amiy meerets mitserayiim lo-vacharetiy veiyr mikhol shivetey yisherael livenvot vayiit liheyvot shemiy sham velo-vacharetiy veiysh liheyvot nagiyd al-amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וָֽאֶבְחַר֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לִהְי֥וֹת שְׁמִ֖י שָׁ֑ם וָאֶבְחַ֣ר בְּדָוִ֔יד לִהְי֖וֹת עַל־עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But then I chose Jerusalem for My name to abide there, and I chose David to rule My people Israel.’
Transliteration: vaevechar viyrushala͏im liheyvot shemiy sham vaevechar vedaviyd liheyvot al-amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י עִם־לְבַ֖ב דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑י לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לְשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Now my father David had wanted to build a House for the name of the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy im-levav daviyd aviy livenvot vayiit leshem yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֔י יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָיָה֙ עִם־לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ לִבְנ֥וֹת בַּ֖יִת לִשְׁמִ֑י הֱֽטִיב֔וֹתָ כִּ֥י הָיָ֖ה עִם־לְבָבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But the L<small>ORD</small> said to my father David, ‘As for your wanting to build a House for My name, you do well to want that.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-daviyd aviy yaan asher hayah im-levavekha livenvot vayiit lishemiy hetiyvvota khiy hayah im-levavekha

Hebrew: רַ֣ק אַתָּ֔ה לֹ֥א תִבְנֶ֖ה הַבָּ֑יִת כִּ֤י בִנְךָ֙ הַיּוֹצֵ֣א מֵחֲלָצֶ֔יךָ הוּא־יִבְנֶ֥ה הַבַּ֖יִת לִשְׁמִֽי׃
Translated: However, you shall not build the House; your son, the issue of your loins, he shall build the House for My name.’
Transliteration: rak atah lo tiveneh havayiit khiy vinekha hayyvotse mechalatseykha hu-yiveneh havayiit lishemiy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קֶם יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־דְּבָר֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר וָאָק֡וּם תַּ֩חַת֩ דָּוִ֨יד אָבִ֜י וָאֵשֵׁ֣ב ׀ עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וָאֶבְנֶ֣ה הַבַּ֔יִת לְשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Now the L<small>ORD</small> has fulfilled the promise that He made. I have succeeded my father David and have ascended the throne of Israel, as the L<small>ORD</small> promised. I have built the House for the name of the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel,
Transliteration: vayakem yehovah et-devarvo asher diver vaakum tachat daviyd aviy vaeshev al-khise yisherael khaasher diver yehovah vaeveneh havayiit leshem yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וָאָשִׂ֥ים שָׁם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אָר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖ת עִם־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and there I have set the Ark containing the Covenant that the L<small>ORD</small> made with the Israelites.”
Transliteration: vaashiym sham et-haarvon asher-sham veriyt yehovah asher kharat im-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֗ד לִפְנֵי֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה נֶ֖גֶד כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּפְרֹ֖שׂ כַּפָּֽיו׃
Translated: Then, standing before the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> in front of the whole congregation of Israel, he spread forth his hands.
Transliteration: vayaamod lifeney mizevach yehovah neged khׇl-kehal yisherael vayiferosh khafayv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֨ה שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה כִּיּ֣וֹר נְחֹ֗שֶׁת וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֘הוּ֮ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעֲזָרָה֒ חָמֵ֨שׁ אַמּ֜וֹת אׇרְכּ֗וֹ וְחָמֵ֤שׁ אַמּוֹת֙ רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וְאַמּ֥וֹת שָׁל֖וֹשׁ קוֹמָת֑וֹ וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד עָלָ֗יו וַיִּבְרַ֤ךְ עַל־בִּרְכָּיו֙ נֶ֚גֶד כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּפָּ֖יו הַשָּׁמָֽיְמָה׃ {פ}
Translated: Solomon had made a bronze platform and placed it in the midst of the Great Court; it was 5 cubits long and 5 cubits wide and 3 cubits high. He stood on it; then, kneeling in front of the whole congregation of Israel, he spread forth his hands to heaven
Transliteration: khiy-ashah shelomoh khiyyvor nechoshet vayitenehu vetvokhe haazarah chamesh amvot ׇrekhvo vechamesh amvot rׇchevvo veamvot shalvosh kvomatvo vayaamod alayv vayiverakhe al-virekhayv neged khׇl-kehal yisherael vayiferosh khafayv hashamayemah {f}

Hebrew:
וַיֹּאמַ֗ר {פ}
יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֵין־כָּמ֣וֹךָ אֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּבָאָ֑רֶץ שֹׁמֵ֤ר הַבְּרִית֙ וְֽהַחֶ֔סֶד לַעֲבָדֶ֕יךָ הַהֹלְכִ֥ים לְפָנֶ֖יךָ בְּכׇל־לִבָּֽם׃
Translated: and said, “O L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, there is no god like You in the heavens and on the earth, You who steadfastly maintain the Covenant with Your servants who walk before You with all their heart;
Transliteration:
vayomar {f}
yehovah elohey yisherael eyn-khamvokha Elohim vashamayiim uvaarets shomer haveriyt vehachesed laavadeykha haholekhiym lefaneykha vekhׇl-livam

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֗רְתָּ לְעַבְדְּךָ֙ דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֔י אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ ל֑וֹ וַתְּדַבֵּ֥ר בְּפִ֛יךָ וּבְיָדְךָ֥ מִלֵּ֖אתָ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: You who have kept the promises You made to Your servant, my father David; You made a promise and have fulfilled it—as is now the case.
Transliteration: asher shamareta leavedekha daviyd aviy et asher-divareta lvo vatedaver vefiykha uveyadekha mileta khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שְׁ֠מֹ֠ר לְעַבְדְּךָ֨ דָוִ֤יד אָבִי֙ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֤רְתָּ לּוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹא־יִכָּרֵ֨ת לְךָ֥ אִישׁ֙ מִלְּפָנַ֔י יוֹשֵׁ֖ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רַ֠ק אִם־יִשְׁמְר֨וּ בָנֶ֜יךָ אֶת־דַּרְכָּ֗ם לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ בְּת֣וֹרָתִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלַ֖כְתָּ לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: And now, O L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, keep that promise that You made to Your servant, my father David, ‘You shall never lack a descendant in My sight sitting on the throne of Israel if only your children will look to their way and walk in the [path] of My teachings as you have walked before Me.’
Transliteration: veatah yehovah elohey yisherael shemor leavedekha daviyd aviy et asher divareta lvo lemor lo-yikharet lekha iysh milefanay yvoshev al-khise yisherael rak im-yishemeru vaneykha et-darekham lalekhet vetvoratiy khaasher halakheta lefanay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יֵֽאָמֵן֙ דְּבָ֣רְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ לְעַבְדְּךָ֥ לְדָוִֽיד׃
Translated: Now, therefore, O God of Israel, let the promise that You made to Your servant, my father David, be confirmed.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah elohey yisherael eiamen devarekha asher divareta leavedekha ledaviyd

Hebrew: כִּ֚י הַֽאֻמְנָ֔ם יֵשֵׁ֧ב אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָאָדָ֖ם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ הִ֠נֵּ֠ה שָׁמַ֜יִם וּשְׁמֵ֤י הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ לֹ֣א יְכַלְכְּל֔וּךָ אַ֕ף כִּֽי־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנִֽיתִי׃
Translated: “Does God really dwell with man on earth? Even the heavens to their uttermost reaches cannot contain You; how much less this House that I have built!
Transliteration: khiy haumenam eishev Elohim et-haadam al-haarets hineh shamayiim ushemey hashamayiim lo yekhalekhelukha af khiy-havayiit hazeh asher vaniytiy

Hebrew: וּפָנִ֜יתָ אֶל־תְּפִלַּ֧ת עַבְדְּךָ֛ וְאֶל־תְּחִנָּת֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י לִשְׁמֹ֤עַ אֶל־הָֽרִנָּה֙ וְאֶל־הַתְּפִלָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַבְדְּךָ֖ מִתְפַּלֵּ֥ל לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Yet turn, O L<small>ORD</small> my God, to the prayer and supplication of Your servant, and hear the cry and the prayer that Your servant offers to You.
Transliteration: ufaniyta el-tefilat avedekha veel-techinatvo yehovah elohay lishemoa el-harinah veel-hatefilah asher avedekha mitefalel lefaneykha

Hebrew: לִהְיוֹת֩ עֵינֶ֨יךָ פְתֻח֜וֹת אֶל־הַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה אֶ֨ל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְתָּ לָשׂ֥וּם שִׁמְךָ֖ שָׁ֑ם לִשְׁמ֙וֹעַ֙ אֶל־הַתְּפִלָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל עַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: May Your eyes be open day and night toward this House, toward the place where You have resolved to make Your name abide; may You heed the prayers that Your servant offers toward this place.
Transliteration: liheyvot eyneykha fetuchvot el-havayiit hazeh yvomam valayelah el-hamakvom asher amareta lashum shimekha sham lishemvoa el-hatefilah asher yitefalel avedekha el-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨מַעְתָּ֜ אֶל־תַּחֲנוּנֵ֤י עַבְדְּךָ֙ וְעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִֽתְפַּלְל֖וּ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְ֠אַתָּ֠ה תִּשְׁמַ֞ע מִמְּק֤וֹם שִׁבְתְּךָ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֖ וְסָלָֽחְתָּ׃
Translated: And when You hear the supplications that Your servant and Your people Israel offer toward this place, give heed in Your heavenly abode—give heed and pardon.
Transliteration: veshamaeta el-tachanuney avedekha veamekha yisherael asher yitefalelu el-hamakvom hazeh veatah tishema mimekvom shivetekha min-hashamayiim veshamaeta vesalacheta

Hebrew: אִם־יֶחֱטָ֥א אִישׁ֙ לְרֵעֵ֔הוּ וְנָשָׁא־ב֥וֹ אָלָ֖ה לְהַאֲלֹת֑וֹ וּבָ֗א אָלָ֛ה לִפְנֵ֥י מִֽזְבַּחֲךָ֖ בַּבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “If a man commits an offense against his fellow, and an oath is exacted from him, causing him to utter an imprecation against himself, and he comes with his imprecation before Your altar in this House,
Transliteration: im-yecheta iysh lereehu venasha-vvo alah lehaalotvo uva alah lifeney mizevachakha vavayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה ׀ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ וְשָׁפַטְתָּ֣ אֶת־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ לְהָשִׁ֣יב לְרָשָׁ֔ע לָתֵ֥ת דַּרְכּ֖וֹ בְּרֹאשׁ֑וֹ וּלְהַצְדִּ֣יק צַדִּ֔יק לָ֥תֶת ל֖וֹ כְּצִדְקָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: may You hear in heaven and take action to judge Your servants, requiting him who is in the wrong by bringing down the punishment of his conduct on his head, vindicating him who is in the right by rewarding him according to his righteousness.
Transliteration: veatah tishema min-hashamayiim veashiyta veshafateta et-avadeykha lehashiyv lerasha latet darekhvo veroshvo ulehatsediyk tsadiyk latet lvo khetsidekatvo {s}

Hebrew: וְֽאִם־יִנָּגֵ֞ף עַמְּךָ֧ יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לִפְנֵ֥י אוֹיֵ֖ב כִּ֣י יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֑ךְ וְשָׁ֙בוּ֙ וְהוֹד֣וּ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וְהִתְפַּֽלְל֧וּ וְהִֽתְחַנְּנ֛וּ לְפָנֶ֖יךָ בַּבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “Should Your people Israel be defeated by an enemy because they have sinned against You, and then once again acknowledge Your name and offer prayer and supplication to You in this House,
Transliteration: veim-yinagef amekha yisherael lifeney voeiv khiy yecheteu-lakhe veshavu vehvodu et-shemekha vehitefalelu vehitechanenu lefaneykha vavayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְסָ֣לַחְתָּ֔ לְחַטַּ֖את עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַהֲשֵֽׁיבוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לָהֶ֖ם וְלַאֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: may You hear in heaven and pardon the sin of Your people Israel, and restore them to the land that You gave to them and to their fathers.
Transliteration: veatah tishema min-hashamayiim vesalacheta lechatat amekha yisherael vahasheyvvotam el-haadamah asher-natatah lahem velaavoteyhem {f}

Hebrew: בְּהֵעָצֵ֧ר הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה מָטָ֖ר כִּ֣י יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֑ךְ וְהִֽתְפַּֽלְל֞וּ אֶל־הַמָּק֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ וְהוֹד֣וּ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֔ךָ מֵחַטָּאתָ֥ם יְשׁוּב֖וּן כִּ֥י תַעֲנֵֽם׃
Translated: “Should the heavens be shut up and there be no rain because they have sinned against You, and then they pray toward this place and acknowledge Your name and repent of their sins, because You humbled them,
Transliteration: veheatser hashamayiim velo-yiheyeh matar khiy yecheteu-lakhe vehitefalelu el-hamakvom hazeh vehvodu et-shemekha mechatatam yeshuvun khiy taanem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה ׀ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וְסָ֨לַחְתָּ֜ לְחַטַּ֤את עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י תוֹרֵ֛ם אֶל־הַדֶּ֥רֶךְ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽלְכוּ־בָ֑הּ וְנָֽתַתָּ֤ה מָטָר֙ עַֽל־אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לְעַמְּךָ֖ לְנַחֲלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: may You hear in heaven and pardon the sin of Your servants, Your people Israel, when You have shown them the proper way in which they are to walk, and send down rain upon the land that You gave to Your people as their heritage.
Transliteration: veatah tishema hashamayiim vesalacheta lechatat avadeykha veamekha yisherael khiy tvorem el-haderekhe hatvovah asher eilekhu-vah venatatah matar al-aretsekha asher-natatah leamekha lenachalah {s}

Hebrew: רָעָ֞ב כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֣ה בָאָ֗רֶץ דֶּ֣בֶר כִּֽי־יִ֠הְיֶ֠ה שִׁדָּפ֨וֹן וְיֵֽרָק֜וֹן אַרְבֶּ֤ה וְחָסִיל֙ כִּ֣י יִֽהְיֶ֔ה כִּ֧י יָצַר־ל֛וֹ אֹיְבָ֖יו בְּאֶ֣רֶץ שְׁעָרָ֑יו כׇּל־נֶ֖גַע וְכׇֽל־מַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated:
So, too, if there is a famine in the land, if there is pestilence, blight, mildew, locusts, or caterpillars, or if an enemy oppresses them in any of the settlements of their land.
“In any plague and in any disease,
Transliteration: raav khiy-yiheyeh vaarets dever khiy-yiheyeh shidafvon veeirakvon areveh vechasiyl khiy yiheyeh khiy yatsar-lvo oyevayv veerets shearayv khׇl-nega vekhׇl-machalah

Hebrew: כׇּל־תְּפִלָּ֣ה כׇל־תְּחִנָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִֽהְיֶה֙ לְכׇל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵדְע֗וּ אִ֤ישׁ נִגְעוֹ֙ וּמַכְאֹב֔וֹ וּפָרַ֥שׂ כַּפָּ֖יו אֶל־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: any prayer or supplication offered by any person among all Your people Israel—each of whom knows his affliction and his pain—when he spreads forth his hands toward this House,
Transliteration: khׇl-tefilah khׇl-techinah asher yiheyeh lekhׇl-haadam ulekhol amekha yisherael asher eideu iysh nigevo umakheovvo ufarash khafayv el-havayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְ֠אַתָּ֠ה תִּשְׁמַ֨ע מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם מְכ֤וֹן שִׁבְתֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְסָ֣לַחְתָּ֔ וְנָתַתָּ֤ה לָאִישׁ֙ כְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר תֵּדַ֖ע אֶת־לְבָב֑וֹ כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ לְבַדְּךָ֣ יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֶת־לְבַ֖ב בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: may You hear in Your heavenly abode, and pardon. Deal with each man according to his ways as You know his heart to be—for You alone know the hearts of all men—
Transliteration: veatah tishema min-hashamayiim mekhvon shivetekha vesalacheta venatatah laiysh khekhׇl-derakhayv asher teda et-levavvo khiy atah levadekha yadaeta et-levav veney haadam

Hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן יִירָא֗וּךָ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ בִּדְרָכֶ֔יךָ כׇּ֨ל־הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥ם חַיִּ֖ים עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תָּה לַאֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: so that they may revere You all the days that they live on the land that You gave to our fathers.
Transliteration: lemaan yiyraukha lalekhet viderakheykha khׇl-hayamiym asher-hem chayiym al-feney haadamah asher natatah laavoteynu {s}

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אֶל־הַנׇּכְרִ֗י אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹ֥א מֵעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ הוּא֒ וּבָ֣א ׀ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֗ה לְמַ֨עַן שִׁמְךָ֤ הַגָּדוֹל֙ וְיָדְךָ֣ הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וּֽזְרוֹעֲךָ֖ הַנְּטוּיָ֑ה וּבָ֥אוּ וְהִֽתְפַּֽלְל֖וּ אֶל־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “Or if a foreigner who is not of Your people Israel comes from a distant land for the sake of Your great name, Your mighty hand, and Your outstretched arm, if he comes to pray toward this House,
Transliteration: vegam el-hanׇkheriy asher lo meamekha yisherael hu uva meerets rechvokah lemaan shimekha hagadvol veyadekha hachazakah uzervoakha hanetuyah uvau vehitefalelu el-havayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה תִּשְׁמַ֤ע מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִמְּכ֣וֹן שִׁבְתֶּ֔ךָ וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָ֥א אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַנׇּכְרִ֑י לְמַ֣עַן יֵדְעוּ֩ כׇל־עַמֵּ֨י הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֗ךָ וּלְיִרְאָ֤ה אֹֽתְךָ֙ כְּעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלָדַ֕עַת כִּֽי־שִׁמְךָ֣ נִקְרָ֔א עַל־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנִֽיתִי׃
Translated: may You hear in Your heavenly abode and grant whatever the foreigner appeals to You for. Thus all the peoples of the earth will know Your name and revere You, as does Your people Israel; and they will recognize that Your name is attached to this House that I have built.
Transliteration: veatah tishema min-hashamayiim mimekhvon shivetekha veashiyta khekhol asher-yikera eleykha hanׇkheriy lemaan eideu khׇl-amey haarets et-shemekha uleyireah otekha kheamekha yisherael veladaat khiy-shimekha nikera al-havayiit hazeh asher vaniytiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵצֵ֨א עַמְּךָ֤ לַמִּלְחָמָה֙ עַל־אֹ֣יְבָ֔יו בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁלָחֵ֑ם וְהִתְפַּֽלְל֣וּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֣רְתָּ בָּ֔הּ וְהַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁר־בָּנִ֥יתִי לִשְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “When Your people take the field against their enemies in a campaign on which You send them, and they pray to You in the direction of the city which You have chosen and the House which I have built to Your name,
Transliteration: khiy-eitse amekha lamilechamah al-oyevayv vaderekhe asher tishelachem vehitefalelu eleykha derekhe haiyr hazot asher vachareta vah vehavayiit asher-vaniytiy lishemekha

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁמַעְתָּ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם אֶת־תְּפִלָּתָ֖ם וְאֶת־תְּחִנָּתָ֑ם וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִשְׁפָּטָֽם׃
Translated: may You hear in heaven their prayer and supplication and uphold their cause.
Transliteration: veshamaeta min-hashamayiim et-tefilatam veet-techinatam veashiyta mishefatam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֗ךְ כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין אָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יֶחֱטָ֔א וְאָנַפְתָּ֣ בָ֔ם וּנְתַתָּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י אוֹיֵ֑ב וְשָׁב֧וּם שׁוֹבֵיהֶ֛ם אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֖ה א֥וֹ קְרוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: “When they sin against You—for there is no person who does not sin—and You are angry with them and deliver them to the enemy, and their captors carry them off to an enemy land, near or far;
Transliteration: khiy yecheteu-lakhe khiy eyn adam asher lo-yecheta veanafeta vam unetatam lifeney voeiv veshavum shvoveyhem el-erets rechvokah vo kervovah

Hebrew: וְהֵשִׁ֙יבוּ֙ אֶל־לְבָבָ֔ם בָּאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבּוּ־שָׁ֑ם וְשָׁ֣בוּ ׀ וְהִֽתְחַנְּנ֣וּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ בְּאֶ֤רֶץ שִׁבְיָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חָטָ֥אנוּ הֶעֱוִ֖ינוּ וְרָשָֽׁעְנוּ׃
Translated: and they take it to heart in the land to which they have been carried off, and repent and make supplication to You in the land of their captivity, saying, ‘We have sinned, we have acted perversely, we have acted wickedly,’
Transliteration: veheshiyvu el-levavam vaarets asher nishevu-sham veshavu vehitechanenu eleykha veerets shiveyam lemor chatanu heeviynu verashaenu

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣בוּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ בְּכׇל־לִבָּם֙ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשָׁ֔ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שִׁבְיָ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־שָׁב֣וּ אֹתָ֑ם וְהִֽתְפַּֽלְל֗וּ דֶּ֤רֶךְ אַרְצָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תָּה לַאֲבוֹתָ֔ם וְהָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֔רְתָּ וְלַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁר־בָּנִ֥יתִי לִשְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: and they turn back to You with all their heart and soul, in the land of their captivity where they were carried off, and pray in the direction of their land which You gave to their fathers and the city which You have chosen, and toward the House which I have built for Your name—
Transliteration: veshavu eleykha vekhׇl-livam uvekhׇl-nafesham veerets shiveyam asher-shavu otam vehitefalelu derekhe aretsam asher natatah laavvotam vehaiyr asher vachareta velavayiit asher-vaniytiy lishemekha

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֨ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם מִמְּכ֣וֹן שִׁבְתְּךָ֗ אֶת־תְּפִלָּתָם֙ וְאֶת־תְּחִנֹּ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִשְׁפָּטָ֑ם וְסָלַחְתָּ֥ לְעַמְּךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטְאוּ־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: may You hear their prayer and supplication in Your heavenly abode, uphold their cause, and pardon Your people who have sinned against You.
Transliteration: veshamaeta min-hashamayiim mimekhvon shivetekha et-tefilatam veet-techinoteyhem veashiyta mishefatam vesalacheta leamekha asher chateu-lakhe

Hebrew: עַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֗י יִֽהְיוּ־נָ֤א עֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ פְּתֻח֔וֹת וְאׇזְנֶ֖יךָ קַשֻּׁב֑וֹת לִתְפִלַּ֖ת הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Now My God, may Your eyes be open and Your ears attentive to prayer from this place, and now,
Transliteration: atah elohay yiheyu-na eyneykha fetuchvot veׇzeneykha kashuvvot litefilat hamakvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה קוּמָ֞ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ לְֽנוּחֶ֔ךָ אַתָּ֖ה וַאֲר֣וֹן עֻזֶּ֑ךָ כֹּהֲנֶ֜יךָ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ יִלְבְּשׁ֣וּ תְשׁוּעָ֔ה וַחֲסִידֶ֖יךָ יִשְׂמְח֥וּ בַטּֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Advance, O LORD God, to your resting-place,
You and Your mighty Ark.
Your priests, O LORD God, are clothed in triumph;
Your loyal ones will rejoice in [Your] goodness.
Transliteration: veatah kumah yehovah Elohim lenuchekha atah vaarvon uzekha khohaneykha yehovah Elohim yileveshu teshuah vachasiydeykha yishemechu vatvov

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים אַל־תָּשֵׁ֖ב פְּנֵ֣י מְשִׁיחֶ֑ךָ זׇכְרָ֕ה לְחַֽסְדֵ֖י דָּוִ֥יד עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
O LORD God,
do not reject Your anointed one;
remember the loyalty of Your servant David.”
Transliteration: yehovah Elohim al-tashev feney meshiychekha zׇkherah lechasedey daviyd avedekha {f}

Hebrew: וּכְכַלּ֤וֹת שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֔ל וְהָאֵ֗שׁ יָֽרְדָה֙ מֵֽהַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַתֹּ֥אכַל הָעֹלָ֖ה וְהַזְּבָחִ֑ים וּכְב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֖ה מָלֵ֥א אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: When Solomon finished praying, fire descended from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of the L<small>ORD</small> filled the House.
Transliteration: ukhekhalvot shelomoh lehitefalel vehaesh yaredah mehashamayiim vatokhal haolah vehazevachiym ukhevvod yehovah male et-havayiit

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים לָב֖וֹא אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־מָלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priests could not enter the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, for the glory of the L<small>ORD</small> filled the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: velo yakhelu hakhohaniym lavvo el-veyt yehovah khiy-male khevvod-yehovah et-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל רֹאִים֙ בְּרֶ֣דֶת הָאֵ֔שׁ וּכְב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־הַבָּ֑יִת וַיִּכְרְעוּ֩ אַפַּ֨יִם אַ֤רְצָה עַל־הָרִֽצְפָה֙ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֔וּ וְהֹד֤וֹת לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב כִּ֥י לְעוֹלָ֖ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: All the Israelites witnessed the descent of the fire and the glory of the L<small>ORD</small> on the House; they knelt with their faces to the ground and prostrated themselves, praising the L<small>ORD</small>, “For He is good, for His steadfast love is eternal.”
Transliteration: vekhol veney yisherael roiym veredet haesh ukhevvod yehovah al-havayiit vayikhereu afayiim aretsah al-haritsefah vayishetachavu vehodvot layhovah khiy tvov khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְכׇל־הָעָ֑ם זֹבְחִ֥ים זֶ֖בַח לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe vekhׇl-haam zovechiym zevach lifeney yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֞ח הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֮ אֶת־זֶ֣בַח הַבָּקָר֒ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְצֹ֕אן מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָ֑לֶף וַֽיַּחְנְכוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְכׇל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: King Solomon offered as sacrifices 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep; thus the king and all the people dedicated the House of God.
Transliteration: vayizevach hamelekhe shelomoh et-zevach havakar esheriym ushenayiim elef vetson meah veesheriym alef vayachenekhu et-veyt haElohim hamelekhe vekhׇl-haam

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֞ים עַל־מִשְׁמְרוֹתָ֣ם עֹמְדִ֗ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם בִּכְלֵי־שִׁ֤יר יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה דָּוִ֣יד הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ לְהֹד֤וֹת לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּ֔וֹ בְּהַלֵּ֥ל דָּוִ֖יד בְּיָדָ֑ם וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ (מחצצרים) [מַחְצְרִ֣ים] נֶגְדָּ֔ם וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֹמְדִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: The priests stood at their watches; the Levites with the instruments for the L<small>ORD</small>’s music that King David had made to praise the L<small>ORD</small>, “For His steadfast love is eternal,” by means of the psalms of David that they knew. The priests opposite them blew trumpets while all Israel were standing.
Transliteration: vehakhohaniym al-mishemervotam omediym vehaleviyim vikheley-shiyr yehovah asher ashah daviyd hamelekhe lehodvot layhovah khiy-levolam chasedvo vehalel daviyd veyadam vehakhohaniym (mchtstsrym) [machetseriym] negedam vekhׇl-yisherael omediym {s}

Hebrew: וַיְקַדֵּ֣שׁ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אֶת־תּ֤וֹךְ הֶחָצֵר֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י בֵית־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּי־עָ֤שָׂה שָׁם֙ הָעֹל֔וֹת וְאֵ֖ת חֶלְבֵ֣י הַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים כִּֽי־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֣ה שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה לֹ֣א יָכ֗וֹל לְהָכִ֛יל אֶת־הָעֹלָ֥ה וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֖ה וְאֶת־הַחֲלָבִֽים׃
Translated: Solomon consecrated the center of the court in front of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, because he presented there the burnt offerings and the fat parts of the offerings of well-being, since the bronze altar that Solomon had made was not able to hold the burnt offerings, the meal offerings, and the fat parts.
Transliteration: vayekadesh shelomoh et-tvokhe hechatser asher lifeney veyt-yehovah khiy-ashah sham haolvot veet chelevey hashelamiym khiy-mizevach hanechoshet asher ashah shelomoh lo yakhvol lehakhiyl et-haolah veet-haminechah veet-hachalaviym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה אֶת־הֶ֠חָ֠ג בָּעֵ֨ת הַהִ֜יא שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עִמּ֔וֹ קָהָ֖ל גָּד֣וֹל מְאֹ֑ד מִלְּב֥וֹא חֲמָ֖ת עַד־נַ֥חַל מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: At that time Solomon kept the Feast for seven days—all Israel with him—a great assemblage from Lebo-hamath to the Wadi of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayaash shelomoh et-hechag vaet hahiy shiveat yamiym vekhׇl-yisherael imvo kahal gadvol meod milevvo chamat ad-nachal mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֛וּ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י עֲצָ֑רֶת כִּ֣י ׀ חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ עָשׂוּ֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים וְהֶחָ֖ג שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: On the eighth day they held a solemn gathering; they observed the dedication of the altar seven days, and the Feast seven days.
Transliteration: vayaashu vayyvom hashemiyniy atsaret khiy chanukhat hamizevecha ashu shiveat yamiym vehechag shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וּבְי֨וֹם עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י שִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הָעָ֖ם לְאׇהֳלֵיהֶ֑ם שְׂמֵחִים֙ וְט֣וֹבֵי לֵ֔ב עַל־הַטּוֹבָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְדָוִ֣יד וְלִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: On the twenty-third day of the seventh month he dismissed the people to their homes, rejoicing and in good spirits over the goodness that the L<small>ORD</small> had shown to David and Solomon and His people Israel.
Transliteration: uveyvom esheriym usheloshah lachodesh hasheviyiy shilach et-haam leׇholeyhem shemechiym vetvovey lev al-hatvovah asher ashah yehovah ledaviyd velishelomoh uleyisherael amvo

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֧ל שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־הַבָּ֜א עַל־לֵ֣ב שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֧וֹת בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֛ה וּבְבֵית֖וֹ הִצְלִֽיחַ׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus Solomon finished building the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and the royal palace; Solomon succeeded in everything he had set his heart on accomplishing with regard to the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and his palace.
Transliteration: vayekhal shelomoh et-veyt yehovah veet-veyt hamelekhe veet khׇl-hava al-lev shelomoh laashvot veveyt-yehovah uveveytvo hitseliycha {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֧א יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בַּלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־תְּפִלָּתֶ֔ךָ וּבָחַ֜רְתִּי בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה לִ֖י לְבֵ֥ית זָֽבַח׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> appeared to Solomon at night and said to him, “I have heard your prayer and have chosen this site as My House of sacrifice.
Transliteration: vayera yehovah el-shelomoh valayelah vayomer lvo shamaetiy et-tefilatekha uvacharetiy vamakvom hazeh liy leveyt zavach

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן אֶעֱצֹ֤ר הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֣ה מָטָ֔ר וְהֵן־אֲצַוֶּ֥ה עַל־חָגָ֖ב לֶאֱכ֣וֹל הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאִם־אֲשַׁלַּ֥ח דֶּ֖בֶר בְּעַמִּֽי׃
Translated: If I shut up the heavens and there is no rain; if I command the locusts to ravage the land; or if I let loose pestilence against My people,
Transliteration: hen eetsor hashamayiim velo-yiheyeh matar vehen-atsaveh al-chagav leekhvol haarets veim-ashalach dever veamiy

Hebrew: וְיִכָּנְע֨וּ עַמִּ֜י אֲשֶׁ֧ר נִֽקְרָא־שְׁמִ֣י עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם וְיִֽתְפַּֽלְלוּ֙ וִיבַקְשׁ֣וּ פָנַ֔י וְיָשֻׁ֖בוּ מִדַּרְכֵיהֶ֣ם הָרָעִ֑ים וַֽאֲנִי֙ אֶשְׁמַ֣ע מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְאֶסְלַח֙ לְחַטָּאתָ֔ם וְאֶרְפָּ֖א אֶת־אַרְצָֽם׃
Translated: when My people, who bear My name, humble themselves, pray, and seek My favor and turn from their evil ways, I will hear in My heavenly abode and forgive their sins and heal their land.
Transliteration: veyikhaneu amiy asher nikera-shemiy aleyhem veyitefalelu viyvakeshu fanay veyashuvu midarekheyhem haraiym vaaniy eshema min-hashamayiim veeselach lechatatam veerefa et-aretsam

Hebrew: עַתָּ֗ה עֵינַי֙ יִהְי֣וּ פְתֻח֔וֹת וְאׇזְנַ֖י קַשֻּׁב֑וֹת לִתְפִלַּ֖ת הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Now My eyes will be open and My ears attentive to the prayers from this place.
Transliteration: atah eynay yiheyu fetuchvot veׇzenay kashuvvot litefilat hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה בָּחַ֤רְתִּי וְהִקְדַּ֙שְׁתִּי֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֣יִת הַזֶּ֔ה לִֽהְיוֹת־שְׁמִ֥י שָׁ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וְהָי֨וּ עֵינַ֧י וְלִבִּ֛י שָׁ֖ם כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: And now I have chosen and consecrated this House that My name be there forever. My eyes and My heart shall always be there.
Transliteration: veatah vacharetiy vehikedashetiy et-havayiit hazeh liheyvot-shemiy sham ad-volam vehayu eynay veliviy sham khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה אִם־תֵּלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנַ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר הָלַךְ֙ דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֔יךָ וְלַעֲשׂ֕וֹת כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֑יךָ וְחֻקַּ֥י וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֖י תִּשְׁמֽוֹר׃
Translated: As for you, if you walk before Me as your father David walked before Me, doing all that I have commanded you, keeping My laws and rules,
Transliteration: veatah im-telekhe lefanay khaasher halakhe daviyd aviykha velaashvot khekhol asher tsiviytiykha vechukay umishefatay tishemvor

Hebrew: וַהֲקִ֣ימוֹתִ֔י אֵ֖ת כִּסֵּ֣א מַלְכוּתֶ֑ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּרַ֗תִּי לְדָוִ֤יד אָבִ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־יִכָּרֵ֤ת לְךָ֙ אִ֔ישׁ מוֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: then I will establish your royal throne over Israel forever, in accordance with the Covenant I made with your father David, saying, ‘You shall never lack a descendant ruling over Israel.’
Transliteration: vahakiymvotiy et khise malekhutekha khaasher kharatiy ledaviyd aviykha lemor lo-yikharet lekha iysh mvoshel veyisherael

Hebrew: וְאִם־תְּשׁוּב֣וּן אַתֶּ֔ם וַֽעֲזַבְתֶּם֙ חֻקּוֹתַ֣י וּמִצְוֺתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֗ם וַֽעֲבַדְתֶּם֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: But if you turn away from Me and forsake My laws and commandments that I set before you, and go and serve other gods and worship them,
Transliteration: veim-teshuvun atem vaazavetem chukvotay umitsevotay asher natatiy lifeneykhem vahalakhetem vaavadetem Elohim acheriym vehishetachaviytem lahem

Hebrew: וּנְתַשְׁתִּ֗ים מֵעַ֤ל אַדְמָתִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תִּי לָהֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְדַּ֣שְׁתִּי לִשְׁמִ֔י אַשְׁלִ֖יךְ מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑י וְאֶתְּנֶ֛נּוּ לְמָשָׁ֥ל וְלִשְׁנִינָ֖ה בְּכׇל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated: then I will uproot them from My land that I gave them, and this House that I consecrated to My name I shall cast out of my sight, and make it a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
Transliteration: unetashetiym meal adematiy asher natatiy lahem veet-havayiit hazeh asher hikedashetiy lishemiy asheliykhe meal fanay veetenenu lemashal velisheniynah vekhׇl-haamiym

Hebrew: וְהַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה עֶלְי֔וֹן לְכׇל־עֹבֵ֥ר עָלָ֖יו יִשֹּׁ֑ם וְאָמַ֗ר בַּמֶּ֨ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ כָּ֔כָה לָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את וְלַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And as for this House, once so exalted, everyone passing by it shall be appalled and say, ‘Why did the L<small>ORD</small> do thus to this land and to this House?’
Transliteration: vehavayiit hazeh asher hayah eleyvon lekhׇl-over alayv yishom veamar vameh ashah yehovah khakhah laarets hazot velavayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאָמְר֗וּ עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָזְב֜וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹצִיאָם֮ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ וַֽיַּחֲזִ֙יקוּ֙ בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם וַיַּעַבְד֑וּם עַל־כֵּן֙ הֵבִ֣יא עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated: And the reply will be, ‘It is because they forsook the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers who freed them from the land of Egypt, and adopted other gods and worshiped them and served them; therefore He brought all this calamity upon them.’”
Transliteration: veameru al asher azevu et-yehovah elohey avoteyhem asher hvotsiyam meerets mitserayiim vayachaziyku velohiym acheriym vayishetachavu lahem vayaavedum al-khen heviy aleyhem et khׇl-haraah hazot {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י מִקֵּ֣ץ ׀ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּנָ֧ה שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: At the end of twenty years, during which Solomon constructed the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and his palace—
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets esheriym shanah asher vanah shelomoh et-veyt yehovah veet-veytvo

Hebrew: וְהֶעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן חוּרָם֙ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה בָּנָ֥ה שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה אֹתָ֑ם וַיּ֥וֹשֶׁב שָׁ֖ם אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Solomon also rebuilt the cities that Huram had given to him, and settled Israelites in them—
Transliteration: veheariym asher natan churam lishelomoh vanah shelomoh otam vayyvoshev sham et-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ חֲמָ֣ת צוֹבָ֔ה וַיֶּחֱזַ֖ק עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Solomon marched against Hamath-zobah and overpowered it.
Transliteration: vayelekhe shelomoh chamat tsvovah vayechezak aleyha

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן אֶת־תַּדְמֹ֖ר בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־עָרֵ֣י הַֽמִּסְכְּנ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָ֖ה בַּחֲמָֽת׃
Translated: He built Tadmor in the desert and all the garrison towns that he built in Hamath.
Transliteration: vayiven et-tademor vamidevar veet khׇl-arey hamisekhenvot asher vanah vachamat

Hebrew: וַיִּ֜בֶן אֶת־בֵּ֤ית חוֹרוֹן֙ הָעֶלְי֔וֹן וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית חוֹר֖וֹן הַתַּחְתּ֑וֹן עָרֵ֣י מָצ֔וֹר חוֹמ֖וֹת דְּלָתַ֥יִם וּבְרִֽיחַ׃
Translated: He built Upper Beth-horon and Lower Beth-horon as fortified cities with walls, gates, and bars,
Transliteration: vayiven et-veyt chvorvon haeleyvon veet-veyt chvorvon hatachetvon arey matsvor chvomvot delatayiim uveriycha

Hebrew: וְאֶֽת־בַּעֲלָ֗ת וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־עָרֵ֤י הַֽמִּסְכְּנוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָי֣וּ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־עָרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב וְאֵ֖ת עָרֵ֣י הַפָּרָשִׁ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־חֵ֣שֶׁק שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָשַׁק֙ לִבְנ֤וֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וּבַלְּבָנ֔וֹן וּבְכֹ֖ל אֶ֥רֶץ מֶמְשַׁלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: as well as Baalath and all of Solomon’s garrison towns, chariot towns, and cavalry towns—everything that Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem and in the Lebanon, and throughout the territory that he ruled.
Transliteration: veet-vaalat veet khׇl-arey hamisekhenvot asher hayu lishelomoh veet khׇl-arey harekhev veet arey hafarashiym veet khׇl-cheshek shelomoh asher chashak livenvot viyrushala͏im uvalevanvon uvekhol erets memeshaletvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־הָ֠עָ֠ם הַנּוֹתָ֨ר מִן־הַחִתִּ֜י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֤י וְהַפְּרִזִּי֙ וְהַחִוִּ֣י וְהַיְבוּסִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹ֥א מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: All the people that were left of the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, none of whom were of Israelite stock—
Transliteration: khׇl-haam hanvotar min-hachitiy vehaemoriy vehaferiziy vehachiviy vehayevusiy asher lo miyisherael hemah

Hebrew: מִן־בְּנֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נוֹתְר֤וּ אַֽחֲרֵיהֶם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־כִלּ֖וּם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּעֲלֵ֤ם שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לְמַ֔ס עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: those of their descendants who were left after them in the land, whom the Israelites had not annihilated—these Solomon subjected to forced labor, as is still the case.
Transliteration: min-veneyhem asher nvoteru achareyhem vaarets asher lo-khilum veney yisherael vayaalem shelomoh lemas ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹא־נָתַ֧ן שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה לַעֲבָדִ֖ים לִמְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ כִּי־הֵ֜מָּה אַנְשֵׁ֤י מִלְחָמָה֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י שָׁלִישָׁ֔יו וְשָׂרֵ֥י רִכְבּ֖וֹ וּפָרָשָֽׁיו׃ {פ}
Translated: But the Israelites, none of whom Solomon enslaved for his works, served as soldiers and as his chief officers, and as commanders of his chariotry and cavalry.
Transliteration: umin-veney yisherael asher lo-natan shelomoh laavadiym limelakhetvo khiy-hemah aneshey milechamah vesharey shaliyshayv vesharey rikhevvo ufarashayv {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה שָׂרֵ֧י (הנציבים) [הַנִּצָּבִ֛ים] אֲשֶׁר־לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם הָרֹדִ֖ים בָּעָֽם׃
Translated: These were King Solomon’s prefects—250 foremen over the people.
Transliteration: veeleh sharey (hntsyvym) [hanitsaviym] asher-lamelekhe shelomoh chamishiym umatayiim harodiym vaam

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה הֶעֱלָ֤ה שְׁלֹמֹה֙ מֵעִ֣יר דָּוִ֔יד לַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנָה־לָ֑הּ כִּ֣י אָמַ֗ר לֹא־תֵשֵׁ֨ב אִשָּׁ֥ה לִי֙ בְּבֵית֙ דָּוִ֣יד מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּֽי־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֔מָּה אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אָֽה־אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Solomon brought up Pharaoh’s daughter from the City of David to the palace that he had built for her, for he said, “No wife of mine shall dwell in a palace of King David of Israel, for [the area] is sacred since the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small> has entered it.”
Transliteration: veet-vat-fareoh heelah shelomoh meiyr daviyd lavayiit asher vanah-lah khiy amar lo-teshev ishah liy veveyt daviyd melekhe-yisherael khiy-kodesh hemah asher-vaah-aleyhem arvon yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז הֶעֱלָ֧ה שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה עֹל֖וֹת לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה עַ֚ל מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הָאוּלָֽם׃
Translated: At that time, Solomon offered burnt offerings on the altar that he had built in front of the porch.
Transliteration: az heelah shelomoh olvot layhovah al mizevach yehovah asher vanah lifeney haulam

Hebrew: וּבִדְבַר־י֣וֹם בְּי֗וֹם לְהַֽעֲלוֹת֙ כְּמִצְוַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֔ה לַשַּׁבָּתוֹת֙ וְלֶ֣חֳדָשִׁ֔ים וְלַמּ֣וֹעֲד֔וֹת שָׁל֥וֹשׁ פְּעָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה בְּחַ֧ג הַמַּצּ֛וֹת וּבְחַ֥ג הַשָּׁבֻע֖וֹת וּבְחַ֥ג הַסֻּכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: What was due for each day he sacrificed according to the commandment of Moses for the sabbaths, the new moons, and the thrice-yearly festivals—the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Booths.
Transliteration: uvidevar-yvom veyvom lehaalvot khemitsevat mosheh lashavatvot velechodashiym velamvoadvot shalvosh feamiym vashanah vechag hamatsvot uvechag hashavuvot uvechag hasukhvot
