Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֣ד כְּמִשְׁפַּ֣ט דָּֽוִיד־אָ֠בִ֠יו אֶת־מַחְלְק֨וֹת הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים עַל־עֲבֹדָתָ֗ם וְהַלְוִיִּ֣ם עַל־מִ֠שְׁמְרוֹתָ֠ם לְהַלֵּ֨ל וּלְשָׁרֵ֜ת נֶ֤גֶד הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לִדְבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ וְהַשֹּׁעֲרִ֥ים בְּמַחְלְקוֹתָ֖ם לְשַׁ֣עַר וָשָׁ֑עַר כִּ֣י כֵ֔ן מִצְוַ֖ת דָּוִ֥יד אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Following the prescription of his father David, he set up the divisions of the priests for their duties, and the Levites for their watches, to praise and to serve alongside the priests, according to each day’s requirement, and the gatekeepers in their watches, gate by gate, for such was the commandment of David, the man of God.
Transliteration: vayaamed khemishefat daviyd-aviyv et-machelekvot hakhohaniym al-avodatam vehaleviyim al-mishemervotam lehalel ulesharet neged hakhohaniym lidevar-yvom veyvomvo vehashoariym vemachelekvotam leshaar vashaar khiy khen mitsevat daviyd iysh-haElohim

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א סָ֩רוּ֩ מִצְוַ֨ת הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ עַל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֛ם לְכׇל־דָּבָ֖ר וְלָאֹצָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: They did not depart from the commandment of the king relating to the priests and the Levites in all these matters and also relating to the treasuries.
Transliteration: velo saru mitsevat hamelekhe al-hakhohaniym vehaleviyim lekhׇl-davar velaotsarvot

Hebrew: וַתִּכֹּן֙ כׇּל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה עַד־הַיּ֛וֹם מוּסַ֥ד בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְעַד־כְּלֹת֑וֹ שָׁלֵ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And all of Solomon’s work was well executed from the day the House of the L<small>ORD</small> was founded until the House of the L<small>ORD</small> was completed to perfection.
Transliteration: vatikhon khׇl-melekhet shelomoh ad-hayyvom musad veyt-yehovah vead-khelotvo shalem veyt yehovah {s}

Hebrew: אָז֩ הָלַ֨ךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה לְעֶצְיֽוֹן־גֶּ֧בֶר וְאֶל־אֵיל֛וֹת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: At that time Solomon went to Ezion-geber and to Eloth on the seacoast of the land of Edom.
Transliteration: az halakhe shelomoh leetseyvon-gever veel-eylvot al-shefat hayam veerets edvom

Hebrew: וַיִּֽשְׁלַֽח־לוֹ֩ חוּרָ֨ם בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֜יו (אוניות) [אֳנִיּ֗וֹת] וַעֲבָדִים֮ י֣וֹדְעֵי יָם֒ וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עִם־עַבְדֵ֤י שְׁלֹמֹה֙ אוֹפִ֔ירָה וַיִּקְח֣וּ מִשָּׁ֔ם אַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים כִּכַּ֣ר זָהָ֑ב וַיָּבִ֖יאוּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Huram sent him, under the charge of servants, a fleet with a crew of expert seamen; they went with Solomon’s men to Ophir, and obtained gold there in the amount of 450 talents, which they brought to King Solomon.
Transliteration: vayishelach-lvo churam veyad-avadayv (vnyvt) [oniyyvot] vaavadiym yvodeey yam vayavou im-avedey shelomoh vofiyrah vayikechu misham areva-mevot vachamishiym khikhar zahav vayaviyu el-hamelekhe shelomoh {f}

Hebrew: וּמַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֗א שָׁמְעָה֮ אֶת־שֵׁ֣מַע שְׁלֹמֹה֒ וַתָּב֣וֹא לְנַסּוֹת֩ אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֨ה בְחִיד֜וֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם בְּחַ֣יִל כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֡ד וּ֠גְמַלִּ֠ים נֹשְׂאִ֨ים בְּשָׂמִ֧ים וְזָהָ֛ב לָרֹ֖ב וְאֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֑ה וַתָּבוֹא֙ אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר עִמּ֔וֹ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה עִם־לְבָבָֽהּ׃
Translated: The queen of Sheba heard of Solomon’s fame, and came to Jerusalem to test Solomon with hard questions, accompanied by a very large retinue, including camels bearing spices, a great quantity of gold, and precious stones. When she came to Solomon, she spoke to him of all that she had on her mind.
Transliteration: umalekhat-sheva shameah et-shema shelomoh vatavvo lenasvot et-shelomoh vechiydvot viyrushala͏im vechayiil khaved meod ugemaliym nosheiym veshamiym vezahav larov veeven yekarah vatavvo el-shelomoh vatedaver imvo et khׇl-asher hayah im-levavah

Hebrew: וַיַּגֶּד־לָ֥הּ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה אֶת־כׇּל־דְּבָרֶ֑יהָ וְלֹֽא־נֶעְלַ֤ם דָּבָר֙ מִשְּׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹ֦א הִגִּ֖יד לָֽהּ׃
Translated: Solomon had answers for all her questions; there was nothing that Solomon did not know, nothing to which he could not give her an answer.
Transliteration: vayaged-lah shelomoh et-khׇl-devareyha velo-neelam davar mishelomoh asher lo higiyd lah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ מַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֔א אֵ֖ת חׇכְמַ֣ת שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וְהַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָֽה׃
Translated: When the queen of Sheba saw how wise Solomon was and the palace he had built,
Transliteration: vatere malekhat-sheva et chׇkhemat shelomoh vehavayiit asher vanah

Hebrew: וּמַאֲכַ֣ל שֻׁלְחָנ֡וֹ וּמוֹשַׁ֣ב עֲבָדָיו֩ וּמַעֲמַ֨ד מְשָׁרְתָ֜יו וּמַלְבּוּשֵׁיהֶ֗ם וּמַשְׁקָיו֙ וּמַלְבּ֣וּשֵׁיהֶ֔ם וַֽעֲלִיָּת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲלֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה ע֛וֹד בָּ֖הּ רֽוּחַ׃
Translated: the fare of his table, the seating of his courtiers, the service and attire of his attendants, his butlers and their attire, and the procession with which he went up to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, it took her breath away.
Transliteration: umaakhal shulechanvo umvoshav avadayv umaamad mesharetayv umalevusheyhem umashekayv umalevusheyhem vaaliyatvo asher yaaleh veyt yehovah velo-hayah vod vah rucha

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֱמֶת֙ הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בְּאַרְצִ֑י עַל־דְּבָרֶ֖יךָ וְעַל־חׇכְמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: She said to the king, “What I heard in my own land about you and your wisdom was true.
Transliteration: vatomer el-hamelekhe emet hadavar asher shamaetiy vearetsiy al-devareykha veal-chׇkhematekha

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הֶאֱמַ֣נְתִּי לְדִבְרֵיהֶ֗ם עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֙אתִי֙ וַתִּרְאֶ֣ינָה עֵינַ֔י וְהִנֵּה֙ לֹ֣א הֻגַּד־לִ֔י חֲצִ֖י מַרְבִּ֣ית חׇכְמָתֶ֑ךָ יָסַ֕פְתָּ עַל־הַשְּׁמוּעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: I did not believe what they said until I came and saw with my own eyes that not even the half of your great wisdom had been described to me; you surpass the report that I heard.
Transliteration: velo-heemanetiy ledivereyhem ad asher-vatiy vatireeynah eynay vehineh lo hugad-liy chatsiy mareviyt chׇkhematekha yasafeta al-hashemuah asher shamaetiy

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אֲנָשֶׁ֔יךָ וְאַשְׁרֵ֖י עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ אֵ֑לֶּה הָעֹמְדִ֤ים לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ תָּמִ֔יד וְשֹׁמְעִ֖ים אֶת־חׇכְמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: How fortunate are your men and how fortunate are these courtiers of yours who are always in attendance on you and can hear your wisdom!
Transliteration: asherey anasheykha veasherey avadeykha eleh haomediym lefaneykha tamiyd veshomeiym et-chׇkhematekha

Hebrew: יְהִ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּר֔וּךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ חָפֵ֣ץ בְּךָ֗ לְתִתְּךָ֤ עַל־כִּסְאוֹ֙ לְמֶ֔לֶךְ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּאַהֲבַ֨ת אֱלֹהֶ֤יךָ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְהַעֲמִיד֣וֹ לְעוֹלָ֔ם וַיִּתֶּנְךָ֤ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ לְמֶ֔לֶךְ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated: Blessed is the L<small>ORD</small> your God, who favored you and set you on His throne as a king before the L<small>ORD</small>. It is because of your God’s love for Israel and in order to establish them forever that He made you king over them to execute righteous justice.”
Transliteration: yehiy yehovah eloheykha varukhe asher chafets vekha letitekha al-khisevo lemelekhe layhovah eloheykha veahavat eloheykha et-yisherael lehaamiydvo levolam vayitenekha aleyhem lemelekhe laashvot mishefat utsedakah

Hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֨ן לַמֶּ֜לֶךְ מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֣ים ׀ כִּכַּ֣ר זָהָ֗ב וּבְשָׂמִ֛ים לָרֹ֥ב מְאֹ֖ד וְאֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א הָיָה֙ כַּבֹּ֣שֶׂם הַה֔וּא אֲשֶׁר־נָתְנָ֥ה מַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֖א לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: She presented the king with 120 talents of gold, and a vast quantity of spices and precious stones. There were no such spices as those which the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon—
Transliteration: vatiten lamelekhe meah veesheriym khikhar zahav uveshamiym larov meod veeven yekarah velo hayah khavoshem hahu asher-natenah malekhat-sheva lamelekhe shelomoh

Hebrew: וְגַם־עַבְדֵ֤י (חירם) [חוּרָם֙] וְעַבְדֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֥יאוּ זָהָ֖ב מֵאוֹפִ֑יר הֵבִ֛יאוּ עֲצֵ֥י אַלְגּוּמִּ֖ים וְאֶ֥בֶן יְקָרָֽה׃
Translated: also, the servants of Huram and Solomon who brought gold from Ophir brought algum-wood and precious stones.
Transliteration: vegam-avedey (chyrm) [churam] veavedey shelomoh asher-heviyu zahav mevofiyr heviyu atsey alegumiym veeven yekarah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ אֶת־עֲצֵ֨י הָאַלְגּוּמִּ֜ים מְסִלּ֤וֹת לְבֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ וּלְבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכִנֹּר֥וֹת וּנְבָלִ֖ים לַשָּׁרִ֑ים וְלֹא־נִרְא֥וּ כָהֵ֛ם לְפָנִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥רֶץ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The king made of the algum-wood ramps for the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and for the royal palace, and lyres and harps for the musicians, whose like had never before been seen in the land of Judah—
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe et-atsey haalegumiym mesilvot leveyt-yehovah uleveyt hamelekhe vekhinorvot unevaliym lashariym velo-nireu khahem lefaniym veerets yehudah

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֨לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה נָתַ֣ן לְמַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֗א אֶת־כׇּל־חֶפְצָהּ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁאָ֔לָה מִלְּבַ֖ד אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֣יאָה אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַֽתַּהֲפֹ֛ךְ וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ לְאַרְצָ֖הּ הִ֥יא וַעֲבָדֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated: King Solomon, in turn, gave the queen of Sheba everything she expressed a desire for, exceeding a return for what she had brought to the king. Then she and her courtiers left and returned to her own land.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe shelomoh natan lemalekhat-sheva et-khׇl-chefetsah asher shaalah milevad asher-heviyah el-hamelekhe vatahafokhe vatelekhe learetsah hiy vaavadeyha {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִשְׁקַ֣ל הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א לִשְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֛וֹת וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים וָשֵׁ֖שׁ כִּכְּרֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
Translated: The gold that Solomon received every year weighed 666 gold talents,
Transliteration: vayehiy mishekal hazahav asher-va lishelomoh veshanah echat shesh mevot veshishiym vashesh khikherey zahav

Hebrew: לְבַ֨ד מֵאַנְשֵׁ֧י הַתָּרִ֛ים וְהַסֹּחֲרִ֖ים מְבִיאִ֑ים וְכׇל־מַלְכֵ֤י עֲרַב֙ וּפַח֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ מְבִיאִ֛ים זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף לִשְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: besides what traders and merchants brought, and the gold and silver that all the kings of Arabia and governors of the regions brought to Solomon.
Transliteration: levad meaneshey hatariym vehasochariym meviyiym vekhׇl-malekhey arav ufachvot haarets meviyiym zahav vakhesef lishelomoh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה מָאתַ֥יִם צִנָּ֖ה זָהָ֣ב שָׁח֑וּט שֵׁ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ זָהָ֣ב שָׁח֔וּט יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־הַצִּנָּ֥ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
Translated: King Solomon made 200 shields of beaten gold—600 shekels of beaten gold for each shield,
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe shelomoh matayiim tsinah zahav shachut shesh mevot zahav shachut yaaleh al-hatsinah haechat

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֤וֹת מָֽגִנִּים֙ זָהָ֣ב שָׁח֔וּט שְׁלֹ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ זָהָ֔ב יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־הַמָּגֵ֣ן הָאֶחָ֑ת וַיִּתְּנֵ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בְּבֵ֖ית יַ֥עַר הַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated: and 300 bucklers of beaten gold—300 [shekels] of gold for each buckler. The king placed them in the Lebanon Forest House.
Transliteration: ushelosh-mevot maginiym zahav shachut shelosh mevot zahav yaaleh al-hamagen haechat vayitenem hamelekhe veveyt yaar halevanvon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ כִּסֵּא־שֵׁ֖ן גָּד֑וֹל וַיְצַפֵּ֖הוּ זָהָ֥ב טָהֽוֹר׃
Translated: The king also made a large throne of ivory, overlaid with pure gold.
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe khise-shen gadvol vayetsafehu zahav tahvor

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מַעֲל֣וֹת לַ֠כִּסֵּ֠א וְכֶ֨בֶשׁ בַּזָּהָ֤ב לַכִּסֵּא֙ מׇאֳחָזִ֔ים וְיָד֛וֹת מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה עַל־מְק֣וֹם הַשָּׁ֑בֶת וּשְׁנַ֣יִם אֲרָי֔וֹת עֹמְדִ֖ים אֵ֥צֶל הַיָּדֽוֹת׃
Translated: Six steps led up to the throne; and the throne had a golden footstool attached to it, and arms on either side of the seat. Two lions stood beside the arms,
Transliteration: veshesh maalvot lakhise vekhevesh vazahav lakhise mׇochaziym veyadvot mizeh umizeh al-mekvom hashavet ushenayiim arayvot omediym etsel hayadvot

Hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֧ים עָשָׂ֣ר אֲרָי֗וֹת עֹמְדִ֥ים שָׁ֛ם עַל־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַֽמַּעֲל֖וֹת מִזֶּ֣ה וּמִזֶּ֑ה לֹא־נַעֲשָׂ֥ה כֵ֖ן לְכׇל־מַמְלָכָֽה׃
Translated: and twelve lions stood on the six steps, six on either side. None such was ever made for any other kingdom.
Transliteration: usheneym ashar arayvot omediym sham al-shesh hamaalvot mizeh umizeh lo-naashah khen lekhׇl-mamelakhah

Hebrew: וְ֠כֹ֠ל כְּלֵ֞י מַשְׁקֵ֨ה הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ זָהָ֔ב וְכֹ֗ל כְּלֵ֛י בֵּֽית־יַ֥עַר הַלְּבָנ֖וֹן זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר אֵ֣ין כֶּ֗סֶף נֶחְשָׁ֛ב בִּימֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לִמְאֽוּמָה׃
Translated: All of King Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the utensils of the Lebanon Forest House were of pure gold; silver counted for nothing in Solomon’s days.
Transliteration: vekhol kheley mashekeh hamelekhe shelomoh zahav vekhol kheley veyt-yaar halevanvon zahav sagur eyn khesef necheshav viymey shelomoh limeumah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֳנִיּ֤וֹת לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הֹלְכ֣וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֔ישׁ עִ֖ם עַבְדֵ֣י חוּרָ֑ם אַחַת֩ לְשָׁל֨וֹשׁ שָׁנִ֜ים תָּב֣וֹאנָה ׀ אֳנִיּ֣וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֗ישׁ נֹֽשְׂאוֹת֙ זָהָ֣ב וָכֶ֔סֶף שֶׁנְהַבִּ֥ים וְקוֹפִ֖ים וְתוּכִּיִּֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The king’s fleet traveled to Tarshish with Huram’s servants. Once every three years, the Tarshish fleet came in, bearing gold and silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
Transliteration: khiy-oniyyvot lamelekhe holekhvot tareshiysh im avedey churam achat leshalvosh shaniym tavvonah oniyyvot tareshiysh noshevot zahav vakhesef shenehaviym vekvofiym vetukhiyiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּל֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל מַלְכֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ לְעֹ֖שֶׁר וְחׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated: King Solomon surpassed all the kings of the earth in wealth and wisdom.
Transliteration: vayigedal hamelekhe shelomoh mikhol malekhey haarets leosher vechׇkhemah

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ מְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ אֶת־חׇכְמָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: All the kings of the earth came to pay homage to Solomon and to listen to the wisdom with which God had endowed him.
Transliteration: vekhol malekhey haarets mevakeshiym et-feney shelomoh lishemoa et-chׇkhematvo asher-natan haElohim velivvo

Hebrew: וְהֵ֣ם מְבִיאִ֣ים אִ֣ישׁ מִנְחָת֡וֹ כְּלֵ֣י כֶ֩סֶף֩ וּכְלֵ֨י זָהָ֤ב וּשְׂלָמוֹת֙ נֵ֣שֶׁק וּבְשָׂמִ֔ים סוּסִ֖ים וּפְרָדִ֑ים דְּבַר־שָׁנָ֖ה בְּשָׁנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Each brought his tribute—silver and gold objects, robes, weapons, and spices, horses and mules—in the amount due each year.
Transliteration: vehem meviyiym iysh minechatvo kheley khesef ukheley zahav ushelamvot neshek uveshamiym susiym uferadiym devar-shanah veshanah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י לִשְׁלֹמֹ֜ה אַרְבַּ֩עַת֩ אֲלָפִ֨ים אֻֽרְי֤וֹת סוּסִים֙ וּמַרְכָּב֔וֹת וּשְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּנִּיחֵם֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב וְעִם־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Solomon had 4,000 stalls for horses and chariots, and 12,000 horsemen, which he stationed in the chariot towns and with the king in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayehiy lishelomoh arevaat alafiym ureyvot susiym umarekhavvot usheneym-ashar elef farashiym vayaniychem vearey harekhev veim-hamelekhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י מוֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכׇל־הַמְּלָכִ֑ים מִן־הַנָּהָר֙ וְעַד־אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְעַ֖ד גְּב֥וּל מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: He ruled over all the kings from the Euphrates to the land of the Philistines and to the border of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayehiy mvoshel vekhׇl-hamelakhiym min-hanahar vead-erets felishetiym vead gevul mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ אֶת־הַכֶּ֛סֶף בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם כָּאֲבָנִ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת הָאֲרָזִ֗ים נָתַ֛ן כַּשִּׁקְמִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־בַּשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: The king made silver as plentiful in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars as plentiful as sycamores in the Shephelah.
Transliteration: vayiten hamelekhe et-hakhesef viyrushala͏im khaavaniym veet haaraziym natan khashikemiym asher-vashefelah larov

Hebrew: וּמוֹצִיאִ֨ים סוּסִ֧ים מִמִּצְרַ֛יִם לִשְׁלֹמֹ֖ה וּמִכׇּל־הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: Horses were brought for Solomon from Egypt and all the lands.
Transliteration: umvotsiyiym susiym mimitserayiim lishelomoh umikhׇl-haaratsvot

Hebrew: וּשְׁאָר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרוֹנִ֑ים הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־דִּבְרֵי֙ נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֔יא וְעַל־נְבוּאַ֞ת אֲחִיָּ֣ה הַשִּׁילוֹנִ֗י וּבַֽחֲזוֹת֙ (יעדי) [יֶעְדּ֣וֹ] הַחֹזֶ֔ה עַל־יָרׇבְעָ֖ם בֶּן־נְבָֽט׃
Translated: The other events of Solomon’s reign, early and late, are recorded in the chronicle of the prophet Nathan and in the prophecies of Ahijah the Shilonite and in the visions of Jedo the seer concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat.
Transliteration: ushear diverey shelomoh harishoniym vehaacharvoniym halo-hem khetuviym al-diverey natan hanaviy veal-nevuat achiyah hashiylvoniy uvachazvot (ydy) [yeedvo] hachozeh al-yarׇveam ven-nevat

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֨ךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֧ה בִירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Solomon reigned forty years over all Israel in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayimelokhe shelomoh viyrushala͏im al-khׇl-yisherael arevaiym shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב שְׁלֹמֹה֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֔הוּ בְּעִ֖יר דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ רְחַבְעָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Solomon slept with his fathers and was buried in the city of his father David; his son Rehoboam succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav shelomoh im-avotayv vayikeveruhu veiyr daviyd aviyv vayimelokhe rechaveam venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֖ם שְׁכֶ֑מָה כִּ֥י שְׁכֶ֛ם בָּ֥אוּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְהַמְלִ֥יךְ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to acclaim him king.
Transliteration: vayelekhe rechaveam shekhemah khiy shekhem vau khׇl-yisherael lehameliykhe otvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּשְׁמֹ֨עַ יָרׇבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־נְבָט֙ וְה֣וּא בְמִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּרַ֔ח מִפְּנֵ֖י שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיָּ֥שׇׁב יָרׇבְעָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Jeroboam son of Nebat learned of it while he was in Egypt where he had fled from King Solomon, and Jeroboam returned from Egypt.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa yarׇveam ven-nevat vehu vemitserayiim asher varach mifeney shelomoh hamelekhe vayashׇv yarׇveam mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ וַיִּקְרְאוּ־ל֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥א יָרׇבְעָ֖ם וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיְדַבְּר֔וּ אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: They sent for him; and Jeroboam and all Israel came and spoke to Rehoboam as follows:
Transliteration: vayishelechu vayikereu-lvo vayavo yarׇveam vekhׇl-yisherael vayedaveru el-rechaveam lemor

Hebrew: אָבִ֖יךָ הִקְשָׁ֣ה אֶת־עֻלֵּ֑נוּ וְעַתָּ֡ה הָקֵל֩ מֵעֲבוֹדַ֨ת אָבִ֜יךָ הַקָּשָׁ֗ה וּמֵעֻלּ֧וֹ הַכָּבֵ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן עָלֵ֖ינוּ וְנַעַבְדֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: “Your father made our yoke heavy. Now lighten the harsh labor and the heavy yoke that your father laid on us, and we will serve you.”
Transliteration: aviykha hikeshah et-ulenu veatah hakel meavvodat aviykha hakashah umeulvo hakhaved asher-natan aleynu venaavedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם ע֛וֹד שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים וְשׁ֣וּבוּ אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: He answered them, “Come back to me in three days.” So the people went away.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem vod sheloshet yamiym veshuvu elay vayelekhe haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֞ץ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֗ם אֶת־הַזְּקֵנִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ עֹמְדִ֗ים לִפְנֵי֙ שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה אָבִ֔יו בִּהְיֹת֥וֹ חַ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר אֵ֚יךְ אַתֶּ֣ם נֽוֹעָצִ֔ים לְהָשִׁ֥יב לָעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: King Rehoboam took counsel with the elders who had served during the lifetime of his father Solomon. He said, “What answer do you counsel to give these people?”
Transliteration: vayivaats hamelekhe rechaveam et-hazekeniym asher-hayu omediym lifeney shelomoh aviyv viheyotvo chay lemor eykhe atem nvoatsiym lehashiyv laam-hazeh davar

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֨וּ אֵלָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר אִם־תִּהְיֶ֨ה לְט֜וֹב לְהָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ וּרְצִיתָ֔ם וְדִבַּרְתָּ֥ אֲלֵהֶ֖ם דְּבָרִ֣ים טוֹבִ֑ים וְהָי֥וּ לְךָ֛ עֲבָדִ֖ים כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: They answered him, “If you will be good to these people and appease them and speak to them with kind words, they will be your servants always.”
Transliteration: vayedaveru elayv lemor im-tiheyeh letvov lehaam hazeh uretsiytam vedivareta alehem devariym tvoviym vehayu lekha avadiym khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲזֹ֛ב אֶת־עֲצַ֥ת הַזְּקֵנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְעָצֻ֑הוּ וַיִּוָּעַ֗ץ אֶת־הַיְלָדִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר גָּדְל֣וּ אִתּ֔וֹ הָעֹמְדִ֖ים לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: But he ignored the counsel that the elders gave him, and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him and were serving him.
Transliteration: vayaazov et-atsat hazekeniym asher yeatsuhu vayivaats et-hayeladiym asher gadelu itvo haomediym lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם מָ֚ה אַתֶּ֣ם נֽוֹעָצִ֔ים וְנָשִׁ֥יב דָּבָ֖ר אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבְּר֤וּ אֵלַי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הָקֵל֙ מִן־הָעֹ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אָבִ֖יךָ עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “What,” he asked, “do you counsel that we reply to these people who said to me, ‘Lighten the yoke that your father laid on us’?”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem mah atem nvoatsiym venashiyv davar et-haam hazeh asher diveru elay lemor hakel min-haol asher-natan aviykha aleynu

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ אִתּ֗וֹ הַיְלָדִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר גָּדְל֣וּ אִתּוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ כֹּה־תֹאמַ֡ר לָעָם֩ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבְּר֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ לֵאמֹ֗ר אָבִ֙יךָ֙ הִכְבִּ֣יד אֶת־עֻלֵּ֔נוּ וְאַתָּ֖ה הָקֵ֣ל מֵעָלֵ֑ינוּ כֹּ֚ה תֹּאמַ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם קָֽטׇנִּ֥י עָבָ֖ה מִמׇּתְנֵ֥י אָבִֽי׃
Translated: And the young men who had grown up with him answered, “Speak thus to the people who said to you, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, now you make it lighter for us.’ Say to them, ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s loins.
Transliteration: vayedaveru itvo hayeladiym asher gadelu itvo lemor khoh-tomar laam asher-diveru eleykha lemor aviykha hikheviyd et-ulenu veatah hakel mealeynu khoh tomar alehem katׇniy avah mimׇteney aviy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אָבִי֙ הֶעְמִ֤יס עֲלֵיכֶם֙ עֹ֣ל כָּבֵ֔ד וַאֲנִ֖י אֹסִ֣יף עַֽל־עֻלְּכֶ֑ם אָבִ֗י יִסַּ֤ר אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּשּׁוֹטִ֔ים וַאֲנִ֖י בָּעַקְרַבִּֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: My father imposed a heavy yoke on you, and I will add to your yoke; my father flogged you with whips, but I [will do so] with scorpions.’”
Transliteration: veatah aviy heemiys aleykhem ol khaved vaaniy osiyf al-ulekhem aviy yisar etekhem vashvotiym vaaniy vaakeraviym {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יָרׇבְעָ֧ם וְכׇל־הָעָ֛ם אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֖ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר שׁ֥וּבוּ אֵלַ֖י בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁלִשִֽׁי׃
Translated: Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, since the king had told them, “Come back on the third day.”
Transliteration: vayavo yarׇveam vekhׇl-haam el-rechaveam vayyvom hashelishiy khaasher diver hamelekhe lemor shuvu elay vayyvom hashelishiy

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנֵ֥ם הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ קָשָׁ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲזֹב֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֔ם אֵ֖ת עֲצַ֥ת הַזְּקֵנִֽים׃
Translated: The king answered them harshly; thus King Rehoboam ignored the elders’ counsel.
Transliteration: vayaanem hamelekhe kashah vayaazov hamelekhe rechaveam et atsat hazekeniym

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם כַּעֲצַ֤ת הַיְלָדִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַכְבִּיד֙ אֶֽת־עֻלְּכֶ֔ם וַאֲנִ֖י אֹסִ֣יף עָלָ֑יו אָבִ֗י יִסַּ֤ר אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּשּׁוֹטִ֔ים וַאֲנִ֖י בָּעַקְרַבִּֽים׃
Translated: He spoke to them in accordance with the counsel of the young men, and said, “I will make your yoke heavy, and I will add to it; my father flogged you with whips, but I [will do so] with scorpions.”
Transliteration: vayedaver alehem khaatsat hayeladiym lemor akheviyd et-ulekhem vaaniy osiyf alayv aviy yisar etekhem vashvotiym vaaniy vaakeraviym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־הָעָ֑ם כִּֽי־הָיְתָ֤ה נְסִבָּה֙ מֵעִ֣ם הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְמַ֩עַן֩ הָקִ֨ים יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־דְּבָר֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּבֶּר֙ בְּיַד֙ אֲחִיָּ֣הוּ הַשִּׁלוֹנִ֔י אֶל־יָרׇבְעָ֖ם בֶּן־נְבָֽט׃
Translated: The king did not listen to the people, for God had brought it about in order that the L<small>ORD</small> might fulfill the promise that He had made through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam son of Nebat.
Transliteration: velo-shama hamelekhe el-haam khiy-hayetah nesivah meim haElohim lemaan hakiym yehovah et-devarvo asher diver veyad achiyahu hashilvoniy el-yarׇveam ven-nevat

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כִּ֠י לֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע הַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ לָהֶם֒ וַיָּשִׁ֣יבוּ הָעָ֣ם אֶת־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ ׀ לֵאמֹ֡ר מַה־לָּ֩נוּ֩ חֵ֨לֶק בְּדָוִ֜יד וְלֹא־נַחֲלָ֣ה בְּבֶן־יִשַׁ֗י אִ֤ישׁ לְאֹהָלֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַתָּ֕ה רְאֵ֥ה בֵיתְךָ֖ דָּוִ֑יד וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְאֹהָלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
When all Israel [saw] that the king had not listened to them, the people answered the king:
“We have no portion in David,
No share in Jesse’s son!
To your tents, O Israel!
Now look to your own house, O David.”
So all Israel returned to their homes.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael khiy lo-shama hamelekhe lahem vayashiyvu haam et-hamelekhe lemor mah-lanu chelek vedaviyd velo-nachalah veven-yishay iysh leohaleykha yisherael atah reeh veytekha daviyd vayelekhe khׇl-yisherael leohalayv {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם רְחַבְעָֽם׃
Translated: But Rehoboam continued to reign over the Israelites who lived in the towns of Judah.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael hayosheviym vearey yehudah vayimelokhe aleyhem rechaveam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֗ם אֶת־הֲדֹרָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַמַּ֔ס וַיִּרְגְּמוּ־ב֧וֹ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶ֖בֶן וַיָּמֹ֑ת {ס} וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֗ם הִתְאַמֵּץ֙ לַעֲל֣וֹת בַּמֶּרְכָּבָ֔ה לָנ֖וּס יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: King Rehoboam sent out Hadoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, but the Israelites pelted him to death with stones. Thereupon, King Rehoboam hurriedly mounted his chariot and fled to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe rechaveam et-hadoram asher al-hamas vayiregemu-vvo veney-yisherael even vayamot {s} vehamelekhe rechaveam hiteamets laalvot vamerekhavah lanus yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּפְשְׁע֤וּ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּבֵ֣ית דָּוִ֔יד עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Israel has been in revolt against the house of David to this day.
Transliteration: vayifesheu yisherael veveyt daviyd ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א רְחַבְעָם֮ יְרוּשָׁלַ֒͏ִם֒ וַיַּקְהֵל֩ אֶת־בֵּ֨ית יְהוּדָ֜ה וּבִנְיָמִ֗ן מֵאָ֨ה וּשְׁמוֹנִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף בָּח֖וּר עֹשֵׂ֣ה מִלְחָמָ֑ה לְהִלָּחֵם֙ עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה לִרְחַבְעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: When Rehoboam arrived in Jerusalem, he mustered the house of Judah and Benjamin, 180,000 picked fighting men, to make war with Israel in order to restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.
Transliteration: vayavo rechaveam yerushala͏im vayakehel et-veyt yehudah uvineyamin meah ushemvoniym elef vachur osheh milechamah lehilachem im-yisherael lehashiyv et-hamamelakhah lirechaveam {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־שְׁמַעְיָ֥הוּ אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But the word of the L<small>ORD</small> came to Shemaiah, the man of God:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-shemaeyahu iysh-haElohim lemor

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֕ר אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֥ם בֶּן־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאֶל֙ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּיהוּדָ֥ה וּבִנְיָמִ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: “Say to Rehoboam son of Solomon king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin:
Transliteration: emor el-rechaveam ven-shelomoh melekhe yehudah veel khׇl-yisherael viyhudah uvineyamin lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֡ה לֹא־תַעֲלוּ֩ וְלֹא־תִלָּ֨חֲמ֜וּ עִם־אֲחֵיכֶ֗ם שׁ֚וּבוּ אִ֣ישׁ לְבֵית֔וֹ כִּ֧י מֵאִתִּ֛י נִֽהְיָ֖ה הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַֽיִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ מִלֶּ֥כֶת אֶל־יָרׇבְעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: You shall not set out to make war on your kinsmen. Let every man return to his home, for this thing has been brought about by Me.” They heeded the words of the L<small>ORD</small> and refrained from marching against Jeroboam.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah lo-taalu velo-tilachamu im-acheykhem shuvu iysh leveytvo khiy meitiy niheyah hadavar hazeh vayishemeu et-diverey yehovah vayashuvu milekhet el-yarׇveam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב רְחַבְעָ֖ם בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיִּ֧בֶן עָרִ֛ים לְמָצ֖וֹר בִּיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem and built fortified towns in Judah.
Transliteration: vayeshev rechaveam viyrushala͏im vayiven ariym lematsvor viyhudah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֧בֶן אֶת־בֵּֽית־לֶ֛חֶם וְאֶת־עֵיטָ֖ם וְאֶת־תְּקֽוֹעַ׃
Translated: He built up Bethlehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
Transliteration: vayiven et-veyt-lechem veet-eytam veet-tekvoa

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בֵּֽית־צ֥וּר וְאֶת־שׂוֹכ֖וֹ וְאֶת־עֲדֻלָּֽם׃
Translated: and Beth-zur, and Soco, and Adullam,
Transliteration: veet-veyt-tsur veet-shvokhvo veet-adulam

Hebrew: וְאֶת־גַּ֥ת וְאֶת־מָרֵשָׁ֖ה וְאֶת־זִֽיף׃
Translated: and Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph,
Transliteration: veet-gat veet-mareshah veet-ziyf

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲדוֹרַ֥יִם וְאֶת־לָכִ֖ישׁ וְאֶת־עֲזֵקָֽה׃
Translated: and Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
Transliteration: veet-advorayiim veet-lakhiysh veet-azekah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־צׇרְעָה֙ וְאֶת־אַיָּל֔וֹן וְאֶ֨ת־חֶבְר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּֽיהוּדָ֖ה וּבְבִנְיָמִ֑ן עָרֵ֖י מְצֻרֽוֹת׃
Translated: and Zorah, and Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin, as fortified towns.
Transliteration: veet-tsׇreah veet-ayalvon veet-chevervon asher viyhudah uvevineyamin arey metsurvot

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֖ק אֶת־הַמְּצוּר֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּ֤ן בָּהֶם֙ נְגִידִ֔ים וְאֹצְר֥וֹת מַאֲכָ֖ל וְשֶׁ֥מֶן וָיָֽיִן׃
Translated: He strengthened the fortified towns and put commanders in them, along with stores of food, oil, and wine,
Transliteration: vayechazek et-hametsurvot vayiten vahem negiydiym veotservot maakhal veshemen vayayiin

Hebrew: וּבְכׇל־עִ֤יר וָעִיר֙ צִנּ֣וֹת וּרְמָחִ֔ים וַֽיְחַזְּקֵ֖ם לְהַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־ל֖וֹ יְהוּדָ֥ה וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: and shields and spears in every town. He strengthened them exceedingly; thus Judah and Benjamin were his.
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-iyr vaiyr tsinvot uremachiym vayechazekem lehareveh meod vayehiy-lvo yehudah uvineyamin {s}

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִֽתְיַצְּב֥וּ עָלָ֖יו מִכׇּל־גְּבוּלָֽם׃
Translated: The priests and the Levites, from all their territories throughout Israel, presented themselves to him.
Transliteration: vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim asher vekhׇl-yisherael hiteyatsevu alayv mikhׇl-gevulam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָזְב֣וּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם אֶת־מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶם֙ וַאֲחֻזָּתָ֔ם וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ לִֽיהוּדָ֖ה וְלִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּֽי־הִזְנִיחָ֤ם יָֽרׇבְעָם֙ וּבָנָ֔יו מִכַּהֵ֖ן לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The Levites had left their pasturelands and their holdings and had set out for Judah and Jerusalem, for Jeroboam and his sons had prevented them from serving the L<small>ORD</small>,
Transliteration: khiy-azevu haleviyim et-migeresheyhem vaachuzatam vayelekhu liyhudah veliyrushala͏im khiy-hizeniycham yarׇveam uvanayv mikhahen layhovah

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲמֶד־לוֹ֙ כֹּֽהֲנִ֔ים לַבָּמ֖וֹת וְלַשְּׂעִירִ֑ים וְלָעֲגָלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: having appointed his own priests for the shrines, goat-demons, and calves which he had made.
Transliteration: vayaamed-lvo khohaniym lavamvot velasheiyriym velaagaliym asher ashah

Hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַנֹּֽתְנִים֙ אֶת־לְבָבָ֔ם לְבַקֵּ֕שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בָּ֚אוּ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לִזְבּ֕וֹחַ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: From all the tribes of Israel, those intent on seeking the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel followed them to Jerusalem, to sacrifice to the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers.
Transliteration: veachareyhem mikhol shivetey yisherael hanoteniym et-levavam levakesh et-yehovah elohey yisherael vau yerushala͏im lizevvocha layhovah elohey avvoteyhem

Hebrew: וַֽיְחַזְּקוּ֙ אֶת־מַלְכ֣וּת יְהוּדָ֔ה וַֽיְאַמְּצ֛וּ אֶת־רְחַבְעָ֥ם בֶּן־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְשָׁנִ֣ים שָׁל֑וֹשׁ כִּ֣י הָלְכ֗וּ בְּדֶ֧רֶךְ דָּוִ֛יד וּשְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְשָׁנִ֥ים שָׁלֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: They strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and supported Rehoboam son of Solomon for three years, for they followed the ways of David and Solomon for three years.
Transliteration: vayechazeku et-malekhut yehudah vayeametsu et-rechaveam ven-shelomoh leshaniym shalvosh khiy halekhu vederekhe daviyd ushelomoh leshaniym shalvosh

Hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֤וֹ רְחַבְעָם֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה אֶת־מָ֣חֲלַ֔ת (בן) [בַּת־]יְרִימ֖וֹת בֶּן־דָּוִ֑יד אֲבִיהַ֕יִל בַּת־אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־יִשָֽׁי׃
Translated: Rehoboam married Mahalath daughter of Jerimoth son of David, and Abihail daughter of Eliab son of Jesse.
Transliteration: vayikach-lvo rechaveam ishah et-machalat (vn) [vat-]yeriymvot ven-daviyd aviyhayiil vat-eliyav ven-yishay

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ בָּנִ֑ים אֶת־יְע֥וּשׁ וְאֶת־שְׁמַרְיָ֖ה וְאֶת־זָֽהַם׃
Translated: She bore him sons: Jeush, Shemariah, and Zaham.
Transliteration: vateled lvo vaniym et-yeush veet-shemareyah veet-zaham

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֶ֣יהָ לָקַ֔ח אֶֽת־מַעֲכָ֖ה בַּת־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־אֲבִיָּה֙ וְאֶת־עַתַּ֔י וְאֶת־זִיזָ֖א וְאֶת־שְׁלֹמִֽית׃
Translated: He then took Maacah daughter of Absalom; she bore him Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.
Transliteration: veachareyha lakach et-maakhah vat-aveshalvom vateled lvo et-aviyah veet-atay veet-ziyza veet-shelomiyt

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֨ב רְחַבְעָ֜ם אֶת־מַעֲכָ֣ה בַת־אַבְשָׁל֗וֹם מִכׇּל־נָשָׁיו֙ וּפִ֣ילַגְשָׁ֔יו כִּ֠י נָשִׁ֤ים שְׁמוֹנֶֽה־עֶשְׂרֵה֙ נָשָׂ֔א וּפִֽילַגְשִׁ֖ים שִׁשִּׁ֑ים וַיּ֗וֹלֶד עֶשְׂרִ֧ים וּשְׁמוֹנָ֛ה בָּנִ֖ים וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים בָּנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Rehoboam loved Maacah daughter of Absalom more than his other wives and concubines—for he took eighteen wives and sixty concubines; he begot twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
Transliteration: vayeehav rechaveam et-maakhah vat-aveshalvom mikhׇl-nashayv ufiylageshayv khiy nashiym shemvoneh-eshereh nasha ufiylageshiym shishiym vayyvoled esheriym ushemvonah vaniym veshishiym vanvot

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֨ד לָרֹ֧אשׁ רְחַבְעָ֛ם אֶת־אֲבִיָּ֥ה בֶֽן־מַעֲכָ֖ה לְנָגִ֣יד בְּאֶחָ֑יו כִּ֖י לְהַמְלִיכֽוֹ׃
Translated: Rehoboam designated Abijah son of Maacah as chief and leader among his brothers, for he intended him to be his successor.
Transliteration: vayaamed larosh rechaveam et-aviyah ven-maakhah lenagiyd veechayv khiy lehameliykhvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩בֶן֩ וַיִּפְרֹ֨ץ מִכׇּל־בָּנָ֜יו לְֽכׇל־אַרְצ֧וֹת יְהוּדָ֣ה וּבִנְיָמִ֗ן לְכֹל֙ עָרֵ֣י הַמְּצֻר֔וֹת וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֛ם הַמָּז֖וֹן לָרֹ֑ב וַיִּשְׁאַ֖ל הֲמ֥וֹן נָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: He prudently distributed all his sons throughout the regions of Judah and Benjamin and throughout the fortified towns; he provided them with abundant food, and he sought many wives for them.
Transliteration: vayaven vayiferots mikhׇl-vanayv lekhׇl-aretsvot yehudah uvineyamin lekhol arey hametsurvot vayiten lahem hamazvon larov vayisheal hamvon nashiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּהָכִ֞ין מַלְכ֤וּת רְחַבְעָם֙ וּכְחֶזְקָת֔וֹ עָזַ֖ב אֶת־תּוֹרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: When the kingship of Rehoboam was firmly established, and he grew strong, he abandoned the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small>, he and all Israel with him.
Transliteration: vayehiy khehakhiyn malekhut rechaveam ukhechezekatvo azav et-tvorat yehovah vekhׇl-yisherael imvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּשָּׁנָ֤ה הַֽחֲמִישִׁית֙ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֔ם עָלָ֛ה שִׁישַׁ֥ק מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּ֥י מָעֲל֖וּ בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the fifth year of King Rehoboam, King Shishak of Egypt marched against Jerusalem—for they had trespassed against the L<small>ORD</small>—
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hachamiyshiyt lamelekhe rechaveam alah shiyshak melekhe-mitserayiim al-yerushala͏im khiy maalu vayhovah

Hebrew: בְּאֶ֤לֶף וּמָאתַ֙יִם֙ רֶ֔כֶב וּבְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֗ר לָעָ֞ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤אוּ עִמּוֹ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לוּבִ֥ים סֻכִּיִּ֖ים וְכוּשִֽׁים׃
Translated: with 1,200 chariots, 60,000 horsemen and innumerable troops who came with him from Egypt: Lybians, Sukkites, and Kushites.
Transliteration: veelef umatayiim rekhev uveshishiym elef farashiym veeyn misefar laam asher-vau imvo mimitserayiim luviym sukhiyiym vekhushiym

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכֹּ֛ד אֶת־עָרֵ֥י הַמְּצֻר֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִיהוּדָ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֖א עַד־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: He took the fortified towns of Judah and advanced on Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayilekhod et-arey hametsurvot asher liyhudah vayavo ad-yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וּֽשְׁמַעְיָ֤ה הַנָּבִיא֙ בָּ֣א אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֔ם וְשָׂרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נֶאֶסְפ֥וּ אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם מִפְּנֵ֣י שִׁישָׁ֑ק וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אַתֶּם֙ עֲזַבְתֶּ֣ם אֹתִ֔י וְאַף־אֲנִ֛י עָזַ֥בְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּיַד־שִׁישָֽׁק׃
Translated: The prophet Shemaiah came to Rehoboam and the officers of Judah, who had assembled in Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said to them, “Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: You have abandoned Me, so I am abandoning you to Shishak.”
Transliteration: ushemaeyah hanaviy va el-rechaveam vesharey yehudah asher-neesefu el-yerushala͏im mifeney shiyshak vayomer lahem khoh-amar yehovah atem azavetem otiy veaf-aniy azavetiy etekhem veyad-shiyshak

Hebrew: וַיִּכָּנְע֥וּ שָׂרֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְהַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ צַדִּ֥יק <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then the officers of Israel and the king humbled themselves and declared, “The L<small>ORD</small> is in the right.”
Transliteration: vayikhaneu sharey-yisherael vehamelekhe vayomeru tsadiyk <small></small> yehovah

Hebrew: וּבִרְא֤וֹת יְהֹוָה֙ כִּ֣י נִכְנָ֔עוּ הָיָה֩ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶל־שְׁמַעְיָ֧ה <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֛ר נִכְנְע֖וּ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִיתֵ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֨י לָהֶ֤ם כִּמְעַט֙ לִפְלֵיטָ֔ה וְלֹא־תִתַּ֧ךְ חֲמָתִ֛י בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּיַד־שִׁישָֽׁק׃
Translated: When the L<small>ORD</small> saw that they had submitted, the word of the L<small>ORD</small> came to Shemaiah, saying, “Since they have humbled themselves, I will not destroy them but will grant them some measure of deliverance, and My wrath will not be poured out on Jerusalem through Shishak.
Transliteration: uvirevot yehovah khiy nikhenau hayah devar-yehovah el-shemaeyah <small></small> lemor nikheneu lo ashechiytem venatatiy lahem khimeat lifeleytah velo-titakhe chamatiy viyrushala͏im veyad-shiyshak

Hebrew: כִּ֥י יִֽהְיוּ־ל֖וֹ לַעֲבָדִ֑ים וְיֵֽדְעוּ֙ עֲב֣וֹדָתִ֔י וַעֲבוֹדַ֖ת מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: They will be subject to him, and they will know the difference between serving Me and serving the kingdoms of the earth.” King Shishak of Egypt marched against Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy yiheyu-lvo laavadiym veeideu avvodatiy vaavvodat mamelekhvot haaratsvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל שִׁישַׁ֥ק מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֒͏ִם֒ וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־אֹצְר֣וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְאֶת־אֹֽצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֶת־הַכֹּ֖ל לָקָ֑ח וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־מָגִנֵּ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: He took away the treasures of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and the treasures of the royal palace; he took away everything; he took away the golden shields that Solomon had made.
Transliteration: vayaal shiyshak melekhe-mitserayiim al-yerushala͏im vayikach et-otservot veyt-yehovah veet-otservot veyt hamelekhe et-hakhol lakach vayikach et-maginey hazahav asher ashah shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ רְחַבְעָם֙ תַּחְתֵּיהֶ֔ם מָגִנֵּ֖י נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְהִפְקִ֗יד עַל־יַד֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָרָצִ֔ים הַשֹּׁ֣מְרִ֔ים פֶּ֖תַח בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: King Rehoboam had bronze shields made in their place, and entrusted them to the officers of the guard who guarded the entrance to the royal palace.
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe rechaveam tacheteyhem maginey nechoshet vehifekiyd al-yad sharey haratsiym hashomeriym fetach veyt hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י מִדֵּי־ב֥וֹא הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בָּ֤אוּ הָֽרָצִים֙ וּנְשָׂא֔וּם וֶהֱשִׁב֖וּם אֶל־תָּ֥א הָרָצִֽים׃
Translated: Whenever the king entered the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, the guards would carry them and then bring them back to the armory of the guards.
Transliteration: vayehiy midey-vvo hamelekhe veyt yehovah vau haratsiym uneshaum veheshivum el-ta haratsiym

Hebrew: וּבְהִכָּֽנְע֗וֹ שָׁ֤ב מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ אַף־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א לְהַשְׁחִ֖ית לְכָלָ֑ה וְגַם֙ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה הָיָ֖ה דְּבָרִ֥ים טוֹבִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: After he had humbled himself, the anger of the L<small>ORD</small> was averted and He did not destroy him entirely; in Judah, too, good things were found.
Transliteration: uvehikhanevo shav mimenu af-yehovah velo lehashechiyt lekhalah vegam viyhudah hayah devariym tvoviym {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֞ק הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֛ם בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וַיִּמְלֹ֑ךְ כִּ֣י בֶן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים וְאַחַ֣ת שָׁנָה֩ רְחַבְעָ֨ם בְּמׇלְכ֜וֹ וּֽשְׁבַ֨ע עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֣ה ׀ מָלַ֣ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הָ֠עִ֠יר אֲשֶׁר־בָּחַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָשׂ֨וּם אֶת־שְׁמ֥וֹ שָׁם֙ מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ נַעֲמָ֖ה הָעַמֹּנִֽית׃
Translated: King Rehoboam grew strong in Jerusalem and exercised kingship. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem—the city the L<small>ORD</small> had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to establish His name there. His mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
Transliteration: vayitechazek hamelekhe rechaveam viyrushala͏im vayimelokhe khiy ven-arevaiym veachat shanah rechaveam vemׇlekhvo usheva eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im haiyr asher-vachar yehovah lashum et-shemvo sham mikhol shivetey yisherael veshem imvo naamah haamoniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ הָרָ֑ע כִּ֣י לֹ֤א הֵכִין֙ לִבּ֔וֹ לִדְר֖וֹשׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: He did what was wrong, for he had not set his heart to seek the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaash hara khiy lo hekhiyn livvo lidervosh et-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וְדִבְרֵ֣י רְחַבְעָ֗ם הָרִֽאשֹׁנִים֙ וְהָאַ֣חֲרוֹנִ֔ים הֲלֹא־הֵ֨ם כְּתוּבִ֜ים בְּדִבְרֵ֨י שְׁמַעְיָ֧ה הַנָּבִ֛יא וְעִדּ֥וֹ הַחֹזֶ֖ה לְהִתְיַחֵ֑שׂ וּמִלְחֲמ֧וֹת רְחַבְעָ֛ם וְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: The deeds of Rehoboam, early and late, are recorded in the chronicles of the prophet Shemaiah and Iddo the seer, in the manner of genealogy. There was continuous war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam.
Transliteration: vediverey rechaveam harishoniym vehaacharvoniym halo-hem khetuviym vediverey shemaeyah hanaviy veidvo hachozeh lehiteyachesh umilechamvot rechaveam veyarׇveam khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב רְחַבְעָם֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲבִיָּ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Rehoboam slept with his fathers and was buried in the City of David. His son Abijah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav rechaveam im-avotayv vayikaver veiyr daviyd vayimelokhe aviyah venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֛ת שְׁמוֹנֶ֥ה עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יָרׇבְעָ֑ם וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ אֲבִיָּ֖ה עַל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah became king over Judah.
Transliteration: vishenat shemvoneh eshereh lamelekhe yarׇveam vayimelokhe aviyah al-yehudah

Hebrew: שָׁל֣וֹשׁ שָׁנִ֗ים מָלַךְ֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ מִיכָיָ֥הוּ בַת־אוּרִיאֵ֖ל מִן־גִּבְעָ֑ה וּמִלְחָמָ֥ה הָֽיְתָ֛ה בֵּ֥ין אֲבִיָּ֖ה וּבֵ֥ין יָרׇבְעָֽם׃
Translated: He reigned three years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Micaiah daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. There was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
Transliteration: shalvosh shaniym malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo miykhayahu vat-uriyel min-giveah umilechamah hayetah veyn aviyah uveyn yarׇveam

Hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֨ר אֲבִיָּ֜ה אֶת־הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה בְּחַ֙יִל֙ גִּבּוֹרֵ֣י מִלְחָמָ֔ה אַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף אִ֣ישׁ בָּח֑וּר {ס} וְיָרׇבְעָ֗ם עָרַ֤ךְ עִמּוֹ֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה בִּשְׁמוֹנֶ֨ה מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֛לֶף אִ֥ישׁ בָּח֖וּר גִּבּ֥וֹר חָֽיִל׃ {ס}
Translated: Abijah joined battle with a force of warriors, 400,000 picked men. Jeroboam arrayed for battle against him 800,000 picked men, warriors.
Transliteration: vayeesor aviyah et-hamilechamah vechayiil givvorey milechamah areva-mevot elef iysh vachur {s} veyarׇveam arakhe imvo milechamah vishemvoneh mevot elef iysh vachur givvor chayiil {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם אֲבִיָּ֗ה מֵעַל֙ לְהַ֣ר צְמָרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שְׁמָע֖וּנִי יָרׇבְעָ֥ם וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Abijah stood on top of Mount Zemaraim in the hill country of Ephraim and said, “Listen to me, Jeroboam and all Israel.
Transliteration: vayakׇm aviyah meal lehar tsemarayiim asher vehar eferayiim vayomer shemauniy yarׇveam vekhׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א לָכֶם֙ לָדַ֔עַת כִּ֞י יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נָתַ֨ן מַמְלָכָ֧ה לְדָוִ֛יד עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְעוֹלָ֑ם ל֥וֹ וּלְבָנָ֖יו בְּרִ֥ית מֶֽלַח׃ {פ}
Translated: Surely you know that the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel gave David kingship over Israel forever—to him and his sons—by a covenant of salt.
Transliteration: halo lakhem ladaat khiy yehovah elohey yisherael natan mamelakhah ledaviyd al-yisherael levolam lvo ulevanayv veriyt melach {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט עֶ֖בֶד שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בֶן־דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּמְרֹ֖ד עַל־אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated: Jeroboam son of Nebat had been in the service of Solomon son of David, but he rose up and rebelled against his master.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yarׇveam ven-nevat eved shelomoh ven-daviyd vayimerod al-adonayv

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ עָלָ֗יו אֲנָשִׁ֤ים רֵקִים֙ בְּנֵ֣י בְלִיַּ֔עַל וַיִּֽתְאַמְּצ֖וּ עַל־רְחַבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וּרְחַבְעָ֗ם הָ֤יָֽה נַ֙עַר֙ וְרַךְ־לֵבָ֔ב וְלֹ֥א הִתְחַזַּ֖ק לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Riffraff and scoundrels gathered around him and pressed hard upon Rehoboam son of Solomon. Rehoboam was inexperienced and fainthearted and could not stand up to them.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu alayv anashiym rekiym veney veliyaal vayiteametsu al-rechaveam ven-shelomoh urechaveam hayah naar verakhe-levav velo hitechazak lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹמְרִ֗ים לְהִתְחַזֵּק֙ לִפְנֵי֙ מַמְלֶ֣כֶת יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּיַ֖ד בְּנֵ֣י דָוִ֑יד וְאַתֶּם֙ הָמ֣וֹן רָ֔ב וְעִמָּכֶם֙ עֶגְלֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם יָרׇבְעָ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Now you are bent on opposing the kingdom of the L<small>ORD</small>, which is in the charge of the sons of David, because you are a great multitude and possess the golden calves that Jeroboam made for you as gods.
Transliteration: veatah atem omeriym lehitechazek lifeney mamelekhet yehovah veyad veney daviyd veatem hamvon rav veimakhem egeley zahav asher ashah lakhem yarׇveam lelohiym

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א הִדַּחְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כֹּהֲנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְהַלְוִיִּ֑ם וַתַּעֲשׂ֨וּ לָכֶ֤ם כֹּֽהֲנִים֙ כְּעַמֵּ֣י הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת כׇּל־הַבָּ֗א לְמַלֵּ֨א יָד֜וֹ בְּפַ֤ר בֶּן־בָּקָר֙ וְאֵילִ֣ם שִׁבְעָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה כֹהֵ֖ן לְלֹ֥א אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Did you not banish the priests of the L<small>ORD</small>, the sons of Aaron and the Levites, and, like the peoples of the land, appoint your own priests? Anyone who offered himself for ordination with a young bull of the herd and seven rams became a priest of no-gods!
Transliteration: halo hidachetem et-khohaney yehovah et-veney aharon vehaleviyim vataashu lakhem khohaniym kheamey haaratsvot khׇl-hava lemale yadvo vefar ven-vakar veeylim shiveah vehayah khohen lelo Elohim {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲנַ֛חְנוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ וְלֹ֣א עֲזַבְנֻ֑הוּ וְכֹ֨הֲנִ֜ים מְשָׁרְתִ֤ים לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְהַלְוִיִּ֖ם בַּמְלָֽאכֶת׃
Translated: As for us, the L<small>ORD</small> is our God, and we have not forsaken Him. The priests who minister to the L<small>ORD</small> are the sons of Aaron, and the Levites are at their tasks.
Transliteration: vaanachenu yehovah eloheynu velo azavenuhu vekhohaniym mesharetiym layhovah veney aharon vehaleviyim vamelakhet

Hebrew: וּמַקְטִרִ֣ים לַיהֹוָ֡ה עֹל֣וֹת בַּבֹּֽקֶר־בַּבֹּ֣קֶר וּבָעֶֽרֶב־בָּעֶ֣רֶב וּקְטֹֽרֶת־סַמִּים֩ וּמַעֲרֶ֨כֶת לֶ֜חֶם עַל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֣ן הַטָּה֗וֹר וּמְנוֹרַ֨ת הַזָּהָ֤ב וְנֵרֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ לְבָעֵר֙ בָּעֶ֣רֶב בָּעֶ֔רֶב כִּֽי־שֹׁמְרִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְאַתֶּ֖ם עֲזַבְתֶּ֥ם אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: They offer burnt offerings in smoke each morning and each evening, and the aromatic incense, the rows of bread on the pure table; they kindle the golden lampstand with its lamps burning each evening, for we keep the charge of the L<small>ORD</small> our God, while you have forsaken it.
Transliteration: umaketiriym layhovah olvot vavoker-vavoker uvaerev-vaerev uketoret-samiym umaarekhet lechem al-hashulechan hatahvor umenvorat hazahav veneroteyha levaer vaerev vaerev khiy-shomeriym anachenu et-mishemeret yehovah eloheynu veatem azavetem otvo

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֩ עִמָּ֨נוּ בָרֹ֜אשׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> וְכֹהֲנָ֛יו וַחֲצֹצְר֥וֹת הַתְּרוּעָ֖ה לְהָרִ֣יעַ עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אַל־תִּלָּ֥חֲמ֛וּ עִם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם כִּי־לֹ֥א תַצְלִֽיחוּ׃
Translated: See, God is with us as our chief, and His priests have the trumpets for sounding blasts against you. O children of Israel, do not fight the L<small>ORD</small> God of your fathers, because you will not succeed.”
Transliteration: vehineh imanu varosh haElohim <small></small> vekhohanayv vachatsotservot hateruah lehariya aleykhem veney yisherael al-tilachamu im-yehovah elohey-avoteykhem khiy-lo tatseliychu

Hebrew: וְיָרׇבְעָ֗ם הֵסֵב֙ אֶת־הַמַּאְרָ֔ב לָב֖וֹא מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְהַמַּאְרָ֖ב מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Jeroboam, however, had directed the ambush to go around and come from the rear, thus the main body was in front of Judah, while the ambush was behind them.
Transliteration: veyarׇveam hesev et-hamaerav lavvo meachareyhem vayiheyu lifeney yehudah vehamaerav meachareyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֣וּ יְהוּדָ֗ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה לָהֶ֤ם הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ פָּנִ֣ים וְאָח֔וֹר וַֽיִּצְעֲק֖וּ לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְהַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים (מחצצרים) [מַחְצְרִ֖ים] בַּחֲצֹצְרֽוֹת׃
Translated: When Judah turned around and saw that the fighting was before and behind them, they cried out to the L<small>ORD</small>, and the priests blew the trumpets.
Transliteration: vayifenu yehudah vehineh lahem hamilechamah faniym veachvor vayitseaku layhovah vehakhohaniym (mchtstsrym) [machetseriym] vachatsotservot

Hebrew: וַיָּרִ֖יעוּ אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיְהִ֗י בְּהָרִ֙יעַ֙ אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה וְהָאֱלֹהִ֗ים נָגַ֤ף אֶת־יָֽרׇבְעָם֙ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִפְנֵ֥י אֲבִיָּ֖ה וִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The men of Judah raised a shout; and when the men of Judah raised a shout, God routed Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
Transliteration: vayariyu iysh yehudah vayehiy vehariya iysh yehudah vehaElohim nagaf et-yarׇveam vekhׇl-yisherael lifeney aviyah viyhudah

Hebrew: וַיָּנ֥וּסוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִפְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדָֽם׃
Translated: The Israelites fled before Judah, and God delivered them into their hands.
Transliteration: vayanusu veney-yisherael mifeney yehudah vayitenem Elohim veyadam

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֥וּ בָהֶ֛ם אֲבִיָּ֥ה וְעַמּ֖וֹ מַכָּ֣ה רַבָּ֑ה וַיִּפְּל֤וּ חֲלָלִים֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל חֲמֵשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף אִ֥ישׁ בָּחֽוּר׃
Translated: Abijah and his army inflicted a severe defeat on them; 500,000 picked men of Israel fell slain.
Transliteration: vayakhu vahem aviyah veamvo makhah ravah vayifelu chalaliym miyisherael chamesh-mevot elef iysh vachur

Hebrew: וַיִּכָּנְע֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑יא וַיֶּֽאֶמְצוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה כִּ֣י נִשְׁעֲנ֔וּ עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The Israelites were crushed at that time, while the people of Judah triumphed because they relied on the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayikhaneu veney-yisherael vaet hahiy vayeemetsu veney yehudah khiy nisheanu al-yehovah elohey avvoteyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדֹּ֣ף אֲבִיָּה֮ אַחֲרֵ֣י יָרׇבְעָם֒ וַיִּלְכֹּ֤ד מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עָרִ֔ים אֶת־בֵּֽית־אֵל֙ וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְאֶת־יְשָׁנָ֖ה וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאֶת־(עפרון) [עֶפְרַ֖יִן] וּבְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Abijah pursued Jeroboam and captured some of his cities—Bethel with its dependencies, Jeshanah with its dependencies, and Ephrain with its dependencies.
Transliteration: vayiredof aviyah acharey yarׇveam vayilekhod mimenu ariym et-veyt-el veet-venvoteyha veet-yeshanah veet-venvoteyha veet-(frvn) [eferayiin] uvenoteyha

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־עָצַ֧ר כֹּֽחַ־יָרׇבְעָ֛ם ע֖וֹד בִּימֵ֣י אֲבִיָּ֑הוּ וַיִּגְּפֵ֥הוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: Jeroboam could not muster strength again during the days of Abijah. The L<small>ORD</small> struck him down and he died.
Transliteration: velo-atsar khocha-yarׇveam vod viymey aviyahu vayigefehu yehovah vayamot {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֣ק אֲבִיָּ֔הוּ וַיִּ֨שָּׂא־ל֔וֹ נָשִׁ֖ים אַרְבַּ֣ע עֶשְׂרֵ֑ה וַיּ֗וֹלֶד עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ בָּנִ֔ים וְשֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה בָּנֽוֹת׃
Translated: But Abijah grew powerful; he married fourteen wives and begat twenty-two sons and sixteen daughters.
Transliteration: vayitechazek aviyahu vayisha-lvo nashiym areva eshereh vayyvoled esheriym ushenayiim vaniym veshesh eshereh vanvot

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י אֲבִיָּ֔ה וּדְרָכָ֖יו וּדְבָרָ֑יו כְּתוּבִ֕ים בְּמִדְרַ֖שׁ הַנָּבִ֥יא עִדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: The other events of Abijah’s reign, his conduct and his acts, are recorded in the story of the prophet Iddo.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey aviyah uderakhayv udevarayv khetuviym vemiderash hanaviy idvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֨ב אֲבִיָּ֜ה עִם־אֲבֹתָ֗יו וַיִּקְבְּר֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֔יד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אָסָ֥א בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּ֑יו בְּיָמָ֛יו שָׁקְטָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ עֶ֥שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Abijah slept with his fathers and was buried in the City of David; his son Asa succeeded him as king. The land was untroubled for ten years.
Transliteration: vayishekhav aviyah im-avotayv vayikeveru otvo veiyr daviyd vayimelokhe asa venvo tachetayv veyamayv shaketah haarets esher shaniym {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אָסָא֙ הַטּ֣וֹב וְהַיָּשָׁ֔ר בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: Asa did what was good and pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small> his God.
Transliteration: vayaash asa hatvov vehayashar veeyney yehovah elohayv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛סַר אֶת־מִזְבְּח֥וֹת הַנֵּכָ֖ר וְהַבָּמ֑וֹת וַיְשַׁבֵּר֙ אֶת־הַמַּצֵּב֔וֹת וַיְגַדַּ֖ע אֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרִֽים׃
Translated: He abolished the alien altars and shrines; he smashed the pillars and cut down the sacred posts.
Transliteration: vayasar et-mizevechvot hanekhar vehavamvot vayeshaver et-hamatsevvot vayegada et-haasheriym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לִֽיהוּדָ֔ה לִדְר֕וֹשׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וְלַעֲשׂ֖וֹת הַתּוֹרָ֥ה וְהַמִּצְוָֽה׃
Translated: He ordered Judah to turn to the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers and to observe the Teaching and the Commandment.
Transliteration: vayomer liyhudah lidervosh et-yehovah elohey avvoteyhem velaashvot hatvorah vehamitsevah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙סַר֙ מִכׇּל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה אֶת־הַבָּמ֖וֹת וְאֶת־הַחַמָּנִ֑ים וַתִּשְׁקֹ֥ט הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: He abolished the shrines and the incense stands throughout the cities of Judah, and the kingdom was untroubled under him.
Transliteration: vayasar mikhׇl-arey yehudah et-havamvot veet-hachamaniym vatishekot hamamelakhah lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיִּ֛בֶן עָרֵ֥י מְצוּרָ֖ה בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה כִּֽי־שָׁקְטָ֣ה הָאָ֗רֶץ וְאֵין־עִמּ֤וֹ מִלְחָמָה֙ בַּשָּׁנִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה כִּֽי־הֵנִ֥יחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: He built fortified towns in Judah, since the land was untroubled and he was not engaged in warfare during those years, for the L<small>ORD</small> had granted him respite.
Transliteration: vayiven arey metsurah viyhudah khiy-shaketah haarets veeyn-imvo milechamah vashaniym haeleh khiy-heniycha yehovah lvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לִיהוּדָ֜ה נִבְנֶ֣ה ׀ אֶת־הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְנָסֵ֨ב חוֹמָ֣ה וּמִגְדָּלִים֮ דְּלָתַ֣יִם וּבְרִיחִים֒ עוֹדֶ֨נּוּ הָאָ֜רֶץ לְפָנֵ֗ינוּ כִּ֤י דָרַ֙שְׁנוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ דָּרַ֕שְׁנוּ וַיָּ֥נַֽח־לָ֖נוּ מִסָּבִ֑יב וַיִּבְנ֖וּ וַיַּצְלִֽיחוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: He said to Judah, “Let us build up these cities and surround them with walls and towers, gates and bars, while the land is at our disposal because we turned to the L<small>ORD</small> our God—we turned [to Him] and He gave us respite on all sides.” They were successful in their building.
Transliteration: vayomer liyhudah niveneh et-heariym haeleh venasev chvomah umigedaliym delatayiim uveriychiym vodenu haarets lefaneynu khiy darashenu et-yehovah eloheynu darashenu vayanach-lanu misaviyv vayivenu vayatseliychu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י לְאָסָ֗א חַ֘יִל֮ נֹשֵׂ֣א צִנָּ֣ה וָרֹ֒מַח֒ מִֽיהוּדָה֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אֶ֔לֶף {ס} וּמִבִּנְיָמִ֗ן נֹשְׂאֵ֤י מָגֵן֙ וְדֹ֣רְכֵי קֶ֔שֶׁת מָאתַ֥יִם וּשְׁמוֹנִ֖ים אָ֑לֶף כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה גִּבּ֥וֹרֵי חָֽיִל׃
Translated: Asa had an army of 300,000 men from Judah bearing shields and spears, and 280,000 from Benjamin bearing bucklers and drawing the bow; all these were valiant men.
Transliteration: vayehiy leasa chayiil noshe tsinah varomach miyhudah shelosh mevot elef {s} umivineyamin nosheey magen vedorekhey keshet matayiim ushemvoniym alef khׇl-eleh givvorey chayiil

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם זֶ֣רַח הַכּוּשִׁ֗י בְּחַ֙יִל֙ אֶ֣לֶף אֲלָפִ֔ים וּמַרְכָּב֖וֹת שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת וַיָּבֹ֖א עַד־מָרֵשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Zerah the Cushite marched out against them with an army of a thousand thousand and 300 chariots. When he reached Mareshah
Transliteration: vayetse aleyhem zerach hakhushiy vechayiil elef alafiym umarekhavvot shelosh mevot vayavo ad-mareshah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א אָסָ֖א לְפָנָ֑יו וַיַּֽעַרְכוּ֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּגֵ֥יא צְפַ֖תָה לְמָרֵשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Asa confronted him, and the battle lines were drawn in the valley of Zephat by Mareshah.
Transliteration: vayetse asa lefanayv vayaarekhu milechamah vegey tsefatah lemareshah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אָסָ֜א אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָיו֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵֽין־עִמְּךָ֤ לַעְזֹר֙ בֵּ֥ין רַב֙ לְאֵ֣ין כֹּ֔חַ עׇזְרֵ֜נוּ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ כִּֽי־עָלֶ֣יךָ נִשְׁעַ֔נּוּ וּבְשִׁמְךָ֣ בָ֔אנוּ עַל־הֶהָמ֖וֹן הַזֶּ֑ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ אַ֔תָּה אַל־יַעְצֹ֥ר עִמְּךָ֖ אֱנֽוֹשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Asa called to the L<small>ORD</small> his God, and said, “O L<small>ORD</small>, it is all the same to You to help the numerous and the powerless. Help us, O L<small>ORD</small> our God, for we rely on You, and in Your name we have come against this great multitude. You are the L<small>ORD</small> our God. Let no mortal hinder You.”
Transliteration: vayikera asa el-yehovah elohayv vayomar yehovah eyn-imekha laezor veyn rav leeyn khocha ׇzerenu yehovah eloheynu khiy-aleykha nisheanu uveshimekha vanu al-hehamvon hazeh yehovah eloheynu atah al-yaetsor imekha envosh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּגֹּ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַכּוּשִׁ֔ים לִפְנֵ֥י אָסָ֖א וְלִפְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ הַכּוּשִֽׁים׃
Translated: So the L<small>ORD</small> routed the Cushites before Asa and Judah, and the Cushites fled.
Transliteration: vayigof yehovah et-hakhushiym lifeney asa velifeney yehudah vayanusu hakhushiym

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפֵ֨ם אָסָ֜א וְהָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־עִמּוֹ֮ עַד־לִגְרָר֒ וַיִּפֹּ֤ל מִכּוּשִׁים֙ לְאֵ֣ין לָהֶ֣ם מִֽחְיָ֔ה כִּֽי־נִשְׁבְּר֥וּ לִפְנֵי־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלִפְנֵ֣י מַחֲנֵ֑הוּ וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ שָׁלָ֖ל הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Asa and the army with him pursued them as far as Gerar. Many of the Cushites fell wounded beyond recovery, for they broke before the L<small>ORD</small> and His camp. Very much spoil was taken.
Transliteration: vayiredefem asa vehaam asher-imvo ad-ligerar vayifol mikhushiym leeyn lahem micheyah khiy-nisheveru lifeney-yehovah velifeney machanehu vayisheu shalal hareveh meod

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֗וּ אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הֶעָרִים֙ סְבִיב֣וֹת גְּרָ֔ר כִּי־הָיָ֥ה פַחַד־יְהֹוָ֖ה עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּבֹ֙זּוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים כִּֽי־בִזָּ֥ה רַבָּ֖ה הָיְתָ֥ה בָהֶֽם׃
Translated: All the cities in the vicinity of Gerar were ravaged, for a terror of the L<small>ORD</small> seized them. All the cities were plundered, and they yielded much booty.
Transliteration: vayakhu et khׇl-heariym seviyvvot gerar khiy-hayah fachad-yehovah aleyhem vayavozu et-khׇl-heariym khiy-vizah ravah hayetah vahem

Hebrew: וְגַם־אׇהֳלֵ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה הִכּ֑וּ וַיִּשְׁבּ֨וּ צֹ֤אן לָרֹב֙ וּגְמַלִּ֔ים וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: They also ravaged the encampment of herdsmen, capturing much sheep and camels. Then they returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vegam-ׇholey mikeneh hikhu vayishevu tson larov ugemaliym vayashuvu yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַעֲזַרְיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־עוֹדֵ֔ד הָיְתָ֥ה עָלָ֖יו ר֥וּחַ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The spirit of God came upon Azariah son of Oded.
Transliteration: vaazareyahu ven-voded hayetah alayv rucha Elohim

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֮ לִפְנֵ֣י אָסָא֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ שְׁמָע֕וּנִי אָסָ֖א וְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֣ה וּבִנְיָמִ֑ן יְהֹוָ֤ה עִמָּכֶם֙ בִּֽהְיוֹתְכֶ֣ם עִמּ֔וֹ וְאִֽם־תִּדְרְשֻׁ֙הוּ֙ יִמָּצֵ֣א לָכֶ֔ם וְאִם־תַּעַזְבֻ֖הוּ יַעֲזֹ֥ב אֶתְכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: He came to Asa and said to him, “Listen to me, Asa and all Judah and Benjamin; the L<small>ORD</small> is with you as long as you are with Him. If you turn to Him, He will respond to you, but if you forsake Him, He will forsake you.
Transliteration: vayetse lifeney asa vayomer lvo shemauniy asa vekhׇl-yehudah uvineyamin yehovah imakhem viheyvotekhem imvo veim-tidereshuhu yimatse lakhem veim-taazevuhu yaazov etekhem {s}

Hebrew: וְיָמִ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְלֹ֣א ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֱמֶ֗ת וּלְלֹ֛א כֹּהֵ֥ן מוֹרֶ֖ה וּלְלֹ֥א תוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: Israel has gone many days without the true God, without a priest to give instruction and without Teaching.
Transliteration: veyamiym raviym leyisherael lelo elohey emet ulelo khohen mvoreh ulelo tvorah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ בַּצַּר־ל֔וֹ עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְבַקְשֻׁ֖הוּ וַיִּמָּצֵ֥א לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: But in distress it returned to the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, and sought Him, and He responded to them.
Transliteration: vayashׇv vatsar-lvo al-yehovah elohey yisherael vayevakeshuhu vayimatse lahem

Hebrew: וּבָעִתִּ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם אֵ֥ין שָׁל֖וֹם לַיּוֹצֵ֣א וְלַבָּ֑א כִּ֚י מְהוּמֹ֣ת רַבּ֔וֹת עַ֥ל כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated: At those times, no wayfarer was safe, for there was much tumult among all the inhabitants of the lands.
Transliteration: uvaitiym hahem eyn shalvom layyvotse velava khiy mehumot ravvot al khׇl-yoshevey haaratsvot

Hebrew: וְכֻתְּת֥וּ גוֹי־בְּג֖וֹי וְעִ֣יר בְּעִ֑יר כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים הֲמָמָ֖ם בְּכׇל־צָרָֽה׃
Translated: Nation was crushed by nation and city by city, for God threw them into panic with every kind of trouble.
Transliteration: vekhutetu gvoy-vegvoy veiyr veiyr khiy-Elohim hamamam vekhׇl-tsarah

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֣ם חִזְק֔וּ וְאַל־יִרְפּ֖וּ יְדֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֛י יֵ֥שׁ שָׂכָ֖ר לִפְעֻלַּתְכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: As for you, be strong, do not be disheartened, for there is reward for your labor.”
Transliteration: veatem chizeku veal-yirefu yedeykhem khiy eish shakhar lifeulatekhem {s}

Hebrew: וְכִשְׁמֹ֨עַ אָסָ֜א הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְהַנְּבוּאָה֮ עֹדֵ֣ד הַנָּבִיא֒ הִתְחַזַּ֗ק וַיַּעֲבֵ֤ר הַשִּׁקּוּצִים֙ מִכׇּל־אֶ֤רֶץ יְהוּדָה֙ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן וּמִן־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָכַ֖ד מֵהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיְחַדֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֕ר לִפְנֵ֖י אוּלָ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When Asa heard these words, the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage and removed the abominations from the entire land of Judah and Benjamin and from the cities that he had captured in the hill country of Ephraim. He restored the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> in front of the porch of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vekhishemoa asa hadevariym haeleh vehanevuah oded hanaviy hitechazak vayaaver hashikutsiym mikhׇl-erets yehudah uvineyamin umin-heariym asher lakhad mehar eferayiim vayechadesh et-mizevach yehovah asher lifeney ulam yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֗ץ אֶת־כׇּל־יְהוּדָה֙ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן וְהַגָּרִים֙ עִמָּהֶ֔ם מֵאֶפְרַ֥יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וּמִשִּׁמְע֑וֹן כִּֽי־נָפְל֨וּ עָלָ֤יו מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל֙ לָרֹ֔ב בִּרְאֹתָ֕ם כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָ֖יו עִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: He assembled all the people of Judah and Benjamin and those people of Ephraim, Manasseh, and Simeon who sojourned among them, for many in Israel had thrown in their lot with him when they saw that the L<small>ORD</small> his God was with him.
Transliteration: vayikevots et-khׇl-yehudah uvineyamin vehagariym imahem meeferayiim umenasheh umishimevon khiy-nafelu alayv miyisherael larov vireotam khiy-yehovah elohayv imvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֥וּ יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֑י לִשְׁנַ֥ת חֲמֵשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה לְמַלְכ֥וּת אָסָֽא׃
Translated: They were assembled in Jerusalem in the third month of the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu yerushala͏im vachodesh hashelishiy lishenat chamesh-eshereh lemalekhut asa

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבְּח֤וּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא מִן־הַשָּׁלָ֖ל הֵבִ֑יאוּ בָּקָר֙ שְׁבַ֣ע מֵא֔וֹת וְצֹ֖אן שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: They brought sacrifices to the L<small>ORD</small> on that day; they brought 700 oxen and 7,000 sheep of the spoil.
Transliteration: vayizevechu layhovah vayyvom hahu min-hashalal heviyu vakar sheva mevot vetson shiveat alafiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ בַבְּרִ֔ית לִדְר֕וֹשׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם בְּכׇל־לְבָבָ֖ם וּבְכׇל־נַפְשָֽׁם׃
Translated: They entered into a covenant to worship the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers with all their heart and with all their soul.
Transliteration: vayavou vaveriyt lidervosh et-yehovah elohey avvoteyhem vekhׇl-levavam uvekhׇl-nafesham

Hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יִדְרֹ֛שׁ לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יוּמָ֑ת לְמִן־קָטֹן֙ וְעַד־גָּד֔וֹל לְמֵאִ֖ישׁ וְעַד־אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Whoever would not worship the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel would be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.
Transliteration: vekhol asher lo-yiderosh layhovah elohey-yisherael yumat lemin-katon vead-gadvol lemeiysh vead-ishah

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּֽׁבְעוּ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּק֥וֹל גָּד֖וֹל וּבִתְרוּעָ֑ה וּבַחֲצֹצְר֖וֹת וּבְשׁוֹפָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: So they took an oath to the L<small>ORD</small> in a loud voice and with shouts, with trumpeting and blasts of the horn.
Transliteration: vayishaveu layhovah vekvol gadvol uviteruah uvachatsotservot uveshvofarvot

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמְח֨וּ כׇל־יְהוּדָ֜ה עַל־הַשְּׁבוּעָ֗ה כִּ֤י בְכׇל־לְבָבָם֙ נִשְׁבָּ֔עוּ וּבְכׇל־רְצוֹנָ֣ם בִּקְשֻׁ֔הוּ וַיִּמָּצֵ֖א לָהֶ֑ם וַיָּ֧נַח יְהֹוָ֛ה לָהֶ֖ם מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: All Judah rejoiced over the oath, for they swore with all their heart and sought Him with all their will. He responded to them and gave them respite on every side.
Transliteration: vayishemechu khׇl-yehudah al-hashevuah khiy vekhׇl-levavam nishevau uvekhׇl-retsvonam vikeshuhu vayimatse lahem vayanach yehovah lahem misaviyv

Hebrew: וְגַֽם־מַעֲכָ֞ה אֵ֣ם ׀ אָסָ֣א הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ הֱסִירָהּ֙ מִגְּבִירָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשְׂתָ֥ה לָאֲשֵׁרָ֖ה מִפְלָ֑צֶת וַיִּכְרֹ֤ת אָסָא֙ אֶת־מִפְלַצְתָּ֔הּ וַיָּ֕דֶק וַיִּשְׂרֹ֖ף בְּנַ֥חַל קִדְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: He also deposed Maacah mother of King Asa from the rank of queen mother, because she had made an abominable thing for [the goddess] Asherah. Asa cut down her abominable thing, reduced it to dust, and burned it in the Wadi Kidron.
Transliteration: vegam-maakhah em asa hamelekhe hesiyrah migeviyrah asher-ashetah laasherah mifelatset vayikherot asa et-mifelatsetah vayadek vayisherof venachal kidervon

Hebrew: וְהַ֨בָּמ֔וֹת לֹא־סָ֖רוּ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רַ֧ק לְבַב־אָסָ֛א הָיָ֥ה שָׁלֵ֖ם כׇּל־יָמָֽיו׃
Translated: The shrines, indeed, were not abolished in Israel; however, Asa was wholehearted [with the L<small>ORD</small>] all his life.
Transliteration: vehavamvot lo-saru miyisherael rak levav-asa hayah shalem khׇl-yamayv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֞א אֶת־קׇדְשֵׁ֥י אָבִ֛יו וְקׇדָשָׁ֖יו בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כֶּ֥סֶף וְזָהָ֖ב וְכֵלִֽים׃
Translated: He brought into the House of God the things that he and his father had consecrated—silver, gold, and utensils.
Transliteration: vayave et-kׇdeshey aviyv vekׇdashayv veyt haElohim khesef vezahav vekheliym

Hebrew: וּמִלְחָמָ֖ה לֹ֣א הָיָ֑תָה עַ֛ד שְׁנַת־שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְחָמֵ֖שׁ לְמַלְכ֥וּת אָסָֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: There was no war until the thirty-fifth year of the reign of Asa.
Transliteration: umilechamah lo hayatah ad shenat-sheloshiym vechamesh lemalekhut asa {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וָשֵׁשׁ֙ לְמַלְכ֣וּת אָסָ֔א עָלָ֞ה בַּעְשָׁ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עַל־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּ֖בֶן אֶת־הָרָמָ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֗י תֵּ֚ת יוֹצֵ֣א וָבָ֔א לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the thirty-sixth year of the reign of Asa, King Baasha of Israel marched against Judah and built up Ramah to block all movement of King Asa of Judah.
Transliteration: vishenat sheloshiym vashesh lemalekhut asa alah vaesha melekhe-yisherael al-yehudah vayiven et-haramah leviletiy tet yvotse vava leasa melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: וַיֹּצֵ֨א אָסָ֜א כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֗ב מֵאֹ֥צְר֛וֹת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה וּבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶל־בֶּן־הֲדַד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם הַיּוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּדַרְמֶ֖שֶׂק לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Asa took all the silver and gold from the treasuries of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and the royal palace, and sent them to King Ben-hadad of Aram, who resided in Damascus, with this message:
Transliteration: vayotse asa khesef vezahav meotservot veyt yehovah uveyt hamelekhe vayishelach el-ven-hadad melekhe aram hayyvoshev vedaremeshek lemor

Hebrew: בְּרִית֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֔ךָ וּבֵ֥ין אָבִ֖י וּבֵ֣ין אָבִ֑יךָ הִנֵּ֨ה שָׁלַ֤חְתִּֽי לְךָ֙ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב לֵ֞ךְ הָפֵ֣ר בְּרִֽיתְךָ֗ אֶת־בַּעְשָׁא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיַעֲלֶ֖ה מֵעָלָֽי׃
Translated: “There is a pact between me and you, as there was between my father and your father. I herewith send you silver and gold; go and break your pact with King Baasha of Israel so that he may withdraw from me.”
Transliteration: veriyt veyniy uveynekha uveyn aviy uveyn aviykha hineh shalachetiy lekha khesef vezahav lekhe hafer veriytekha et-vaesha melekhe yisherael veyaaleh mealay

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע בֶּן־הֲדַ֜ד אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָסָ֗א וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח אֶת־שָׂרֵ֨י הַחֲיָלִ֤ים אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֙ אֶל־עָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּכּוּ֙ אֶת־עִיּ֣וֹן וְאֶת־דָּ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת אָבֵ֣ל מָ֑יִם וְאֵ֥ת כׇּֽל־מִסְכְּנ֖וֹת עָרֵ֥י נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
Translated: Ben-hadad acceded to King Asa’s request; he sent his army commanders against the towns of Israel and ravaged Ijon, Dan, Abel-maim, and all the garrison towns of Naphtali.
Transliteration: vayishema ven-hadad el-hamelekhe asa vayishelach et-sharey hachayaliym asher-lvo el-arey yisherael vayakhu et-iyyvon veet-dan veet avel mayiim veet khׇl-misekhenvot arey nafetaliy

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ בַּעְשָׁ֔א וַיֶּחְדַּ֕ל מִבְּנ֖וֹת אֶת־הָרָמָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁבֵּ֖ת אֶת־מְלַאכְתּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: When Baasha heard about it, he stopped building up Ramah and put an end to the work on it.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa vaesha vayechedal mivenvot et-haramah vayashevet et-melakhetvo {s}

Hebrew: וְאָסָ֣א הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ לָקַח֙ אֶת־כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּשְׂא֞וּ אֶת־אַבְנֵ֤י הָרָמָה֙ וְאֶת־עֵצֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָ֖ה בַּעְשָׁ֑א וַיִּ֣בֶן בָּהֶ֔ם אֶת־גֶּ֖בַע וְאֶת־הַמִּצְפָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Then King Asa mustered all Judah, and they carried away the stones and timber with which Baasha had built up Ramah; with these King Asa built up Geba and Mizpah.
Transliteration: veasa hamelekhe lakach et-khׇl-yehudah vayisheu et-aveney haramah veet-etseyha asher vanah vaesha vayiven vahem et-geva veet-hamitsefah {s}

Hebrew: וּבָעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא בָּ֚א חֲנָ֣נִי הָרֹאֶ֔ה אֶל־אָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו בְּהִשָּׁ֨עֶנְךָ֜ עַל־מֶ֤לֶךְ אֲרָם֙ וְלֹ֤א נִשְׁעַ֙נְתָּ֙ עַל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ עַל־כֵּ֗ן נִמְלַ֛ט חֵ֥יל מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֖ם מִיָּדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: At that time, Hanani the seer came to King Asa of Judah and said to him, “Because you relied on the king of Aram and did not rely on the L<small>ORD</small> your God, therefore the army of the king of Aram has slipped out of your hands.
Transliteration: uvaet hahiy va chananiy haroeh el-asa melekhe yehudah vayomer elayv vehishaenekha al-melekhe aram velo nisheaneta al-yehovah eloheykha al-khen nimelat cheyl melekhe-aram miyadekha

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֧א הַכּוּשִׁ֣ים וְהַלּוּבִ֗ים הָי֨וּ לְחַ֧יִל <small>׀</small> לָרֹ֛ב לְרֶ֥כֶב וּלְפָרָשִׁ֖ים לְהַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וּבְהִשָּׁעֶנְךָ֥ עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה נְתָנָ֥ם בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: The Cushites and Lybians were a mighty army with chariots and horsemen in very great numbers, yet because you relied on the L<small>ORD</small> He delivered them into your hands.
Transliteration: halo hakhushiym vehaluviym hayu lechayiil <small></small> larov lerekhev ulefarashiym lehareveh meod uvehishaenekha al-yehovah netanam veyadekha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה עֵינָ֞יו מְשֹׁטְט֤וֹת בְּכׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לְ֠הִתְחַזֵּ֠ק עִם־לְבָבָ֥ם שָׁלֵ֛ם אֵלָ֖יו נִסְכַּ֣לְתָּ עַל־זֹ֑את כִּ֣י מֵעַ֔תָּה יֵ֥שׁ עִמְּךָ֖ מִלְחָמֽוֹת׃
Translated: For the eyes of the L<small>ORD</small> range over the entire earth, to give support to those who are wholeheartedly with Him. You have acted foolishly in this matter, and henceforth you will be beset by wars.”
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eynayv meshotetvot vekhׇl-haarets lehitechazek im-levavam shalem elayv nisekhaleta al-zot khiy meatah eish imekha milechamvot

Hebrew: וַיִּכְעַ֨ס אָסָ֜א אֶל־הָרֹאֶ֗ה וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֙הוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית הַמַּהְפֶּ֔כֶת כִּֽי־בְזַ֥עַף עִמּ֖וֹ עַל־זֹ֑את וַיְרַצֵּ֥ץ אָסָ֛א מִן־הָעָ֖ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽיא׃
Translated: Asa was vexed at the seer and put him into the stocks, for he was furious with him because of that. Asa inflicted cruelties on some of the people at that time.
Transliteration: vayikheas asa el-haroeh vayitenehu veyt hamahefekhet khiy-vezaaf imvo al-zot vayeratsets asa min-haam vaet hahiy

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י אָסָ֔א הָרִאשׁוֹנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרוֹנִ֑ים הִנָּ֤ם כְּתוּבִים֙ עַל־סֵ֣פֶר הַמְּלָכִ֔ים לִיהוּדָ֖ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The acts of Asa, early and late, are recorded in the annals of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Transliteration: vehineh diverey asa harishvoniym vehaacharvoniym hinam khetuviym al-sefer hamelakhiym liyhudah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֶּחֱלֶ֣א אָסָ֡א בִּשְׁנַת֩ שְׁלוֹשִׁ֨ים וָתֵ֤שַׁע לְמַלְכוּתוֹ֙ בְּרַגְלָ֔יו עַד־לְמַ֖עְלָה חׇלְי֑וֹ וְגַם־בְּחׇלְיוֹ֙ לֹא־דָרַ֣שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֖י בָּרֹפְאִֽים׃
Translated: In the thirty-ninth year of his reign, Asa suffered from an acute foot ailment; but ill as he was, he still did not turn to the L<small>ORD</small> but to physicians.
Transliteration: vayechele asa vishenat shelvoshiym vatesha lemalekhutvo veragelayv ad-lemaelah chׇleyvo vegam-vechׇleyvo lo-darash et-yehovah khiy varofeiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אָסָ֖א עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וַיָּ֕מׇת בִּשְׁנַ֛ת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וְאַחַ֖ת לְמׇלְכֽוֹ׃
Translated: Asa slept with his fathers. He died in the forty-first year of his reign
Transliteration: vayishekhav asa im-avotayv vayamׇt vishenat arevaiym veachat lemׇlekhvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּרֻ֣הוּ בְקִבְרֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּרָה־לוֹ֮ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִיד֒ וַיַּשְׁכִּיבֻ֗הוּ בַּמִּשְׁכָּב֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר מִלֵּא֙ בְּשָׂמִ֣ים וּזְנִ֔ים מְרֻקָּחִ֖ים בְּמִרְקַ֣חַת מַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וַיִּשְׂרְפוּ־ל֥וֹ שְׂרֵפָ֖ה גְּדוֹלָ֥ה עַד־לִמְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: and was buried in the grave that he had made for himself in the City of David. He was laid in his resting-place, which was filled with spices of all kinds, expertly blended; a very great fire was made in his honor.
Transliteration: vayikeveruhu vekiverotayv asher kharah-lvo veiyr daviyd vayashekhiyvuhu vamishekhav asher mile veshamiym uzeniym merukachiym vemirekachat maasheh vayisherefu-lvo sherefah gedvolah ad-limeod {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּ֑יו וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֖ק עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: His son Jehoshaphat succeeded him as king, and took firm hold of Israel.
Transliteration: vayimelokhe yehvoshafat venvo tachetayv vayitechazek al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨תֶּן־חַ֔יִל בְּכׇל־עָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה הַבְּצֻר֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּ֤ן נְצִיבִים֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבְעָרֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָכַ֖ד אָסָ֥א אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He stationed troops in all the fortified towns of Judah, and stationed garrisons throughout the land of Judah and the cities of Ephraim which his father Asa had captured.
Transliteration: vayiten-chayiil vekhׇl-arey yehudah havetsurvot vayiten netsiyviym veerets yehudah uvearey eferayiim asher lakhad asa aviyv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עִם־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֑ט כִּ֣י הָלַ֗ךְ בְּדַרְכֵ֞י דָּוִ֤יד אָבִיו֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א דָרַ֖שׁ לַבְּעָלִֽים׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> was with Jehoshaphat because he followed the earlier ways of his father David, and did not worship the Baalim,
Transliteration: vayehiy yehovah im-yehvoshafat khiy halakhe vedarekhey daviyd aviyv harishoniym velo darash lavealiym

Hebrew: כִּ֠י לֵאלֹהֵ֤י אָבִיו֙ דָּרָ֔שׁ וּבְמִצְוֺתָ֖יו הָלָ֑ךְ וְלֹ֖א כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: but worshiped the God of his father and followed His commandments—unlike the behavior of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy lelohey aviyv darash uvemitsevotayv halakhe velo khemaasheh yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨כֶן יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ וַיִּתְּנ֧וּ כׇל־יְהוּדָ֛ה מִנְחָ֖ה לִיהֽוֹשָׁפָ֑ט וַיְהִי־ל֥וֹ עֹשֶׁר־וְכָב֖וֹד לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: So the L<small>ORD</small> established the kingdom in his hands, and all Judah gave presents to Jehoshaphat. He had wealth and glory in abundance.
Transliteration: vayakhen yehovah et-hamamelakhah veyadvo vayitenu khׇl-yehudah minechah liyhvoshafat vayehiy-lvo osher-vekhavvod larov

Hebrew: וַיִּגְבַּ֥הּ לִבּ֖וֹ בְּדַרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְע֗וֹד הֵסִ֛יר אֶת־הַבָּמ֥וֹת וְאֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרִ֖ים מִיהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: His mind was elevated in the ways of the L<small>ORD</small>. Moreover, he abolished the shrines and the sacred posts from Judah.
Transliteration: vayigevah livvo vedarekhey yehovah vevod hesiyr et-havamvot veet-haasheriym miyhudah {f}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַ֨ת שָׁל֜וֹשׁ לְמׇלְכ֗וֹ שָׁלַ֤ח לְשָׂרָיו֙ לְבֶן־חַ֙יִל֙ וּלְעֹבַדְיָ֣ה וְלִזְכַרְיָ֔ה וְלִנְתַנְאֵ֖ל וּלְמִיכָיָ֑הוּ לְלַמֵּ֖ד בְּעָרֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the third year of his reign he sent his officers Ben-hail, Obadiah, Zechariah, Nethanel, and Micaiah throughout the cities of Judah to offer instruction.
Transliteration: uvishenat shalvosh lemׇlekhvo shalach lesharayv leven-chayiil uleovadeyah velizekhareyah velinetaneel ulemiykhayahu lelamed vearey yehudah

Hebrew: וְעִמָּהֶ֣ם הַלְוִיִּ֗ם שְֽׁמַעְיָ֡הוּ וּנְתַנְיָ֡הוּ וּזְבַדְיָ֡הוּ וַעֲשָׂהאֵ֡ל (ושמרימות) [וּשְׁמִירָמ֡וֹת] וִיהוֹנָתָן֩ וַאֲדֹ֨נִיָּ֧הוּ וְטוֹבִיָּ֛הוּ וְט֥וֹב אֲדוֹנִיָּ֖ה הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְעִמָּהֶ֛ם אֱלִישָׁמָ֥ע וִיהוֹרָ֖ם הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: With them were the Levites, Shemaiah, Nethaniah, Zebadiah, Asahel, Shemiramoth, Jehonathan, Adonijah, Tobijah and Tob-adonijah the Levites; with them were Elishama and Jehoram the priests.
Transliteration: veimahem haleviyim shemaeyahu unetaneyahu uzevadeyahu vaashahel (vshmrymvt) [ushemiyramvot] viyhvonatan vaadoniyahu vetvoviyahu vetvov advoniyah haleviyim veimahem eliyshama viyhvoram hakhohaniym

Hebrew: וַֽיְלַמְּדוּ֙ בִּיהוּדָ֔ה וְעִ֨מָּהֶ֔ם סֵ֖פֶר תּוֹרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּסֹ֙בּוּ֙ בְּכׇל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַֽיְלַמְּד֖וּ בָּעָֽם׃
Translated: They offered instruction throughout Judah, having with them the Book of the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small>. They made the rounds of all the cities of Judah and instructed the people.
Transliteration: vayelamedu viyhudah veimahem sefer tvorat yehovah vayasovu vekhׇl-arey yehudah vayelamedu vaam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ פַּ֣חַד יְהֹוָ֗ה עַ֚ל כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר סְבִיב֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א נִלְחֲמ֖וּ עִם־יְהוֹשָׁפָֽט׃
Translated: A terror of the L<small>ORD</small> seized all the kingdoms of the lands around Judah, and they did not go to war with Jehoshaphat.
Transliteration: vayehiy fachad yehovah al khׇl-mamelekhvot haaratsvot asher seviyvvot yehudah velo nilechamu im-yehvoshafat

Hebrew: וּמִן־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֗ים מְבִיאִ֧ים לִיהוֹשָׁפָ֛ט מִנְחָ֖ה וְכֶ֣סֶף מַשָּׂ֑א גַּ֣ם הָעַרְבִיאִ֗ים מְבִיאִ֥ים לוֹ֙ צֹ֕אן אֵילִ֗ים שִׁבְעַ֤ת אֲלָפִים֙ וּשְׁבַ֣ע מֵא֔וֹת וּתְיָשִׁ֕ים שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: From Philistia a load of silver was brought to Jehoshaphat as tribute. The Arabs, too, brought him flocks: 7,700 rams and 7,700 he-goats.
Transliteration: umin-felishetiym meviyiym liyhvoshafat minechah vekhesef masha gam haareviyiym meviyiym lvo tson eyliym shiveat alafiym usheva mevot uteyashiym shiveat alafiym usheva mevot {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י יְהוֹשָׁפָ֛ט הֹלֵ֥ךְ וְגָדֵ֖ל עַד־לְמָ֑עְלָה וַיִּ֧בֶן בִּיהוּדָ֛ה בִּירָנִיּ֖וֹת וְעָרֵ֥י מִסְכְּנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat grew greater and greater, and he built up fortresses and garrison towns in Judah.
Transliteration: vayehiy yehvoshafat holekhe vegadel ad-lemaelah vayiven viyhudah viyraniyyvot vearey misekhenvot

Hebrew: וּמְלָאכָ֥ה רַבָּ֛ה הָ֥יָה ל֖וֹ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאַנְשֵׁ֧י מִלְחָמָ֛ה גִּבּ֥וֹרֵי חַ֖יִל בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He carried out extensive works in the towns of Judah, and had soldiers, valiant men, in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: umelakhah ravah hayah lvo vearey yehudah veaneshey milechamah givvorey chayiil viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה פְקֻדָּתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם לִֽיהוּדָה֙ שָׂרֵ֣י אֲלָפִ֔ים {ס} עַדְנָ֣ה הַשָּׂ֔ר וְעִמּוֹ֙ גִּבּ֣וֹרֵי חַ֔יִל שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: They were enrolled according to their clans. Judah: chiefs of thousands, Adnah the chief, who had 300,000 valiant men;
Transliteration: veeleh fekudatam leveyt avvoteyhem liyhudah sharey alafiym {s} adenah hashar veimvo givvorey chayiil shelosh mevot alef {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָד֖וֹ יְהוֹחָנָ֣ן הַשָּׂ֑ר וְעִמּ֕וֹ מָאתַ֥יִם וּשְׁמוֹנִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: next to him was Jehohanan the captain, who had 280,000;
