Transliteration: veal-yadvo yehvochanan hashar veimvo matayiim ushemvoniym alef {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדוֹ֙ עֲמַסְיָ֣ה בֶן־זִכְרִ֔י הַמִּתְנַדֵּ֖ב לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְעִמּ֛וֹ מָאתַ֥יִם אֶ֖לֶף גִּבּ֥וֹר חָֽיִל׃ {ס}
Translated: next to him was Amasiah son of Zichri, who made a freewill offering to the L<small>ORD</small>. He had 200,000 valiant men.
Transliteration: veal-yadvo amaseyah ven-zikheriy hamitenadev layhovah veimvo matayiim elef givvor chayiil {s}

Hebrew: וּמִ֨ן־בִּנְיָמִ֔ן גִּבּ֥וֹר חַ֖יִל אֶלְיָדָ֑ע וְעִמּ֛וֹ נֹשְׁקֵי־קֶ֥שֶׁת וּמָגֵ֖ן מָאתַ֥יִם אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: Benjamin: Eliada, a valiant man, who had 200,000 men armed with bow and buckler;
Transliteration: umin-vineyamin givvor chayiil eleyada veimvo noshekey-keshet umagen matayiim alef {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָד֖וֹ יְהוֹזָבָ֑ד וְעִמּ֛וֹ מֵאָה־וּשְׁמוֹנִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף חֲלוּצֵ֥י צָבָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: next to him was Jehozabad, who had 180,000 armed men.
Transliteration: veal-yadvo yehvozavad veimvo meah-ushemvoniym elef chalutsey tsava {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה הַמְשָׁרְתִ֣ים אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ מִלְּבַ֞ד אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ בְּעָרֵ֥י הַמִּבְצָ֖ר בְּכׇל־יְהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: These served the king, besides those whom the king assigned to the fortified towns throughout Judah.
Transliteration: eleh hamesharetiym et-hamelekhe milevad asher-natan hamelekhe vearey hamivetsar vekhׇl-yehudah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י לִיהוֹשָׁפָ֛ט עֹ֥שֶׁר וְכָב֖וֹד לָרֹ֑ב וַיִּתְחַתֵּ֖ן לְאַחְאָֽב׃
Translated: So Jehoshaphat had wealth and honor in abundance, and he allied himself by marriage to Ahab.
Transliteration: vayehiy liyhvoshafat osher vekhavvod larov vayitechaten leacheav

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩רֶד֩ לְקֵ֨ץ שָׁנִ֤ים אֶל־אַחְאָב֙ לְשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וַיִּֽזְבַּֽח־ל֨וֹ אַחְאָ֜ב צֹ֤אן וּבָקָר֙ לָרֹ֔ב וְלָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֑וֹ וַיְסִיתֵ֕הוּ לַעֲל֖וֹת אֶל־רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: After some years had passed, he came to visit Ahab at Samaria. Ahab slaughtered sheep and oxen in abundance for him and for the people with him, and persuaded him to march against Ramoth-gilead.
Transliteration: vayered lekets shaniym el-acheav leshomervon vayizevach-lvo acheav tson uvakar larov velaam asher imvo vayesiytehu laalvot el-ramot gilead

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר אַחְאָ֣ב מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶל־יְהֽוֹשָׁפָט֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה הֲתֵלֵ֥ךְ עִמִּ֖י רָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ כָּמ֤וֹנִי כָמ֙וֹךָ֙ וּכְעַמְּךָ֣ עַמִּ֔י וְעִמְּךָ֖ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: King Ahab of Israel said to King Jehoshaphat of Judah, “Will you accompany me to Ramoth-gilead?” He answered him, “I will do what you do; my troops shall be your troops and shall accompany you in battle.”
Transliteration: vayomer acheav melekhe-yisherael el-yehvoshafat melekhe yehudah hatelekhe imiy ramot gilead vayomer lvo khamvoniy khamvokha ukheamekha amiy veimekha vamilechamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל דְּרׇשׁ־נָ֥א כַיּ֖וֹם אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat then said to the king of Israel, “But first inquire for the word of the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshafat el-melekhe yisherael derׇsh-na khayyvom et-devar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֨ץ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֶֽת־הַנְּבִאִים֮ אַרְבַּ֣ע מֵא֣וֹת אִישׁ֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם הֲנֵלֵ֞ךְ אֶל־רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָ֛ד לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אִם־אֶחְדָּ֑ל וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ עֲלֵ֔ה וְיִתֵּ֥ן הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So the king of Israel gathered the prophets, four hundred men, and asked them, “Shall I march upon Ramoth-gilead for battle, or shall I not?” “March,” they said, “and God will deliver it into the king’s hands.”
Transliteration: vayikevots melekhe-yisherael et-haneviiym areva mevot iysh vayomer alehem hanelekhe el-ramot gilead lamilechamah im-echedal vayomeru aleh veyiten haElohim veyad hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט הַאֵ֨ין פֹּ֥ה נָבִ֛יא לַיהֹוָ֖ה ע֑וֹד וְנִדְרְשָׁ֖ה מֵאֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then Jehoshaphat asked, “Is there not another prophet of the L<small>ORD</small> here through whom we can inquire?”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshafat haeyn foh naviy layhovah vod venidereshah meotvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> אֶֽל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֡ט ע֣וֹד אִישׁ־אֶחָ֡ד לִדְרוֹשׁ֩ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֨ה מֵאֹת֜וֹ וַאֲנִ֣י שְׂנֵאתִ֗יהוּ כִּֽי־אֵ֠ינֶ֠נּוּ מִתְנַבֵּ֨א עָלַ֤י לְטוֹבָה֙ כִּ֣י כׇל־יָמָ֣יו לְרָעָ֔ה ה֖וּא מִיכָ֣יְהוּ בֶן־יִמְלָ֑א וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט אַל־יֹאמַ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ כֵּֽן׃
Translated: And the king of Israel answered Jehoshaphat, “There is one more man through whom we can inquire of the L<small>ORD</small>; but I hate him, because he never prophesies anything good for me but always misfortune. He is Micaiah son of Imlah.” Jehoshaphat replied, “Let the king not say such a thing.”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-yisherael <small></small> el-yehvoshafat vod iysh-echad lidervosh et-yehovah meotvo vaaniy shenetiyhu khiy-eynenu mitenave alay letvovah khiy khׇl-yamayv leraah hu miykhayehu ven-yimela vayomer yehvoshafat al-yomar hamelekhe khen

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־סָרִ֖יס אֶחָ֑ד וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַהֵ֖ר (מיכהו) [מִיכָ֥יְהוּ] בֶן־יִמְלָֽא׃
Translated: So the king of Israel summoned an officer and said, “Bring Micaiah son of Imlah at once.”
Transliteration: vayikera melekhe yisherael el-sariys echad vayomer maher (mykhhv) [miykhayehu] ven-yimela

Hebrew: וּמֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֡ה יוֹשְׁבִים֩ אִ֨ישׁ עַל־כִּסְא֜וֹ מְלֻבָּשִׁ֤ים בְּגָדִים֙ וְיֹשְׁבִ֣ים בְּגֹ֔רֶן פֶּ֖תַח שַׁ֣עַר שֹׁמְר֑וֹן וְכׇ֨ל־הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים מִֽתְנַבְּאִ֖ים לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah, wearing their robes, were seated on their thrones situated in the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
Transliteration: umelekhe yisherael viyhvoshafat melekhe-yehudah yvosheviym iysh al-khisevo meluvashiym vegadiym veyosheviym vegoren fetach shaar shomervon vekhׇl-haneviyiym mitenaveiym lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ צִדְקִיָּ֥הוּ בֶֽן־כְּנַעֲנָ֖ה קַרְנֵ֣י בַרְזֶ֑ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּאֵ֛לֶּה תְּנַגַּ֥ח אֶת־אֲרָ֖ם עַד־כַּלּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Zedekiah son of Chenaanah had provided himself with iron horns; and he said, “Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: With these you shall gore the Arameans till you make an end of them.”
Transliteration: vayaash lvo tsidekiyahu ven-khenaanah kareney varezel vayomer khoh-amar yehovah veeleh tenagach et-aram ad-khalvotam

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־הַנְּבִאִ֔ים נִבְּאִ֥ים כֵּ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר עֲלֵ֞ה רָמֹ֤ת גִּלְעָד֙ וְהַצְלַ֔ח וְנָתַ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: All the other prophets were prophesying similarly, “March against Ramoth-gilead and be victorious! The L<small>ORD</small> will deliver it into Your Majesty’s hands.”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haneviiym niveiym khen lemor aleh ramot gilead vehatselach venatan yehovah veyad hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהַמַּלְאָ֞ךְ אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֣ךְ ׀ לִקְרֹ֣א לְמִיכָ֗יְהוּ דִּבֶּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֞ה דִּבְרֵ֧י הַנְּבִאִ֛ים פֶּה־אֶחָ֥ד ט֖וֹב אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וִיהִי־נָ֧א דְבָרְךָ֛ כְּאַחַ֥ד מֵהֶ֖ם וְדִבַּ֥רְתָּ טּֽוֹב׃
Translated: The messenger who had gone to summon Micaiah said to him, “Look, the words of the prophets are unanimously favorable to the king. Let your word be like that of the rest of them; speak a favorable word.”
Transliteration: vehamaleakhe asher-halakhe likero lemiykhayehu diver elayv lemor hineh diverey haneviiym feh-echad tvov el-hamelekhe viyhiy-na devarekha kheachad mehem vedivareta tvov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִיכָ֑יְהוּ חַי־יְהֹוָ֕ה כִּ֛י אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמַ֥ר אֱלֹהַ֖י אֹת֥וֹ אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: “By the life of the L<small>ORD</small>,” Micaiah answered, “I will speak only what my God tells me.”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhayehu chay-yehovah khiy et-asher-yomar elohay otvo adaver

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֮ אֶל־הַמֶּ֒לֶךְ֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֵלָ֗יו מִיכָה֙ הֲנֵלֵ֞ךְ אֶל־רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָ֛ד לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אִם־אֶחְדָּ֑ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ עֲל֣וּ וְהַצְלִ֔יחוּ וְיִנָּתְנ֖וּ בְּיֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translated: When he came before the king, the king said to him, “Micah, shall we march against Ramoth-gilead for battle or shall we not?” He answered him, “March and be victorious! They will be delivered into your hands.”
Transliteration: vayavo el-hamelekhe vayomer hamelekhe elayv miykhah hanelekhe el-ramot gilead lamilechamah im-echedal vayomer alu vehatseliychu veyinatenu veyedekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַד־כַּמֶּ֥ה פְעָמִ֖ים אֲנִ֣י מַשְׁבִּיעֶ֑ךָ אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־תְדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֛י רַק־אֱמֶ֖ת בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The king said to him, “How many times must I adjure you to tell me nothing but the truth in the name of the L<small>ORD</small>?”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv hamelekhe ad-khameh feamiym aniy masheviyekha asher lo-tedaver elay rak-emet veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר רָאִ֤יתִי אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נְפוֹצִ֣ים עַל־הֶהָרִ֔ים כַּצֹּ֕אן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־לָהֶ֖ן רֹעֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ לֹֽא־אֲדֹנִ֣ים לָאֵ֔לֶּה יָשׁ֥וּבוּ אִישׁ־לְבֵית֖וֹ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Then he said, “I saw all Israel scattered over the hills like sheep without a shepherd; and the L<small>ORD</small> said, ‘These have no master; let everyone return to his home in safety.’”
Transliteration: vayomer raiytiy et-khׇl-yisherael nefvotsiym al-hehariym khatson asher eyn-lahen roeh vayomer yehovah lo-adoniym laeleh yashuvu iysh-leveytvo veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֑ט הֲלֹא֙ אָמַ֣רְתִּי אֵלֶ֔יךָ לֹא־יִתְנַבֵּ֥א עָלַ֛י ט֖וֹב כִּ֥י אִם־לְרָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “Did I not tell you that he would not prophesy good fortune for me, but only misfortune?”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-yisherael el-yehvoshafat halo amaretiy eleykha lo-yitenave alay tvov khiy im-lera {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָכֵ֖ן שִׁמְע֣וּ דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה רָאִ֤יתִי אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ וְכׇל־צְבָ֤א הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ עֹמְדִ֔ים עַל־יְמִינ֖וֹ וּשְׂמֹאלֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then [Micaiah] said, “Indeed, hear now the word of the L<small>ORD</small>! I saw the L<small>ORD</small> seated upon His throne, with all the host of heaven standing in attendance to the right and to the left of Him.
Transliteration: vayomer lakhen shimeu devar-yehovah raiytiy et-yehovah yvoshev al-khisevo vekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim omediym al-yemiynvo ushemolvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה מִ֤י יְפַתֶּה֙ אֶת־אַחְאָ֣ב מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיַ֕עַל וְיִפֹּ֖ל בְּרָמ֣וֹת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֹּ֕אמֶר זֶ֚ה אֹמֵ֣ר כָּ֔כָה וְזֶ֖ה אֹמֵ֥ר כָּֽכָה׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> asked, ‘Who will entice King Ahab of Israel so that he will march and fall at Ramoth-gilead?’ Then one said this and another said that,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah miy yefateh et-acheav melekhe-yisherael veyaal veyifol veramvot gilead vayomer zeh omer khakhah vezeh omer khakhah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א הָר֗וּחַ וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲנִ֣י אֲפַתֶּ֑נּוּ וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלָ֖יו בַּמָּֽה׃
Translated: until a certain spirit came forward and stood before the L<small>ORD</small> and said, ‘I will entice him.’ ‘How?’ said the L<small>ORD</small> to him.
Transliteration: vayetse harucha vayaamod lifeney yehovah vayomer aniy afatenu vayomer yehovah elayv vamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵצֵא֙ וְהָיִ֙יתִי֙ לְר֣וּחַ שֶׁ֔קֶר בְּפִ֖י כׇּל־נְבִיאָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר תְּפַתֶּה֙ וְגַם־תּוּכָ֔ל צֵ֖א וַעֲשֵׂה־כֵֽן׃
Translated: And he replied, ‘I will go forth and become a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.’ Then He said, ‘You will entice with success. Go forth and do it.’
Transliteration: vayomer etse vehayiytiy lerucha sheker vefiy khׇl-neviyayv vayomer tefateh vegam-tukhal tse vaasheh-khen

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ ר֣וּחַ שֶׁ֔קֶר בְּפִ֖י נְבִיאֶ֣יךָ אֵ֑לֶּה וַֽיהֹוָ֔ה דִּבֶּ֥ר עָלֶ֖יךָ רָעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these prophets of yours; for the L<small>ORD</small> has decreed misfortune for you.”
Transliteration: veatah hineh natan yehovah rucha sheker vefiy neviyeykha eleh vayhovah diver aleykha raah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּשׁ֙ צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ בֶֽן־כְּנַעֲנָ֔ה וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־מִיכָ֖יְהוּ עַל־הַלֶּ֑חִי וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵ֣י זֶ֤ה הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ עָבַ֧ר רוּחַ־יְהֹוָ֛ה מֵאִתִּ֖י לְדַבֵּ֥ר אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: Thereupon Zedekiah son of Chenaanah came up and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and exclaimed, “However did the spirit of the L<small>ORD</small> pass from me to speak with you!”
Transliteration: vayigash tsidekiyahu ven-khenaanah vayakhe et-miykhayehu al-halechiy vayomer ey zeh haderekhe avar rucha-yehovah meitiy ledaver otakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִיכָ֔יְהוּ הִנְּךָ֥ רֹאֶ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּב֛וֹא חֶ֥דֶר בְּחֶ֖דֶר לְהֵחָבֵֽא׃
Translated: Micaiah replied, “You will see on the day when you try to hide in the innermost room.”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhayehu hinekha roeh vayyvom hahu asher tavvo cheder vecheder lehechave

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קְחוּ֙ אֶת־מִיכָ֔יְהוּ וַהֲשִׁיבֻ֖הוּ אֶל־אָמ֣וֹן שַׂר־הָעִ֑יר וְאֶל־יוֹאָ֖שׁ בֶּן־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah and turn him over to Amon, the governor of the city, and to Prince Joash,
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe yisherael kechu et-miykhayehu vahashiyvuhu el-amvon shar-haiyr veel-yvoash ven-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֗ם כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שִׂ֥ימוּ זֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית הַכֶּ֑לֶא וְהַאֲכִלֻ֜הוּ לֶ֤חֶם לַ֙חַץ֙ וּמַ֣יִם לַ֔חַץ עַ֖ד שׁוּבִ֥י בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: and say, ‘The king’s orders are: Put this fellow in prison, and let his fare be scant bread and scant water until I come home safe.’”
Transliteration: vaamaretem khoh amar hamelekhe shiymu zeh veyt hakhele vehaakhiluhu lechem lachats umayiim lachats ad shuviy veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִיכָ֔יְהוּ אִם־שׁ֤וֹב תָּשׁוּב֙ בְּשָׁל֔וֹם לֹא־דִבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁמְע֖וּ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: To which Micaiah retorted, “If you ever come home safe, the L<small>ORD</small> has not spoken through me.” He said further, “Listen, all you peoples!”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhayehu im-shvov tashuv veshalvom lo-diver yehovah viy vayomer shimeu amiym khulam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַל מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה אֶל־רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: The king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah marched against Ramoth-gilead.
Transliteration: vayaal melekhe-yisherael viyhvoshafat melekhe-yehudah el-ramot gilead

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט הִתְחַפֵּשׂ֙ וָב֣וֹא בַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה לְבַ֣שׁ בְּגָדֶ֑יךָ וַיִּתְחַפֵּשׂ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into the battle, but you, wear your robes.” So the king of Israel disguised himself, and they went into the battle.
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe yisherael el-yehvoshafat hitechafesh vavvo vamilechamah veatah levash vegadeykha vayitechafesh melekhe yisherael vayavou vamilechamah

Hebrew: וּמֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֡ם צִוָּה֩ אֶת־שָׂרֵ֨י הָרֶ֤כֶב אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֚א תִּלָּ֣חֲמ֔וּ אֶת־הַקָּטֹ֖ן אֶת־הַגָּד֑וֹל כִּ֛י אִֽם־אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: The king of Aram had given these instructions to his chariot officers: “Do not attack anyone, small or great, except the king of Israel.”
Transliteration: umelekhe aram tsivah et-sharey harekhev asher-lvo lemor lo tilachamu et-hakaton et-hagadvol khiy im-et-melekhe yisherael levadvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כִּרְאוֹת֩ שָׂרֵ֨י הָרֶ֜כֶב אֶת־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט וְהֵ֤מָּה אָֽמְרוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ה֔וּא וַיָּסֹ֥בּוּ עָלָ֖יו לְהִלָּחֵ֑ם וַיִּזְעַ֤ק יְהֽוֹשָׁפָט֙ וַיהֹוָ֣ה עֲזָר֔וֹ וַיְסִיתֵ֥ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: When the chariot officers saw Jehoshaphat, whom they took for the king of Israel, they wheeled around to attack him, and Jehoshaphat cried out and the L<small>ORD</small> helped him, and God diverted them from him.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot sharey harekhev et-yehvoshafat vehemah ameru melekhe yisherael hu vayasovu alayv lehilachem vayizeak yehvoshafat vayhovah azarvo vayesiytem Elohim mimenu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּרְאוֹת֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב כִּ֥י לֹֽא־הָיָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּשׁ֖וּבוּ מֵאַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: And when the chariot officers realized that he was not the king of Israel, they gave up the pursuit.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot sharey harekhev khiy lo-hayah melekhe yisherael vayashuvu meacharayv

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ מָשַׁ֤ךְ בַּקֶּ֙שֶׁת֙ לְתֻמּ֔וֹ וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בֵּ֥ין הַדְּבָקִ֖ים וּבֵ֣ין הַשִּׁרְיָ֑ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָרַכָּ֗ב הֲפֹ֧ךְ (ידיך) [יָדְךָ֛] וְהוֹצֵאתַ֥נִי מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה כִּ֥י הׇֽחֳלֵֽיתִי׃
Translated: Then a man drew his bow at random and hit the king of Israel between the plates of the armor and he said to his charioteer, “Turn around and get me behind the lines; I am wounded.”
Transliteration: veiysh mashakhe vakeshet letumvo vayakhe et-melekhe yisherael veyn hadevakiym uveyn hashireyan vayomer larakhav hafokhe (ydykh) [yadekha] vehvotsetaniy min-hamachaneh khiy hׇcholeytiy

Hebrew: וַתַּ֤עַל הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וּמֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הָיָ֨ה מַעֲמִ֧יד בַּמֶּרְכָּבָ֛ה נֹ֥כַח אֲרָ֖ם עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וַיָּ֕מׇת לְעֵ֖ת בּ֥וֹא הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: The battle raged all day long, and the king remained propped up in the chariot facing Aram until dusk; he died as the sun was setting.
Transliteration: vataal hamilechamah vayyvom hahu umelekhe yisherael hayah maamiyd vamerekhavah nokhach aram ad-haarev vayamׇt leet vvo hashamesh

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּ֠שׇׁב יְהוֹשָׁפָ֨ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֧ה אֶל־בֵּית֛וֹ בְּשָׁל֖וֹם לִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: King Jehoshaphat of Judah returned safely to his palace, to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoshafat melekhe-yehudah el-veytvo veshalvom liyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א אֶל־פָּנָ֗יו יֵה֣וּא בֶן־חֲנָ֘נִי֮ הַחֹזֶה֒ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֔ט הֲלָרָשָׁ֣ע לַעְזֹ֔ר וּלְשֹׂנְאֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תֶּאֱהָ֑ב וּבָזֹאת֙ עָלֶ֣יךָ קֶּ֔צֶף מִלִּפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jehu son of Hanani the seer went out to meet King Jehoshaphat and said to him, “Should one give aid to the wicked and befriend those who hate the L<small>ORD</small>? For this, wrath is upon you from the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayetse el-fanayv eihu ven-chananiy hachozeh vayomer el-hamelekhe yehvoshafat halarasha laezor uleshoneey yehovah teehav uvazot aleykha ketsef milifeney yehovah

Hebrew: אֲבָ֕ל דְּבָרִ֥ים טוֹבִ֖ים נִמְצְא֣וּ עִמָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־בִעַ֤רְתָּ הָאֲשֵׁרוֹת֙ מִן־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַהֲכִינ֥וֹתָ לְבָבְךָ֖ לִדְרֹ֥שׁ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: However, there is some good in you, for you have purged the land of the sacred posts and have dedicated yourself to worship God.”
Transliteration: aval devariym tvoviym nimetseu imakhe khiy-viareta haashervot min-haarets vahakhiynvota levavekha liderosh haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיָּ֜שׇׁב וַיֵּצֵ֣א בָעָ֗ם מִבְּאֵ֥ר שֶׁ֙בַע֙ עַד־הַ֣ר אֶפְרַ֔יִם וַיְשִׁיבֵ֕ם אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat remained in Jerusalem a while and then went out among the people from Beer-sheba to the hill country of Ephraim; he brought them back to the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayeshev yehvoshafat viyrushala͏im vayashׇv vayetse vaam miveer sheva ad-har eferayiim vayeshiyvem el-yehovah elohey avvoteyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֨ד שֹׁפְטִ֜ים בָּאָ֗רֶץ בְּכׇל־עָרֵ֧י יְהוּדָ֛ה הַבְּצֻר֖וֹת לְעִ֥יר וָעִֽיר׃
Translated: He appointed judges in the land in all the fortified towns of Judah, in each and every town.
Transliteration: vayaamed shofetiym vaarets vekhׇl-arey yehudah havetsurvot leiyr vaiyr

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־הַשֹּׁפְטִ֗ים רְאוּ֙ מָה־אַתֶּ֣ם עֹשִׂ֔ים כִּ֣י לֹ֧א לְאָדָ֛ם תִּשְׁפְּט֖וּ כִּ֣י לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְעִמָּכֶ֖ם בִּדְבַ֥ר מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: He charged the judges: “Consider what you are doing, for you judge not on behalf of man, but on behalf of the L<small>ORD</small>, and He is with you when you pass judgment.
Transliteration: vayomer el-hashofetiym reu mah-atem oshiym khiy lo leadam tishefetu khiy layhovah veimakhem videvar mishefat

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה יְהִ֥י פַחַד־יְהֹוָ֖ה עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם שִׁמְר֣וּ וַעֲשׂ֔וּ כִּֽי־אֵ֞ין עִם־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ עַוְלָ֛ה וּמַשֹּׂ֥א פָנִ֖ים וּמִקַּח־שֹֽׁחַד׃
Translated: Now let the dread of the L<small>ORD</small> be upon you; act with care, for there is no injustice or favoritism or bribe-taking with the L<small>ORD</small> our God.”
Transliteration: veatah yehiy fachad-yehovah aleykhem shimeru vaashu khiy-eyn im-yehovah eloheynu avelah umasho faniym umikach-shochad

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם בִּ֠ירוּשָׁלַ֠͏ִם הֶעֱמִ֨יד יְהוֹשָׁפָ֜ט מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֣ם וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים וּמֵרָאשֵׁ֤י הָאָבוֹת֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְמִשְׁפַּ֥ט יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלָרִ֑יב וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat also appointed in Jerusalem some Levites and priests and heads of the clans of Israelites for rendering judgment in matters of the L<small>ORD</small>, and for disputes. Then they returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vegam viyrushala͏im heemiyd yehvoshafat min-haleviyim vehakhohaniym umerashey haavvot leyisherael lemishefat yehovah velariyv vayashuvu yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֤ה תַֽעֲשׂוּן֙ בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה בֶּאֱמוּנָ֖ה וּבְלֵבָ֥ב שָׁלֵֽם׃
Translated: He charged them, “This is how you shall act: in fear of the L<small>ORD</small>, with fidelity, and with whole heart.
Transliteration: vayetsav aleyhem lemor khoh taashun veyireat yehovah veemunah uvelevav shalem

Hebrew: וְכׇל־רִיב֩ אֲשֶׁר־יָב֨וֹא עֲלֵיכֶ֜ם מֵאֲחֵיכֶ֣ם ׀ הַיֹּשְׁבִ֣ים בְּעָרֵיהֶ֗ם בֵּֽין־דָּ֣ם ׀ לְדָם֮ בֵּין־תּוֹרָ֣ה לְמִצְוָה֮ לְחֻקִּ֣ים וּלְמִשְׁפָּטִים֒ וְהִזְהַרְתֶּ֣ם אֹתָ֔ם וְלֹ֤א יֶאְשְׁמוּ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְהָיָה־קֶ֥צֶף עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְעַל־אֲחֵיכֶ֑ם כֹּ֥ה תַעֲשׂ֖וּן וְלֹ֥א תֶאְשָֽׁמוּ׃
Translated: When a dispute comes before you from your brothers living in their towns, whether about homicide, or about ritual, or laws or rules, you must instruct them so that they do not incur guilt before the L<small>ORD</small> and wrath be upon you and your brothers. Act so and you will not incur guilt.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-riyv asher-yavvo aleykhem meacheykhem hayosheviym veareyhem veyn-dam ledam veyn-tvorah lemitsevah lechukiym ulemishefatiym vehizeharetem otam velo yeeshemu layhovah vehayah-ketsef aleykhem veal-acheykhem khoh taashun velo teeshamu

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֡ה אֲמַרְיָ֣הוּ כֹהֵן֩ הָרֹ֨אשׁ עֲלֵיכֶ֜ם לְכֹ֣ל דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה וּזְבַדְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־יִשְׁמָעֵ֜אל הַנָּגִ֤יד לְבֵית־יְהוּדָה֙ לְכֹ֣ל דְּבַר־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְשֹׁטְרִ֥ים הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם חִזְק֣וּ וַעֲשׂ֔וּ וִיהִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עִם־הַטּֽוֹב׃ {פ}
Translated: See, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all cases concerning the L<small>ORD</small>, and Zebadiah son of Ishmael is the commander of the house of Judah in all cases concerning the king; the Levitical officials are at your disposal; act with resolve and the L<small>ORD</small> be with the good.”
Transliteration: vehineh amareyahu khohen harosh aleykhem lekhol devar-yehovah uzevadeyahu ven-yishemael hanagiyd leveyt-yehudah lekhol devar-hamelekhe veshoteriym haleviyim lifeneykhem chizeku vaashu viyhiy yehovah im-hatvov {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֡ן בָּ֣אוּ בְנֵי־מוֹאָב֩ וּבְנֵ֨י עַמּ֜וֹן וְעִמָּהֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> מֵהָעַמּוֹנִ֛ים עַל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: After that, Moabites, Ammonites, together with some Ammonim, came against Jehoshaphat to wage war.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vau veney-mvoav uveney amvon veimahem <small></small> mehaamvoniym al-yehvoshafat lamilechamah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ וַיַּגִּ֤ידוּ לִיהֽוֹשָׁפָט֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֣א עָלֶ֜יךָ הָמ֥וֹן רָ֛ב מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיָּ֖ם מֵאֲרָ֑ם וְהִנָּם֙ בְּחַֽצְצ֣וֹן תָּמָ֔ר הִ֖יא עֵ֥ין גֶּֽדִי׃
Translated: The report was brought to Jehoshaphat: “A great multitude is coming against you from beyond the sea, from Aram, and is now in Hazazon-tamar”—that is, Ein-gedi.
Transliteration: vayavou vayagiydu liyhvoshafat lemor va aleykha hamvon rav meever layam mearam vehinam vechatsetsvon tamar hiy eyn gediy

Hebrew: וַיִּרָ֕א וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהוֹשָׁפָ֛ט אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו לִדְר֣וֹשׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּקְרָא־צ֖וֹם עַל־כׇּל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat was afraid; he decided to resort to the L<small>ORD</small> and proclaimed a fast for all Judah.
Transliteration: vayira vayiten yehvoshafat et-fanayv lidervosh layhovah vayikera-tsvom al-khׇl-yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ יְהוּדָ֔ה לְבַקֵּ֖שׁ מֵיְהֹוָ֑ה גַּ֚ם מִכׇּל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה בָּ֖אוּ לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Judah assembled to beseech the L<small>ORD</small>. They also came from all the towns of Judah to seek the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu yehudah levakesh meyehovah gam mikhׇl-arey yehudah vau levakesh et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט בִּקְהַ֧ל יְהוּדָ֛ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה לִפְנֵ֖י הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַחֲדָשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem in the House of the L<small>ORD</small> at the front of the new court.
Transliteration: vayaamod yehvoshafat vikehal yehudah viyrushala͏im veveyt yehovah lifeney hechatser hachadashah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ הֲלֹ֨א אַתָּה־ה֤וּא אֱלֹהִים֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְאַתָּ֣ה מוֹשֵׁ֔ל בְּכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וּבְיָֽדְךָ֙ כֹּ֣חַ וּגְבוּרָ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין עִמְּךָ֖ לְהִתְיַצֵּֽב׃
Translated: He said, “L<small>ORD</small> God of our fathers, truly You are the God in heaven and You rule over the kingdoms of the nations; power and strength are Yours; none can oppose You.
Transliteration: vayomar yehovah elohey avoteynu halo atah-hu Elohim vashamayiim veatah mvoshel vekhol mamelekhvot hagvoyim uveyadekha khocha ugevurah veeyn imekha lehiteyatsev

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א ׀ אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ הוֹרַ֙שְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־יֹֽשְׁבֵי֙ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את מִלִּפְנֵ֖י עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽתִּתְּנָ֗הּ לְזֶ֛רַע אַבְרָהָ֥ם אֹהַבְךָ֖ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: O our God, you dispossessed the inhabitants of this land before Your people Israel, and You gave it to the descendants of Your friend Abraham forever.
Transliteration: halo atah eloheynu hvorasheta et-yoshevey haarets hazot milifeney amekha yisherael vatitenah lezera averaham ohavekha levolam

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ־בָ֑הּ וַיִּבְנ֨וּ לְךָ֧ <small>׀</small> בָּ֛הּ מִקְדָּ֖שׁ לְשִׁמְךָ֥ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: They settled in it and in it built for You a House for Your name. They said,
Transliteration: vayeshevu-vah vayivenu lekha <small></small> vah mikedash leshimekha lemor

Hebrew: אִם־תָּב֨וֹא עָלֵ֜ינוּ רָעָ֗ה חֶ֘רֶב֮ שְׁפוֹט֮ וְדֶ֣בֶר וְרָעָב֒ נַעַמְדָ֞ה לִפְנֵ֨י הַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ וּלְפָנֶ֔יךָ כִּ֥י שִׁמְךָ֖ בַּבַּ֣יִת הַזֶּ֑ה וְנִזְעַ֥ק אֵלֶ֛יךָ מִצָּרָתֵ֖נוּ וְתִשְׁמַ֥ע וְתוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated: ‘Should misfortune befall us—the punishing sword, pestilence, or famine, we shall stand before this House and before You—for Your name is in this House—and we shall cry out to You in our distress, and You will listen and deliver us.’
Transliteration: im-tavvo aleynu raah cherev shefvot vedever veraav naamedah lifeney havayiit hazeh ulefaneykha khiy shimekha vavayiit hazeh venizeak eleykha mitsaratenu vetishema vetvoshiya

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה הִנֵּה֩ בְנֵי־עַמּ֨וֹן וּמוֹאָ֜ב וְהַר־שֵׂעִ֗יר אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־נָתַ֤תָּה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לָב֣וֹא בָהֶ֔ם בְּבֹאָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּ֛י סָ֥רוּ מֵעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וְלֹ֥א הִשְׁמִידֽוּם׃
Translated: Now the people of Ammon, Moab, and the hill country of Seir, into whose [land] You did not let Israel come when they came from Egypt, but they turned aside from them and did not wipe them out,
Transliteration: veatah hineh veney-amvon umvoav vehar-sheiyr asher lo-natatah leyisherael lavvo vahem vevoam meerets mitserayiim khiy saru mealeyhem velo hishemiydum

Hebrew: וְהִ֨נֵּה־הֵ֔ם גֹּמְלִ֖ים עָלֵ֑ינוּ לָבוֹא֙ לְגָ֣רְשֵׁ֔נוּ מִיְּרֻשָּׁתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹרַשְׁתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: these now repay us by coming to expel us from Your possession which You gave us as ours.
Transliteration: vehineh-hem gomeliym aleynu lavvo legareshenu miyerushatekha asher hvorashetanu

Hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ הֲלֹ֣א תִשְׁפׇּט־בָּ֔ם כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין בָּ֙נוּ֙ כֹּ֔חַ לִ֠פְנֵ֠י הֶהָמ֥וֹן הָרָ֛ב הַזֶּ֖ה הַבָּ֣א עָלֵ֑ינוּ וַאֲנַ֗חְנוּ לֹ֤א נֵדַע֙ מַֽה־נַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה כִּ֥י עָלֶ֖יךָ עֵינֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: O our God, surely You will punish them, for we are powerless before this great multitude that has come against us, and do not know what to do, but our eyes are on You.”
Transliteration: eloheynu halo tishefׇt-vam khiy eyn vanu khocha lifeney hehamvon harav hazeh hava aleynu vaanachenu lo neda mah-naasheh khiy aleykha eyneynu

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־יְהוּדָ֔ה עֹמְדִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה גַּם־טַפָּ֖ם נְשֵׁיהֶ֥ם וּבְנֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: All Judah stood before the L<small>ORD</small> with their little ones, their womenfolk, and their children.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yehudah omediym lifeney yehovah gam-tafam nesheyhem uveneyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְיַחֲזִיאֵ֡ל בֶּן־זְכַרְיָ֡הוּ בֶּן־בְּ֠נָיָ֠ה בֶּן־יְעִיאֵ֧ל בֶּן־מַתַּנְיָ֛ה הַלֵּוִ֖י מִן־בְּנֵ֣י אָסָ֑ף הָיְתָ֤ה עָלָיו֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ הַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: Then in the midst of the congregation the spirit of the L<small>ORD</small> came upon Jahaziel son of Zechariah son of Benaiah son of Jeiel son of Mattaniah the Levite, of the sons of Asaph,
Transliteration: veyachaziyel ven-zekhareyahu ven-venayah ven-yeiyel ven-mataneyah haleviy min-veney asaf hayetah alayv rucha yehovah vetvokhe hakahal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַקְשִׁ֤יבוּ כׇל־יְהוּדָה֙ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְהַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֑ט כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָכֶ֗ם אַ֠תֶּ֠ם אַל־תִּֽירְא֤וּ וְאַל־תֵּחַ֙תּוּ֙ מִפְּנֵ֨י הֶהָמ֤וֹן הָרָב֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֥א לָכֶ֛ם הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה כִּ֥י לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and he said, “Give heed, all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and King Jehoshaphat; thus said the L<small>ORD</small> to you, ‘Do not fear or be dismayed by this great multitude, for the battle is God’s, not yours.
Transliteration: vayomer hakeshiyvu khׇl-yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im vehamelekhe yehvoshafat khoh-amar yehovah lakhem atem al-tiyreu veal-techatu mifeney hehamvon harav hazeh khiy lo lakhem hamilechamah khiy lelohiym

Hebrew: מָחָר֙ רְד֣וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם הִנָּ֥ם עֹלִ֖ים בְּמַעֲלֵ֣ה הַצִּ֑יץ וּמְצָאתֶ֤ם אֹתָם֙ בְּס֣וֹף הַנַּ֔חַל פְּנֵ֖י מִדְבַּ֥ר יְרוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: March down against them tomorrow as they come up by the Ascent of Ziz; you will find them at the end of the wadi in the direction of the wilderness of Jeruel.
Transliteration: machar redu aleyhem hinam oliym vemaaleh hatsiyts umetsatem otam vesvof hanachal feney midevar yeruel

Hebrew: לֹ֥א לָכֶ֖ם לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם בָּזֹ֑את הִתְיַצְּב֣וּ עִמְד֡וּ וּרְא֣וּ אֶת־יְשׁוּעַת֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה עִמָּכֶ֜ם יְהוּדָ֣ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אַל־תִּֽירְאוּ֙ וְאַל־תֵּחַ֔תּוּ מָחָר֙ צְא֣וּ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: It is not for you to fight this battle; stand by, wait, and witness your deliverance by the L<small>ORD</small>, O Judah and Jerusalem; do not fear or be dismayed; go forth to meet them tomorrow and the L<small>ORD</small> will be with you.’”
Transliteration: lo lakhem lehilachem vazot hiteyatsevu imedu ureu et-yeshuat yehovah imakhem yehudah viyrushala͏im al-tiyreu veal-techatu machar tseu lifeneyhem vayhovah imakhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקֹּ֧ד יְהוֹשָׁפָ֛ט אַפַּ֖יִם אָ֑רְצָה וְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֞ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם נָֽפְלוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֖ת לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat bowed low with his face to the ground, and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem threw themselves down before the L<small>ORD</small> to worship the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikod yehvoshafat afayiim aretsah vekhׇl-yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im nafelu lifeney yehovah lehishetachavot layhovah

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֧מוּ הַלְוִיִּ֛ם מִן־בְּנֵ֥י הַקְּהָתִ֖ים וּמִן־בְּנֵ֣י הַקׇּרְחִ֑ים לְהַלֵּ֗ל לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּק֥וֹל גָּד֖וֹל לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: Levites of the sons of Kohath and of the sons of Korah got up to extol the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel at the top of their voices.
Transliteration: vayakumu haleviyim min-veney hakehatiym umin-veney hakׇrechiym lehalel layhovah elohey yisherael vekvol gadvol lemaelah

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֵּצְא֖וּ לְמִדְבַּ֣ר תְּק֑וֹעַ וּבְצֵאתָ֞ם עָמַ֣ד יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ שְׁמָע֗וּנִי יְהוּדָה֙ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם הַאֲמִ֜ינוּ בַּֽיהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ וְתֵ֣אָמֵ֔נוּ הַאֲמִ֥ינוּ בִנְבִיאָ֖יו וְהַצְלִֽיחוּ׃
Translated: Early the next morning they arose and went forth to the wilderness of Tekoa. As they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Listen to me, O Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: Trust firmly in the L<small>ORD</small> your God and you will stand firm; trust firmly in His prophets and you will succeed.”
Transliteration: vayashekhiymu vavoker vayetseu lemidevar tekvoa uvetsetam amad yehvoshafat vayomer shemauniy yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im haamiynu vayhovah eloheykhem veteamenu haamiynu vineviyayv vehatseliychu

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַץ֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וַיַּעֲמֵ֤ד מְשֹֽׁרְרִים֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וּֽמְהַלְלִ֖ים לְהַדְרַת־קֹ֑דֶשׁ בְּצֵאת֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הֶחָל֔וּץ וְאֹֽמְרִים֙ הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י לְעוֹלָ֖ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: After taking counsel with the people, he stationed singers to the L<small>ORD</small> extolling the One majestic in holiness as they went forth ahead of the vanguard, saying, “Praise the L<small>ORD</small>, for His steadfast love is eternal.”
Transliteration: vayivaats el-haam vayaamed meshoreriym layhovah umehaleliym lehaderat-kodesh vetset lifeney hechaluts veomeriym hvodu layhovah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וּבְעֵת֩ הֵחֵ֨לּוּ בְרִנָּ֜ה וּתְהִלָּ֗ה נָתַ֣ן יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> מְ֠אָֽרְבִ֠ים עַל־בְּנֵ֨י עַמּ֜וֹן מוֹאָ֧ב וְהַר־שֵׂעִ֛יר הַבָּאִ֥ים לִֽיהוּדָ֖ה וַיִּנָּגֵֽפוּ׃
Translated: As they began their joyous shouts and hymns, the L<small>ORD</small> set ambushes for the men of Ammon, Moab, and the hill country of Seir, who were marching against Judah, and they were routed.
Transliteration: uveet hechelu verinah utehilah natan yehovah <small></small> meareviym al-veney amvon mvoav vehar-sheiyr havaiym liyhudah vayinagefu

Hebrew: וַ֠יַּעַמְד֠וּ בְּנֵ֨י עַמּ֧וֹן וּמוֹאָ֛ב עַל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הַר־שֵׂעִ֖יר לְהַחֲרִ֣ים וּלְהַשְׁמִ֑יד וּכְכַלּוֹתָם֙ בְּיוֹשְׁבֵ֣י שֵׂעִ֔יר עָזְר֥וּ אִישׁ־בְּרֵעֵ֖הוּ לְמַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated: The Ammonites and Moabites turned against the men of the hill country of Seir to exterminate and annihilate them. When they had made an end of the men of Seir, each helped to destroy his fellow.
Transliteration: vayaamedu veney amvon umvoav al-yoshevey har-sheiyr lehachariym ulehashemiyd ukhekhalvotam veyvoshevey sheiyr azeru iysh-vereehu lemashechiyt

Hebrew: וִיהוּדָ֛ה בָּ֥א עַל־הַמִּצְפֶּ֖ה לַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיִּפְנוּ֙ אֶל־הֶ֣הָמ֔וֹן וְהִנָּ֧ם פְּגָרִ֛ים נֹפְלִ֥ים אַ֖רְצָה וְאֵ֥ין פְּלֵיטָֽה׃
Translated: When Judah reached the lookout in the wilderness and looked for the multitude, they saw them lying on the ground as corpses; not one had survived.
Transliteration: viyhudah va al-hamitsefeh lamidevar vayifenu el-hehamvon vehinam fegariym nofeliym aretsah veeyn feleytah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יְהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט וְעַמּוֹ֮ לָבֹ֣ז אֶת־שְׁלָלָם֒ וַיִּמְצְאוּ֩ בָהֶ֨ם לָרֹ֜ב וּרְכ֤וּשׁ וּפְגָרִים֙ וּכְלֵ֣י חֲמֻד֔וֹת וַיְנַצְּל֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם לְאֵ֣ין מַשָּׂ֑א וַיִּהְי֞וּ יָמִ֧ים שְׁלוֹשָׁ֛ה בֹּזְזִ֥ים אֶת־הַשָּׁלָ֖ל כִּ֥י רַב־הֽוּא׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat and his army came to take the booty, and found an abundance of goods, corpses, and precious objects, which they pillaged, more than they could carry off. For three days they were taking booty, there was so much of it.
Transliteration: vayavo yehvoshafat veamvo lavoz et-shelalam vayimetseu vahem larov urekhush ufegariym ukheley chamudvot vayenatselu lahem leeyn masha vayiheyu yamiym shelvoshah vozeziym et-hashalal khiy rav-hu

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הָרְבִעִ֗י נִקְהֲלוּ֙ לְעֵ֣מֶק בְּרָכָ֔ה כִּי־שָׁ֖ם בֵּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֡ן קָרְא֞וּ אֶת־שֵׁ֨ם הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֛וּא עֵ֥מֶק בְּרָכָ֖ה עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: On the fourth day they assembled in the Valley of Blessing—for there they blessed the L<small>ORD</small>; that is why that place is called the Valley of Blessing to this day.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hareviiy nikehalu leemek verakhah khiy-sham verekhu et-yehovah al-khen kareu et-shem hamakvom hahu emek verakhah ad-hayyvom

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּשֻׁב֠וּ כׇּל־אִ֨ישׁ יְהוּדָ֤ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט בְּרֹאשָׁ֔ם לָשׁ֥וּב אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בְּשִׂמְחָ֑ה כִּֽי־שִׂמְּחָ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵאוֹיְבֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: All the men of Judah and Jerusalem with Jehoshaphat at their head returned joyfully to Jerusalem, for the L<small>ORD</small> had given them cause for rejoicing over their enemies.
Transliteration: vayashuvu khׇl-iysh yehudah viyrushala͏im viyhvoshafat verosham lashuv el-yerushala͏im veshimechah khiy-shimecham yehovah mevoyeveyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בִּנְבָלִ֥ים וּבְכִנֹּר֖וֹת וּבַחֲצֹֽצְר֑וֹת אֶל־בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They came to Jerusalem to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, to the accompaniment of harps, lyres, and trumpets.
Transliteration: vayavou yerushala͏im vinevaliym uvekhinorvot uvachatsotservot el-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ פַּ֣חַד אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַ֖ל כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת בְּשׇׁמְעָ֕ם כִּ֚י נִלְחַ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה עִ֖ם אוֹיְבֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The terror of God seized all the kingdoms of the lands when they heard that the L<small>ORD</small> had fought the enemies of Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy fachad Elohim al khׇl-mamelekhvot haaratsvot veshׇmeam khiy nilecham yehovah im voyevey yisherael

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁקֹ֖ט מַלְכ֣וּת יְהוֹשָׁפָ֑ט וַיָּ֧נַֽח ל֦וֹ אֱלֹהָ֖יו מִסָּבִֽיב׃ {פ}
Translated: The kingdom of Jehoshaphat was untroubled, and his God granted him respite on all sides.
Transliteration: vatishekot malekhut yehvoshafat vayanach lvo elohayv misaviyv {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט עַל־יְהוּדָ֑ה בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁים֩ וְחָמֵ֨שׁ שָׁנָ֜ה בְּמׇלְכ֗וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ מָלַ֣ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ עֲזוּבָ֖ה בַּת־שִׁלְחִֽי׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for twenty-five years. His mother’s name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.
Transliteration: vayimelokhe yehvoshafat al-yehudah ven-sheloshiym vechamesh shanah vemׇlekhvo veesheriym vechamesh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo azuvah vat-shilechiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּדֶ֛רֶךְ אָבִ֥יו אָסָ֖א וְלֹא־סָ֣ר מִמֶּ֑נָּה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He followed the course of his father Asa and did not deviate from it, doing what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vederekhe aviyv asa velo-sar mimenah laashvot hayashar veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: אַ֥ךְ הַבָּמ֖וֹת לֹא־סָ֑רוּ וְע֤וֹד הָעָם֙ לֹא־הֵכִ֣ינוּ לְבָבָ֔ם לֵאלֹהֵ֖י אֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: However, the shrines did not cease; the people still did not direct their heart toward the God of their fathers.
Transliteration: akhe havamvot lo-saru vevod haam lo-hekhiynu levavam lelohey avoteyhem

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהוֹשָׁפָ֔ט הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרֹנִ֑ים הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים בְּדִבְרֵי֙ יֵה֣וּא בֶן־חֲנָ֔נִי אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֹֽעֲלָ֔ה עַל־סֵ֖פֶר מַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: As for the other events of Jehoshaphat’s reign, early and late, they are recorded in the annals of Jehu son of Hanani, which were included in the book of the kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yehvoshafat harishoniym vehaacharoniym hinam khetuviym vediverey eihu ven-chananiy asher hoalah al-sefer malekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֶתְחַבַּר֙ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֔ה עִ֖ם אֲחַזְיָ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ה֖וּא הִרְשִׁ֥יעַ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated: Afterward, King Jehoshaphat of Judah entered into a partnership with King Ahaziah of Israel, thereby acting wickedly.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen etechavar yehvoshafat melekhe-yehudah im achazeyah melekhe-yisherael hu hireshiya laashvot

Hebrew: וַיְחַבְּרֵ֣הוּ עִמּ֔וֹ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֳנִיּ֖וֹת לָלֶ֣כֶת תַּרְשִׁ֑ישׁ וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֳנִיּ֖וֹת בְּעֶצְי֥וֹן גָּֽבֶר׃
Translated: He joined with him in constructing ships to go to Tarshish; the ships were constructed in Ezion-geber.
Transliteration: vayechaverehu imvo laashvot oniyyvot lalekhet tareshiysh vayaashu oniyyvot veetseyvon gaver

Hebrew: וַיִּתְנַבֵּ֞א אֱלִיעֶ֤זֶר בֶּן־דֹּדָוָ֙הוּ֙ מִמָּ֣רֵשָׁ֔ה עַל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּהִֽתְחַבֶּרְךָ֣ עִם־אֲחַזְיָ֗הוּ פָּרַ֤ץ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽת־מַעֲשֶׂ֔יךָ וַיִּשָּׁבְר֣וּ אֳנִיּ֔וֹת וְלֹ֥א עָצְר֖וּ לָלֶ֥כֶת אֶל־תַּרְשִֽׁישׁ׃
Translated: Eliezer son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, “As you have made a partnership with Ahaziah, the L<small>ORD</small> will break up your work.” The ships were wrecked and were unable to go to Tarshish.
Transliteration: vayitenave eliyezer ven-dodavahu mimareshah al-yehvoshafat lemor khehitechaverekha im-achazeyahu farats yehovah et-maasheykha vayishaveru oniyyvot velo atseru lalekhet el-tareshiysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יְהוֹשָׁפָט֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹרָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the City of David; his son Jehoram succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yehvoshafat im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr daviyd vayimelokhe yehvoram venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וְלוֹ־אַחִ֞ים בְּנֵ֣י יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט עֲזַרְיָ֤ה וִֽיחִיאֵל֙ וּזְכַרְיָ֣הוּ וַעֲזַרְיָ֔הוּ וּמִיכָאֵ֖ל וּשְׁפַטְיָ֑הוּ כׇּל־אֵ֕לֶּה בְּנֵ֖י יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He had brothers, sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariahu, Michael, and Shephatiah; all these were sons of King Jehoshaphat of Israel.
Transliteration: velvo-achiym veney yehvoshafat azareyah viychiyel uzekhareyahu vaazareyahu umiykhael ushefateyahu khׇl-eleh veney yehvoshafat melekhe-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֣ם ׀ אֲ֠בִיהֶ֠ם מַתָּנ֨וֹת רַבּ֜וֹת לְכֶ֤סֶף וּלְזָהָב֙ וּלְמִגְדָּנ֔וֹת עִם־עָרֵ֥י מְצֻר֖וֹת בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה וְאֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָ֛ה נָתַ֥ן לִֽיהוֹרָ֖ם כִּי־ה֥וּא הַבְּכֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated: Their father gave them many gifts of silver, gold, and [other] presents, as well as fortified towns in Judah, but he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the first-born.
Transliteration: vayiten lahem aviyhem matanvot ravvot lekhesef ulezahav ulemigedanvot im-arey metsurvot viyhudah veet-hamamelakhah natan liyhvoram khiy-hu havekhvor {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם יְהוֹרָ֜ם עַל־מַמְלֶ֤כֶת אָבִיו֙ וַיִּתְחַזַּ֔ק וַיַּהֲרֹ֥ג אֶת־כׇּל־אֶחָ֖יו בֶּחָ֑רֶב וְגַ֖ם מִשָּׂרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Jehoram proceeded to take firm hold of his father’s kingdom and put to the sword all his brothers, as well as some of the officers of Israel.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yehvoram al-mamelekhet aviyv vayitechazak vayaharog et-khׇl-echayv vecharev vegam misharey yisherael

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֛יִם שָׁנָ֖ה יְהוֹרָ֣ם בְּמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׁמוֹנֶ֣ה שָׁנִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years.
Transliteration: ven-sheloshiym ushetayiim shanah yehvoram vemׇlekhvo ushemvoneh shaniym malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֜לֶךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֔ב כִּ֚י בַּת־אַחְאָ֔ב הָ֥יְתָה לּ֖וֹ אִשָּׁ֑ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He followed the practices of the kings of Israel doing what the House of Ahab had done, for he married a daughter of Ahab; he did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vederekhe malekhey yisherael khaasher ashu veyt acheav khiy vat-acheav hayetah lvo ishah vayaash hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אָבָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה לְהַשְׁחִית֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֔יד לְמַ֣עַן הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖ת לְדָוִ֑יד וְכַאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֗ר לָתֵ֨ת ל֥וֹ נִ֛יר וּלְבָנָ֖יו כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: However, the L<small>ORD</small> refrained from destroying the House of David for the sake of the covenant he had made with David, and in accordance with his promise to maintain a lamp for him and his descendants for all time.
Transliteration: velo-avah yehovah lehashechiyt et-veyt daviyd lemaan haveriyt asher kharat ledaviyd vekhaasher amar latet lvo niyr ulevanayv khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: בְּיָמָיו֙ פָּשַׁ֣ע אֱד֔וֹם מִתַּ֖חַת יַד־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיַּמְלִ֥יכוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: During his reign, the Edomites rebelled against Judah’s rule and set up a king of their own.
Transliteration: veyamayv fasha edvom mitachat yad-yehudah vayameliykhu aleyhem melekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר יְהוֹרָם֙ עִם־שָׂרָ֔יו וְכׇל־הָרֶ֖כֶב עִמּ֑וֹ וַֽיְהִי֙ קָ֣ם לַ֔יְלָה וַיַּ֗ךְ אֶת־אֱדוֹם֙ הַסּוֹבֵ֣ב אֵלָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת שָׂרֵ֥י הָרָֽכֶב׃
Translated: Jehoram advanced [against them] with his officers and all his chariotry. He arose by night and attacked the Edomites, who surrounded him and the chariot commanders.
Transliteration: vayaavor yehvoram im-sharayv vekhׇl-harekhev imvo vayehiy kam layelah vayakhe et-edvom hasvovev elayv veet sharey harakhev

Hebrew: וַיִּפְשַׁ֨ע אֱד֜וֹם מִתַּ֣חַת יַד־יְהוּדָ֗ה עַ֚ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה אָ֣ז תִּפְשַׁ֥ע לִבְנָ֛ה בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖יא מִתַּ֣חַת יָד֑וֹ כִּ֣י עָזַ֔ב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Edom has been in rebellion against Judah, to this day; Libnah also rebelled against him at that time, because he had forsaken the L<small>ORD</small> God of his fathers.
Transliteration: vayifesha edvom mitachat yad-yehudah ad hayyvom hazeh az tifesha livenah vaet hahiy mitachat yadvo khiy azav et-yehovah elohey avotayv

Hebrew: גַּם־ה֥וּא עָשָֽׂה־בָמ֖וֹת בְּהָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיֶּ֙זֶן֙ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיַּדַּ֖ח אֶת־יְהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Moreover, he built shrines in the hill country of Judah; he led astray the inhabitants of Jerusalem and made Judah wayward.
Transliteration: gam-hu ashah-vamvot veharey yehudah vayezen et-yoshevey yerushala͏im vayadach et-yehudah {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א אֵלָיו֙ מִכְתָּ֔ב מֵאֵלִיָּ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֔יךָ תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־הָלַ֙כְתָּ֙ בְּדַרְכֵי֙ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט אָבִ֔יךָ וּבְדַרְכֵ֖י אָסָ֥א מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: A letter from Elijah the prophet came to him which read, “Thus says the L<small>ORD</small> God of your father David: Since you have not followed the practices of your father Jehoshaphat and the practices of King Asa of Judah,
Transliteration: vayavo elayv mikhetav meeliyahu hanaviy lemor khoh amar yehovah elohey daviyd aviykha tachat asher lo-halakheta vedarekhey yehvoshafat aviykha uvedarekhey asa melekhe-yehudah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּדֶ֙רֶךְ֙ מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַתַּזְנֶ֤ה אֶת־יְהוּדָה֙ וְאֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כְּהַזְנ֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב וְגַ֨ם אֶת־אַחֶ֧יךָ בֵית־אָבִ֛יךָ הַטּוֹבִ֥ים מִמְּךָ֖ הָרָֽגְתָּ׃
Translated: but have followed the practices of the kings of Israel, leading astray Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem as the House of Ahab led them astray, and have also killed your brothers of your father’s house, who were better than you,
Transliteration: vatelekhe vederekhe malekhey yisherael vatazeneh et-yehudah veet-yoshevey yerushala͏im khehazenvot veyt acheav vegam et-acheykha veyt-aviykha hatvoviym mimekha harageta

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה נֹגֵ֛ף מַגֵּפָ֥ה גְדוֹלָ֖ה בְּעַמֶּ֑ךָ וּבְבָנֶ֥יךָ וּבְנָשֶׁ֖יךָ וּבְכׇל־רְכוּשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: therefore, the L<small>ORD</small> will inflict a great blow upon your people, your sons, and your wives and all your possessions.
Transliteration: hineh yehovah nogef magefah gedvolah veamekha uvevaneykha uvenasheykha uvekhׇl-rekhushekha

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֛ה בׇּחֳלָיִ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים בְּמַחֲלֵ֣ה מֵעֶ֑יךָ עַד־יֵצְא֤וּ מֵעֶ֙יךָ֙ מִן־הַחֹ֔לִי יָמִ֖ים עַל־יָמִֽים׃
Translated: As for you, you will be severely stricken with a disorder of the bowels year after year until your bowels drop out.”
Transliteration: veatah vׇcholayiym raviym vemachaleh meeykha ad-eitseu meeykha min-hacholiy yamiym al-yamiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨עַר יְהֹוָ֜ה עַל־יְהוֹרָ֗ם אֵ֣ת ר֤וּחַ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ וְהָ֣עַרְבִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־יַ֥ד כּוּשִֽׁים׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> stirred up the spirit of the Philistines and the Arabs who were neighbors of the Cushites against Jehoram.
Transliteration: vayaar yehovah al-yehvoram et rucha hafelishetiym vehaareviym asher al-yad khushiym

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֤וּ בִיהוּדָה֙ וַיִּבְקָע֔וּהָ וַיִּשְׁבּ֗וּ אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָרְכוּשׁ֙ הַנִּמְצָ֣א לְבֵית־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְגַם־בָּנָ֖יו וְנָשָׁ֑יו וְלֹ֤א נִשְׁאַר־לוֹ֙ בֵּ֔ן כִּ֥י אִם־יְהוֹאָחָ֖ז קְטֹ֥ן בָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: They marched against Judah, breached its defenses, and carried off all the property that was found in the king’s palace, as well as his sons and his wives. The only son who remained was Jehoahaz, his youngest.
Transliteration: vayaalu viyhudah vayivekauha vayishevu et khׇl-harekhush hanimetsa leveyt-hamelekhe vegam-vanayv venashayv velo nishear-lvo ven khiy im-yehvoachaz keton vanayv

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵ֖י כׇּל־זֹ֑את נְגָפ֨וֹ יְהֹוָ֧ה <small>׀</small> בְּמֵעָ֛יו לׇחֳלִ֖י לְאֵ֥ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃
Translated: After this, the L<small>ORD</small> afflicted him with an incurable disease of the bowels.
Transliteration: veacharey khׇl-zot negafvo yehovah <small></small> vemeayv lׇcholiy leeyn marefe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י לְיָמִ֣ים ׀ מִיָּמִ֡ים וּכְעֵת֩ צֵ֨את הַקֵּ֜ץ לְיָמִ֣ים ׀ שְׁנַ֗יִם יָצְא֤וּ מֵעָיו֙ עִם־חׇלְי֔וֹ וַיָּ֖מׇת בְּתַחֲלֻאִ֣ים רָעִ֑ים וְלֹא־עָ֨שׂוּ ל֥וֹ עַמּ֛וֹ שְׂרֵפָ֖ה כִּשְׂרֵפַ֥ת אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Some years later, when a period of two years had elapsed, his bowels dropped out because of his disease, and he died a gruesome death. His people did not make a fire for him like the fire for his fathers.
Transliteration: vayehiy leyamiym miyamiym ukheet tset hakets leyamiym shenayiim yatseu meayv im-chׇleyvo vayamׇt vetachaluiym raiym velo-ashu lvo amvo sherefah khisherefat avotayv

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּשְׁתַּ֙יִם֙ הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וּשְׁמוֹנֶ֣ה שָׁנִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּלֹ֣א חֶמְדָּ֔ה וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֙הוּ֙ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֔יד וְלֹ֖א בְּקִבְר֥וֹת הַמְּלָכִֽים׃
Translated: He was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years. He departed unpraised, and was buried in the City of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.
Transliteration: ven-sheloshiym ushetayiim hayah vemׇlekhvo ushemvoneh shaniym malakhe viyrushala͏im vayelekhe velo chemedah vayikeveruhu veiyr daviyd velo vekivervot hamelakhiym

Hebrew: וַיַּמְלִ֩יכוּ֩ יוֹשְׁבֵ֨י יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם אֶת־אֲחַזְיָ֨הוּ בְנ֤וֹ הַקָּטֹן֙ תַּחְתָּ֔יו כִּ֤י כׇל־הָרִֽאשֹׁנִים֙ הָרַ֣ג הַגְּד֔וּד הַבָּ֥א בָעַרְבִ֖ים לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲחַזְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹרָ֖ם מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah, his youngest son, king in his stead, because all the older ones had been killed by the troops that penetrated the camp with the Arabs. Ahaziah son of Jehoram reigned as king of Judah.
Transliteration: vayameliykhu yvoshevey yerushala͏im et-achazeyahu venvo hakaton tachetayv khiy khׇl-harishoniym harag hagedud hava vaareviym lamachaneh vayimelokhe achazeyahu ven-yehvoram melekhe yehudah {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֨ים וּשְׁתַּ֤יִם שָׁנָה֙ אֲחַזְיָ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְשָׁנָ֣ה אַחַ֔ת מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ עֲתַלְיָ֖הוּ בַּת־עׇמְרִֽי׃
Translated: Ahaziah was forty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem one year; his mother’s name was Athaliah daughter of Omri.
Transliteration: ven-arevaiym ushetayiim shanah achazeyahu vemׇlekhvo veshanah achat malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo ataleyahu vat-ׇmeriy

Hebrew: גַּם־ה֣וּא הָלַ֔ךְ בְּדַרְכֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב כִּ֥י אִמּ֛וֹ הָיְתָ֥ה יוֹעַצְתּ֖וֹ לְהַרְשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated: He too followed the practices of the house of Ahab, for his mother counseled him to do evil.
Transliteration: gam-hu halakhe vedarekhey veyt acheav khiy imvo hayetah yvoatsetvo lehareshiya

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּבֵ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב כִּי־הֵ֜מָּה הָיוּ־ל֣וֹ יוֹעֲצִ֗ים אַחֲרֵ֛י מ֥וֹת אָבִ֖יו לְמַשְׁחִ֥ית לֽוֹ׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, like the house of Ahab, for they became his counselors after his father’s death, to his ruination.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah kheveyt acheav khiy-hemah hayu-lvo yvoatsiym acharey mvot aviyv lemashechiyt lvo

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם בַּעֲצָתָם֮ הָלַךְ֒ וַיֵּ֩לֶךְ֩ אֶת־יְהוֹרָ֨ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֜ב מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה עַל־חֲזָאֵ֥ל מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֖ם בְּרָמ֣וֹת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיַּכּ֥וּ הָרַמִּ֖ים אֶת־יוֹרָֽם׃
Translated: Moreover, he followed their counsel and marched with Jehoram son of King Ahab of Israel to battle against King Hazael of Aram at Ramoth-gilead, where the Arameans wounded Joram.
Transliteration: gam vaatsatam halakhe vayelekhe et-yehvoram ven-acheav melekhe yisherael lamilechamah al-chazael melekhe-aram veramvot gilead vayakhu haramiym et-yvoram

Hebrew: וַיָּ֜שׇׁב לְהִתְרַפֵּ֣א בְיִזְרְעֶ֗אל כִּ֤י הַמַּכִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִכֻּ֣הוּ בָרָמָ֔ה בְּהִלָּ֣חֲמ֔וֹ אֶת־חֲזָהאֵ֖ל מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֑ם וַעֲזַרְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹרָ֜ם מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה יָרַ֡ד לִרְא֞וֹת אֶת־יְהוֹרָ֧ם בֶּן־אַחְאָ֛ב בְּיִזְרְעֶ֖אל כִּי־חֹלֶ֥ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: He returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds inflicted on him at Ramah when he fought against King Hazael of Aram. King Azariah son of Jehoram of Judah went down to Jezreel to visit Jehoram son of Ahab while he was ill.
Transliteration: vayashׇv lehiterafe veyizereel khiy hamakhiym asher hikhuhu varamah vehilachamvo et-chazahel melekhe aram vaazareyahu ven-yehvoram melekhe yehudah yarad lirevot et-yehvoram ven-acheav veyizereel khiy-choleh hu

Hebrew: וּמֵאֱלֹהִ֗ים הָֽיְתָה֙ תְּבוּסַ֣ת אֲחַזְיָ֔הוּ לָב֖וֹא אֶל־יוֹרָ֑ם וּבְבֹא֗וֹ יָצָ֤א עִם־יְהוֹרָם֙ אֶל־יֵה֣וּא בֶן־נִמְשִׁ֔י אֲשֶׁ֣ר מְשָׁח֣וֹ יְהֹוָ֔ה לְהַכְרִ֖ית אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אַחְאָֽב׃
Translated: God caused the downfall of Ahaziah because he visited Joram. During his visit he went out with Jehoram to Jehu son of Nimshi, whom the L<small>ORD</small> had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.
Transliteration: umeElohim hayetah tevusat achazeyahu lavvo el-yvoram uvevovo yatsa im-yehvoram el-eihu ven-nimeshiy asher meshachvo yehovah lehakheriyt et-veyt acheav

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּהִשָּׁפֵ֥ט יֵה֖וּא עִם־בֵּ֣ית אַחְאָ֑ב וַיִּמְצָא֩ אֶת־שָׂרֵ֨י יְהוּדָ֜ה וּבְנֵ֨י אֲחֵ֧י אֲחַזְיָ֛הוּ מְשָׁרְתִ֥ים לַאֲחַזְיָ֖הוּ וַיַּהַרְגֵֽם׃
Translated: In the course of bringing the house of Ahab to judgment, Jehu came upon the officers of Judah and the nephews of Ahaziah, ministers of Ahaziah, and killed them.
Transliteration: vayehiy khehishafet eihu im-veyt acheav vayimetsa et-sharey yehudah uveney achey achazeyahu mesharetiym laachazeyahu vayaharegem

Hebrew: וַיְבַקֵּשׁ֩ אֶת־אֲחַזְיָ֨הוּ וַֽיִּלְכְּדֻ֜הוּ וְה֧וּא מִתְחַבֵּ֣א בְשֹׁמְר֗וֹן וַיְבִאֻ֣הוּ אֶל־יֵהוּא֮ וַיְמִיתֻ֒הוּ֒ וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֔הוּ כִּ֤י אָֽמְרוּ֙ בֶּן־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁר־דָּרַ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּכׇל־לְבָב֑וֹ וְאֵין֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲחַזְיָ֔הוּ לַעְצֹ֥ר כֹּ֖חַ לְמַמְלָכָֽה׃
Translated: He sent in search of Ahaziah, who was caught hiding in Samaria, was brought to Jehu, and put to death. He was given a burial, because it was said, “He is the son of Jehoshaphat who worshiped the L<small>ORD</small> wholeheartedly.” So the house of Ahaziah could not muster the strength to rule.
Transliteration: vayevakesh et-achazeyahu vayilekheduhu vehu mitechave veshomervon vayeviuhu el-eihu vayemiytuhu vayikeveruhu khiy ameru ven-yehvoshafat hu asher-darash et-yehovah vekhׇl-levavvo veeyn leveyt achazeyahu laetsor khocha lemamelakhah

Hebrew: וַעֲתַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֵ֣ם אֲחַזְיָ֔הוּ רָאֲתָ֖ה כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת בְּנָ֑הּ וַתָּ֗קׇם וַתְּדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה לְבֵ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: When Athaliah, Ahaziah’s mother, learned that her son was dead, she promptly did away with all who were of the royal stock of the house of Judah.
Transliteration: vaataleyahu em achazeyahu raatah khiy met venah vatakׇm vatedaver et-khׇl-zera hamamelakhah leveyt yehudah

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּח֩ יְהוֹשַׁבְעַ֨ת בַּת־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־יוֹאָ֣שׁ בֶּן־אֲחַזְיָ֗הוּ וַתִּגְנֹ֤ב אֹתוֹ֙ מִתּ֤וֹךְ בְּנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַמּ֣וּמָתִ֔ים וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־מֵינִקְתּ֖וֹ בַּחֲדַ֣ר הַמִּטּ֑וֹת וַתַּסְתִּירֵ֡הוּ יְהוֹשַׁבְעַ֣ת בַּת־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יְהוֹרָ֡ם אֵ֩שֶׁת֩ יְהוֹיָדָ֨ע הַכֹּהֵ֜ן כִּ֣י הִיא֩ הָיְתָ֨ה אֲח֧וֹת אֲחַזְיָ֛הוּ מִפְּנֵ֥י עֲתַלְיָ֖הוּ וְלֹ֥א הֱמִיתָֽתְהוּ׃
Translated: But Jehoshabeath, daughter of the king, spirited away Ahaziah’s son Joash from among the princes who were being slain, and put him and his nurse in a bedroom. Jehoshabeath, daughter of King Jehoram, wife of the priest Jehoiada—she was the sister of Ahaziah—kept him hidden from Athaliah so that he was not put to death.
Transliteration: vatikach yehvoshaveat vat-hamelekhe et-yvoash ven-achazeyahu vatigenov otvo mitvokhe veney-hamelekhe hamumatiym vatiten otvo veet-meyniketvo vachadar hamitvot vatasetiyrehu yehvoshaveat vat-hamelekhe yehvoram eshet yehvoyada hakhohen khiy hiy hayetah achvot achazeyahu mifeney ataleyahu velo hemiytatehu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י אִתָּם֙ בְּבֵ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מִתְחַבֵּ֖א שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וַעֲתַלְיָ֖ה מֹלֶ֥כֶת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: He stayed with them for six years, hidden in the House of God, while Athaliah reigned over the land.
Transliteration: vayehiy itam veveyt haElohim mitechave shesh shaniym vaataleyah molekhet al-haarets {f}

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֨ה הַשְּׁבִעִ֜ית הִתְחַזַּ֣ק יְהוֹיָדָ֗ע וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־שָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֡וֹת לַעֲזַרְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־יְרֹחָ֡ם וּלְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בֶּן־יְ֠הוֹחָנָ֠ן וְלַעֲזַרְיָ֨הוּ בֶן־עוֹבֵ֜ד וְאֶת־מַעֲשֵׂיָ֧הוּ בֶן־עֲדָיָ֛הוּ וְאֶת־אֱלִישָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־זִכְרִ֖י עִמּ֥וֹ בַבְּרִֽית׃
Translated: In the seventh year, Jehoiada took courage and brought the chiefs of the hundreds, Azariah son of Jeroham, Ishmael son of Jehohanan, Azariah son of Obed, Maaseiah son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat son of Zichri, into a compact with him.
Transliteration: uvashanah hasheviiyt hitechazak yehvoyada vayikach et-sharey hamevot laazareyahu ven-yerocham uleyishemael ven-yehvochanan velaazareyahu ven-voved veet-maasheyahu ven-adayahu veet-eliyshafat ven-zikheriy imvo vaveriyt

Hebrew: וַיָּסֹ֙בּוּ֙ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּקְבְּצ֤וּ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּם֙ מִכׇּל־עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְרָאשֵׁ֥י הָאָב֖וֹת לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: They went through Judah and assembled the Levites from all the towns of Judah, and the chiefs of the clans of Israel. They came to Jerusalem
Transliteration: vayasovu viyhudah vayikevetsu et-haleviyim mikhׇl-arey yehudah verashey haavvot leyisherael vayavou el-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֨ת כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֥ל בְּרִ֛ית בְּבֵ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עִם־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם הִנֵּ֤ה בֶן־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ יִמְלֹ֔ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י דָוִֽיד׃
Translated: and the entire assembly made a covenant with the king in the House of God. He said to them, “The son of the king shall be king according to the promise the L<small>ORD</small> made concerning the sons of David.
Transliteration: vayikherot khׇl-hakahal veriyt veveyt haElohim im-hamelekhe vayomer lahem hineh ven-hamelekhe yimelokhe khaasher diver yehovah al-veney daviyd

Hebrew: זֶ֥ה הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֨ית מִכֶּ֜ם בָּאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֗ת לַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְלַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְשֹׁעֲרֵ֖י הַסִּפִּֽים׃
Translated: This is what you must do: One third of you, priests and Levites, who are on duty for the week, shall be gatekeepers at the thresholds;
Transliteration: zeh hadavar asher taashu hashelishiyt mikhem vaey hashavat lakhohaniym velaleviyim leshoarey hasifiym

Hebrew: וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁית֙ בְּבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁ֖ית בְּשַׁ֣עַר הַיְס֑וֹד וְכׇ֨ל־הָעָ֔ם בְּחַצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: another third shall be stationed in the royal palace, and the other third at the Foundation Gate. All the people shall be in the courts of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vehashelishiyt veveyt hamelekhe vehashelishiyt veshaar hayesvod vekhׇl-haam vechatservot veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְאַל־יָב֣וֹא בֵית־יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּ֤י אִם־הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַמְשָׁרְתִ֣ים לַלְוִיִּ֔ם הֵ֥מָּה יָבֹ֖אוּ כִּי־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֑מָּה וְכׇ֨ל־הָעָ֔ם יִשְׁמְר֖וּ מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Let no one enter the House of the L<small>ORD</small> except the priests and the ministering Levites. They may enter because they are sanctified, but all the people shall obey the proscription of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: veal-yavvo veyt-yehovah khiy im-hakhohaniym vehamesharetiym laleviyim hemah yavou khiy-kodesh hemah vekhׇl-haam yishemeru mishemeret yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִקִּ֩יפוּ֩ הַלְוִיִּ֨ם אֶת־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ סָבִ֗יב אִ֚ישׁ וְכֵלָ֣יו בְּיָד֔וֹ וְהַבָּ֥א אֶל־הַבַּ֖יִת יוּמָ֑ת וִֽהְי֥וּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּבֹא֥וֹ וּבְצֵאתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The Levites shall surround the king on every side, every man with his weapons at the ready; and whoever enters the House shall be killed. Stay close to the king in his comings and goings.”
Transliteration: vehikiyfu haleviyim et-hamelekhe saviyv iysh vekhelayv veyadvo vehava el-havayiit yumat viheyu et-hamelekhe vevovo uvetsetvo

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ הַלְוִיִּ֜ם וְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֗ה כְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּה֮ יְהוֹיָדָ֣ע הַכֹּהֵן֒ וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אֲנָשָׁ֔יו בָּאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת עִ֖ם יוֹצְאֵ֣י הַשַּׁבָּ֑ת כִּ֣י לֹ֥א פָטַ֛ר יְהוֹיָדָ֥ע הַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַֽמַּחְלְקֽוֹת׃
Translated: The Levites and all Judah did just as Jehoiada the priest ordered: each took his men—those who were on duty that week and those who were off duty that week, for Jehoiada the priest had not dismissed the divisions.
Transliteration: vayaashu haleviyim vekhׇl-yehudah khekhol asher-tsivah yehvoyada hakhohen vayikechu iysh et-anashayv vaey hashavat im yvotseey hashavat khiy lo fatar yehvoyada hakhohen et-hamachelekvot

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֩ יְהוֹיָדָ֨ע הַכֹּהֵ֜ן לְשָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֗וֹת אֶת־הַֽחֲנִיתִים֙ וְאֶת־הַמָּֽגִנּוֹת֙ וְאֶת־הַשְּׁלָטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑יד אֲשֶׁ֖ר בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Jehoiada the priest gave the chiefs of the hundreds King David’s spears and shields and quivers that were kept in the House of God.
Transliteration: vayiten yehvoyada hakhohen lesharey hamevot et-hachaniytiym veet-hamaginvot veet-hashelatiym asher lamelekhe daviyd asher veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֨ד אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֜ם וְאִ֣ישׁ ׀ שִׁלְח֣וֹ בְיָד֗וֹ מִכֶּ֨תֶף הַבַּ֤יִת הַיְמָנִית֙ עַד־כֶּ֤תֶף הַבַּ֙יִת֙ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֔ית לַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ וְלַבָּ֑יִת עַל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He stationed the entire force, each man with his weapons at the ready, from the south end of the House to the north end of the House, at the altar and the House, to guard the king on every side.
Transliteration: vayaamed et-khׇl-haam veiysh shilechvo veyadvo mikhetef havayiit hayemaniyt ad-khetef havayiit hashemaliyt lamizevecha velavayiit al-hamelekhe saviyv

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֣יאוּ אֶת־בֶּן־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ עָלָיו֙ אֶת־הַנֵּ֙זֶר֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣עֵד֔וּת וַיַּמְלִ֖יכוּ אֹת֑וֹ וַיִּמְשָׁחֻ֙הוּ֙ יְהוֹיָדָ֣ע וּבָנָ֔יו וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ יְחִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then they brought out the king’s son, and placed upon him the crown and the insignia. They proclaimed him king, and Jehoiada and his sons anointed him and shouted, “Long live the king!”
Transliteration: vayyvotsiyu et-ven-hamelekhe vayitenu alayv et-hanezer veet-haedut vayameliykhu otvo vayimeshachuhu yehvoyada uvanayv vayomeru yechiy hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁמַ֣ע עֲתַלְיָ֗הוּ אֶת־ק֤וֹל הָעָם֙ הָרָצִ֔ים וְהַֽמְהַלְלִ֖ים אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַתָּב֥וֹא אֶל־הָעָ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When Athaliah heard the shouting of the people and the guards and the acclamation of the king, she came out to the people, to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vatishema ataleyahu et-kvol haam haratsiym vehamehaleliym et-hamelekhe vatavvo el-haam veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֡רֶא וְהִנֵּ֣ה הַמֶּ֩לֶךְ֩ עוֹמֵ֨ד עַֽל־עַמּוּד֜וֹ בַּמָּב֗וֹא וְהַשָּׂרִ֣ים וְהַחֲצֹצְרוֹת֮ עַל־הַמֶּ֒לֶךְ֒ וְכׇל־עַ֨ם הָאָ֜רֶץ שָׂמֵ֗חַ וְתוֹקֵ֙עַ֙ בַּחֲצֹ֣צְר֔וֹת וְהַמְשֽׁוֹרְרִים֙ בִּכְלֵ֣י הַשִּׁ֔יר וּמוֹדִיעִ֖ים לְהַלֵּ֑ל וַתִּקְרַ֤ע עֲתַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֶת־בְּגָדֶ֔יהָ וַתֹּ֖אמֶר קֶ֥שֶׁר קָֽשֶׁר׃ {ס}
Translated: She looked about and saw the king standing by his pillar at the entrance, the chiefs with their trumpets beside the king, and all the people of the land rejoicing and blowing trumpets, and the singers with musical instruments leading the hymns. Athaliah rent her garments and cried out, “Treason, treason!”
Transliteration: vatere vehineh hamelekhe vomed al-amudvo vamavvo vehashariym vehachatsotservot al-hamelekhe vekhׇl-am haarets shamecha vetvokea vachatsotservot vehameshvoreriym vikheley hashiyr umvodiyiym lehalel vatikera ataleyahu et-vegadeyha vatomer kesher kasher {s}

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵא֩ יְהוֹיָדָ֨ע הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־שָׂרֵ֥י הַמֵּא֣וֹת ׀ פְּקוּדֵ֣י הַחַ֗יִל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ הוֹצִיא֙וּהָ֙ אֶל־מִבֵּ֣ית הַשְּׂדֵר֔וֹת וְהַבָּ֥א אַחֲרֶ֖יהָ יוּמַ֣ת בֶּחָ֑רֶב כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן לֹ֥א תְמִית֖וּהָ בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then the priest Jehoiada ordered out the army officers, the chiefs of hundreds, and said to them, “Take her out between the ranks, and if anyone follows her, put him to the sword.” For the priest thought, “Let her not be put to death in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayyvotse yehvoyada hakhohen et-sharey hamevot fekudey hachayiil vayomer alehem hvotsiyuha el-miveyt hashedervot vehava achareyha yumat vecharev khiy amar hakhohen lo temiytuha veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֤ימוּ לָהּ֙ יָדַ֔יִם וַתָּב֛וֹא אֶל־מְב֥וֹא שַֽׁעַר־הַסּוּסִ֖ים בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיְמִית֖וּהָ שָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: They cleared a passage for her and she came to the entrance of the Horse Gate to the royal palace; there she was put to death.
Transliteration: vayashiymu lah yadayiim vatavvo el-mevvo shaar-hasusiym veyt hamelekhe vayemiytuha sham {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֤ת יְהֽוֹיָדָע֙ בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינ֕וֹ וּבֵ֥ין כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם וּבֵ֣ין הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ לִהְי֥וֹת לְעָ֖ם לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then Jehoiada solemnized a covenant between himself and the people and the king that they should be the people of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikherot yehvoyada veriyt veynvo uveyn khׇl-haam uveyn hamelekhe liheyvot leam layhovah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ כׇל־הָעָ֤ם בֵּית־הַבַּ֙עַל֙ וַֽיִּתְּצֻ֔הוּ וְאֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָ֥יו וְאֶת־צְלָמָ֖יו שִׁבֵּ֑רוּ וְאֵ֗ת מַתָּן֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן הַבַּ֔עַל הָרְג֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י הַֽמִּזְבְּחֽוֹת׃
Translated: All the people then went to the temple of Baal; they tore it down and smashed its altars and images to bits, and they slew Mattan, the priest of Baal, in front of the altars.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-haam veyt-havaal vayitetsuhu veet-mizevechotayv veet-tselamayv shiveru veet matan khohen havaal haregu lifeney hamizevechvot

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שֶׂם֩ יְהוֹיָדָ֨ע פְּקֻדּ֜וֹת בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּיַ֨ד הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים הַלְוִיִּם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָלַ֣ק דָּוִיד֮ עַל־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָה֒ לְֽהַעֲל֞וֹת עֹל֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֗ה כַּכָּת֛וּב בְּתוֹרַ֥ת מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּשִׂמְחָ֣ה וּבְשִׁ֑יר עַ֖ל יְדֵ֥י דָוִֽיד׃
Translated: Jehoiada put the officers of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in the charge of Levite priests whom David had assigned over the House of the L<small>ORD</small> to offer up burnt offerings, as is prescribed in the Teaching of Moses, accompanied by joyful song as ordained by David.
Transliteration: vayashem yehvoyada fekudvot veyt yehovah veyad hakhohaniym haleviyim asher chalak daviyd al-veyt yehovah lehaalvot olvot yehovah khakhatuv vetvorat mosheh veshimechah uveshiyr al yedey daviyd

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֵד֙ הַשּׁ֣וֹעֲרִ֔ים עַֽל־שַׁעֲרֵ֖י בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹא־יָב֥וֹא טָמֵ֖א לְכׇל־דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: He stationed the gatekeepers at the gates of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> to prevent the entry of anyone unclean for any reason.
Transliteration: vayaamed hashvoariym al-shaarey veyt yehovah velo-yavvo tame lekhׇl-davar

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־שָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֡וֹת וְאֶת־הָאַדִּירִים֩ וְאֶת־הַמּוֹשְׁלִ֨ים בָּעָ֜ם וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֗רֶץ וַיּ֤וֹרֶד אֶת־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ בְּתֽוֹךְ־שַׁ֥עַר הָעֶלְי֖וֹן בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיּוֹשִׁ֙יבוּ֙ אֶת־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַ֖ל כִּסֵּ֥א הַמַּמְלָכָֽה׃
Translated: He took the chiefs of hundreds, the nobles, and the rulers of the people and all the people of the land, and they escorted the king down from the House of the L<small>ORD</small> into the royal palace by the upper gate, and seated the king on the royal throne.
Transliteration: vayikach et-sharey hamevot veet-haadiyriym veet-hamvosheliym vaam veet khׇl-am haarets vayyvored et-hamelekhe miveyt yehovah vayavou vetvokhe-shaar haeleyvon veyt hamelekhe vayyvoshiyvu et-hamelekhe al khise hamamelakhah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמְח֥וּ כׇל־עַם־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהָעִ֣יר שָׁקָ֑טָה וְאֶת־עֲתַלְיָ֖הוּ הֵמִ֥יתוּ בֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: All the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. As for Athaliah, she had been put to the sword.
Transliteration: vayishemechu khׇl-am-haarets vehaiyr shakatah veet-ataleyahu hemiytu vecharev

Hebrew: בֶּן־שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ יֹאָ֣שׁ בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ צִבְיָ֖ה מִבְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: Jehoash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem forty years. His mother’s name was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: ven-sheva shaniym yoash vemׇlekhvo vearevaiym shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo tsiveyah miveer shava

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ יוֹאָ֛שׁ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כׇּל־יְמֵ֖י יְהוֹיָדָ֥ע הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of the priest Jehoiada, Jehoash did what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaash yvoash hayashar veeyney yehovah khׇl-yemey yehvoyada hakhohen {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂא־ל֥וֹ יְהוֹיָדָ֖ע נָשִׁ֣ים שְׁתָּ֑יִם וַיּ֖וֹלֶד בָּנִ֥ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Jehoiada took two wives for him, by whom he had sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayisha-lvo yehvoyada nashiym shetayiim vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֑ן הָיָה֙ עִם־לֵ֣ב יוֹאָ֔שׁ לְחַדֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Afterward, Joash decided to renovate the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen hayah im-lev yvoash lechadesh et-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּץ֮ אֶת־הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּם֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֡ם צְא֣וּ לְעָרֵ֪י יְהוּדָ֟ה וְקִבְצוּ֩ מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל כֶּ֜סֶף לְחַזֵּ֣ק ׀ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם מִדֵּ֤י שָׁנָה֙ בְּשָׁנָ֔ה וְאַתֶּ֖ם תְּמַהֲר֣וּ לַדָּבָ֑ר וְלֹ֥א מִהֲר֖וּ הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: He assembled the priests and the Levites and charged them as follows: “Go out to the towns of Judah and collect money from all Israel for the annual repair of the House of your God. Do it quickly.” But the Levites did not act quickly.
Transliteration: vayikevots et-hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vayomer lahem tseu learey yehudah vekivetsu mikhׇl-yisherael khesef lechazek et-veyt eloheykhem midey shanah veshanah veatem temaharu ladavar velo miharu haleviyim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א הַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ לִיהוֹיָדָ֣ע הָרֹאשׁ֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ מַדּ֙וּעַ֙ לֹא־דָרַ֣שְׁתָּ עַל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְהָבִ֞יא מִיהוּדָ֣ה וּמִירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֶת־מַשְׂאַת֙ מֹשֶׁ֣ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהַקָּהָ֖ל לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְאֹ֖הֶל הָעֵדֽוּת׃
Translated: The king summoned Jehoiada the chief and said to him, “Why have you not seen to it that the Levites brought the tax imposed by Moses, the servant of the L<small>ORD</small>, and the congregation of Israel from Judah and Jerusalem to the Tent of the Pact?”
Transliteration: vayikera hamelekhe liyhvoyada harosh vayomer lvo madua lo-darasheta al-haleviyim lehaviy miyhudah umiyrushala͏im et-masheat mosheh eved-yehovah vehakahal leyisherael leohel haedut

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עֲתַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ הַמִּרְשַׁ֔עַת בָּנֶ֥יהָ פָרְצ֖וּ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְגַם֙ כׇּל־קׇדְשֵׁ֣י בֵית־יְהֹוָ֔ה עָשׂ֖וּ לַבְּעָלִֽים׃
Translated: For the children of the wicked Athaliah had violated the House of God and had even used the sacred things of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> for the Baals.
Transliteration: khiy ataleyahu hamireshaat vaneyha faretsu et-veyt haElohim vegam khׇl-kׇdeshey veyt-yehovah ashu lavealiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ אֲר֣וֹן אֶחָ֑ד וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֛הוּ בְּשַׁ֥עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה חֽוּצָה׃
Translated: The king ordered that a chest be made and placed on the outside of the gate of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe vayaashu arvon echad vayitenuhu veshaar veyt-yehovah chutsah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנוּ־ק֞וֹל בִּיהוּדָ֣ה וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם לְהָבִ֤יא לַֽיהֹוָה֙ מַשְׂאַ֞ת מֹשֶׁ֧ה עֶבֶד־הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: A proclamation was issued in Judah and Jerusalem to bring the tax imposed on Israel in the wilderness by Moses, the servant of God.
Transliteration: vayitenu-kvol viyhudah uviyrushala͏im lehaviy layhovah masheat mosheh eved-haElohim al-yisherael vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמְח֥וּ כׇל־הַשָּׂרִ֖ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֑ם וַיָּבִ֛יאוּ וַיַּשְׁלִ֥יכוּ לָאָר֖וֹן עַד־לְכַלֵּֽה׃
Translated: All the officers and all the people gladly brought it and threw it into the chest till it was full.
Transliteration: vayishemechu khׇl-hashariym vekhׇl-haam vayaviyu vayasheliykhu laarvon ad-lekhaleh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י בְּעֵת֩ יָבִ֨יא אֶת־הָאָר֜וֹן אֶל־פְּקֻדַּ֣ת הַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ בְּיַ֣ד הַלְוִיִּם֒ וְכִרְאוֹתָ֞ם כִּֽי־רַ֣ב הַכֶּ֗סֶף וּבָ֨א סוֹפֵ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וּפְקִיד֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן הָרֹ֔אשׁ וִיעָ֙רוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אָר֔וֹן וְיִשָּׂאֻ֖הוּ וִישִׁיבֻ֣הוּ אֶל־מְקֹמ֑וֹ כֹּ֤ה עָשׂוּ֙ לְי֣וֹם <small>׀</small> בְּי֔וֹם וַיַּאַסְפוּ־כֶ֖סֶף לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: Whenever the chest was brought to the royal officers by the Levites, and they saw that it contained much money, the royal scribe and the agent of the chief priest came and emptied out the chest and carried it back to its place. They did this day by day, and much money was collected.
Transliteration: vayehiy veet yaviy et-haarvon el-fekudat hamelekhe veyad haleviyim vekhirevotam khiy-rav hakhesef uva svofer hamelekhe ufekiyd khohen harosh viyaru et-haarvon veyishauhu viyshiyvuhu el-mekomvo khoh ashu leyvom <small></small> veyvom vayaasefu-khesef larov

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנֵ֨הוּ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וִיהוֹיָדָ֗ע אֶל־עוֹשֵׂה֙ מְלֶ֙אכֶת֙ עֲבוֹדַ֣ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּהְי֤וּ שֹֽׂכְרִים֙ חֹצְבִ֣ים וְחָרָשִׁ֔ים לְחַדֵּ֖שׁ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֠גַ֠ם לְחָרָשֵׁ֤י בַרְזֶל֙ וּנְחֹ֔שֶׁת לְחַזֵּ֖ק אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The king and Jehoiada delivered the money to those who oversaw the tasks connected with the work of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>. They hired masons and carpenters to renovate the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, as well as craftsmen in iron and bronze to repair the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayitenehu hamelekhe viyhvoyada el-vosheh melekhet avvodat veyt-yehovah vayiheyu shokheriym chotseviym vecharashiym lechadesh veyt yehovah vegam lecharashey varezel unechoshet lechazek et-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ עֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה וַתַּ֧עַל אֲרוּכָ֛ה לַמְּלָאכָ֖ה בְּיָדָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲמִ֜ידוּ אֶת־בֵּ֧ית הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עַל־מַתְכֻּנְתּ֖וֹ וַֽיְאַמְּצֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: The overseers did their work; under them the work went well and they restored the House of God to its original form and repaired it.
Transliteration: vayaashu oshey hamelakhah vataal arukhah lamelakhah veyadam vayaamiydu et-veyt haElohim al-matekhunetvo vayeametsuhu

Hebrew: וּֽכְכַלּוֹתָ֡ם הֵבִ֣יאוּ לִפְנֵי֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ וִיהוֹיָדָ֜ע אֶת־שְׁאָ֣ר הַכֶּ֗סֶף וַיַּעֲשֵׂ֨הוּ כֵלִ֤ים לְבֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ כְּלֵ֣י שָׁרֵ֔ת וְהַעֲל֣וֹת וְכַפּ֔וֹת וּכְלֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב וָכָ֑סֶף וַ֠יִּהְי֠וּ מַעֲלִ֨ים עֹל֤וֹת בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ תָּמִ֔יד כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י יְהוֹיָדָֽע׃ {פ}
Translated: When they had finished, they brought the money that was left over to the king and Jehoiada; it was made into utensils for the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, service vessels: buckets and ladles, golden and silver vessels. Burnt offerings were offered up regularly in the House of the L<small>ORD</small> all the days of Jehoiada.
Transliteration: ukhekhalvotam heviyu lifeney hamelekhe viyhvoyada et-shear hakhesef vayaashehu kheliym leveyt-yehovah kheley sharet vehaalvot vekhafvot ukheley zahav vakhasef vayiheyu maaliym olvot veveyt-yehovah tamiyd khol yemey yehvoyada {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּזְקַ֧ן יְהוֹיָדָ֛ע וַיִּשְׂבַּ֥ע יָמִ֖ים וַיָּמֹ֑ת בֶּן־מֵאָ֧ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּמוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Jehoiada reached a ripe old age and died; he was one hundred and thirty years old at his death.
Transliteration: vayizekan yehvoyada vayisheva yamiym vayamot ven-meah usheloshiym shanah vemvotvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּרֻ֥הוּ בְעִיר־דָּוִ֖יד עִם־הַמְּלָכִ֑ים כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֤ה טוֹבָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעִ֥ם הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וּבֵיתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: They buried him in the City of David together with the kings, because he had done good in Israel, and on behalf of God and His House.
Transliteration: vayikeveruhu veiyr-daviyd im-hamelakhiym khiy-ashah tvovah veyisherael veim haElohim uveytvo {f}

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵ֥י מוֹת֙ יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע בָּ֚אוּ שָׂרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לַמֶּ֑לֶךְ אָ֛ז שָׁמַ֥ע הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But after the death of Jehoiada, the officers of Judah came, bowing low to the king; and the king listened to them.
Transliteration: veacharey mvot yehvoyada vau sharey yehudah vayishetachavu lamelekhe az shama hamelekhe aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּעַזְב֗וּ אֶת־בֵּ֤ית יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֽוֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּעַבְד֥וּ אֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרִ֖ים וְאֶת־הָעֲצַבִּ֑ים וַֽיְהִי־קֶ֗צֶף עַל־יְהוּדָה֙ וִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם בְּאַשְׁמָתָ֖ם זֹֽאת׃
Translated: They forsook the House of the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers to serve the sacred posts and idols; and there was wrath upon Judah and Jerusalem because of this guilt of theirs.
Transliteration: vayaazevu et-veyt yehovah elohey avvoteyhem vayaavedu et-haasheriym veet-haatsaviym vayehiy-ketsef al-yehudah viyrushala͏im veashematam zot

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח בָּהֶם֙ נְבִאִ֔ים לַהֲשִׁיבָ֖ם אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּעִ֥ידוּ בָ֖ם וְלֹ֥א הֶאֱזִֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> sent prophets among them to bring them back to Him; they admonished them but they would not pay heed.
Transliteration: vayishelach vahem neviiym lahashiyvam el-yehovah vayaiydu vam velo heeziynu {s}

Hebrew: וְר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֗ים לָֽבְשָׁה֙ אֶת־זְכַרְיָה֙ בֶּן־יְהוֹיָדָ֣ע הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד מֵעַ֣ל לָעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים לָמָה֩ אַתֶּ֨ם עֹבְרִ֜ים אֶת־מִצְוֺ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ וְלֹ֣א תַצְלִ֔יחוּ כִּֽי־עֲזַבְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיַּעֲזֹ֥ב אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then the spirit of God enveloped Zechariah son of Jehoiada the priest; he stood above the people and said to them, “Thus God said: Why do you transgress the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> when you cannot succeed? Since you have forsaken the L<small>ORD</small>, He has forsaken you.”
Transliteration: verucha Elohim laveshah et-zekhareyah ven-yehvoyada hakhohen vayaamod meal laam vayomer lahem khoh amar haElohim lamah atem overiym et-mitsevot yehovah velo tatseliychu khiy-azavetem et-yehovah vayaazov etekhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשְׁר֣וּ עָלָ֔יו וַיִּרְגְּמֻ֥הוּ אֶ֖בֶן בְּמִצְוַ֣ת הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ בַּחֲצַ֖ר בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They conspired against him and pelted him with stones in the court of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, by order of the king.
Transliteration: vayikesheru alayv vayiregemuhu even vemitsevat hamelekhe vachatsar veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־זָכַ֞ר יוֹאָ֣שׁ הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ הַחֶ֙סֶד֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה יְהוֹיָדָ֤ע אָבִיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַֽיַּהֲרֹ֖ג אֶת־בְּנ֑וֹ וּכְמוֹת֣וֹ אָמַ֔ר יֵ֥רֶא יְהֹוָ֖ה וְיִדְרֹֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: King Joash disregarded the loyalty that his father Jehoiada had shown to him, and killed his son. As he was dying, he said, “May the L<small>ORD</small> see and requite it.”
Transliteration: velo-zakhar yvoash hamelekhe hachesed asher ashah yehvoyada aviyv imvo vayaharog et-venvo ukhemvotvo amar eire yehovah veyiderosh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ לִתְקוּפַ֣ת הַשָּׁנָ֗ה עָלָ֣ה עָלָיו֮ חֵ֣יל אֲרָם֒ וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ אֶל־יְהוּדָה֙ וִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיַּשְׁחִ֛יתוּ אֶת־כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם מֵעָ֑ם וְכׇל־שְׁלָלָ֥ם שִׁלְּח֖וּ לְמֶ֥לֶךְ דַּרְמָֽשֶׂק׃
Translated: At the turn of the year, the army of Aram marched against him; they invaded Judah and Jerusalem, and wiped out all the officers of the people from among the people, and sent all the booty they took to the king of Damascus.
Transliteration: vayehiy litekufat hashanah alah alayv cheyl aram vayavou el-yehudah viyrushala͏im vayashechiytu et-khׇl-sharey haam meam vekhׇl-shelalam shilechu lemelekhe daremashek

Hebrew: כִּי֩ בְמִצְעַ֨ר אֲנָשִׁ֜ים בָּ֣אוּ ׀ חֵ֣יל אֲרָ֗ם וַֽיהֹוָה֙ נָתַ֨ן בְּיָדָ֥ם חַ֙יִל֙ לָרֹ֣ב מְאֹ֔ד כִּ֣י עָֽזְב֔וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֶת־יוֹאָ֖שׁ עָשׂ֥וּ שְׁפָטִֽים׃
