Translated: The invading army of Aram had come with but a few men, but the L<small>ORD</small> delivered a very large army into their hands, because they had forsaken the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers. They inflicted punishments on Joash.
Transliteration: khiy vemitsear anashiym vau cheyl aram vayhovah natan veyadam chayiil larov meod khiy azevu et-yehovah elohey avvoteyhem veet-yvoash ashu shefatiym

Hebrew: וּבְלֶכְתָּ֣ם מִמֶּ֗נּוּ כִּי־עָזְב֣וּ אֹתוֹ֮ בְּמַחֲלֻיִ֣ים רַבִּים֒ הִתְקַשְּׁר֨וּ עָלָ֜יו עֲבָדָ֗יו בִּדְמֵי֙ בְּנֵי֙ יְהֽוֹיָדָ֣ע הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וַיַּהַרְגֻ֥הוּ עַל־מִטָּת֖וֹ וַיָּמֹ֑ת וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֙הוּ֙ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֔יד וְלֹ֥א קְבָרֻ֖הוּ בְּקִבְר֥וֹת הַמְּלָכִֽים׃
Translated: When they withdrew, having left him with many wounds, his courtiers plotted against him because of the murder of the sons of Jehoiada the priest, and they killed him in bed. He died and was buried in the City of David; he was not buried in the tombs of the kings.
Transliteration: uvelekhetam mimenu khiy-azevu otvo vemachaluyiym raviym hitekasheru alayv avadayv videmey veney yehvoyada hakhohen vayahareguhu al-mitatvo vayamot vayikeveruhu veiyr daviyd velo kevaruhu vekivervot hamelakhiym

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה הַמִּתְקַשְּׁרִ֣ים עָלָ֑יו זָבָ֗ד בֶּן־שִׁמְעָת֙ הָעַמּוֹנִ֔ית וִיה֣וֹזָבָ֔ד בֶּן־שִׁמְרִ֖ית הַמּוֹאָבִֽית׃
Translated: These were the men who conspired against him: Zabad son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
Transliteration: veeleh hamitekasheriym alayv zavad ven-shimeat haamvoniyt viyhvozavad ven-shimeriyt hamvoaviyt

Hebrew: וּבָנָ֞יו (ורב) [יִ֧רֶב] הַמַּשָּׂ֣א עָלָ֗יו וִיסוֹד֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַל־מִדְרַ֖שׁ סֵ֣פֶר הַמְּלָכִ֑ים וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲמַצְיָ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: As to his sons, and the many pronouncements against him, and his rebuilding of the House of God, they are recorded in the story in the book of the kings. His son Amaziah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: uvanayv (vrv) [yirev] hamasha alayv viysvod veyt haElohim hinam khetuviym al-miderash sefer hamelakhiym vayimelokhe amatseyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ מָלַ֣ךְ אֲמַצְיָ֔הוּ וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָתֵ֙שַׁע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ יְהוֹעַדָּ֖ן מִירוּשָׁלָֽיִם׃
Translated: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah malakhe amatseyahu veesheriym vatesha shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo yehvoadan miyrushalayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה רַ֕ק לֹ֖א בְּלֵבָ֥ב שָׁלֵֽם׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, but not with a whole heart.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah rak lo velevav shalem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר חָזְקָ֥ה הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו וַֽיַּהֲרֹג֙ אֶת־עֲבָדָ֔יו הַמַּכִּ֖ים אֶת־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Once he had the kingdom firmly under control, he executed the courtiers who had assassinated his father the king.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher chazekah hamamelakhah alayv vayaharog et-avadayv hamakhiym et-hamelekhe aviyv

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֣א הֵמִ֑ית כִּ֣י כַכָּת֣וּב בַּתּוֹרָ֡ה בְּסֵ֣פֶר מֹשֶׁה֩ אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹא־יָמ֨וּתוּ אָב֤וֹת עַל־בָּנִים֙ וּבָנִים֙ לֹא־יָמ֣וּתוּ עַל־אָב֔וֹת כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ בְּחֶטְא֖וֹ יָמֽוּתוּ׃
Translated: But he did not put their children to death for [he acted] in accordance with what is written in the Teaching, in the Book of Moses, where the L<small>ORD</small> commanded, “Parents shall not die for children, nor shall children die for parents, but every person shall die only for his own crime.”
Transliteration: veet-veneyhem lo hemiyt khiy khakhatuv vatvorah vesefer mosheh asher-tsivah yehovah lemor lo-yamutu avvot al-vaniym uvaniym lo-yamutu al-avvot khiy iysh vechetevo yamutu

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֤ץ אֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ אֶת־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיַּעֲמִידֵ֣ם לְבֵית־אָב֗וֹת לְשָׂרֵ֤י הָאֲלָפִים֙ וּלְשָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֔וֹת לְכׇל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וּבִנְיָמִ֑ן וַֽיִּפְקְדֵ֗ם לְמִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וַיִּמְצָאֵ֗ם שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֨וֹת אֶ֤לֶף בָּחוּר֙ יוֹצֵ֣א צָבָ֔א אֹחֵ֖ז רֹ֥מַח וְצִנָּֽה׃
Translated: Amaziah assembled the men of Judah, and he put all the men of Judah and Benjamin under officers of thousands and officers of hundreds, by clans. He mustered them from the age of twenty upward, and found them to be 300,000 picked men fit for service, able to bear spear and shield.
Transliteration: vayikevots amatseyahu et-yehudah vayaamiydem leveyt-avvot lesharey haalafiym ulesharey hamevot lekhׇl-yehudah uvineyamin vayifekedem lemiven esheriym shanah vamaelah vayimetsaem shelosh-mevot elef vachur yvotse tsava ochez romach vetsinah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂכֹּ֣ר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵ֥אָה אֶ֛לֶף גִּבּ֥וֹר חָ֖יִל בְּמֵאָ֥ה כִכַּר־כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: He hired 100,000 warriors from Israel for 100 talents of silver.
Transliteration: vayishekhor miyisherael meah elef givvor chayiil vemeah khikhar-khasef

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים בָּ֤א אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַמֶּ֕לֶךְ אַל־יָב֥וֹא עִמְּךָ֖ צְבָ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין יְהֹוָה֙ עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֹּ֖ל בְּנֵ֥י אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Then a man of God came to him and said, “O king! Do not let the army of Israel go with you, for the L<small>ORD</small> is not with Israel—all these Ephraimites.
Transliteration: veiysh haElohim va elayv lemor hamelekhe al-yavvo imekha tseva yisherael khiy eyn yehovah im-yisherael khol veney eferayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֚י אִם־בֹּ֣א אַתָּ֔ה עֲשֵׂ֖ה חֲזַ֣ק לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה יַכְשִֽׁילְךָ֤ הָאֱלֹהִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אוֹיֵ֔ב כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־כֹּ֛חַ בֵּאלֹהִ֖ים לַעְז֥וֹר וּלְהַכְשִֽׁיל׃
Translated: But go by yourself and do it; take courage for battle, [else] God will make you fall before the enemy. For in God there is power to help one or make one fall!”
Transliteration: khiy im-vo atah asheh chazak lamilechamah yakheshiylekha haElohim lifeney voeiv khiy yesh-khocha velohiym laezvor ulehakheshiyl

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ לְאִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּמַֽה־לַּעֲשׂוֹת֙ לִמְאַ֣ת הַכִּכָּ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִגְד֣וּד יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים יֵ֚שׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לָ֥תֶת לְךָ֖ הַרְבֵּ֥ה מִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Amaziah said to the man of God, “And what am I to do about the 100 talents I gave for the Israelite force?” The man of God replied, “The L<small>ORD</small> has the means to give you much more than that.”
Transliteration: vayomer amatseyahu leiysh haElohim umah-laashvot limeat hakhikhar asher natatiy ligedud yisherael vayomer iysh haElohim eish layhovah latet lekha hareveh mizeh

Hebrew: וַיַּבְדִּילֵ֣ם אֲמַצְיָ֗הוּ לְהַגְּדוּד֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤א אֵלָיו֙ מֵאֶפְרַ֔יִם לָלֶ֖כֶת לִמְקוֹמָ֑ם וַיִּ֨חַר אַפָּ֤ם מְאֹד֙ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה וַיָּשׁ֥וּבוּ לִמְקוֹמָ֖ם בׇּחֳרִי־אָֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: So Amaziah detached the force that came to him from Ephraim, [ordering them] to go back to their place. They were greatly enraged against Judah and returned to their place in a rage.
Transliteration: vayavediylem amatseyahu lehagedud asher-va elayv meeferayiim lalekhet limekvomam vayichar afam meod viyhudah vayashuvu limekvomam vׇchoriy-af {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ הִתְחַזַּ֔ק וַיִּנְהַג֙ אֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ גֵּ֣יא הַמֶּ֑לַח וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־שֵׂעִ֖יר עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: Amaziah took courage and, leading his army, he marched to the Valley of Salt. He slew 10,000 men of Seir;
Transliteration: vaamatseyahu hitechazak vayinehag et-amvo vayelekhe gey hamelach vayakhe et-veney-sheiyr asheret alafiym

Hebrew: וַעֲשֶׂ֨רֶת אֲלָפִ֜ים חַיִּ֗ים שָׁבוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיְבִיא֖וּם לְרֹ֣אשׁ הַסָּ֑לַע וַיַּשְׁלִיכ֥וּם מֵֽרֹאשׁ־הַסֶּ֖לַע וְכֻלָּ֥ם נִבְקָֽעוּ׃
Translated: another 10,000 the men of Judah captured alive and brought to the top of Sela. They threw them down from the top of Sela and every one of them was burst open.
Transliteration: vaasheret alafiym chayiym shavu veney yehudah vayeviyum lerosh hasala vayasheliykhum merosh-hasela vekhulam nivekau

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י הַגְּד֗וּד אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵשִׁ֤יב אֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ מִלֶּ֤כֶת עִמּוֹ֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַֽיִּפְשְׁטוּ֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה מִשֹּׁמְר֖וֹן וְעַד־בֵּ֣ית חוֹר֑וֹן וַיַּכּ֤וּ מֵהֶם֙ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖זּוּ בִּזָּ֥ה רַבָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The men of the force that Amaziah had sent back so they would not go with him into battle made forays against the towns of Judah from Samaria to Beth-horon. They slew 3,000 of them, and took much booty.
Transliteration: uveney hagedud asher heshiyv amatseyahu milekhet imvo lamilechamah vayifeshetu vearey yehudah mishomervon vead-veyt chvorvon vayakhu mehem sheloshet alafiym vayavozu vizah ravah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵ֨י ב֤וֹא אֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ מֵהַכּ֣וֹת אֶת־אֲדוֹמִ֔ים וַיָּבֵ֗א אֶת־אֱלֹהֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י שֵׂעִ֔יר וַיַּעֲמִידֵ֥ם ל֖וֹ לֵאלֹהִ֑ים וְלִפְנֵיהֶ֥ם יִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה וְלָהֶ֥ם יְקַטֵּֽר׃
Translated: After Amaziah returned from defeating the Edomites, he had the gods of the men of Seir brought, and installed them as his gods; he prostrated himself before them, and to them he made sacrifice.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey vvo amatseyahu mehakhvot et-advomiym vayave et-elohey veney sheiyr vayaamiydem lvo lelohiym velifeneyhem yishetachaveh velahem yekater

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּאֲמַצְיָ֑הוּ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אֵלָיו֙ נָבִ֔יא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ לָ֤מָּה דָרַ֙שְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־הִצִּ֥ילוּ אֶת־עַמָּ֖ם מִיָּדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> was enraged at Amaziah, and sent a prophet to him who said to him, “Why are you worshiping the gods of a people who could not save their people from you?”
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah vaamatseyahu vayishelach elayv naviy vayomer lvo lamah darasheta et-elohey haam asher lo-hitsiylu et-amam miyadekha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בְּדַבְּר֣וֹ אֵלָ֗יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הַלְיוֹעֵ֤ץ לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ נְתַנּ֔וּךָ חֲדַל־לְךָ֖ לָ֣מָּה יַכּ֑וּךָ וַיֶּחְדַּ֣ל הַנָּבִ֗יא וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־יָעַ֤ץ אֱלֹהִים֙ לְהַשְׁחִיתֶ֔ךָ כִּֽי־עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּ֔את וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ לַעֲצָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: As he spoke to him, [Amaziah] said to him, “Have we appointed you a counselor to the king? Stop, else you will be killed!” The prophet stopped, saying, “I see God has counseled that you be destroyed, since you act this way and disregard my counsel.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vedavervo elayv vayomer lvo haleyvoets lamelekhe netanukha chadal-lekha lamah yakhukha vayechedal hanaviy vayomer yadaetiy khiy-yaats Elohim lehashechiytekha khiy-ashiyta zot velo shamaeta laatsatiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֗ץ אֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח אֶל־יוֹאָ֨שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֧ז בֶּן־יֵה֛וּא מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר (לך) [לְכָ֖ה] נִתְרָאֶ֥ה פָנִֽים׃
Translated: Then King Amaziah of Judah took counsel and sent this message to Joash son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, “Come, let us confront each other!”
Transliteration: vayivaats amatseyahu melekhe yehudah vayishelach el-yvoash ven-yehvoachaz ven-eihu melekhe yisherael lemor (lkh) [lekhah] niteraeh faniym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח יוֹאָ֣שׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶל־אֲמַצְיָ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָה֮ לֵאמֹר֒ הַח֜וֹחַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּלְּבָנ֗וֹן שָׁ֠לַ֠ח אֶל־הָאֶ֜רֶז אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּלְּבָנוֹן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תְּנָֽה־אֶת־בִּתְּךָ֥ לִבְנִ֖י לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַֽתַּעֲבֹ֞ר חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּלְּבָנ֔וֹן וַתִּרְמֹ֖ס אֶת־הַחֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: King Joash of Israel sent back this message to King Amaziah of Judah, “The thistle in Lebanon sent this message to the cedar in Lebanon, ‘Give your daughter to my son in marriage.’ But a wild beast in Lebanon passed by and trampled the thistle.
Transliteration: vayishelach yvoash melekhe-yisherael el-amatseyahu melekhe-yehudah lemor hachvocha asher valevanvon shalach el-haerez asher valevanvon lemor tenah-et-vitekha liveniy leishah vataavor chayat hashadeh asher valevanvon vatiremos et-hachvocha

Hebrew: אָמַ֗רְתָּ הִנֵּ֤ה הִכִּ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־אֱד֔וֹם וּנְשָׂאֲךָ֥ לִבְּךָ֖ לְהַכְבִּ֑יד עַתָּה֙ שְׁבָ֣ה בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ לָ֤מָּה תִתְגָּרֶה֙ בְּרָעָ֔ה וְנָ֣פַלְתָּ֔ אַתָּ֖ה וִיהוּדָ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: You boast that you have defeated the Edomites and you are ambitious to get more glory. Now stay at home, lest, provoking disaster you fall, dragging Judah down with you.”
Transliteration: amareta hineh hikhiyta et-edvom uneshaakha livekha lehakheviyd atah shevah veveytekha lamah titegareh veraah venafaleta atah viyhudah imakhe

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע אֲמַצְיָ֔הוּ כִּ֤י מֵהָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ הִ֔יא לְמַ֖עַן תִּתָּ֣ם בְּיָ֑ד כִּ֣י דָֽרְשׁ֔וּ אֵ֖ת אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: But Amaziah paid no heed—it was God’s doing, in order to deliver them up because they worshiped the gods of Edom.
Transliteration: velo-shama amatseyahu khiy mehaElohim hiy lemaan titam veyad khiy dareshu et elohey edvom

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל יוֹאָ֤שׁ מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיִּתְרָא֣וּ פָנִ֔ים ה֖וּא וַאֲמַצְיָ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה בְּבֵ֥ית שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: King Joash of Israel marched up, and he and King Amaziah of Judah confronted each other at Beth-shemesh in Judah.
Transliteration: vayaal yvoash melekhe-yisherael vayiterau faniym hu vaamatseyahu melekhe-yehudah veveyt shemesh asher liyhudah

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֥גֶף יְהוּדָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ אִ֥ישׁ לְאֹהָלָֽיו׃
Translated: The men of Judah were routed by Israel, and they all fled to their homes.
Transliteration: vayinagef yehudah lifeney yisherael vayanusu iysh leohalayv

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ אֲמַצְיָ֨הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֜ה בֶּן־יוֹאָ֣שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֗ז תָּפַ֛שׂ יוֹאָ֥שׁ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּבֵ֣ית שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וַיְבִיאֵ֙הוּ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיִּפְרֹ֞ץ בְּחוֹמַ֣ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם מִשַּׁ֤עַר אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ עַד־שַׁ֣עַר הַפּוֹנֶ֔ה אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אַמָּֽה׃
Translated: King Joash of Israel captured Amaziah son of Joash son of Jehoahaz, king of Judah, in Beth-shemesh. He brought him to Jerusalem and made a breach of 400 cubits in the wall of Jerusalem, from the Ephraim Gate to the Corner Gate.
Transliteration: veet amatseyahu melekhe-yehudah ven-yvoash ven-yehvoachaz tafash yvoash melekhe-yisherael veveyt shamesh vayeviyehu yerushala͏im vayiferots vechvomat yerushala͏im mishaar eferayiim ad-shaar hafvoneh areva mevot amah

Hebrew: וְכׇֽל־הַזָּהָ֣ב וְהַכֶּ֡סֶף וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַ֠כֵּלִ֠ים הַנִּמְצְאִ֨ים בְּבֵית־הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים עִם־עֹבֵ֣ד אֱד֗וֹם וְאֶת־אֽוֹצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י הַתַּעֲרֻב֑וֹת וַיָּ֖שׇׁב שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: Then, with all the gold and silver and all the utensils that were to be found in the House of God in the custody of Obed-edom, and with the treasuries of the royal palace, and with the hostages, he returned to Samaria.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hazahav vehakhesef veet khׇl-hakheliym hanimetseiym veveyt-haElohim im-oved edvom veet-votservot veyt hamelekhe veet veney hataaruvvot vayashׇv shomervon {f}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֨י אֲמַצְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־יוֹאָשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֣י מ֔וֹת יוֹאָ֥שׁ בֶּן־יְהוֹאָחָ֖ז מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חֲמֵ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: King Amaziah son of Joash of Judah lived fifteen years after the death of King Joash son of Jehoahaz of Israel.
Transliteration: vayechiy amatseyahu ven-yvoash melekhe yehudah acharey mvot yvoash ven-yehvoachaz melekhe yisherael chamesh eshereh shanah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י אֲמַצְיָ֔הוּ הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרוֹנִ֑ים הֲלֹא֙ הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַל־סֵ֥פֶר מַלְכֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Amaziah’s reign, early and late, are recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey amatseyahu harishoniym vehaacharvoniym halo hinam khetuviym al-sefer malekhey-yehudah veyisherael

Hebrew: וּמֵעֵ֗ת אֲשֶׁר־סָ֤ר אֲמַצְיָ֙הוּ֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּקְשְׁר֨וּ עָלָ֥יו קֶ֛שֶׁר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וַיָּ֣נׇס לָכִ֑ישָׁה וַיִּשְׁלְח֤וּ אַחֲרָיו֙ לָכִ֔ישָׁה וַיְמִיתֻ֖הוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: From the time that Amaziah turned from following the L<small>ORD</small>, a conspiracy was formed against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish; but they sent men after him to Lachish and they put him to death there.
Transliteration: umeet asher-sar amatseyahu meacharey yehovah vayikesheru alayv kesher viyrushala͏im vayanׇs lakhiyshah vayishelechu acharayv lakhiyshah vayemiytuhu sham

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֖הוּ עַל־הַסּוּסִ֑ים וַֽיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֖יו בְּעִ֥יר יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: They brought his body back on horses and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.
Transliteration: vayishauhu al-hasusiym vayikeveru otvo im-avotayv veiyr yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ כׇּל־עַ֤ם יְהוּדָה֙ אֶת־עֻזִּיָּ֔הוּ וְה֕וּא בֶּן־שֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה וַיַּמְלִ֣יכוּ אֹת֔וֹ תַּ֖חַת אָבִ֥יו אֲמַצְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and proclaimed him king to succeed his father Amaziah.
Transliteration: vayikechu khׇl-am yehudah et-uziyahu vehu ven-shesh eshereh shanah vayameliykhu otvo tachat aviyv amatseyahu

Hebrew: ה֚וּא בָּנָ֣ה אֶת־אֵיל֔וֹת וַיְשִׁיבֶ֖הָ לִֽיהוּדָ֑ה אַחֲרֵ֥י שְׁכַֽב־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עִם־אֲבֹתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: It was he who rebuilt Eloth and restored it to Judah after King [Amaziah] slept with his fathers.
Transliteration: hu vanah et-eylvot vayeshiyveha liyhudah acharey shekhav-hamelekhe im-avotayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שֵׁ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ עֻזִּיָּ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֔וֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּשְׁתַּ֙יִם֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ (יכיליה) [יְכׇלְיָ֖ה] מִן־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-shesh eshereh shanah uziyahu vemׇlekhvo vachamishiym ushetayiim shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo (ykhylyh) [yekhׇleyah] min-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה אֲמַצְיָ֥הוּ אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small> just as his father Amaziah had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah amatseyahu aviyv

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ לִדְרֹ֣שׁ אֱלֹהִ֔ים בִּימֵ֣י זְכַרְיָ֔הוּ הַמֵּבִ֖ין בִּרְאֹ֣ת הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבִימֵי֙ דׇּרְשׁ֣וֹ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה הִצְלִיח֖וֹ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: He applied himself to the worship of God during the time of Zechariah, instructor in the visions of God; during the time he worshiped the L<small>ORD</small>, God made him prosper.
Transliteration: vayehiy liderosh Elohim viymey zekhareyahu hameviyn vireot haElohim uviymey dׇreshvo et-yehovah hitseliychvo haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ וַיִּלָּ֣חֶם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיִּפְרֹ֞ץ אֶת־ח֣וֹמַת גַּ֗ת וְאֵת֙ חוֹמַ֣ת יַבְנֵ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת חוֹמַ֣ת אַשְׁדּ֑וֹד וַיִּבְנֶ֣ה עָרִ֔ים בְּאַשְׁדּ֖וֹד וּבַפְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: He went forth to fight the Philistines, and breached the wall of Gath and the wall of Jabneh and the wall of Ashdod; he built towns in [the region of] Ashdod and among the Philistines.
Transliteration: vayetse vayilachem vafelishetiym vayiferots et-chvomat gat veet chvomat yaveneh veet chvomat ashedvod vayiveneh ariym veashedvod uvafelishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּעְזְרֵ֨הוּ הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים עַל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֧ים וְעַל־[הָעַרְבִ֛ים] (הערביים) הַיֹּשְׁבִ֥ים בְּגוּר־בָּ֖עַל וְהַמְּעוּנִֽים׃
Translated: God helped him against the Philistines, against the Arabs who lived in Gur-baal, and the Meunites.
Transliteration: vayaezerehu haElohim al-felishetiym veal-[haareviym] (hrvyym) hayosheviym vegur-vaal vehameuniym

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֧וּ הָעַמּוֹנִ֛ים מִנְחָ֖ה לְעֻזִּיָּ֑הוּ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ שְׁמוֹ֙ עַד־לְב֣וֹא מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֥י הֶחֱזִ֖יק עַד־לְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: The Ammonites paid tribute to Uzziah, and his fame spread to the approaches of Egypt, for he grew exceedingly strong.
Transliteration: vayitenu haamvoniym minechah leuziyahu vayelekhe shemvo ad-levvo mitserayiim khiy hecheziyk ad-lemaelah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨בֶן עֻזִּיָּ֤הוּ מִגְדָּלִים֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם עַל־שַׁ֧עַר הַפִּנָּ֛ה וְעַל־שַׁ֥עַר הַגַּ֖יְא וְעַל־הַמִּקְצ֑וֹעַ וַֽיְחַזְּקֵֽם׃
Translated: Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem on the Corner Gate and the Valley Gate and on the Angle, and fortified them.
Transliteration: vayiven uziyahu migedaliym viyrushala͏im al-shaar hafinah veal-shaar hagaye veal-hamiketsvoa vayechazekem

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨בֶן מִגְדָּלִ֜ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר וַיַּחְצֹב֙ בֹּר֣וֹת רַבִּ֔ים כִּ֤י מִקְנֶה־רַּב֙ הָ֣יָה ל֔וֹ וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה וּבַמִּישׁ֑וֹר אִכָּרִ֣ים וְכֹרְמִ֗ים בֶּהָרִים֙ וּבַכַּרְמֶ֔ל כִּי־אֹהֵ֥ב אֲדָמָ֖ה הָיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: He built towers in the wilderness and hewed out many cisterns, for he had much cattle, and farmers in the foothills and on the plain, and vine dressers in the mountains and on the fertile lands, for he loved the soil.
Transliteration: vayiven migedaliym vamidevar vayachetsov vorvot raviym khiy mikeneh-rav hayah lvo uvashefelah uvamiyshvor ikhariym vekhoremiym vehariym uvakharemel khiy-ohev adamah hayah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י לְעֻזִּיָּ֡הוּ חַ֩יִל֩ עֹשֵׂ֨ה מִלְחָמָ֜ה יוֹצְאֵ֧י צָבָ֣א לִגְד֗וּד בְּמִסְפַּר֙ פְּקֻדָּתָ֔ם בְּיַד֙ (יעואל) [יְעִיאֵ֣ל] הַסּוֹפֵ֔ר וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֖הוּ הַשּׁוֹטֵ֑ר עַ֚ל יַד־חֲנַנְיָ֔הוּ מִשָּׂרֵ֖י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Uzziah had an army of warriors, a battle-ready force who were mustered by Jeiel the scribe and Maasseiah the adjutant under Hananiah, one of the king’s officers.
Transliteration: vayehiy leuziyahu chayiil osheh milechamah yvotseey tsava ligedud vemisefar fekudatam veyad (yvl) [yeiyel] hasvofer umaasheyahu hashvoter al yad-chananeyahu misharey hamelekhe

Hebrew: כֹּ֠ל מִסְפַּ֞ר רָאשֵׁ֤י הָאָבוֹת֙ לְגִבּ֣וֹרֵי חָ֔יִל אַלְפַּ֖יִם וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: The clan chiefs, valiants, totaled 2,600;
Transliteration: khol misefar rashey haavvot legivvorey chayiil alefayiim veshesh mevot

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָדָם֩ חֵ֨יל צָבָ֜א שְׁלֹ֧שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אֶ֗לֶף וְשִׁבְעַ֤ת אֲלָפִים֙ וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת עוֹשֵׂ֥י מִלְחָמָ֖ה בְּכֹ֣חַ חָ֑יִל לַעְזֹ֥ר לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עַל־הָאוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated: under them was the trained army of 307,500, who made war with might and power to aid the king against the enemy.
Transliteration: veal-yadam cheyl tsava shelosh mevot elef veshiveat alafiym vachamesh mevot voshey milechamah vekhocha chayiil laezor lamelekhe al-havoeiv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩כֶן֩ לָהֶ֨ם עֻזִּיָּ֜הוּ לְכׇל־הַצָּבָ֗א מָגִנִּ֤ים וּרְמָחִים֙ וְכ֣וֹבָעִ֔ים וְשִׁרְיֹנ֖וֹת וּקְשָׁת֑וֹת וּלְאַבְנֵ֖י קְלָעִֽים׃
Translated: Uzziah provided them—the whole army—with shields and spears, and helmets and mail, and bows and slingstones.
Transliteration: vayakhen lahem uziyahu lekhׇl-hatsava maginiym uremachiym vekhvovaiym veshireyonvot ukeshatvot uleaveney kelaiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ ׀ בִּירוּשָׁלַ֨͏ִם חִשְּׁבֹנ֜וֹת מַחֲשֶׁ֣בֶת חוֹשֵׁ֗ב לִהְי֤וֹת עַל־הַמִּגְדָּלִים֙ וְעַל־הַפִּנּ֔וֹת לִירוֹא֙ בַּחִצִּ֔ים וּבָאֲבָנִ֖ים גְּדֹל֑וֹת וַיֵּצֵ֤א שְׁמוֹ֙ עַד־לְמֵ֣רָח֔וֹק כִּֽי־הִפְלִ֥יא לְהֵעָזֵ֖ר עַ֥ד כִּֽי־חָזָֽק׃
Translated: He made clever devices in Jerusalem, set on the towers and the corners, for shooting arrows and large stones. His fame spread far, for he was helped wonderfully, and he became strong.
Transliteration: vayaash viyrushala͏im chishevonvot machashevet chvoshev liheyvot al-hamigedaliym veal-hafinvot liyrvo vachitsiym uvaavaniym gedolvot vayetse shemvo ad-lemerachvok khiy-hifeliy leheazer ad khiy-chazak

Hebrew: וּכְחֶזְקָת֗וֹ גָּבַ֤הּ לִבּוֹ֙ עַד־לְהַשְׁחִ֔ית וַיִּמְעַ֖ל בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־הֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה לְהַקְטִ֖יר עַל־מִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
Translated: When he was strong, he grew so arrogant he acted corruptly: he trespassed against his God by entering the Temple of the L<small>ORD</small> to offer incense on the incense altar.
Transliteration: ukhechezekatvo gavah livvo ad-lehashechiyt vayimeal vayhovah elohayv vayavo el-heykhal yehovah lehaketiyr al-mizevach haketoret

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אַחֲרָ֖יו עֲזַרְיָ֣הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְעִמּ֞וֹ כֹּהֲנִ֧ים <small>׀</small> לַיהֹוָ֛ה שְׁמוֹנִ֖ים בְּנֵי־חָֽיִל׃
Translated: The priest Azariah, with eighty other brave priests of the L<small>ORD</small>, followed him in
Transliteration: vayavo acharayv azareyahu hakhohen veimvo khohaniym <small></small> layhovah shemvoniym veney-chayiil

Hebrew: וַיַּעַמְד֞וּ עַל־עֻזִּיָּ֣הוּ הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ לֹֽא־לְךָ֣ עֻזִּיָּ֗הוּ לְהַקְטִיר֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֣י לַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־אַהֲרֹ֛ן הַמְקֻדָּשִׁ֖ים לְהַקְטִ֑יר צֵ֤א מִן־הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ כִּ֣י מָעַ֔לְתָּ וְלֹֽא־לְךָ֥ לְכָב֖וֹד מֵיְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and, confronting King Uzziah, said to him, “It is not for you, Uzziah, to offer incense to the L<small>ORD</small>, but for the Aaronite priests, who have been consecrated, to offer incense. Get out of the Sanctuary, for you have trespassed; there will be no glory in it for you from the L<small>ORD</small> God.”
Transliteration: vayaamedu al-uziyahu hamelekhe vayomeru lvo lo-lekha uziyahu lehaketiyr layhovah khiy lakhohaniym veney-aharon hamekudashiym lehaketiyr tse min-hamikedash khiy maaleta velo-lekha lekhavvod meyehovah Elohim

Hebrew: וַיִּזְעַף֙ עֻזִּיָּ֔הוּ וּבְיָד֥וֹ מִקְטֶ֖רֶת לְהַקְטִ֑יר וּבְזַעְפּ֣וֹ עִם־הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים וְ֠הַצָּרַ֠עַת זָרְחָ֨ה בְמִצְח֜וֹ לִפְנֵ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵעַ֖ל לְמִזְבַּ֥ח הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃
Translated: Uzziah, holding the censer and ready to burn incense, got angry; but as he got angry with the priests, leprosy broke out on his forehead in front of the priests in the House of the L<small>ORD</small> beside the incense altar.
Transliteration: vayizeaf uziyahu uveyadvo miketeret lehaketiyr uvezaefvo im-hakhohaniym vehatsaraat zarechah vemitsechvo lifeney hakhohaniym veveyt yehovah meal lemizevach haketoret

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣פֶן אֵלָ֡יו עֲזַרְיָ֩הוּ֩ כֹהֵ֨ן הָרֹ֜אשׁ וְכׇל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים וְהִנֵּה־ה֤וּא מְצֹרָע֙ בְּמִצְח֔וֹ וַיַּבְהִל֖וּהוּ מִשָּׁ֑ם וְגַם־הוּא֙ נִדְחַ֣ף לָצֵ֔את כִּ֥י נִגְּע֖וֹ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When the chief priest Azariah and all the other priests looked at him, his forehead was leprous, so they rushed him out of there; he too made haste to get out, for the L<small>ORD</small> had struck him with a plague.
Transliteration: vayifen elayv azareyahu khohen harosh vekhׇl-hakhohaniym vehineh-hu metsora vemitsechvo vayavehiluhu misham vegam-hu nidechaf latset khiy nigevo yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ עֻזִּיָּ֨הוּ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ מְצֹרָ֣ע ׀ עַד־י֣וֹם מוֹת֗וֹ וַיֵּ֜שֶׁב בֵּ֤ית (החפשות) [הַֽחׇפְשִׁית֙] מְצֹרָ֔ע כִּ֥י נִגְזַ֖ר מִבֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וְיוֹתָ֤ם בְּנוֹ֙ עַל־בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שׁוֹפֵ֖ט אֶת־עַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: King Uzziah was a leper until the day of his death. He lived in isolated quarters as a leper, for he was cut off from the House of the L<small>ORD</small>—while Jotham his son was in charge of the king’s house and governed the people of the land.
Transliteration: vayehiy uziyahu hamelekhe metsora ad-yvom mvotvo vayeshev veyt (hchfshvt) [hachׇfeshiyt] metsora khiy nigezar miveyt yehovah veyvotam venvo al-veyt hamelekhe shvofet et-am haarets

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י עֻזִּיָּ֔הוּ הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרֹנִ֑ים כָּתַ֛ב יְשַֽׁעְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־אָמ֖וֹץ הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: The other events of Uzziah’s reign, early and late, were recorded by the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey uziyahu harishoniym vehaacharoniym khatav yeshaeyahu ven-amvots hanaviy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֨ב עֻזִּיָּ֜הוּ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֗יו וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ עִם־אֲבֹתָיו֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֤ה הַקְּבוּרָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַמְּלָכִ֔ים כִּ֥י אָמְר֖וּ מְצוֹרָ֣ע ה֑וּא וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יוֹתָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Uzziah slept with his fathers in the burial field of the kings, because, they said, he was a leper; his son Jotham succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav uziyahu im-avotayv vayikeveru otvo im-avotayv vishedeh hakevurah asher lamelakhiym khiy ameru metsvora hu vayimelokhe yvotam venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ יוֹתָ֣ם בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְשֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ יְרוּשָׁ֖ה בַּת־צָדֽוֹק׃
Translated: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Jerushah daughter of Zadok.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah yvotam vemׇlekhvo veshesh-eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo yerushah vat-tsadvok

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֜ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה כְּכֹ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֙ עֻזִּיָּ֣הוּ אָבִ֔יו רַ֕ק לֹא־בָ֖א אֶל־הֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה וְע֥וֹד הָעָ֖ם מַשְׁחִיתִֽים׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small> just as his father Uzziah had done, but he did not enter the Temple of the L<small>ORD</small>; however, the people still acted corruptly.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah uziyahu aviyv rak lo-va el-heykhal yehovah vevod haam mashechiytiym

Hebrew: ה֗וּא בָּנָ֛ה אֶת־שַׁ֥עַר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה הָעֶלְי֑וֹן וּבְחוֹמַ֥ת הָעֹ֛פֶל בָּנָ֖ה לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: It was he who built the Upper Gate of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>; he also built extensively on the wall of Ophel.
Transliteration: hu vanah et-shaar veyt-yehovah haeleyvon uvechvomat haofel vanah larov

Hebrew: וְעָרִ֥ים בָּנָ֖ה בְּהַר־יְהוּדָ֑ה וּבֶחֳרָשִׁ֣ים בָּנָ֔ה בִּירָנִיּ֖וֹת וּמִגְדָּלִֽים׃
Translated: He built towns in the hill country of Judah, and in the woods he built fortresses and towers.
Transliteration: veariym vanah vehar-yehudah uvechorashiym vanah viyraniyyvot umigedaliym

Hebrew: וְ֠ה֠וּא נִלְחַ֞ם עִם־מֶ֣לֶךְ בְּנֵֽי־עַמּוֹן֮ וַיֶּחֱזַ֣ק עֲלֵיהֶם֒ וַיִּתְּנוּ־ל֨וֹ בְנֵי־עַמּ֜וֹן בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַהִ֗יא מֵאָה֙ כִּכַּר־כֶּ֔סֶף וַעֲשֶׂ֨רֶת אֲלָפִ֤ים כֹּרִים֙ חִטִּ֔ים וּשְׂעוֹרִ֖ים עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֑ים זֹ֗את הֵשִׁ֤יבוּ לוֹ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וּבַשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית וְהַשְּׁלִשִֽׁית׃
Translated: Moreover, he fought with the king of the Ammonites and overcame them; the Ammonites gave him that year 100 talents of silver and 10,000 kor of wheat and another 10,000 of barley; that is what the Ammonites paid him, and [likewise] in the second and third years.
Transliteration: vehu nilecham im-melekhe veney-amvon vayechezak aleyhem vayitenu-lvo veney-amvon vashanah hahiy meah khikhar-khesef vaasheret alafiym khoriym chitiym ushevoriym asheret alafiym zot heshiyvu lvo veney amvon uvashanah hasheniyt vehashelishiyt

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֖ק יוֹתָ֑ם כִּ֚י הֵכִ֣ין דְּרָכָ֔יו לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: Jotham was strong because he maintained a faithful course before the L<small>ORD</small> his God.
Transliteration: vayitechazek yvotam khiy hekhiyn derakhayv lifeney yehovah elohayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י יוֹתָ֔ם וְכׇל־מִלְחֲמֹתָ֖יו וּדְרָכָ֑יו הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַל־סֵ֥פֶר מַלְכֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Jotham’s reign, and all his battles and his conduct, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yvotam vekhׇl-milechamotayv uderakhayv hinam khetuviym al-sefer malekhey-yisherael viyhudah

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֧ים וְחָמֵ֛שׁ שָׁנָ֖ה הָיָ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֑וֹ וְשֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah hayah vemׇlekhvo veshesh-eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יוֹתָם֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אָחָ֥ז בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Jotham slept with his fathers, and was buried in the City of David; his son Ahaz succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yvotam im-avotayv vayikeveru otvo veiyr daviyd vayimelokhe achaz venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ אָחָ֣ז בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְשֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְלֹא־עָשָׂ֧ה הַיָּשָׁ֛ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּדָוִ֥יד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. He did not do what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small> as his father David had done,
Transliteration: ven-esheriym shanah achaz vemׇlekhvo veshesh-eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im velo-ashah hayashar veeyney yehovah khedaviyd aviyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ בְּדַרְכֵ֖י מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְגַ֧ם מַסֵּכ֛וֹת עָשָׂ֖ה לַבְּעָלִֽים׃
Translated: but followed the ways of the kings of Israel; he even made molten images for the Baals.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vedarekhey malekhey yisherael vegam masekhvot ashah lavealiym

Hebrew: וְה֥וּא הִקְטִ֖יר בְּגֵ֣יא בֶן־הִנֹּ֑ם וַיַּבְעֵ֤ר אֶת־בָּנָיו֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ כְּתֹֽעֲבוֹת֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הֹרִ֣ישׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He made offerings in the Valley of Ben-hinnom and burned his sons in fire, in the abhorrent fashion of the nations which the L<small>ORD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vehu hiketiyr vegey ven-hinom vayaveer et-vanayv vaesh khetoavvot hagvoyim asher horiysh yehovah mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְזַבֵּ֧חַ וַיְקַטֵּ֛ר בַּבָּמ֖וֹת וְעַל־הַגְּבָע֑וֹת וְתַ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated: He sacrificed and made offerings at the shrines, on the hills, and under every leafy tree.
Transliteration: vayezavecha vayekater vavamvot veal-hagevavot vetachat khׇl-ets raanan

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֜הוּ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָיו֮ בְּיַ֣ד מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָם֒ וַיַּ֨כּוּ־ב֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁבּ֤וּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ שִׁבְיָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וַיָּבִ֖יאוּ דַּרְמָ֑שֶׂק וְ֠גַ֠ם בְּיַד־מֶ֤לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נִתָּ֔ן וַיַּךְ־בּ֖וֹ מַכָּ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> his God delivered him over to the king of Aram, who defeated him and took many of his men captive, and brought them to Damascus. He was also delivered over to the king of Israel, who inflicted a great defeat on him.
Transliteration: vayitenehu yehovah elohayv veyad melekhe aram vayakhu-vvo vayishevu mimenu shiveyah gedvolah vayaviyu daremashek vegam veyad-melekhe yisherael nitan vayakhe-vvo makhah gedvolah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּהֲרֹג֩ פֶּ֨קַח בֶּן־רְמַלְיָ֜הוּ בִּיהוּדָ֗ה מֵאָ֨ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָ֖ד הַכֹּ֣ל בְּנֵי־חָ֑יִל בְּעׇזְבָ֕ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Pekah son of Remaliah killed 120,000 in Judah—all brave men—in one day, because they had forsaken the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayaharog fekach ven-remaleyahu viyhudah meah veesheriym elef veyvom echad hakhol veney-chayiil veׇzevam et-yehovah elohey avvotam

Hebrew: וַֽיַּהֲרֹ֞ג זִכְרִ֣י ׀ גִּבּ֣וֹר אֶפְרַ֗יִם אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאֶת־עַזְרִיקָ֖ם נְגִ֣יד הַבָּ֑יִת וְאֶת־אֶלְקָנָ֖ה מִשְׁנֵ֥ה הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Zichri, the champion of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king’s son, and Azrikam chief of the palace, and Elkanah, the second to the king.
Transliteration: vayaharog zikheriy givvor eferayiim et-maasheyahu ven-hamelekhe veet-azeriykam negiyd havayiit veet-elekanah misheneh hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבּוּ֩ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל מֵאֲחֵיהֶ֜ם מָאתַ֣יִם אֶ֗לֶף נָשִׁים֙ בָּנִ֣ים וּבָנ֔וֹת וְגַם־שָׁלָ֥ל רָ֖ב בָּזְז֣וּ מֵהֶ֑ם וַיָּבִ֥יאוּ אֶת־הַשָּׁלָ֖ל לְשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: The Israelites captured 200,000 of their kinsmen, women, boys, and girls; they also took a large amount of booty from them and brought the booty to Samaria.
Transliteration: vayishevu veney-yisherael meacheyhem matayiim elef nashiym vaniym uvanvot vegam-shalal rav vazezu mehem vayaviyu et-hashalal leshomervon {s}

Hebrew: וְ֠שָׁ֠ם הָיָ֨ה נָבִ֥יא לַֽיהֹוָה֮ עֹדֵ֣ד שְׁמוֹ֒ וַיֵּצֵ֗א לִפְנֵ֤י הַצָּבָא֙ הַבָּ֣א לְשֹׁמְר֔וֹן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם הִ֠נֵּ֠ה בַּחֲמַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֛ם עַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה נְתָנָ֣ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֑ם וַתַּהַרְגוּ־בָ֣ם בְּזַ֔עַף עַ֥ד לַשָּׁמַ֖יִם הִגִּֽיעַ׃
Translated: A prophet of the L<small>ORD</small> by the name of Oded was there, who went out to meet the army on its return to Samaria. He said to them, “Because of the fury of the L<small>ORD</small> God of your fathers against Judah, He delivered them over to you, and you killed them in a rage that reached heaven.
Transliteration: vesham hayah naviy layhovah oded shemvo vayetse lifeney hatsava hava leshomervon vayomer lahem hineh vachamat yehovah elohey-avvoteykhem al-yehudah netanam veyedekhem vataharegu-vam vezaaf ad lashamayiim higiya

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֤ה וִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים לִכְבֹּ֛שׁ לַעֲבָדִ֥ים וְלִשְׁפָח֖וֹת לָכֶ֑ם הֲלֹ֤א רַק־אַתֶּם֙ עִמָּכֶ֣ם אֲשָׁמ֔וֹת לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do you now intend to subjugate the men and women of Judah and Jerusalem to be your slaves? As it is, you have nothing but offenses against the L<small>ORD</small> your God.
Transliteration: veatah veney-yehudah viyrushala͏im atem omeriym likhevosh laavadiym velishefachvot lakhem halo rak-atem imakhem ashamvot layhovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה שְׁמָע֔וּנִי וְהָשִׁ֙יבוּ֙ הַשִּׁבְיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שְׁבִיתֶ֖ם מֵאֲחֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֛י חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָ֖ה עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Now then, listen to me, and send back the captives you have taken from your kinsmen, for the wrath of the L<small>ORD</small> is upon you!”
Transliteration: veatah shemauniy vehashiyvu hashiveyah asher sheviytem meacheykhem khiy charvon af-yehovah aleykhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֨מוּ אֲנָשִׁ֜ים מֵרָאשֵׁ֣י בְנֵי־אֶפְרַ֗יִם עֲזַרְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־יְהֽוֹחָנָן֙ בֶּרֶכְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־מְשִׁלֵּמ֔וֹת וִֽיחִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־שַׁלֻּ֔ם וַעֲמָשָׂ֖א בֶּן־חַדְלָ֑י עַל־הַבָּאִ֖ים מִן־הַצָּבָֽא׃
Translated: Some of the chief men of the Ephraimites—Azariah son of Jehohanan, Berechiah son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah son of Shallum, and Amasa son of Hadlai—confronted those returning from the campaign
Transliteration: vayakumu anashiym merashey veney-eferayiim azareyahu ven-yehvochanan verekheyahu ven-meshilemvot viychizekiyahu ven-shalum vaamasha ven-chadelay al-havaiym min-hatsava

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לָהֶ֗ם לֹֽא־תָבִ֤יאוּ אֶת־הַשִּׁבְיָה֙ הֵ֔נָּה כִּי֩ לְאַשְׁמַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֤ה עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים לְהֹסִ֥יף עַל־חַטֹּאתֵ֖נוּ וְעַל־אַשְׁמָתֵ֑נוּ כִּֽי־רַבָּ֤ה אַשְׁמָה֙ לָ֔נוּ וַחֲר֥וֹן אָ֖ף עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: and said to them, “Do not bring these captives here, for it would mean our offending the L<small>ORD</small>, adding to our sins and our offenses; for our offense is grave enough, and there is already wrath upon Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lahem lo-taviyu et-hashiveyah henah khiy leashemat yehovah aleynu atem omeriym lehosiyf al-chatotenu veal-ashematenu khiy-ravah ashemah lanu vacharvon af al-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲזֹ֣ב הֶחָל֗וּץ אֶת־הַשִּׁבְיָה֙ וְאֶת־הַבִּזָּ֔ה לִפְנֵ֥י הַשָּׂרִ֖ים וְכׇל־הַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: So the soldiers released the captives and the booty in the presence of the officers and all the congregation.
Transliteration: vayaazov hechaluts et-hashiveyah veet-havizah lifeney hashariym vekhׇl-hakahal

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֣מוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים֩ אֲשֶׁר־נִקְּב֨וּ בְשֵׁמ֜וֹת וַיַּחֲזִ֣יקוּ בַשִּׁבְיָ֗ה וְכׇֽל־מַעֲרֻמֵּיהֶם֮ הִלְבִּ֣ישׁוּ מִן־הַשָּׁלָל֒ וַיַּלְבִּשֻׁ֣ם וַ֠יַּנְעִל֠וּם וַיַּאֲכִל֨וּם וַיַּשְׁק֜וּם וַיְסֻכ֗וּם וַיְנַהֲל֤וּם בַּֽחֲמֹרִים֙ לְכׇל־כּוֹשֵׁ֔ל וַיְבִיא֛וּם יְרֵח֥וֹ עִיר־הַתְּמָרִ֖ים אֵ֣צֶל אֲחֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּשׁ֖וּבוּ שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: Then the men named above proceeded to take the captives in hand, and with the booty they clothed all the naked among them—they clothed them and shod them and gave them to eat and drink and anointed them and provided donkeys for all who were failing and brought them to Jericho, the city of palms, back to their kinsmen. Then they returned to Samaria.
Transliteration: vayakumu haanashiym asher-nikevu veshemvot vayachaziyku vashiveyah vekhׇl-maarumeyhem hileviyshu min-hashalal vayalevishum vayaneilum vayaakhilum vayashekum vayesukhum vayenahalum vachamoriym lekhׇl-khvoshel vayeviyum yerechvo iyr-hatemariym etsel acheyhem vayashuvu shomervon {f}

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא שָׁלַ֞ח הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ אָחָ֛ז עַל־מַלְכֵ֥י אַשּׁ֖וּר לַעְזֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: At that time, King Ahaz sent to the king of Assyria for help.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy shalach hamelekhe achaz al-malekhey ashur laezor lvo

Hebrew: וְע֥וֹד אֲדוֹמִ֖ים בָּ֑אוּ וַיַּכּ֥וּ בִיהוּדָ֖ה וַיִּשְׁבּוּ־שֶֽׁבִי׃
Translated: Again the Edomites came and inflicted a defeat on Judah and took captives.
Transliteration: vevod advomiym vau vayakhu viyhudah vayishevu-sheviy

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֣ים פָּֽשְׁט֗וּ בְּעָרֵ֨י הַשְּׁפֵלָ֣ה וְהַנֶּ֘גֶב֮ לִֽיהוּדָה֒ וַֽ֠יִּלְכְּד֠וּ אֶת־בֵּֽית־שֶׁ֨מֶשׁ וְאֶת־אַיָּל֜וֹן וְאֶת־הַגְּדֵר֗וֹת וְאֶת־שׂוֹכ֤וֹ וּבְנוֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ וְאֶת־תִּמְנָ֣ה וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְאֶת־גִּמְז֖וֹ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֶ֑יהָ וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: And the Philistines made forays against the cities of the Shephelah and the Negeb of Judah; they seized Beth-shemesh and Aijalon and Gederoth, and Soco with its villages, and Timnah with its villages, and Gimzo with its villages; and they settled there.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym fashetu vearey hashefelah vehanegev liyhudah vayilekhedu et-veyt-shemesh veet-ayalvon veet-hagedervot veet-shvokhvo uvenvoteyha veet-timenah uvenvoteyha veet-gimezvo veet-venoteyha vayeshevu sham

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִכְנִ֤יעַ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יְהוּדָ֔ה בַּעֲב֖וּר אָחָ֣ז מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֤י הִפְרִ֙יעַ֙ בִּֽיהוּדָ֔ה וּמָע֥וֹל מַ֖עַל בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> brought Judah low on account of King Ahaz of Israel, for he threw off restraint in Judah and trespassed against the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy-hikheniya yehovah et-yehudah vaavur achaz melekhe-yisherael khiy hiferiya viyhudah umavol maal vayhovah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א עָלָ֔יו תִּלְּגַ֥ת פִּלְנְאֶ֖סֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיָּ֥צַר ל֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א חֲזָקֽוֹ׃
Translated: Tillegath-pilneser, king of Assyria, marched against him and gave him trouble, instead of supporting him.
Transliteration: vayavo alayv tilegat fileneeser melekhe ashur vayatsar lvo velo chazakvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חָלַ֤ק אָחָז֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְהַשָּׂרִ֑ים וַיִּתֵּן֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וְלֹ֥א לְעֶזְרָ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: For Ahaz plundered the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and the house of the king and the officers, and made a gift to the king of Assyria—to no avail.
Transliteration: khiy-chalak achaz et-veyt yehovah veet-veyt hamelekhe vehashariym vayiten lemelekhe ashur velo leezerah lvo

Hebrew: וּבְעֵת֙ הָצֵ֣ר ל֔וֹ וַיּ֖וֹסֶף לִמְע֣וֹל בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה ה֖וּא הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אָחָֽז׃
Translated: In his time of trouble, this King Ahaz trespassed even more against the L<small>ORD</small>,
Transliteration: uveet hatser lvo vayyvosef limevol vayhovah hu hamelekhe achaz

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֗ח לֵאלֹהֵ֣י דַרְמֶ֘שֶׂק֮ הַמַּכִּ֣ים בּוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּ֠י אֱלֹהֵ֤י מַלְכֵֽי־אֲרָם֙ הֵ֚ם מַעְזְרִ֣ים אֹתָ֔ם לָהֶ֥ם אֲזַבֵּ֖חַ וְיַעְזְר֑וּנִי וְהֵ֛ם הָיוּ־ל֥וֹ לְהַכְשִׁיל֖וֹ וּלְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: sacrificing to the gods of Damascus which had defeated him, for he thought, “The gods of the kings of Aram help them; I shall sacrifice to them and they will help me”; but they were his ruin and that of all Israel.
Transliteration: vayizevach lelohey daremeshek hamakhiym vvo vayomer khiy elohey malekhey-aram hem maezeriym otam lahem azavecha veyaezeruniy vehem hayu-lvo lehakheshiylvo ulekhׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֨ף אָחָ֜ז אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י בֵית־הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים וַיְקַצֵּץ֙ אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י בֵית־הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּסְגֹּ֖ר אֶת־דַּלְת֣וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּ֨עַשׂ ל֧וֹ מִזְבְּח֛וֹת בְּכׇל־פִּנָּ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Ahaz collected the utensils of the House of God, and cut the utensils of the House of God to pieces. He shut the doors of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and made himself altars in every corner of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayeesof achaz et-kheley veyt-haElohim vayekatsets et-kheley veyt-haElohim vayisegor et-daletvot veyt-yehovah vayaash lvo mizevechvot vekhׇl-finah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וּבְכׇל־עִ֨יר וָעִ֤יר לִֽיהוּדָה֙ עָשָׂ֣ה בָמ֔וֹת לְקַטֵּ֖ר לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיַּכְעֵ֕ס אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: In every town in Judah he set up shrines to make offerings to other gods, vexing the L<small>ORD</small> God of his fathers.
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-iyr vaiyr liyhudah ashah vamvot lekater lelohiym acheriym vayakhees et-yehovah elohey avotayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֤תֶר דְּבָרָיו֙ וְכׇל־דְּרָכָ֔יו הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרוֹנִ֑ים הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַל־סֵ֥פֶר מַלְכֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of his reign and all his conduct, early and late, are recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter devarayv vekhׇl-derakhayv harishoniym vehaacharvoniym hinam khetuviym al-sefer malekhey-yehudah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֨ב אָחָ֜ז עִם־אֲבֹתָ֗יו וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֤הוּ בָעִיר֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כִּ֚י לֹ֣א הֱבִיאֻ֔הוּ לְקִבְרֵ֖י מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְחִזְקִיָּ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Ahaz slept with his fathers and was buried in the city, in Jerusalem; his body was not brought to the tombs of the kings of Israel. His son Hezekiah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav achaz im-avotayv vayikeveruhu vaiyr viyrushala͏im khiy lo heviyuhu lekiverey malekhey yisherael vayimelokhe yechizekiyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ מָלַ֗ךְ בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וְחָמֵשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָתֵ֙שַׁע֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ אֲבִיָּ֖ה בַּת־זְכַרְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: Hezekiah became king at the age of twenty-five, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Abijah daughter of Zechariah.
Transliteration: yechizekiyahu malakhe ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah veesheriym vatesha shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo aviyah vat-zekhareyahu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה דָּוִ֥יד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, just as his father David had done.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah khekhol asher-ashah daviyd aviyv

Hebrew: ה֣וּא בַשָּׁנָה֩ הָרִאשׁוֹנָ֨ה לְמׇלְכ֜וֹ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן פָּתַ֛ח אֶת־דַּלְת֥וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַֽיְחַזְּקֵֽם׃
Translated: He, in the first month of the first year of his reign, opened the doors of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and repaired them.
Transliteration: hu vashanah harishvonah lemׇlekhvo vachodesh harishvon fatach et-daletvot veyt-yehovah vayechazekem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֥א אֶת־הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וַיַּאַסְפֵ֖ם לִרְח֥וֹב הַמִּזְרָֽח׃
Translated: He summoned the priests and the Levites and assembled them in the east square.
Transliteration: vayave et-hakhohaniym veet-haleviyim vayaasefem lirechvov hamizerach

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָהֶ֖ם שְׁמָע֣וּנִי הַלְוִיִּ֑ם עַתָּ֣ה הִֽתְקַדְּשׁ֗וּ וְקַדְּשׁוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֤ית יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֔ם וְהוֹצִ֥יאוּ אֶת־הַנִּדָּ֖ה מִן־הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: He said to them, “Listen to me, Levites! Sanctify yourselves and sanctify the House of the L<small>ORD</small> God of your fathers, and take the abhorrent things out of the holy place.
Transliteration: vayomer lahem shemauniy haleviyim atah hitekadeshu vekadeshu et-veyt yehovah elohey avoteykhem vehvotsiyu et-hanidah min-hakodesh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מָעֲל֣וּ אֲבֹתֵ֗ינוּ וְעָשׂ֥וּ הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה־אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ וַיַּעַזְבֻ֑הוּ וַיַּסֵּ֧בּוּ פְנֵיהֶ֛ם מִמִּשְׁכַּ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיִּתְּנוּ־עֹֽרֶף׃
Translated: For our fathers trespassed and did what displeased the L<small>ORD</small> our God; they forsook Him and turned their faces away from the dwelling-place of the L<small>ORD</small>, turning their backs on it.
Transliteration: khiy-maalu avoteynu veashu hara veeyney yehovah-eloheynu vayaazevuhu vayasevu feneyhem mimishekhan yehovah vayitenu-oref

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם סָגְר֞וּ דַּלְת֣וֹת הָאוּלָ֗ם וַיְכַבּוּ֙ אֶת־הַנֵּר֔וֹת וּקְטֹ֖רֶת לֹ֣א הִקְטִ֑ירוּ וְעֹלָה֙ לֹא־הֶעֱל֣וּ בַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ לֵאלֹהֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: They also shut the doors of the porch and put out the lights; they did not offer incense and did not make burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.
Transliteration: gam sageru daletvot haulam vayekhavu et-hanervot uketoret lo hiketiyru veolah lo-heelu vakodesh lelohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ קֶ֣צֶף יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיִּתְּנֵ֤ם (לזועה) [לְזַעֲוָה֙] לְשַׁמָּ֣ה וְלִשְׁרֵקָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר אַתֶּ֥ם רֹאִ֖ים בְּעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: The wrath of the L<small>ORD</small> was upon Judah and Jerusalem; He made them an object of horror, amazement, and hissing as you see with your own eyes.
Transliteration: vayehiy ketsef yehovah al-yehudah viyrushala͏im vayitenem (lzvh) [lezaavah] leshamah velisherekah khaasher atem roiym veeyneykhem

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֛ה נָפְל֥וּ אֲבוֹתֵ֖ינוּ בֶּחָ֑רֶב וּבָנֵ֨ינוּ וּבְנוֹתֵ֧ינוּ וְנָשֵׁ֛ינוּ בַּשְּׁבִ֖י עַל־זֹֽאת׃
Translated: Our fathers died by the sword, and our sons and daughters and wives are in captivity on account of this.
Transliteration: vehineh nafelu avvoteynu vecharev uvaneynu uvenvoteynu venasheynu vasheviy al-zot

Hebrew: עַתָּה֙ עִם־לְבָבִ֔י לִכְר֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְיָשֹׁ֥ב מִמֶּ֖נּוּ חֲר֥וֹן אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now I wish to make a covenant with the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, so that His rage may be withdrawn from us.
Transliteration: atah im-levaviy likhervot veriyt layhovah elohey yisherael veyashov mimenu charvon afvo

Hebrew: בָּנַ֕י עַתָּ֖ה אַל־תִּשָּׁל֑וּ כִּֽי־בָכֶ֞ם בָּחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לַעֲמֹ֤ד לְפָנָיו֙ לְשָׁ֣רְת֔וֹ וְלִהְי֥וֹת ל֖וֹ מְשָׁרְתִ֥ים וּמַקְטִרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Now, my sons, do not be slack, for the L<small>ORD</small> chose you to attend upon Him, to serve Him, to be His ministers and to make offerings to Him.”
Transliteration: vanay atah al-tishalu khiy-vakhem vachar yehovah laamod lefanayv lesharetvo veliheyvot lvo mesharetiym umaketiriym {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֣מוּ הַ֠לְוִיִּ֠ם מַ֣חַת בֶּן־עֲמָשַׂ֞י וְיוֹאֵ֣ל בֶּן־עֲזַרְיָ֘הוּ֮ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י הַקְּהָתִי֒ וּמִן־בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֔י קִ֚ישׁ בֶּן־עַבְדִּ֔י וַעֲזַרְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־יְהַלֶּלְאֵ֑ל {ס} וּמִן־הַגֵּ֣רְשֻׁנִּ֔י יוֹאָח֙ בֶּן־זִמָּ֔ה וְעֵ֖דֶן בֶּן־יוֹאָֽח׃
Translated: So the Levites set to—Mahath son of Amasai and Joel son of Azariah of the sons of Kohath; and of the sons of Merari, Kish son of Abdi and Azariah son of Jehallelel; and of the Gershonites, Joah son of Zimmah and Eden son of Joah;
Transliteration: vayakumu haleviyim machat ven-amashay veyvoel ven-azareyahu min-veney hakehatiy umin-veney merariy kiysh ven-avediy vaazareyahu ven-yehaleleel {s} umin-hagereshuniy yvoach ven-zimah veeden ven-yvoach

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵי֙ אֱלִ֣יצָפָ֔ן שִׁמְרִ֖י (ויעואל) [וִיעִיאֵ֑ל] וּמִן־בְּנֵ֣י אָסָ֔ף זְכַרְיָ֖הוּ וּמַתַּנְיָֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: and of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeiel; and of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;
Transliteration: umin-veney eliytsafan shimeriy (vyvl) [viyiyel] umin-veney asaf zekhareyahu umataneyahu {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵ֥י הֵימָ֖ן (יחואל) [יְחִיאֵ֣ל] וְשִׁמְעִ֑י {ס} וּמִן־בְּנֵ֣י יְדוּת֔וּן שְׁמַֽעְיָ֖ה וְעֻזִּיאֵֽל׃
Translated: and of the sons of Heman, Jehiel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel—
Transliteration: umin-veney heyman (ychvl) [yechiyel] veshimeiy {s} umin-veney yedutun shemaeyah veuziyel

Hebrew: וַיַּאַסְפ֤וּ אֶת־אֲחֵיהֶם֙ וַיִּֽתְקַדְּשׁ֔וּ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ כְמִצְוַת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּדִבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לְטַהֵ֖ר בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and, gathering their brothers, they sanctified themselves and came, by a command of the king concerning the L<small>ORD</small>’s ordinances, to purify the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaasefu et-acheyhem vayitekadeshu vayavou khemitsevat-hamelekhe vediverey yehovah letaher veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ הַ֠כֹּהֲנִ֠ים לִפְנִ֣ימָה בֵית־יְהֹוָה֮ לְטַהֵר֒ וַיּוֹצִ֗יאוּ אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַטֻּמְאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָֽצְאוּ֙ בְּהֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה לַחֲצַ֖ר בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיְקַבְּלוּ֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְהוֹצִ֥יא לְנַחַל־קִדְר֖וֹן חֽוּצָה׃
Translated: The priests went into the House of the L<small>ORD</small> to purify it, and brought all the unclean things they found in the Temple of the L<small>ORD</small> out into the court of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>; [there] the Levites received them, to take them outside to Wadi Kidron.
Transliteration: vayavou hakhohaniym lifeniymah veyt-yehovah letaher vayyvotsiyu et khׇl-hatumeah asher matseu veheykhal yehovah lachatsar veyt yehovah vayekavelu haleviyim lehvotsiy lenachal-kidervon chutsah

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּחֵ֠לּוּ בְּאֶחָ֞ד לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן֮ לְקַדֵּשׁ֒ וּבְי֧וֹם שְׁמוֹנָ֣ה לַחֹ֗דֶשׁ בָּ֚אוּ לְאוּלָ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיְקַדְּשׁ֥וּ אֶת־בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְיָמִ֣ים שְׁמוֹנָ֑ה וּבְי֨וֹם שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן כִּלּֽוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: They began the sanctification on the first day of the first month; on the eighth day of the month they reached the porch of the L<small>ORD</small>. They sanctified the House of the L<small>ORD</small> for eight days, and on the sixteenth day of the first month they finished.
Transliteration: vayachelu veechad lachodesh harishvon lekadesh uveyvom shemvonah lachodesh vau leulam yehovah vayekadeshu et-veyt-yehovah leyamiym shemvonah uveyvom shishah ashar lachodesh harishvon khilu {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּב֤וֹאֽוּ פְנִ֙ימָה֙ אֶל־חִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ טִהַ֖רְנוּ אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶת־מִזְבַּ֤ח הָעוֹלָה֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־שֻׁלְחַ֥ן הַֽמַּעֲרֶ֖כֶת וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָֽיו׃
Translated: Then they went into the palace of King Hezekiah and said, “We have purified the whole House of the L<small>ORD</small> and the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the table of the bread of display and all its utensils;
Transliteration: vayavvou feniymah el-chizekiyahu hamelekhe vayomeru tiharenu et-khׇl-veyt yehovah et-mizevach havolah veet-khׇl-khelayv veet-shulechan hamaarekhet veet-khׇl-khelayv

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִזְנִ֩יחַ֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אָחָ֧ז בְּמַלְכוּת֛וֹ בְּמַעֲל֖וֹ הֵכַ֣נּוּ וְהִקְדָּ֑שְׁנוּ וְהִנָּ֕ם לִפְנֵ֖י מִזְבַּ֥ח יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and all the utensils that King Ahaz had befouled during his reign, when he trespassed, we have made ready and sanctified. They are standing in front of the altar of the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: veet khׇl-hakheliym asher hizeniycha hamelekhe achaz vemalekhutvo vemaalvo hekhanu vehikedashenu vehinam lifeney mizevach yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּם֙ יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיֶּאֱסֹ֕ף אֵ֖ת שָׂרֵ֣י הָעִ֑יר וַיַּ֖עַל בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: King Hezekiah rose early, gathered the officers of the city, and went up to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayashekhem yechizekiyahu hamelekhe vayeesof et sharey haiyr vayaal veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ פָֽרִים־שִׁבְעָה֩ וְאֵילִ֨ים שִׁבְעָ֜ה וּכְבָשִׂ֣ים שִׁבְעָ֗ה וּצְפִירֵ֨י עִזִּ֤ים שִׁבְעָה֙ לְחַטָּ֔את עַל־הַמַּמְלָכָ֥ה וְעַל־הַמִּקְדָּ֖שׁ וְעַל־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לִבְנֵ֤י אַֽהֲרֹן֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים לְהַעֲל֖וֹת עַל־מִזְבַּ֥ח יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They brought seven bulls and seven rams and seven lambs and seven he-goats as a sin offering for the kingdom and for the Sanctuary and for Judah. He ordered the Aaronite priests to offer them on the altar of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaviyu fariym-shiveah veeyliym shiveah ukhevashiym shiveah utsefiyrey iziym shiveah lechatat al-hamamelakhah veal-hamikedash veal-yehudah vayomer liveney aharon hakhohaniym lehaalvot al-mizevach yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁחֲטוּ֙ הַבָּקָ֔ר וַיְקַבְּל֤וּ הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַֽיִּזְרְק֖וּ הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וַיִּשְׁחֲט֣וּ הָאֵלִ֗ים וַיִּזְרְק֤וּ הַדָּם֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה וַֽיִּשְׁחֲטוּ֙ הַכְּבָשִׂ֔ים וַיִּזְרְק֥וּ הַדָּ֖ם הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translated: The cattle were slaughtered, and the priests received the blood and dashed it against the altar; the rams were slaughtered and the blood was dashed against the altar; the lambs were slaughtered and the blood was dashed against the altar.
Transliteration: vayishechatu havakar vayekavelu hakhohaniym et-hadam vayizereku hamizevechah vayishechatu haeliym vayizereku hadam hamizevechah vayishechatu hakhevashiym vayizereku hadam hamizevechah

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֙ישׁוּ֙ אֶת־שְׂעִירֵ֣י הַחַטָּ֔את לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְהַקָּהָ֑ל וַיִּסְמְכ֥וּ יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The he-goats for the sin offering were presented to the king and the congregation, who laid their hands upon them.
Transliteration: vayagiyshu et-sheiyrey hachatat lifeney hamelekhe vehakahal vayisemekhu yedeyhem aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָטוּם֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וַֽיְחַטְּא֤וּ אֶת־דָּמָם֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֤י לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הָעוֹלָ֖ה וְהַחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: The priests slaughtered them and performed the purgation rite with the blood against the altar, to expiate for all Israel, for the king had designated the burnt offering and the sin offering to be for all Israel.
Transliteration: vayishechatum hakhohaniym vayechateu et-damam hamizevechah lekhafer al-khׇl-yisherael khiy lekhׇl-yisherael amar hamelekhe havolah vehachatat

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֨ד אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֜ם בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֗ה בִּמְצִלְתַּ֙יִם֙ בִּנְבָלִ֣ים וּבְכִנֹּר֔וֹת בְּמִצְוַ֥ת דָּוִ֛יד וְגָ֥ד חֹזֵֽה־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְנָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֑יא כִּ֧י בְיַד־יְהֹוָ֛ה הַמִּצְוָ֖ה בְּיַד־נְבִיאָֽיו׃
Translated: He stationed the Levites in the House of the L<small>ORD</small> with cymbals and harps and lyres, as David and Gad the king’s seer and Nathan the prophet had ordained, for the ordinance was by the L<small>ORD</small> through His prophets.
Transliteration: vayaamed et-haleviyim veyt yehovah vimetsiletayiim vinevaliym uvekhinorvot vemitsevat daviyd vegad chozeh-hamelekhe venatan hanaviy khiy veyad-yehovah hamitsevah veyad-neviyayv

Hebrew: וַיַּעַמְד֤וּ הַלְוִיִּם֙ בִּכְלֵ֣י דָוִ֔יד וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בַּחֲצֹצְרֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: When the Levites were in place with the instruments of David, and the priests with their trumpets,
Transliteration: vayaamedu haleviyim vikheley daviyd vehakhohaniym vachatsotservot {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ חִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ לְהַעֲל֥וֹת הָעֹלָ֖ה לְהַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וּבְעֵ֞ת הֵחֵ֣ל הָעוֹלָ֗ה הֵחֵ֤ל שִׁיר־יְהֹוָה֙ וְהַחֲצֹ֣צְר֔וֹת וְעַ֨ל־יְדֵ֔י כְּלֵ֖י דָּוִ֥יד מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Hezekiah gave the order to offer the burnt offering on the altar. When the burnt offering began, the song of the L<small>ORD</small> and the trumpets began also, together with the instruments of King David of Israel.
Transliteration: vayomer chizekiyahu lehaalvot haolah lehamizevecha uveet hechel havolah hechel shiyr-yehovah vehachatsotservot veal-yedey kheley daviyd melekhe-yisherael

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַקָּהָל֙ מִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֔ים וְהַשִּׁ֣יר מְשׁוֹרֵ֔ר וְהַחֲצֹצְר֖וֹת (מחצצרים) [מַחְצְרִ֑ים] הַכֹּ֕ל עַ֖ד לִכְל֥וֹת הָעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: All the congregation prostrated themselves, the song was sung and the trumpets were blown—all this until the end of the burnt offering.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hakahal mishetachaviym vehashiyr meshvorer vehachatsotservot (mchtstsrym) [machetseriym] hakhol ad likhelvot haolah

Hebrew: וּכְכַלּ֖וֹת לְהַעֲל֑וֹת כָּֽרְע֗וּ הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְכׇֽל־הַנִּמְצְאִ֥ים אִתּ֖וֹ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
Translated: When the offering was finished, the king and all who were there with him knelt and prostrated themselves.
Transliteration: ukhekhalvot lehaalvot khareu hamelekhe vekhׇl-hanimetseiym itvo vayishetachavu

Hebrew: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר יְחִזְקִיָּ֨הוּ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וְהַשָּׂרִים֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְהַלֵּל֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּדִבְרֵ֥י דָוִ֖יד וְאָסָ֣ף הַחֹזֶ֑ה וַֽיְהַלְלוּ֙ עַד־לְשִׂמְחָ֔ה וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: King Hezekiah and the officers ordered the Levites to praise the L<small>ORD</small> in the words of David and Asaph the seer; so they praised rapturously, and they bowed and prostrated themselves.
Transliteration: vayomer yechizekiyahu hamelekhe vehashariym laleviyim lehalel layhovah vediverey daviyd veasaf hachozeh vayehalelu ad-leshimechah vayikedu vayishetachavu {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן יְחִזְקִיָּ֜הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר עַתָּה֙ מִלֵּאתֶ֤ם יֶדְכֶם֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה גֹּ֧שׁוּ וְהָבִ֛יאוּ זְבָחִ֥ים וְתוֹד֖וֹת לְבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּבִ֤יאוּ הַקָּהָל֙ זְבָחִ֣ים וְתוֹד֔וֹת וְכׇל־נְדִ֥יב לֵ֖ב עֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Then Hezekiah said, “Now you have consecrated yourselves to the L<small>ORD</small>; come, bring sacrifices of well-being and thanksgiving to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.” The congregation brought sacrifices of well-being and thanksgiving, and all who felt so moved brought burnt offerings.
Transliteration: vayaan yechizekiyahu vayomer atah miletem yedekhem layhovah goshu vehaviyu zevachiym vetvodvot leveyt yehovah vayaviyu hakahal zevachiym vetvodvot vekhׇl-nediyv lev olvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י מִסְפַּ֣ר הָעֹלָה֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵבִ֣יאוּ הַקָּהָל֒ בָּקָ֣ר שִׁבְעִ֔ים אֵילִ֥ים מֵאָ֖ה כְּבָשִׂ֣ים מָאתָ֑יִם לְעֹלָ֥ה לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה כׇּל־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: The number of burnt offerings that the congregation brought was 70 cattle, 100 rams, 200 lambs—all these for burnt offerings to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy misefar haolah asher heviyu hakahal vakar shiveiym eyliym meah khevashiym matayiim leolah layhovah khׇl-eleh

Hebrew: וְֽהַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים בָּקָר֙ שֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וְצֹ֖אן שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: The sacred offerings were 600 large cattle and 3,000 small cattle.
Transliteration: vehakodashiym vakar shesh mevot vetson sheloshet alafiym

Hebrew: רַ֤ק הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ הָי֣וּ לִמְעָ֔ט וְלֹ֣א יָכְל֔וּ לְהַפְשִׁ֖יט אֶת־כׇּל־הָעֹל֑וֹת וַֽיְחַזְּק֞וּם אֲחֵיהֶ֣ם הַלְוִיִּ֗ם עַד־כְּל֤וֹת הַמְּלָאכָה֙ וְעַ֣ד יִתְקַדְּשׁ֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים כִּ֤י הַלְוִיִּם֙ יִשְׁרֵ֣י לֵבָ֔ב לְהִתְקַדֵּ֖שׁ מֵהַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: The priests were too few to be able to flay all the burnt offerings, so their kinsmen, the Levites, reinforced them till the end of the work, and till the [rest of the] priests sanctified themselves. (The Levites were more conscientious about sanctifying themselves than the priests.)
Transliteration: rak hakhohaniym hayu limeat velo yakhelu lehafeshiyt et-khׇl-haolvot vayechazekum acheyhem haleviyim ad-khelvot hamelakhah vead yitekadeshu hakhohaniym khiy haleviyim yisherey levav lehitekadesh mehakhohaniym

Hebrew: וְגַם־עֹלָ֨ה לָרֹ֜ב בְּחֶלְבֵ֧י הַשְּׁלָמִ֛ים וּבַנְּסָכִ֖ים לָֽעֹלָ֑ה וַתִּכּ֖וֹן עֲבוֹדַ֥ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: For beside the large number of burnt offerings, there were the fat parts of the sacrifices of well-being and the libations for the burnt offerings; so the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> was properly accomplished.
Transliteration: vegam-olah larov vechelevey hashelamiym uvanesakhiym laolah vatikhvon avvodat veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמַ֤ח יְחִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ וְכׇל־הָעָ֔ם עַ֛ל הַהֵכִ֥ין הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לָעָ֑ם כִּ֥י בְּפִתְאֹ֖ם הָיָ֥ה הַדָּבָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced over what God had enabled the people to accomplish, because it had happened so suddenly.
Transliteration: vayishemach yechizekiyahu vekhׇl-haam al hahekhiyn haElohim laam khiy vefiteom hayah hadavar {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יְחִזְקִיָּ֜הוּ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וִיהוּדָ֗ה וְגַֽם־אִגְּרוֹת֙ כָּתַב֙ עַל־אֶפְרַ֣יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לָב֥וֹא לְבֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת פֶּ֔סַח לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Hezekiah sent word to all Israel and Judah; he also wrote letters to Ephraim and Manasseh to come to the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in Jerusalem to keep the Passover for the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel.
Transliteration: vayishelach yechizekiyahu al-khׇl-yisherael viyhudah vegam-igervot khatav al-eferayiim umenasheh lavvo leveyt-yehovah viyrushala͏im laashvot fesach layhovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֨ץ הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ וְשָׂרָ֛יו וְכׇל־הַקָּהָ֖ל בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הַפֶּ֖סַח בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: The king and his officers and the congregation in Jerusalem had agreed to keep the Passover in the second month,
Transliteration: vayivaats hamelekhe vesharayv vekhׇl-hakahal viyrushala͏im laashvot hafesach vachodesh hasheniy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֧א יָכְל֛וּ לַעֲשֹׂת֖וֹ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑יא כִּ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לֹֽא־הִתְקַדְּשׁ֣וּ לְמַדַּ֔י וְהָעָ֖ם לֹא־נֶאֶסְפ֥וּ לִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: for at the time, they were unable to keep it, for not enough priests had sanctified themselves, nor had the people assembled in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy lo yakhelu laashotvo vaet hahiy khiy hakhohaniym lo-hitekadeshu lemaday vehaam lo-neesefu liyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּישַׁ֥ר הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וּבְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־הַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: The king and the whole congregation thought it proper
Transliteration: vayiyshar hadavar veeyney hamelekhe uveeyney khׇl-hakahal

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִ֣ידוּ דָבָ֗ר לְהַעֲבִ֨יר ק֤וֹל בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִבְּאֵֽר־שֶׁ֣בַע וְעַד־דָּ֔ן לָב֞וֹא לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת פֶּ֛סַח לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּ֣י לֹ֥א לָרֹ֛ב עָשׂ֖וּ כַּכָּתֽוּב׃
Translated: to issue a decree and proclaim throughout all Israel from Beer-sheba to Dan that they come and keep the Passover for the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel in Jerusalem—not often did they act in accord with what was written.
Transliteration: vayaamiydu davar lehaaviyr kvol vekhׇl-yisherael miveer-sheva vead-dan lavvo laashvot fesach layhovah elohey-yisherael viyrushala͏im khiy lo larov ashu khakhatuv

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ֩ הָרָצִ֨ים בָּאִגְּר֜וֹת מִיַּ֧ד הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ וְשָׂרָ֗יו בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וּכְמִצְוַ֥ת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֑ר בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שׁ֚וּבוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אַבְרָהָם֙ יִצְחָ֣ק וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיָשֹׁב֙ אֶל־הַפְּלֵיטָ֔ה הַנִּשְׁאֶ֣רֶת לָכֶ֔ם מִכַּ֖ף מַלְכֵ֥י אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: The couriers went out with the letters from the king and his officers through all Israel and Judah, by order of the king, proclaiming, “O you Israelites! Return to the L<small>ORD</small> God of your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and He will return to the remnant of you who escaped from the hand of the kings of Assyria.
Transliteration: vayelekhu haratsiym vaigervot miyad hamelekhe vesharayv vekhׇl-yisherael viyhudah ukhemitsevat hamelekhe lemor veney yisherael shuvu el-yehovah elohey averaham yitsechak veyisherael veyashov el-hafeleytah hanisheeret lakhem mikhaf malekhey ashur

Hebrew: וְאַל־תִּֽהְי֗וּ כַּאֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ וְכַ֣אֲחֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָעֲל֔וּ בַּיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּתְּנֵ֣ם לְשַׁמָּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אַתֶּ֥ם רֹאִֽים׃
Translated: Do not be like your fathers and brothers who trespassed against the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers and He turned them into a horror, as you see.
Transliteration: veal-tiheyu khaavvoteykhem vekhaacheykhem asher maalu vayhovah elohey avvoteyhem vayitenem leshamah khaasher atem roiym

Hebrew: עַתָּ֕ה אַל־תַּקְשׁ֥וּ עׇרְפְּכֶ֖ם כַּאֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם תְּנוּ־יָ֣ד לַיהֹוָ֗ה וּבֹ֤אוּ לְמִקְדָּשׁוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְדִּ֣ישׁ לְעוֹלָ֔ם וְעִבְדוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם וְיָשֹׁ֥ב מִכֶּ֖ם חֲר֥וֹן אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now do not be stiffnecked like your fathers; submit yourselves to the L<small>ORD</small> and come to His sanctuary, which He consecrated forever, and serve the L<small>ORD</small> your God so that His anger may turn back from you.
Transliteration: atah al-takeshu ׇrefekhem khaavvoteykhem tenu-yad layhovah uvou lemikedashvo asher hikediysh levolam veivedu et-yehovah eloheykhem veyashov mikhem charvon afvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְשׁוּבְכֶ֞ם עַל־יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲחֵיכֶ֨ם וּבְנֵיכֶ֤ם לְרַֽחֲמִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י שֽׁוֹבֵיהֶ֔ם וְלָשׁ֖וּב לָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את כִּֽי־חַנּ֤וּן וְרַחוּם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־יָסִ֤יר פָּנִים֙ מִכֶּ֔ם אִם־תָּשׁ֖וּבוּ אֵלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: If you return to the L<small>ORD</small>, your brothers and children will be regarded with compassion by their captors, and will return to this land; for the L<small>ORD</small> your God is gracious and merciful; He will not turn His face from you if you return to Him.”
Transliteration: khiy veshuvekhem al-yehovah acheykhem uveneykhem lerachamiym lifeney shvoveyhem velashuv laarets hazot khiy-chanun verachum yehovah eloheykhem velo-yasiyr faniym mikhem im-tashuvu elayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֨וּ הָרָצִ֜ים עֹבְרִ֨ים מֵעִ֧יר <small>׀</small> לָעִ֛יר בְּאֶרֶץ־אֶפְרַ֥יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְעַד־זְבֻל֑וּן וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ מַשְׂחִיקִ֣ים עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וּמַלְעִגִ֖ים בָּֽם׃
Translated: As the couriers passed from town to town in the land of Ephraim and Manasseh till they reached Zebulun, they were laughed at and mocked.
Transliteration: vayiheyu haratsiym overiym meiyr <small></small> laiyr veerets-eferayiim umenasheh vead-zevulun vayiheyu mashechiykiym aleyhem umaleigiym vam

Hebrew: אַךְ־אֲנָשִׁ֛ים מֵאָשֵׁ֥ר וּמְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וּמִזְּבֻל֑וּן נִֽכְנְע֔וּ וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ לִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Some of the people of Asher and Manasseh and Zebulun, however, were contrite, and came to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: akhe-anashiym measher umenasheh umizevulun nikheneu vayavou liyrushala͏im

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם בִּיהוּדָ֗ה הָֽיְתָה֙ יַ֣ד הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם לֵ֣ב אֶחָ֑ד לַעֲשׂ֞וֹת מִצְוַ֥ת הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְהַשָּׂרִ֖ים בִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The hand of God was on Judah, too, making them of a single mind to carry out the command of the king and officers concerning the ordinance of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: gam viyhudah hayetah yad haElohim latet lahem lev echad laashvot mitsevat hamelekhe vehashariym videvar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָסְפ֤וּ יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ עַם־רָ֔ב לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת אֶת־חַ֥ג הַמַּצּ֖וֹת בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֑י קָהָ֖ל לָרֹ֥ב מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: A great crowd assembled at Jerusalem to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread in the second month, a very great congregation.
Transliteration: vayeasefu yerushala͏im am-rav laashvot et-chag hamatsvot vachodesh hasheniy kahal larov meod

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֕מוּ וַיָּסִ֙ירוּ֙ אֶת־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַֽמְקַטְּרוֹת֙ הֵסִ֔ירוּ וַיַּשְׁלִ֖יכוּ לְנַ֥חַל קִדְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: They set to and removed the altars that were in Jerusalem, and they removed all the incense stands and threw them into Wadi Kidron.
Transliteration: vayakumu vayasiyru et-hamizevechvot asher viyrushala͏im veet khׇl-hamekatervot hesiyru vayasheliykhu lenachal kidervon

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחֲט֣וּ הַפֶּ֔סַח בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֤ם נִכְלְמוּ֙ וַיִּֽתְקַדְּשׁ֔וּ וַיָּבִ֥יאוּ עֹל֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They slaughtered the paschal sacrifice on the fourteenth of the second month. The priests and Levites were ashamed, and they sanctified themselves and brought burnt offerings to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayishechatu hafesach vearevaah ashar lachodesh hasheniy vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim nikhelemu vayitekadeshu vayaviyu olvot veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעַמְד֤וּ עַל־עׇמְדָם֙ כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֔ם כְּתוֹרַ֖ת מֹשֶׁ֣ה אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ זֹרְקִ֣ים אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם מִיַּ֖ד הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: They took their stations, as was their rule according to the Teaching of Moses, man of God. The priests dashed the blood [which they received] from the Levites.
Transliteration: vayaamedu al-ׇmedam khemishefatam khetvorat mosheh iysh-haElohim hakhohaniym zorekiym et-hadam miyad haleviyim

Hebrew: כִּי־רַבַּ֥ת בַּקָּהָ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־הִתְקַדָּ֑שׁוּ וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם עַל־שְׁחִיטַ֣ת הַפְּסָחִ֗ים לְכֹל֙ לֹ֣א טָה֔וֹר לְהַקְדִּ֖ישׁ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Since many in the congregation had not sanctified themselves, the Levites were in charge of slaughtering the paschal sacrifice for everyone who was not clean, so as to consecrate them to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy-ravat vakahal asher lo-hitekadashu vehaleviyim al-shechiytat hafesachiym lekhol lo tahvor lehakediysh layhovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מַרְבִּ֣ית הָעָ֡ם רַ֠בַּ֠ת מֵאֶפְרַ֨יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֜ה יִשָּׂשכָ֤ר וּזְבֻלוּן֙ לֹ֣א הִטֶּהָ֔רוּ כִּֽי־אָכְל֥וּ אֶת־הַפֶּ֖סַח בְּלֹ֣א כַכָּת֑וּב כִּי֩ הִתְפַּלֵּ֨ל יְחִזְקִיָּ֤הוּ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָ֥ה הַטּ֖וֹב יְכַפֵּ֥ר בְּעַֽד׃
Translated: For most of the people—many from Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun—had not purified themselves, yet they ate the paschal sacrifice in violation of what was written. Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, “The good L<small>ORD</small> will provide atonement for
Transliteration: khiy mareviyt haam ravat meeferayiim umenasheh yishashkhar uzevulun lo hiteharu khiy-akhelu et-hafesach velo khakhatuv khiy hitefalel yechizekiyahu aleyhem lemor yehovah hatvov yekhafer vead

Hebrew: כׇּל־לְבָב֣וֹ הֵכִ֔ין לִדְר֛וֹשׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֥ים ׀ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבוֹתָ֑יו וְלֹ֖א כְּטׇהֳרַ֥ת הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: everyone who set his mind on worshiping God, the L<small>ORD</small> God of his fathers, even if he is not purified for the sanctuary.”
Transliteration: khׇl-levavvo hekhiyn lidervosh haElohim yehovah elohey avvotayv velo khetׇhorat hakodesh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְחִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ וַיִּרְפָּ֖א אֶת־הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> heard Hezekiah and healed the people.
Transliteration: vayishema yehovah el-yechizekiyahu vayirefa et-haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל הַנִּמְצְאִ֨ים בִּירוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם אֶת־חַ֧ג הַמַּצּ֛וֹת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים בְּשִׂמְחָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וּֽמְהַלְלִ֣ים לַ֠יהֹוָ֠ה י֣וֹם ׀ בְּי֞וֹם הַלְוִיִּ֧ם וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים בִּכְלֵי־עֹ֖ז לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The Israelites who were in Jerusalem kept the Feast of Unleavened Bread seven days, with great rejoicing, the Levites and the priests praising the L<small>ORD</small> daily with powerful instruments for the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-yisherael hanimetseiym viyrushala͏im et-chag hamatsvot shiveat yamiym veshimechah gedvolah umehaleliym layhovah yvom veyvom haleviyim vehakhohaniym vikheley-oz layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְחִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ עַל־לֵב֙ כׇּל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם הַמַּשְׂכִּילִ֥ים שֵֽׂכֶל־ט֖וֹב לַיהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּאכְל֤וּ אֶת־הַמּוֹעֵד֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֔ים מְזַבְּחִים֙ זִבְחֵ֣י שְׁלָמִ֔ים וּמִ֨תְוַדִּ֔ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezekiah persuaded all the Levites who performed skillfully for the L<small>ORD</small> to spend the seven days of the festival making offerings of well-being, and confessing to the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayedaver yechizekiyahu al-lev khׇl-haleviyim hamashekhiyliym shekhel-tvov layhovah vayokhelu et-hamvoed shiveat hayamiym mezavechiym zivechey shelamiym umitevadiym layhovah elohey avvoteyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּֽעֲצוּ֙ כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֔ל לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ שִׁבְעַת־יָמִ֖ים שִׂמְחָֽה׃
Translated: All the congregation resolved to keep seven more days, so they kept seven more days of rejoicing.
Transliteration: vayivaatsu khׇl-hakahal laashvot shiveat yamiym acheriym vayaashu shiveat-yamiym shimechah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י חִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־יְ֠הוּדָ֠ה הֵרִ֨ים לַקָּהָ֜ל אֶ֣לֶף פָּרִים֮ וְשִׁבְעַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֣ים צֹאן֒ {ס} וְהַשָּׂרִ֞ים הֵרִ֤ימוּ לַקָּהָל֙ פָּרִ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף וְצֹ֖אן עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֑ים וַיִּֽתְקַדְּשׁ֥וּ כֹהֲנִ֖ים לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: King Hezekiah of Judah contributed to the congregation 1,000 bulls and 7,000 sheep. And the officers contributed to the congregation 1,000 bulls and 10,000 sheep. And the priests sanctified themselves in large numbers.
Transliteration: khiy chizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah heriym lakahal elef fariym veshiveat alafiym tson {s} vehashariym heriymu lakahal fariym elef vetson asheret alafiym vayitekadeshu khohaniym larov

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׂמְח֣וּ ׀ כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יְהוּדָ֗ה וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְכׇל־הַקָּהָ֖ל הַבָּאִ֣ים מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהַגֵּרִ֗ים הַבָּאִים֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהַיּוֹשְׁבִ֖ים בִּיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: All the congregation of Judah and the priests and the Levites and all the congregation that came from Israel, and the resident aliens who came from the land of Israel and who lived in Judah, rejoiced.
Transliteration: vayishemechu khׇl-kehal yehudah vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim vekhׇl-hakahal havaiym miyisherael vehageriym havaiym meerets yisherael vehayyvosheviym viyhudah

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֥י שִׂמְחָֽה־גְדוֹלָ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כִּ֠י מִימֵ֞י שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה בֶן־דָּוִיד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א כָזֹ֖את בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: There was great rejoicing in Jerusalem, for since the time of King Solomon son of David of Israel nothing like it had happened in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vatehiy shimechah-gedvolah viyrushala͏im khiy miymey shelomoh ven-daviyd melekhe yisherael lo khazot viyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֜מוּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים הַלְוִיִּם֙ וַיְבָרְכ֣וּ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַיִּשָּׁמַ֖ע בְּקוֹלָ֑ם וַתָּב֧וֹא תְפִלָּתָ֛ם לִמְע֥וֹן קׇדְשׁ֖וֹ לַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: The Levite priests rose and blessed the people, and their voice was heard, and their prayer went up to His holy abode, to heaven.
Transliteration: vayakumu hakhohaniym haleviyim vayevarekhu et-haam vayishama vekvolam vatavvo tefilatam limevon kׇdeshvo lashamayiim {f}

Hebrew: וּכְכַלּ֣וֹת כׇּל־זֹ֗את יָצְא֨וּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל הַֽנִּמְצְאִים֮ לְעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָה֒ וַיְשַׁבְּר֣וּ הַמַּצֵּב֣וֹת וַיְגַדְּע֣וּ הָאֲשֵׁרִ֡ים וַיְנַתְּצ֣וּ אֶת־הַ֠בָּמ֠וֹת וְאֶת־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֞וֹת מִכׇּל־יְהוּדָ֧ה וּבִנְיָמִ֛ן וּבְאֶפְרַ֥יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֖ה עַד־לְכַלֵּ֑ה וַיָּשׁ֜וּבוּ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אִ֥ישׁ לַאֲחֻזָּת֖וֹ לְעָרֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: When all this was finished, all Israel who were present went out into the towns of Judah and smashed the pillars, cut down the sacred posts, demolished the shrines and altars throughout Judah and Benjamin, and throughout Ephraim and Manasseh, to the very last one. Then all the Israelites returned to their towns, each to his possession.
Transliteration: ukhekhalvot khׇl-zot yatseu khׇl-yisherael hanimetseiym learey yehudah vayeshaveru hamatsevvot vayegadeu haasheriym vayenatetsu et-havamvot veet-hamizevechvot mikhׇl-yehudah uvineyamin uveeferayiim umenasheh ad-lekhaleh vayashuvu khׇl-veney yisherael iysh laachuzatvo leareyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֣ד יְחִזְקִיָּ֡הוּ אֶת־מַחְלְק֣וֹת הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְ֠הַלְוִיִּ֠ם עַֽל־מַחְלְקוֹתָ֞ם אִ֣ישׁ ׀ כְּפִ֣י עֲבֹדָת֗וֹ לַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְלַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְעֹלָ֖ה וְלִשְׁלָמִ֑ים לְשָׁרֵת֙ וּלְהֹד֣וֹת וּלְהַלֵּ֔ל בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֖י מַחֲנ֥וֹת יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezekiah reconstituted the divisions of the priests and Levites, each man of the priests and Levites according to his office, for the burnt offerings, the offerings of well-being, to minister, and to sing hymns and praises in the gates of the courts of the L<small>ORD</small>;
Transliteration: vayaamed yechizekiyahu et-machelekvot hakhohaniym vehaleviyim al-machelekvotam iysh khefiy avodatvo lakhohaniym velaleviyim leolah velishelamiym lesharet ulehodvot ulehalel veshaarey machanvot yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וּמְנָת֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ מִן־רְכוּשׁ֜וֹ לָעֹל֗וֹת לְעֹלוֹת֙ הַבֹּ֣קֶר וְהָעֶ֔רֶב וְהָ֣עֹל֔וֹת לַשַּׁבָּת֖וֹת וְלֶחֳדָשִׁ֣ים וְלַמֹּעֲדִ֑ים כַּכָּת֖וּב בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: also the king’s portion, from his property, for the burnt offerings—the morning and evening burnt offering, and the burnt offerings for sabbaths, and new moons, and festivals, as prescribed in the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: umenat hamelekhe min-rekhushvo laolvot leolvot havoker vehaerev vehaolvot lashavatvot velechodashiym velamoadiym khakhatuv vetvorat yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָעָם֙ לְיוֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לָתֵ֕ת מְנָ֥ת הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֑ם לְמַ֥עַן יֶחֶזְק֖וּ בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He ordered the people, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to deliver the portions of the priests and the Levites, so that they might devote themselves to the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer laam leyvoshevey yerushala͏im latet menat hakhohaniym vehaleviyim lemaan yechezeku vetvorat yehovah

Hebrew: וְכִפְרֹ֣ץ הַדָּבָ֗ר הִרְבּ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ רֵאשִׁ֣ית דָּגָ֗ן תִּיר֤וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָר֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ וְכֹ֖ל תְּבוּאַ֣ת שָׂדֶ֑ה וּמַעְשַׂ֥ר הַכֹּ֛ל לָרֹ֖ב הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translated: When the word spread, the Israelites brought large quantities of grain, wine, oil, honey, and all kinds of agricultural produce, and tithes of all, in large amounts.
Transliteration: vekhiferots hadavar hirevu veney-yisherael reshiyt dagan tiyrvosh veyitsehar udevash vekhol tevuat shadeh umaeshar hakhol larov heviyu

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וִיהוּדָ֗ה הַיּוֹשְׁבִים֮ בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָה֒ גַּם־הֵ֗ם מַעְשַׂ֤ר בָּקָר֙ וָצֹ֔אן וּמַעְשַׂ֣ר קׇֽדָשִׁ֔ים הַמְקֻדָּשִׁ֖ים לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם הֵבִ֕יאוּ וַֽיִּתְּנ֖וּ עֲרֵמ֥וֹת עֲרֵמֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: The men of Israel and Judah living in the towns of Judah—they too brought tithes of cattle and sheep and tithes of sacred things consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small> their God, piling them in heaps.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael viyhudah hayyvosheviym vearey yehudah gam-hem maeshar vakar vatson umaeshar kׇdashiym hamekudashiym layhovah eloheyhem heviyu vayitenu aremvot aremvot {s}

Hebrew: בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֔י הֵחֵ֥לּוּ הָעֲרֵמ֖וֹת לְיִסּ֑וֹד וּבַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י כִּלּֽוּ׃ {ס}
