Translated: In the third month the heaps began to accumulate, and were finished in the seventh month.
Transliteration: vachodesh hashelishiy hechelu haaremvot leyisvod uvachodesh hasheviyiy khilu {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ וְהַשָּׂרִ֔ים וַיִּרְא֖וּ אֶת־הָעֲרֵמ֑וֹת וַֽיְבָרְכוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת עַמּ֥וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: When Hezekiah and the officers came and saw the heaps, they blessed the L<small>ORD</small> and his people Israel.
Transliteration: vayavou yechizekiyahu vehashariym vayireu et-haaremvot vayevarekhu et-yehovah veet amvo yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּדְרֹ֣שׁ יְחִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ עַל־הַכֹּ֥הֲנִ֛ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֖ם עַל־הָעֲרֵמֽוֹת׃
Translated: Hezekiah asked the priests and Levites about the heaps.
Transliteration: vayiderosh yechizekiyahu al-hakhohaniym vehaleviyim al-haaremvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו עֲזַרְיָ֧הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן הָרֹ֖אשׁ לְבֵ֣ית צָד֑וֹק וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר מֵהָחֵ֨ל הַתְּרוּמָ֜ה לָבִ֣יא בֵית־יְהֹוָ֗ה אָכ֨וֹל וְשָׂב֤וֹעַ וְהוֹתֵר֙ עַד־לָר֔וֹב כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ בֵּרַ֣ךְ אֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ וְהַנּוֹתָ֖ר אֶת־הֶהָמ֥וֹן הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The chief priest Azariah, of the house of Zadok, replied to him, saying, “Ever since the gifts began to be brought to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, people have been eating to satiety and leaving over in great amounts, for the L<small>ORD</small> has blessed His people; this huge amount is left over!”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv azareyahu hakhohen harosh leveyt tsadvok vayomer mehachel haterumah laviy veyt-yehovah akhvol veshavvoa vehvoter ad-larvov khiy yehovah verakhe et-amvo vehanvotar et-hehamvon hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְחִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ לְהָכִ֧ין לְשָׁכ֛וֹת בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיָּכִֽינוּ׃
Translated: Hezekiah then gave orders to prepare store-chambers in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>; and they were prepared.
Transliteration: vayomer yechizekiyahu lehakhiyn leshakhvot veveyt yehovah vayakhiynu

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֨יאוּ אֶת־הַתְּרוּמָ֧ה וְהַֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֛ר וְהַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים בֶּאֱמוּנָ֑ה וַעֲלֵיהֶ֤ם נָגִיד֙ (כונניהו) [כׇּֽנַנְיָ֣הוּ] הַלֵּוִ֔י וְשִׁמְעִ֥י אָחִ֖יהוּ מִשְׁנֶֽה׃
Translated: They brought in the gifts and the tithes and the sacred things faithfully. Their supervisor was Conaniah the Levite, and Shimei his brother was second in rank.
Transliteration: vayaviyu et-haterumah vehamaasher vehakodashiym veemunah vaaleyhem nagiyd (khvnnyhv) [khׇnaneyahu] haleviy veshimeiy achiyhu misheneh

Hebrew: וִיחִיאֵ֡ל וַ֠עֲזַזְיָ֠הוּ וְנַ֨חַת וַעֲשָׂהאֵ֜ל וִירִימ֤וֹת וְיֽוֹזָבָד֙ וֶאֱלִיאֵ֣ל וְיִסְמַכְיָ֔הוּ וּמַ֖חַת וּבְנָיָ֑הוּ פְּקִידִ֗ים מִיַּ֤ד (כונניהו) [כׇּֽנַנְיָ֙הוּ֙] וְשִׁמְעִ֣י אָחִ֔יו בְּמִפְקַד֙ יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַעֲזַרְיָ֖הוּ נְגִ֥יד בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Jehiel and Azaziah and Nahath and Asahel and Jerimoth and Jozabad and Eliel and Ismachiah and Mahath and Benaiah were commissioners under Conaniah and Shimei his brother by appointment of King Hezekiah; Azariah was supervisor of the House of God.
Transliteration: viychiyel vaazazeyahu venachat vaashahel viyriymvot veyvozavad veeliyel veyisemakheyahu umachat uvenayahu fekiydiym miyad (khvnnyhv) [khׇnaneyahu] veshimeiy achiyv vemifekad yechizekiyahu hamelekhe vaazareyahu negiyd veyt-haElohim

Hebrew: וְקוֹרֵ֨א בֶן־יִמְנָ֤ה הַלֵּוִי֙ הַשּׁוֹעֵ֣ר לַמִּזְרָ֔חָה עַ֖ל נִדְב֣וֹת הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים לָתֵת֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה וְקׇדְשֵׁ֖י הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Kore son of Imnah the Levite, the keeper of the East Gate, was in charge of the freewill offerings to God, of the allocation of gifts to the L<small>ORD</small>, and the most sacred things.
Transliteration: vekvore ven-yimenah haleviy hashvoer lamizerachah al nidevvot haElohim latet terumat yehovah vekׇdeshey hakodashiym

Hebrew: וְעַל־יָד֡וֹ עֵ֣דֶן וּ֠מִנְיָמִ֠ן וְיֵשׁ֨וּעַ וּֽשְׁמַעְיָ֜הוּ אֲמַרְיָ֧הוּ וּשְׁכַנְיָ֛הוּ בְּעָרֵ֥י הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בֶּאֱמוּנָ֑ה לָתֵ֤ת לַֽאֲחֵיהֶם֙ בְּמַחְלְק֔וֹת כַּגָּד֖וֹל כַּקָּטָֽן׃
Translated: Under him were Eden, Miniamin, Jeshua, Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah, in offices of trust in the priestly towns, making allocation to their brothers by divisions, to great and small alike;
Transliteration: veal-yadvo eden umineyamin veeishua ushemaeyahu amareyahu ushekhaneyahu vearey hakhohaniym veemunah latet laacheyhem vemachelekvot khagadvol khakatan

Hebrew: מִלְּבַ֞ד הִתְיַחְשָׂ֣ם לִזְכָרִ֗ים מִבֶּ֨ן שָׁל֤וֹשׁ שָׁנִים֙ וּלְמַ֔עְלָה לְכׇל־הַבָּ֥א לְבֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה לִדְבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֑וֹ לַעֲב֣וֹדָתָ֔ם בְּמִשְׁמְרוֹתָ֖ם כְּמַחְלְקוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: besides allocating their daily rations to those males registered by families from three years old and up, all who entered the House of the L<small>ORD</small> according to their service and their shift by division;
Transliteration: milevad hiteyachesham lizekhariym miven shalvosh shaniym ulemaelah lekhׇl-hava leveyt-yehovah lidevar-yvom veyvomvo laavvodatam vemishemervotam khemachelekvoteyhem

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת הִתְיַחֵ֤שׂ הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וְהַ֨לְוִיִּ֔ם מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּלְמָ֑עְלָה בְּמִשְׁמְרוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם בְּמַחְלְקוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: and in charge of the registry of priests by clans, and of the Levites, from twenty years old and up, by shifts, in their divisions;
Transliteration: veet hiteyachesh hakhohaniym leveyt avvoteyhem vehaleviyim miven esheriym shanah ulemaelah vemishemervoteyhem vemachelekvoteyhem

Hebrew: וּלְהִתְיַחֵ֗שׂ בְּכׇל־טַפָּ֛ם נְשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֥ם וּבְנוֹתֵיהֶ֖ם לְכׇל־קָהָ֑ל כִּ֥י בֶאֱמוּנָתָ֖ם יִתְקַדְּשׁוּ־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: and the registry of the dependents of their whole company—wives, sons, and daughters—for, relying upon them, they sanctified themselves in holiness.
Transliteration: ulehiteyachesh vekhׇl-tafam nesheyhem uveneyhem uvenvoteyhem lekhׇl-kahal khiy veemunatam yitekadeshu-kodesh

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים בִּשְׂדֵ֨י מִגְרַ֤שׁ עָֽרֵיהֶם֙ בְּכׇל־עִ֣יר וָעִ֔יר אֲנָשִׁ֕ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִקְּב֖וּ בְּשֵׁמ֑וֹת לָתֵ֣ת מָנ֗וֹת לְכׇל־זָכָר֙ בַּכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וּלְכׇל־הִתְיַחֵ֖שׂ בַּלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: And for the Aaronite priests, in each and every one of their towns with adjoining fields, the above-named men were to allocate portions to every male of the priests and to every registered Levite.
Transliteration: veliveney aharon hakhohaniym vishedey migerash areyhem vekhׇl-iyr vaiyr anashiym asher nikevu veshemvot latet manvot lekhׇl-zakhar vakhohaniym ulekhׇl-hiteyachesh valeviyim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ כָּזֹ֛את יְחִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּכׇל־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַטּ֤וֹב וְהַיָּשָׁר֙ וְהָ֣אֱמֶ֔ת לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: Hezekiah did this throughout Judah. He acted in a way that was good, upright, and faithful before the L<small>ORD</small> his God.
Transliteration: vayaash khazot yechizekiyahu vekhׇl-yehudah vayaash hatvov vehayashar vehaemet lifeney yehovah elohayv

Hebrew: וּבְכׇֽל־מַעֲשֶׂ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵחֵ֣ל ׀ בַּעֲבוֹדַ֣ת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים וּבַתּוֹרָה֙ וּבַמִּצְוָ֔ה לִדְרֹ֖שׁ לֵאלֹהָ֑יו בְּכׇל־לְבָב֥וֹ עָשָׂ֖ה וְהִצְלִֽיחַ׃ {פ}
Translated: Every work he undertook in the service of the House of God or in the Teaching and the Commandment, to worship his God, he did with all his heart; and he prospered.
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-maasheh asher-hechel vaavvodat veyt-haElohim uvatvorah uvamitsevah liderosh lelohayv vekhׇl-levavvo ashah vehitseliycha {f}

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֨י הַדְּבָרִ֤ים וְהָֽאֱמֶת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה בָּ֖א סַנְחֵרִ֣יב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיָּבֹ֣א בִיהוּדָ֗ה וַיִּ֙חַן֙ עַל־הֶעָרִ֣ים הַבְּצֻר֔וֹת וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְבִקְעָ֥ם אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: After these faithful deeds, King Sennacherib of Assyria invaded Judah and encamped against its fortified towns with the aim of taking them over.
Transliteration: acharey hadevariym vehaemet haeleh va sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur vayavo viyhudah vayichan al-heariym havetsurvot vayomer levikeam elayv

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ יְחִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ כִּי־בָ֖א סַנְחֵרִ֑יב וּפָנָ֕יו לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: When Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib had come, intent on making war against Jerusalem,
Transliteration: vayare yechizekiyahu khiy-va sanecheriyv ufanayv lamilechamah al-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֗ץ עִם־שָׂרָיו֙ וְגִבֹּרָ֔יו לִסְתּוֹם֙ אֶת־מֵימֵ֣י הָעֲיָנ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֑יר וַֽיַּעְזְרֽוּהוּ׃
Translated: he consulted with his officers and warriors about stopping the flow of the springs outside the city, and they supported him.
Transliteration: vayivaats im-sharayv vegivorayv lisetvom et-meymey haayanvot asher michuts laiyr vayaezeruhu

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ עַם־רָ֔ב וַֽיִּסְתְּמוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמַּעְיָנ֔וֹת וְאֶת־הַנַּ֛חַל הַשּׁוֹטֵ֥ף בְּתוֹךְ־הָאָ֖רֶץ לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֤מָּה יָב֙וֹאוּ֙ מַלְכֵ֣י אַשּׁ֔וּר וּמָצְא֖וּ מַ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated: A large force was assembled to stop up all the springs and the wadi that flowed through the land, for otherwise, they thought, the king of Assyria would come and find water in abundance.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu am-rav vayisetemu et-khׇl-hamaeyanvot veet-hanachal hashvotef vetvokhe-haarets lemor lamah yavvou malekhey ashur umatseu mayiim raviym

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַזַּ֡ק וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ אֶת־כׇּל־הַחוֹמָ֨ה הַפְּרוּצָ֜ה וַיַּ֣עַל עַל־הַמִּגְדָּל֗וֹת וְלַח֙וּצָה֙ הַחוֹמָ֣ה אַחֶ֔רֶת וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק אֶת־הַמִּלּ֖וֹא עִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיַּ֥עַשׂ שֶׁ֛לַח לָרֹ֖ב וּמָגִנִּֽים׃
Translated: He acted with vigor, rebuilding the whole breached wall, raising towers on it, and building another wall outside it. He fortified the Millo of the City of David, and made a great quantity of arms and shields.
Transliteration: vayitechazak vayiven et-khׇl-hachvomah haferutsah vayaal al-hamigedalvot velachutsah hachvomah acheret vayechazek et-hamilvo iyr daviyd vayaash shelach larov umaginiym

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֛ן שָׂרֵ֥י מִלְחָמ֖וֹת עַל־הָעָ֑ם וַיִּקְבְּצֵ֣ם אֵלָ֗יו אֶל־רְחוֹב֙ שַׁ֣עַר הָעִ֔יר וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר עַל־לְבָבָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: He appointed battle officers over the people; then, gathering them to him in the square of the city gate, he rallied them, saying,
Transliteration: vayiten sharey milechamvot al-haam vayikevetsem elayv el-rechvov shaar haiyr vayedaver al-levavam lemor

Hebrew: חִזְק֣וּ וְאִמְצ֔וּ אַל־תִּֽירְא֣וּ וְאַל־תֵּחַ֗תּוּ מִפְּנֵי֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וּמִלִּפְנֵ֖י כׇּל־הֶהָמ֣וֹן אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־עִמָּ֥נוּ רַ֖ב מֵֽעִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Be strong and of good courage; do not be frightened or dismayed by the king of Assyria or by the horde that is with him, for we have more with us than he has with him.
Transliteration: chizeku veimetsu al-tiyreu veal-techatu mifeney melekhe ashur umilifeney khׇl-hehamvon asher-imvo khiy-imanu rav meimvo

Hebrew: עִמּוֹ֙ זְר֣וֹעַ בָּשָׂ֔ר וְעִמָּ֜נוּ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ לְעׇזְרֵ֔נוּ וּלְהִלָּחֵ֖ם מִלְחֲמֹתֵ֑נוּ וַיִּסָּמְכ֣וּ הָעָ֔ם עַל־דִּבְרֵ֖י יְחִזְקִיָּ֥הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: With him is an arm of flesh, but with us is the L<small>ORD</small> our God, to help us and to fight our battles.” The people were encouraged by the speech of King Hezekiah of Judah.
Transliteration: imvo zervoa vashar veimanu yehovah eloheynu leׇzerenu ulehilachem milechamotenu vayisamekhu haam al-diverey yechizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah {f}

Hebrew: אַ֣חַר זֶ֗ה שָׁ֠לַ֠ח סַנְחֵרִ֨יב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֤וּר עֲבָדָיו֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔יְמָה וְהוּא֙ עַל־לָכִ֔ישׁ וְכׇל־מֶמְשַׁלְתּ֖וֹ עִמּ֑וֹ עַל־יְחִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה וְעַל־כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Afterward, King Sennacherib of Assyria sent his officers to Jerusalem—he and all his staff being at Lachish—with this message to King Hezekiah of Judah and to all the people of Judah who were in Jerusalem:
Transliteration: achar zeh shalach sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur avadayv yerushalayemah vehu al-lakhiysh vekhׇl-memeshaletvo imvo al-yechizekiyahu melekhe yehudah veal-khׇl-yehudah asher viyrushala͏im lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָמַ֔ר סַנְחֵרִ֖יב מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר עַל־מָה֙ אַתֶּ֣ם בֹּטְחִ֔ים וְיֹשְׁבִ֥ים בְּמָצ֖וֹר בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: “Thus said King Sennacherib of Assyria: On what do you trust to enable you to endure a siege in Jerusalem?
Transliteration: khoh amar sanecheriyv melekhe ashur al-mah atem votechiym veyosheviym vematsvor viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א יְחִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ מַסִּ֣ית אֶתְכֶ֔ם לָתֵ֣ת אֶתְכֶ֔ם לָמ֛וּת בְּרָעָ֥ב וּבְצָמָ֖א לֵאמֹ֑ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ יַצִּילֵ֕נוּ מִכַּ֖ף מֶ֥לֶךְ אַשּֽׁוּר׃
Translated: Hezekiah is seducing you to a death of hunger and thirst, saying, ‘The L<small>ORD</small> our God will save us from the king of Assyria.’
Transliteration: halo yechizekiyahu masiyt etekhem latet etekhem lamut veraav uvetsama lemor yehovah eloheynu yatsiylenu mikhaf melekhe ashur

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־הוּא֙ יְחִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ הֵסִ֥יר אֶת־בָּמֹתָ֖יו וְאֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָ֑יו וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לִיהוּדָ֤ה וְלִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לִפְנֵ֨י מִזְבֵּ֧חַ אֶחָ֛ד תִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ וְעָלָ֥יו תַּקְטִֽירוּ׃
Translated: But is not Hezekiah the one who removed His shrines and His altars and commanded the people of Judah and Jerusalem saying, ‘Before this one altar you shall prostrate yourselves, and upon it make your burnt offerings’?
Transliteration: halo-hu yechizekiyahu hesiyr et-vamotayv veet-mizevechotayv vayomer liyhudah veliyrushala͏im lemor lifeney mizevecha echad tishetachavu vealayv taketiyru

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א תֵדְע֗וּ מֶ֤ה עָשִׂ֙יתִי֙ אֲנִ֣י וַאֲבוֹתַ֔י לְכֹ֖ל עַמֵּ֣י הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת הֲיָכ֣וֹל יָֽכְל֗וּ אֱלֹהֵי֙ גּוֹיֵ֣ הָאֲרָצ֔וֹת לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶת־אַרְצָ֖ם מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Surely you know what I and my fathers have done to the peoples of the lands? Were the gods of the nations of the lands able to save their lands from me?
Transliteration: halo tedeu meh ashiytiy aniy vaavvotay lekhol amey haaratsvot hayakhvol yakhelu elohey gvoei haaratsvot lehatsiyl et-aretsam miyadiy

Hebrew: מִ֠י בְּֽכׇל־אֱלֹהֵ֞י הַגּוֹיִ֤ם הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶחֱרִ֣ימוּ אֲבוֹתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָכ֔וֹל לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ מִיָּדִ֑י כִּ֤י יוּכַל֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Which of all the gods of any of those nations whom my fathers destroyed was able to save his people from me, that your God should be able to save you from me?
Transliteration: miy vekhׇl-elohey hagvoyim haeleh asher hecheriymu avvotay asher yakhvol lehatsiyl et-amvo miyadiy khiy yukhal eloheykhem lehatsiyl etekhem miyadiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה אַל־יַשִּׁיא֩ אֶתְכֶ֨ם חִזְקִיָּ֜הוּ וְאַל־יַסִּ֨ית אֶתְכֶ֣ם כָּזֹאת֮ וְאַל־תַּאֲמִ֣ינוּ לוֹ֒ כִּֽי־לֹ֣א יוּכַ֗ל כׇּל־אֱל֙וֹהַּ֙ כׇּל־גּ֣וֹי וּמַמְלָכָ֔ה לְהַצִּ֥יל עַמּ֛וֹ מִיָּדִ֖י וּמִיַּ֣ד אֲבוֹתָ֑י אַ֚ף כִּ֣י אֱֽלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם לֹא־יַצִּ֥ילוּ אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Now then, do not let Hezekiah delude you; do not let him seduce you in this way; do not believe him. For no god of any nation or kingdom has been able to save his people from me or from my fathers—much less your God, to save you from me!”
Transliteration: veatah al-yashiy etekhem chizekiyahu veal-yasiyt etekhem khazot veal-taamiynu lvo khiy-lo yukhal khׇl-elvoha khׇl-gvoy umamelakhah lehatsiyl amvo miyadiy umiyad avvotay af khiy eloheykhem lo-yatsiylu etekhem miyadiy

Hebrew: וְעוֹד֙ דִּבְּר֣וּ עֲבָדָ֔יו עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעַ֖ל יְחִזְקִיָּ֥הוּ עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: His officers said still more things against the L<small>ORD</small> God and against His servant Hezekiah.
Transliteration: vevod diveru avadayv al-yehovah haElohim veal yechizekiyahu avedvo

Hebrew: וּסְפָרִ֣ים כָּתַ֔ב לְחָרֵ֕ף לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֵאמֹ֨ר עָלָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר כֵּאלֹהֵ֞י גּוֹיֵ֤י הָֽאֲרָצוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־הִצִּ֤ילוּ עַמָּם֙ מִיָּדִ֔י כֵּ֣ן לֹֽא־יַצִּ֞יל אֱלֹהֵ֧י יְחִזְקִיָּ֛הוּ עַמּ֖וֹ מִיָּדִֽי׃
Translated: He also wrote letters reviling the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel, saying of Him, “Just as the gods of the other nations of the earth did not save their people from me, so the God of Hezekiah will not save his people from me.”
Transliteration: usefariym khatav lecharef layhovah elohey yisherael velemor alayv lemor khelohey gvoeiy haaratsvot asher lo-hitsiylu amam miyadiy khen lo-yatsiyl elohey yechizekiyahu amvo miyadiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֨וּ בְקוֹל־גָּד֜וֹל יְהוּדִ֗ית עַל־עַ֤ם יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַחוֹמָ֔ה לְיָֽרְאָ֖ם וּֽלְבַהֲלָ֑ם לְמַ֖עַן יִלְכְּד֥וּ אֶת־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: They called loudly in the language of Judah to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, to frighten them into panic, so as to capture the city.
Transliteration: vayikereu vekvol-gadvol yehudiyt al-am yerushala͏im asher al-hachvomah leyaream ulevahalam lemaan yilekhedu et-haiyr

Hebrew: וַֽיְדַבְּר֔וּ אֶל־אֱלֹהֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כְּעַ֗ל אֱלֹהֵי֙ עַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְדֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: They spoke of the God of Jerusalem as though He were like the gods of the other peoples of the earth, made by human hands.
Transliteration: vayedaveru el-elohey yerushala͏im kheal elohey amey haarets maasheh yedey haadam {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֞ל יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וִישַׁעְיָ֧הוּ בֶן־אָמ֛וֹץ הַנָּבִ֖יא עַל־זֹ֑את וַֽיִּזְעֲק֖וּ הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then King Hezekiah and the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz prayed about this, and cried out to heaven.
Transliteration: vayitefalel yechizekiyahu hamelekhe viyshaeyahu ven-amvots hanaviy al-zot vayizeaku hashamayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ מַלְאָ֔ךְ וַיַּכְחֵ֞ד כׇּל־גִּבּ֥וֹר חַ֙יִל֙ וְנָגִ֣יד וְשָׂ֔ר בְּמַחֲנֵ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ בְּבֹ֨שֶׁת פָּנִ֜ים לְאַרְצ֗וֹ וַיָּבֹא֙ בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהָ֔יו (ומיציאו) [וּמִיצִיאֵ֣י] מֵעָ֔יו שָׁ֖ם הִפִּילֻ֥הוּ בֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> sent an angel who annihilated every mighty warrior, commander, and officer in the army of the king of Assyria, and he returned in disgrace to his land. He entered the house of his god, and there some of his own offspring struck him down by the sword.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehovah maleakhe vayakheched khׇl-givvor chayiil venagiyd veshar vemachaneh melekhe ashur vayashׇv vevoshet faniym learetsvo vayavo veyt elohayv (vmytsyv) [umiytsiyey] meayv sham hifiyluhu vecharev

Hebrew: וַיּ֩וֹשַׁע֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶת־יְחִזְקִיָּ֜הוּ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם מִיַּ֛ד סַנְחֵרִ֥יב מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֖וּר וּמִיַּד־כֹּ֑ל וַֽיְנַהֲלֵ֖ם מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: Thus the L<small>ORD</small> delivered Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from King Sennacherib of Assyria, and from everyone; He provided for them on all sides.
Transliteration: vayyvosha yehovah et-yechizekiyahu veet yoshevey yerushala͏im miyad sanecheriyv melekhe-ashur umiyad-khol vayenahalem misaviyv

Hebrew: וְ֠רַבִּ֠ים מְבִיאִ֨ים מִנְחָ֤ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ לִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וּמִ֨גְדָּנ֔וֹת לִֽיחִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּנַּשֵּׂ֛א לְעֵינֵ֥י כׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם מֵאַחֲרֵי־כֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: Many brought tribute to the L<small>ORD</small> to Jerusalem, and gifts to King Hezekiah of Judah; thereafter he was exalted in the eyes of all the nations.
Transliteration: veraviym meviyiym minechah layhovah liyrushala͏im umigedanvot liychizekiyahu melekhe yehudah vayinashe leeyney khׇl-hagvoyim meacharey-khen {f}

Hebrew: בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם חָלָ֥ה יְחִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ עַד־לָמ֑וּת וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ וּמוֹפֵ֖ת נָ֥תַן לֽוֹ׃
Translated: At that time, Hezekiah fell deathly sick. He prayed to the L<small>ORD</small>, who responded to him and gave him a sign.
Transliteration: vayamiym hahem chalah yechizekiyahu ad-lamut vayitefalel el-yehovah vayomer lvo umvofet natan lvo

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־כִגְמֻ֤ל עָלָיו֙ הֵשִׁ֣יב יְחִזְקִיָּ֔הוּ כִּ֥י גָבַ֖הּ לִבּ֑וֹ וַֽיְהִ֤י עָלָיו֙ קֶ֔צֶף וְעַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Hezekiah made no return for what had been bestowed upon him, for he grew arrogant; so wrath was decreed for him and for Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: velo-khigemul alayv heshiyv yechizekiyahu khiy gavah livvo vayehiy alayv ketsef veal-yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּכָּנַ֤ע יְחִזְקִיָּ֙הוּ֙ בְּגֹ֣בַהּ לִבּ֔וֹ ה֖וּא וְיוֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְלֹא־בָ֤א עֲלֵיהֶם֙ קֶ֣צֶף יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּימֵ֖י יְחִזְקִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Then Hezekiah humbled himself where he had been arrogant, he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and no wrath of the L<small>ORD</small> came on them during the reign of Hezekiah.
Transliteration: vayikhana yechizekiyahu vegovah livvo hu veyvoshevey yerushala͏im velo-va aleyhem ketsef yehovah viymey yechizekiyahu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י לִיחִזְקִיָּ֛הוּ עֹ֥שֶׁר וְכָב֖וֹד הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וְאֹצָר֣וֹת עָֽשָׂה־ל֠וֹ לְכֶ֨סֶף וּלְזָהָ֜ב וּלְאֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֗ה וְלִבְשָׂמִים֙ וּלְמָ֣גִנִּ֔ים וּלְכֹ֖ל כְּלֵ֥י חֶמְדָּֽה׃
Translated: Hezekiah enjoyed riches and glory in abundance; he filled treasuries with silver and gold, precious stones, spices, shields, and all lovely objects;
Transliteration: vayehiy liychizekiyahu osher vekhavvod hareveh meod veotsarvot ashah-lvo lekhesef ulezahav uleeven yekarah veliveshamiym ulemaginiym ulekhol kheley chemedah

Hebrew: וּמִ֨סְכְּנ֔וֹת לִתְבוּאַ֥ת דָּגָ֖ן וְתִיר֣וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָ֑ר וְאֻֽרָוֺת֙ לְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֣ה וּבְהֵמָ֔ה וַעֲדָרִ֖ים לָאֲוֵרֹֽת׃
Translated: and store-cities with the produce of grain, wine, and oil, and stalls for all kinds of beasts, and flocks for sheepfolds.
Transliteration: umisekhenvot litevuat dagan vetiyrvosh veyitsehar veuravot lekhׇl-vehemah uvehemah vaadariym laaverot

Hebrew: וְעָרִים֙ עָ֣שָׂה ל֔וֹ וּמִקְנֵה־צֹ֥אן וּבָקָ֖ר לָרֹ֑ב כִּ֤י נָֽתַן־לוֹ֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים רְכ֖וּשׁ רַ֥ב מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: And he acquired towns, and flocks of small and large cattle in great number, for God endowed him with very many possessions.
Transliteration: veariym ashah lvo umikeneh-tson uvakar larov khiy natan-lvo Elohim rekhush rav meod

Hebrew: וְה֣וּא יְחִזְקִיָּ֗הוּ סָתַם֙ אֶת־מוֹצָ֞א מֵימֵ֤י גִיחוֹן֙ הָֽעֶלְי֔וֹן וַֽיַּישְּׁרֵ֥ם לְמַֽטָּה־מַּעְרָ֖בָה לְעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיַּצְלַ֥ח יְחִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ בְּכׇֽל־מַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃
Translated: It was Hezekiah who stopped up the spring of water of Upper Gihon, leading it downward west of the City of David; Hezekiah prospered in all that he did.
Transliteration: vehu yechizekiyahu satam et-mvotsa meymey giychvon haeleyvon vayaysherem lematah-maeravah leiyr daviyd vayatselach yechizekiyahu vekhׇl-maashehu

Hebrew: וְכֵ֞ן בִּמְלִיצֵ֣י ׀ שָׂרֵ֣י בָבֶ֗ל הַֽמְשַׁלְּחִ֤ים עָלָיו֙ לִדְרֹ֗שׁ הַמּוֹפֵת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֣ה בָאָ֔רֶץ עֲזָב֖וֹ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים לְנַ֨סּוֹת֔וֹ לָדַ֖עַת כׇּל־בִּלְבָבֽוֹ׃
Translated: So too in the matter of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who were sent to him to inquire about the sign that was in the land, when God forsook him in order to test him, to learn all that was in his mind.
Transliteration: vekhen vimeliytsey sharey vavel hameshalechiym alayv liderosh hamvofet asher hayah vaarets azavvo haElohim lenasvotvo ladaat khׇl-vilevavvo

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יְחִזְקִיָּ֖הוּ וַחֲסָדָ֑יו הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים בַּחֲז֞וֹן יְשַׁעְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־אָמוֹץ֙ הַנָּבִ֔יא עַל־סֵ֥פֶר מַלְכֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Hezekiah’s reign, and his faithful acts, are recorded in the visions of the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz and in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yechizekiyahu vachasadayv hinam khetuviym vachazvon yeshaeyahu ven-amvots hanaviy al-sefer malekhey-yehudah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֨ב יְחִזְקִיָּ֜הוּ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֗יו וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֘הוּ֮ בְּֽמַעֲלֵה֮ קִבְרֵ֣י בְנֵי־דָוִיד֒ וְכָבוֹד֙ עָשׂוּ־ל֣וֹ בְמוֹת֔וֹ כׇּל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and was buried on the upper part of the tombs of the sons of David. When he died, all the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem accorded him much honor. Manasseh, his son, succeeded him.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yechizekiyahu im-avotayv vayikeveruhu vemaaleh kiverey veney-daviyd vekhavvod ashu-lvo vemvotvo khׇl-yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im vayimelokhe menasheh venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֛ה שָׁנָ֖ה מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה בְמׇלְכ֑וֹ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וְחָמֵשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-sheteym eshereh shanah menasheh vemׇlekhvo vachamishiym vechamesh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּתֽוֹעֲבוֹת֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הוֹרִ֣ישׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, following the abhorrent practices of the nations that the L<small>ORD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khetvoavvot hagvoyim asher hvoriysh yehovah mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּ֗שׇׁב וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־הַבָּמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִתַּ֖ץ יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ אָבִ֑יו וַיָּ֨קֶם מִזְבְּח֤וֹת לַבְּעָלִים֙ וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֲשֵׁר֔וֹת וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ לְכׇל־צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ד אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: He rebuilt the shrines that his father Hezekiah had demolished; he erected altars for the Baals and made sacred posts. He bowed down to all the host of heaven and worshiped them,
Transliteration: vayashׇv vayiven et-havamvot asher nitats yechizekiyahu aviyv vayakem mizevechvot lavealiym vayaash ashervot vayishetachu lekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim vayaavod otam

Hebrew: וּבָנָ֥ה מִזְבְּח֖וֹת בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּירוּשָׁלַ֥͏ִם יִֽהְיֶה־שְּׁמִ֖י לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: and he built altars [to them] in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, of which the L<small>ORD</small> had said, “My name will be in Jerusalem forever.”
Transliteration: uvanah mizevechvot veveyt yehovah asher amar yehovah viyrushala͏im yiheyeh-shemiy levolam

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן מִזְבְּח֖וֹת לְכׇל־צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בִּשְׁתֵּ֖י חַצְר֥וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayiven mizevechvot lekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim vishetey chatservot veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהוּא֩ הֶעֱבִ֨יר אֶת־בָּנָ֤יו בָּאֵשׁ֙ בְּגֵ֣י בֶן־הִנֹּ֔ם וְעוֹנֵ֤ן וְנִחֵשׁ֙ וְֽכִשֵּׁ֔ף וְעָ֥שָׂה א֖וֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִ֑י הִרְבָּ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהַכְעִיסֽוֹ׃
Translated: He consigned his sons to the fire in the Valley of Ben-hinnom, and he practiced soothsaying, divination, and sorcery, and consulted ghosts and familiar spirits; he did much that was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small> in order to vex Him.
Transliteration: vehu heeviyr et-vanayv vaesh vegey ven-hinom vevonen venichesh vekhishef veashah vov veyidevoniy hirevah laashvot hara veeyney yehovah lehakheiysvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֕שֶׂם אֶת־פֶּ֥סֶל הַסֶּ֖מֶל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה בְּבֵ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־דָּוִיד֙ וְאֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנ֔וֹ בַּבַּ֨יִת הַזֶּ֜ה וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּחַ֙רְתִּי֙ מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אָשִׂ֥ים אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י לְעֵילֽוֹם׃
Translated: He placed a sculptured image that he made in the House of God, of which God had said to David and to his son Solomon, “In this House and in Jerusalem, which I chose out of all the tribes of Israel, I will establish My name forever.
Transliteration: vayashem et-fesel hasemel asher ashah veveyt haElohim asher amar Elohim el-daviyd veel-shelomoh venvo vavayiit hazeh uviyrushala͏im asher vacharetiy mikhol shivetey yisherael ashiym et-shemiy leeylvom

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א אֹסִ֗יף לְהָסִיר֙ אֶת־רֶ֣גֶל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵעַל֙ הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱמַ֖דְתִּי לַאֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם רַ֣ק ׀ אִם־יִשְׁמְר֣וּ לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ים לְכׇל־הַתּוֹרָ֛ה וְהַחֻקִּ֥ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֖ים בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: And I will never again remove the feet of Israel from the land that I assigned to their fathers, if only they observe faithfully all that I have commanded them—all the teaching and the laws and the rules given by Moses.”
Transliteration: velo osiyf lehasiyr et-regel yisherael meal haadamah asher heemadetiy laavvoteykhem rak im-yishemeru laashvot et khׇl-asher tsiviytiym lekhׇl-hatvorah vehachukiym vehamishefatiym veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיֶּ֣תַע מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה אֶת־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת רָ֔ע מִ֨ן־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הִשְׁמִ֣יד יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Manasseh led Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem astray into evil greater than that done by the nations that the L<small>ORD</small> had destroyed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayeta menasheh et-yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im laashvot ra min-hagvoyim asher hishemiyd yehovah mifeney veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה וְאֶל־עַמּ֖וֹ וְלֹ֥א הִקְשִֽׁיבוּ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> spoke to Manasseh and his people, but they would not pay heed,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-menasheh veel-amvo velo hikeshiyvu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֨א יְהֹוָ֜ה עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם אֶת־שָׂרֵ֤י הַצָּבָא֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וַיִּלְכְּד֥וּ אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה בַּחֹחִ֑ים וַיַּאַסְרֻ֙הוּ֙ בַּֽנְחֻשְׁתַּ֔יִם וַיּוֹלִיכֻ֖הוּ בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: so the L<small>ORD</small> brought against them the officers of the army of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh captive in manacles, bound him in fetters, and led him off to Babylon.
Transliteration: vayave yehovah aleyhem et-sharey hatsava asher lemelekhe ashur vayilekhedu et-menasheh vachochiym vayaaseruhu vanechushetayiim vayyvoliykhuhu vavelah

Hebrew: וּכְהָצֵ֣ר ל֔וֹ חִלָּ֕ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו וַיִּכָּנַ֣ע מְאֹ֔ד מִלִּפְנֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: In his distress, he entreated the L<small>ORD</small> his God and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.
Transliteration: ukhehatser lvo chilah et-feney yehovah elohayv vayikhana meod milifeney elohey avotayv

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֣ל אֵלָ֗יו וַיֵּעָ֤תֶר לוֹ֙ וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע תְּחִנָּת֔וֹ וַיְשִׁיבֵ֥הוּ יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לְמַלְכוּת֑וֹ וַיֵּ֣דַע מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֥וּא הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: He prayed to Him, and He granted his prayer, heard his plea, and returned him to Jerusalem to his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the L<small>ORD</small> alone was God.
Transliteration: vayitefalel elayv vayeater lvo vayishema techinatvo vayeshiyvehu yerushala͏im lemalekhutvo vayeda menasheh khiy yehovah hu haElohim

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֡ן בָּנָ֣ה חוֹמָ֣ה חִיצוֹנָ֣ה <small>׀</small> לְעִיר־דָּוִ֡יד מַעְרָ֩בָה֩ לְגִיח֨וֹן בַּנַּ֜חַל וְלָב֨וֹא בְשַׁ֤עַר הַדָּגִים֙ וְסָבַ֣ב לָעֹ֔פֶל וַיַּגְבִּיהֶ֖הָ מְאֹ֑ד וַיָּ֧שֶׂם שָׂרֵי־חַ֛יִל בְּכׇל־הֶעָרִ֥ים הַבְּצֻר֖וֹת בִּיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Afterward he built the outer wall of the City of David west of Gihon in the wadi on the way to the Fish Gate, and it encircled Ophel; he raised it very high. He also placed army officers in all the fortified towns of Judah.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen vanah chvomah chiytsvonah <small></small> leiyr-daviyd maeravah legiychvon vanachal velavvo veshaar hadagiym vesavav laofel vayageviyheha meod vayashem sharey-chayiil vekhׇl-heariym havetsurvot viyhudah

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּ֠סַר אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֨י הַנֵּכָ֤ר וְאֶת־הַסֶּ֙מֶל֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְכׇל־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָ֛ה בְּהַ֥ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּבִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיַּשְׁלֵ֖ךְ ח֥וּצָה לָעִֽיר׃
Translated: He removed the foreign gods and the image from the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, as well as all the altars that he had built on the Mount of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and in Jerusalem, and dumped them outside the city.
Transliteration: vayasar et-elohey hanekhar veet-hasemel miveyt yehovah vekhׇl-hamizevechvot asher vanah vehar veyt-yehovah uviyrushala͏im vayashelekhe chutsah laiyr

Hebrew: (ויכן) [וַיִּ֙בֶן֙] אֶת־מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּזְבַּ֣ח עָלָ֔יו זִבְחֵ֥י שְׁלָמִ֖ים וְתוֹדָ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לִיהוּדָ֔ה לַעֲב֕וֹד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He rebuilt the altar of the L<small>ORD</small> and offered on it sacrifices of well-being and thanksgiving, and commanded the people of Judah to worship the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel.
Transliteration: (vykhn) [vayiven] et-mizevach yehovah vayizevach alayv zivechey shelamiym vetvodah vayomer liyhudah laavvod et-yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: אֲבָל֙ ע֣וֹד הָעָ֔ם זֹבְחִ֖ים בַּבָּמ֑וֹת רַ֖ק לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: To be sure, the people continued sacrificing at the shrines, but only to the L<small>ORD</small> their God.
Transliteration: aval vod haam zovechiym vavamvot rak layhovah eloheyhem

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁה֮ וּתְפִלָּת֣וֹ אֶל־אֱלֹהָיו֒ וְדִבְרֵי֙ הַחֹזִ֔ים הַֽמְדַבְּרִ֣ים אֵלָ֔יו בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִנָּ֕ם עַל־דִּבְרֵ֖י מַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Manasseh’s reign, and his prayer to his God, and the words of the seers who spoke to him in the name of the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel are found in the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey menasheh utefilatvo el-elohayv vediverey hachoziym hamedaveriym elayv veshem yehovah elohey yisherael hinam al-diverey malekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וּתְפִלָּת֣וֹ וְהֵעָתֶר־לוֹ֮ וְכׇל־חַטָּאת֣וֹ וּמַעְלוֹ֒ וְהַמְּקֹמ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁר֩ בָּנָ֨ה בָהֶ֤ם בָּמוֹת֙ וְהֶֽעֱמִיד֙ הָאֲשֵׁרִ֣ים וְהַפְּסִלִ֔ים לִפְנֵ֖י הִכָּֽנְע֑וֹ הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַ֖ל דִּבְרֵ֥י חוֹזָֽי׃
Translated: His prayer and how it was granted to him, the whole account of his sin and trespass, and the places in which he built shrines and installed sacred posts and images before he humbled himself are recorded in the words of Hozai.
Transliteration: utefilatvo veheater-lvo vekhׇl-chatatvo umaelvo vehamekomvot asher vanah vahem vamvot veheemiyd haasheriym vehafesiliym lifeney hikhanevo hinam khetuviym al diverey chvozay

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב מְנַשֶּׁה֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֖הוּ בֵּית֑וֹ וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אָמ֥וֹן בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Manasseh slept with his fathers and was buried on his palace grounds; his son Amon succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav menasheh im-avotayv vayikeveruhu veytvo vayimelokhe amvon venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֛יִם שָׁנָ֖ה אָמ֣וֹן בְּמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׁתַּ֣יִם שָׁנִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירֽוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym ushetayiim shanah amvon vemׇlekhvo ushetayiim shaniym malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה אָבִ֑יו וּלְכׇל־הַפְּסִילִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה אָבִ֔יו זִבַּ֥ח אָמ֖וֹן וַיַּעַבְדֵֽם׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, as his father Manasseh had done. Amon sacrificed to all the idols that his father Manasseh had made and worshiped them.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah khaasher ashah menasheh aviyv ulekhׇl-hafesiyliym asher ashah menasheh aviyv zivach amvon vayaavedem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א נִכְנַע֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה כְּהִכָּנַ֖ע מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה אָבִ֑יו כִּ֛י ה֥וּא אָמ֖וֹן הִרְבָּ֥ה אַשְׁמָֽה׃
Translated: He did not humble himself before the L<small>ORD</small>, as his father Manasseh had humbled himself; instead, Amon incurred much guilt.
Transliteration: velo nikhena milifeney yehovah khehikhana menasheh aviyv khiy hu amvon hirevah ashemah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשְׁר֤וּ עָלָיו֙ עֲבָדָ֔יו וַיְמִיתֻ֖הוּ בְּבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: His courtiers conspired against him and killed him in his palace.
Transliteration: vayikesheru alayv avadayv vayemiytuhu veveytvo

Hebrew: וַיַּכּוּ֙ עַם־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַקֹּשְׁרִ֖ים עַל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָמ֑וֹן וַיַּמְלִ֧יכוּ עַם־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֶת־יֹאשִׁיָּ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: But the people of the land struck down all who had conspired against King Amon; and the people of the land made his son Josiah king in his stead.
Transliteration: vayakhu am-haarets et khׇl-hakosheriym al-hamelekhe amvon vayameliykhu am-haarets et-yoshiyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁמוֹנֶ֥ה שָׁנִ֖ים יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וְאַחַת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-shemvoneh shaniym yoshiyahu vemׇlekhvo usheloshiym veachat shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּדַרְכֵי֙ דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֔יו וְלֹא־סָ֖ר יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃
Translated: He did what was pleasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, following the ways of his father David without deviating to the right or to the left.
Transliteration: vayaash hayashar veeyney yehovah vayelekhe vedarekhey daviyd aviyv velo-sar yamiyn ushemovl

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁמוֹנֶ֨ה שָׁנִ֜ים לְמׇלְכ֗וֹ וְהוּא֙ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ נַ֔עַר הֵחֵ֕ל לִדְר֕וֹשׁ לֵאלֹהֵ֖י דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑יו וּבִשְׁתֵּ֧ים עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה שָׁנָ֗ה הֵחֵל֙ לְטַהֵ֗ר אֶת־יְהוּדָה֙ וִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם מִן־הַבָּמוֹת֙ וְהָ֣אֲשֵׁרִ֔ים וְהַפְּסִלִ֖ים וְהַמַּסֵּכֽוֹת׃
Translated: In the eighth year of his reign, while he was still young, he began to seek the God of his father David, and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem of the shrines, the sacred posts, the idols, and the molten images.
Transliteration: uvishemvoneh shaniym lemׇlekhvo vehu vodenu naar hechel lidervosh lelohey daviyd aviyv uvisheteym eshereh shanah hechel letaher et-yehudah viyrushala͏im min-havamvot vehaasheriym vehafesiliym vehamasekhvot

Hebrew: וַיְנַתְּצ֣וּ לְפָנָ֗יו אֵ֚ת מִזְבְּח֣וֹת הַבְּעָלִ֔ים וְהַחַמָּנִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־לְמַ֥עְלָה מֵעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם גִּדֵּ֑עַ וְ֠הָאֲשֵׁרִ֠ים וְהַפְּסִלִ֤ים וְהַמַּסֵּכוֹת֙ שִׁבַּ֣ר וְהֵדַ֔ק וַיִּזְרֹק֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַקְּבָרִ֔ים הַזֹּבְחִ֖ים לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: At his bidding, they demolished the altars of the Baals, and he had the incense stands above them cut down; he smashed the sacred posts, the idols, and the images, ground them into dust, and strewed it onto the graves of those who had sacrificed to them.
Transliteration: vayenatetsu lefanayv et mizevechvot havealiym vehachamaniym asher-lemaelah mealeyhem gidea vehaasheriym vehafesiliym vehamasekhvot shivar vehedak vayizerok al-feney hakevariym hazovechiym lahem

Hebrew: וְעַצְמוֹת֙ כֹּֽהֲנִ֔ים שָׂרַ֖ף עַל־[מִזְבְּחוֹתָ֑ם] (מזבחותים) וַיְטַהֵ֥ר אֶת־יְהוּדָ֖ה וְאֶת־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: He burned the bones of priests on their altars and purged Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veatsemvot khohaniym sharaf al-[mizevechvotam] (mzvchvtym) vayetaher et-yehudah veet-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וּבְעָרֵ֨י מְנַשֶּׁ֧ה וְאֶפְרַ֛יִם וְשִׁמְע֖וֹן וְעַד־נַפְתָּלִ֑י (בחר בתיהם) [בְּחַרְבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם] סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: In the towns of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon, as far as Naphtali, [lying] in ruins on every side,
Transliteration: uvearey menasheh veeferayiim veshimevon vead-nafetaliy (vchr vtyhm) [vecharevoteyhem] saviyv

Hebrew: וַיְנַתֵּ֣ץ אֶת־הַֽמִּזְבְּח֗וֹת וְאֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרִ֤ים וְהַפְּסִלִים֙ כִּתַּ֣ת לְהֵדַ֔ק וְכׇל־הַחַמָּנִ֥ים גִּדַּ֖ע בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּ֖שׇׁב לִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: he demolished the altars and the sacred posts and smashed the idols and ground them into dust; and he hewed down all the incense stands throughout the land of Israel. Then he returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayenatets et-hamizevechvot veet-haasheriym vehafesiliym khitat lehedak vekhׇl-hachamaniym gida vekhׇl-erets yisherael vayashׇv liyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁמוֹנֶ֤ה עֶשְׂרֵה֙ לְמׇלְכ֔וֹ לְטַהֵ֥ר הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהַבָּ֑יִת שָׁ֠לַ֠ח אֶת־שָׁפָ֨ן בֶּן־אֲצַלְיָ֜הוּ וְאֶת־מַעֲשֵׂיָ֣הוּ שַׂר־הָעִ֗יר וְ֠אֵ֠ת יוֹאָ֤ח בֶּן־יֽוֹאָחָז֙ הַמַּזְכִּ֔יר לְחַזֵּ֕ק אֶת־בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: In the eighteenth year of his reign, after purging the land and the House, he commissioned Shaphan son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah son of Joahaz the recorder to repair the House of the L<small>ORD</small> his God.
Transliteration: uvishenat shemvoneh eshereh lemׇlekhvo letaher haarets vehavayiit shalach et-shafan ven-atsaleyahu veet-maasheyahu shar-haiyr veet yvoach ven-yvoachaz hamazekhiyr lechazek et-veyt yehovah elohayv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אֶל־חִלְקִיָּ֣הוּ ׀ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּד֗וֹל וַֽיִּתְּנוּ֮ אֶת־הַכֶּ֘סֶף֮ הַמּוּבָ֣א בֵית־אֱלֹהִים֒ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָסְפֽוּ־הַלְוִיִּם֩ שֹׁמְרֵ֨י הַסַּ֜ף מִיַּ֧ד מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה וְאֶפְרַ֗יִם וּמִכֹּל֙ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִכׇּל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וּבִנְיָמִ֑ן (וישבי) [וַיָּשׁ֖וּבוּ] יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: They came to the high priest Hilkiah and delivered to him the silver brought to the House of God, which the Levites, the guards of the threshold, had collected from Manasseh and Ephraim and from all the remnant of Israel and from all Judah and Benjamin and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayavou el-chilekiyahu hakhohen hagadvol vayitenu et-hakhesef hamuva veyt-Elohim asher asefu-haleviyim shomerey hasaf miyad menasheh veeferayiim umikhol sheeriyt yisherael umikhׇl-yehudah uvineyamin (vyshvy) [vayashuvu] yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ עַל־יַד֙ עֹשֵׂ֣ה הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה הַמֻּפְקָדִ֖ים בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ עוֹשֵׂ֣י הַמְּלָאכָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֹשִׂים֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה לִבְדּ֥וֹק וּלְחַזֵּ֖ק הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: They delivered it into the custody of the overseers who were in charge at the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, and the overseers who worked in the House of the L<small>ORD</small> spent it on examining and repairing the House.
Transliteration: vayitenu al-yad osheh hamelakhah hamufekadiym veveyt yehovah vayitenu otvo voshey hamelakhah asher oshiym veveyt yehovah livedvok ulechazek havayiit

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ לֶחָֽרָשִׁים֙ וְלַבֹּנִ֔ים לִקְנוֹת֙ אַבְנֵ֣י מַחְצֵ֔ב וְעֵצִ֖ים לַֽמְחַבְּר֑וֹת וּלְקָרוֹת֙ אֶת־הַבָּ֣תִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁחִ֖יתוּ מַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: They paid it out to the artisans and the masons to buy quarried stone and wood for the couplings and for making roof-beams for the buildings that the kings of Judah had allowed to fall into ruin.
Transliteration: vayitenu lecharashiym velavoniym likenvot aveney machetsev veetsiym lamechavervot ulekarvot et-havatiym asher hishechiytu malekhey yehudah {s}

Hebrew: וְהָאֲנָשִׁים֩ עֹשִׂ֨ים בֶּאֱמוּנָ֜ה בַּמְּלָאכָ֗ה וַעֲלֵיהֶ֣ם <small>׀</small> מֻ֠פְקָדִ֠ים יַ֣חַת וְעֹבַדְיָ֤הוּ הַלְוִיִּם֙ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֔י וּזְכַרְיָ֧ה וּמְשֻׁלָּ֛ם מִן־בְּנֵ֥י הַקְּהָתִ֖ים לְנַצֵּ֑חַ וְהַ֨לְוִיִּ֔ם כׇּל־מֵבִ֖ין בִּכְלֵי־שִֽׁיר׃
Translated: The men did the work honestly; over them were appointed the Levites Jahath and Obadiah, of the sons of Merari, and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of Kohath, to supervise; while other Levites, all the master musicians,
Transliteration: vehaanashiym oshiym veemunah vamelakhah vaaleyhem <small></small> mufekadiym yachat veovadeyahu haleviyim min-veney merariy uzekhareyah umeshulam min-veney hakehatiym lenatsecha vehaleviyim khׇl-meviyn vikheley-shiyr

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל הַסַּבָּלִ֗ים וּֽמְנַצְּחִים֙ לְכֹל֙ עֹשֵׂ֣ה מְלָאכָ֔ה לַעֲבוֹדָ֖ה וַעֲבוֹדָ֑ה וּמֵֽהַלְוִיִּ֔ם סוֹפְרִ֥ים וְשֹׁטְרִ֖ים וְשׁוֹעֲרִֽים׃
Translated: were over the porters, supervising all who worked at each and every task; some of the Levites were scribes and officials and gatekeepers.
Transliteration: veal hasavaliym umenatsechiym lekhol osheh melakhah laavvodah vaavvodah umehaleviyim svoferiym veshoteriym veshvoariym

Hebrew: וּבְהוֹצִיאָ֣ם אֶת־הַכֶּ֔סֶף הַמּוּבָ֖א בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה מָצָא֙ חִלְקִיָּ֣הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶת־סֵ֥פֶר תּוֹרַת־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: As they took out the silver that had been brought to the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, the priest Hilkiah found a scroll of the L<small>ORD</small>’s Teaching given by Moses.
Transliteration: uvehvotsiyam et-hakhesef hamuva veyt yehovah matsa chilekiyahu hakhohen et-sefer tvorat-yehovah veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן חִלְקִיָּ֗הוּ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־שָׁפָ֣ן הַסּוֹפֵ֔ר סֵ֧פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֛ה מָצָ֖אתִי בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֧ן חִלְקִיָּ֛הוּ אֶת־הַסֵּ֖פֶר אֶל־שָׁפָֽן׃
Translated: Hilkiah spoke up and said to the scribe Shaphan, “I have found a scroll of the Teaching in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>”; and Hilkiah gave the scroll to Shaphan.
Transliteration: vayaan chilekiyahu vayomer el-shafan hasvofer sefer hatvorah matsatiy veveyt yehovah vayiten chilekiyahu et-hasefer el-shafan

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֨א שָׁפָ֤ן אֶת־הַסֵּ֙פֶר֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיָּ֨שֶׁב ע֧וֹד אֶת־הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ דָּבָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־נִתַּ֥ן בְּיַד־עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ הֵ֥ם עֹשִֽׂים׃
Translated: Shaphan brought the scroll to the king and also reported to the king, “All that was entrusted to your servants is being done;
Transliteration: vayave shafan et-hasefer el-hamelekhe vayashev vod et-hamelekhe davar lemor khol asher-nitan veyad-avadeykha hem oshiym

Hebrew: וַיַּתִּ֕יכוּ אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף הַנִּמְצָ֣א בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּהוּ עַל־יַד֙ הַמֻּפְקָדִ֔ים וְעַל־יַ֖ד עוֹשֵׂ֥י הַמְּלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: they have melted down the silver that was found in the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and delivered it to those who were in charge, to the overseers.”
Transliteration: vayatiykhu et-hakhesef hanimetsa veveyt-yehovah vayitenuhu al-yad hamufekadiym veal-yad voshey hamelakhah

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֞ד שָׁפָ֤ן הַסּוֹפֵר֙ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֔ר סֵ֚פֶר נָ֣תַן לִ֔י חִלְקִיָּ֖הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וַיִּקְרָא־ב֥וֹ שָׁפָ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The scribe Shaphan also told the king, “The priest Hilkiah has given me a scroll”; and Shaphan read from it to the king.
Transliteration: vayaged shafan hasvofer lamelekhe lemor sefer natan liy chilekiyahu hakhohen vayikera-vvo shafan lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֣י הַתּוֹרָ֑ה וַיִּקְרַ֖ע אֶת־בְּגָדָֽיו׃
Translated: When the king heard the words of the Teaching, he tore his clothes.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa hamelekhe et diverey hatvorah vayikera et-vegadayv

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ אֶת־חִלְקִיָּ֡הוּ וְאֶת־אֲחִיקָ֣ם בֶּן־שָׁ֠פָ֠ן וְאֶת־עַבְדּ֨וֹן בֶּן־מִיכָ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שָׁפָ֣ן הַסּוֹפֵ֗ר וְאֵ֛ת עֲשָׂיָ֥ה עֶֽבֶד־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The king gave orders to Hilkiah, and Ahikam son of Shaphan, and Abdon son of Micah, and the scribe Shaphan, and Asaiah the king’s minister, saying,
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe et-chilekiyahu veet-achiykam ven-shafan veet-avedvon ven-miykhah veet shafan hasvofer veet ashayah eved-hamelekhe lemor

Hebrew: לְכוּ֩ דִרְשׁ֨וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֜ה בַּעֲדִ֗י וּבְעַד֙ הַנִּשְׁאָר֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וּבִיהוּדָ֔ה עַל־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַסֵּ֖פֶר אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִמְצָ֑א כִּֽי־גְדוֹלָ֤ה חֲמַת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִתְּכָ֣ה בָ֔נוּ עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־שָׁמְר֤וּ אֲבוֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת כְּכׇל־הַכָּת֖וּב עַל־הַסֵּ֥פֶר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “Go, inquire of the L<small>ORD</small> on my behalf and on behalf of those who remain in Israel and Judah concerning the words of the scroll that has been found, for great indeed must be the wrath of the L<small>ORD</small> that has been poured down upon us because our fathers did not obey the word of the L<small>ORD</small> and do all that is written in this scroll.”
Transliteration: lekhu direshu et-yehovah vaadiy uvead hanishear veyisherael uviyhudah al-diverey hasefer asher nimetsa khiy-gedvolah chamat-yehovah asher nitekhah vanu al asher lo-shameru avvoteynu et-devar yehovah laashvot khekhׇl-hakhatuv al-hasefer hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ חִלְקִיָּ֜הוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֶל־חֻלְדָּ֨ה הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה אֵ֣שֶׁת ׀ שַׁלֻּ֣ם בֶּן־[תׇּקְהַ֗ת] (תוקהת) בֶּן־חַסְרָה֙ שׁוֹמֵ֣ר הַבְּגָדִ֔ים וְהִ֛יא יוֹשֶׁ֥בֶת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם בַּמִּשְׁנֶ֑ה וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלֶ֖יהָ כָּזֹֽאת׃
Translated: Hilkiah and those whom the king [had ordered] went to the prophetess Huldah, wife of Shallum son of Tokhath son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe, who was living in Jerusalem in the Mishneh, and spoke to her accordingly.
Transliteration: vayelekhe chilekiyahu vaasher hamelekhe el-chuledah haneviyah eshet shalum ven-[tׇkehat] (tvkht) ven-chaserah shvomer havegadiym vehiy yvoshevet viyrushala͏im vamisheneh vayedaveru eleyha khazot

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִמְר֣וּ לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: She responded to them: “Thus said the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel: Say to the man who sent you to Me,
Transliteration: vatomer lahem khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael imeru laiysh asher-shalach etekhem elay {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֥יא רָעָ֛ה עַל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה וְעַל־יֽוֹשְׁבָ֑יו אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָֽאָלוֹת֙ הַכְּתוּב֣וֹת עַל־הַסֵּ֔פֶר אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָֽרְא֔וּ לִפְנֵ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: ‘Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: I am going to bring disaster upon this place and its inhabitants—all the curses that are written in the scroll that was read to the king of Judah—
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineniy meviy raah al-hamakvom hazeh veal-yvoshevayv et khׇl-haalvot hakhetuvvot al-hasefer asher kareu lifeney melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲזָב֗וּנִי (ויקטירו) [וַֽיְקַטְּרוּ֙] לֵאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים לְמַ֙עַן֙ הַכְעִיסֵ֔נִי בְּכֹ֖ל מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יְדֵיהֶ֑ם וְתִתַּ֧ךְ חֲמָתִ֛י בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תִכְבֶּֽה׃
Translated: because they forsook Me and made offerings to other gods in order to vex Me with all the works of their hands; My wrath shall be poured out against this place and not be quenched.’
Transliteration: tachat asher azavuniy (vyktyrv) [vayekateru] lelohiym acheriym lemaan hakheiyseniy vekhol maashey yedeyhem vetitakhe chamatiy vamakvom hazeh velo tikheveh

Hebrew: וְאֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה הַשֹּׁלֵ֤חַ אֶתְכֶם֙ לִדְר֣וֹשׁ בַּיהֹוָ֔ה כֹּ֥ה תֹאמְר֖וּ אֵלָ֑יו {ס} כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: But say this to the king of Judah who sent you to inquire of the L<small>ORD</small>: ‘Thus said the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel: As for the words which you have heard,
Transliteration: veel-melekhe yehudah hasholecha etekhem lidervosh vayhovah khoh tomeru elayv {s} khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael hadevariym asher shamaeta

Hebrew: יַ֠עַן רַךְ־לְבָ֨בְךָ֜ וַתִּכָּנַ֣ע ׀ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֗ים בְּשׇׁמְעֲךָ֤ אֶת־דְּבָרָיו֙ עַל־הַמָּק֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ וְעַל־יֹ֣שְׁבָ֔יו וַתִּכָּנַ֣ע לְפָנַ֔י וַתִּקְרַ֥ע אֶת־בְּגָדֶ֖יךָ וַתֵּ֣בְךְּ לְפָנָ֑י וְגַם־אֲנִ֥י שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: since your heart was softened and you humbled yourself before God when you heard His words concerning this place and its inhabitants, and you humbled yourself before Me and tore your clothes and wept before Me, I for My part have listened, declares the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: yaan rakhe-levavekha vatikhana milifeney Elohim veshׇmeakha et-devarayv al-hamakvom hazeh veal-yoshevayv vatikhana lefanay vatikera et-vegadeykha vatevekhe lefanay vegam-aniy shamaetiy neum-yehovah

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י אֹסִפְךָ֜ אֶל־אֲבֹתֶ֗יךָ וְנֶאֱסַפְתָּ֣ אֶל־קִבְרוֹתֶ֘יךָ֮ בְּשָׁלוֹם֒ וְלֹא־תִרְאֶ֣ינָה עֵינֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹל֙ הָרָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֥י מֵבִ֛יא עַל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה וְעַל־יֹֽשְׁבָ֑יו וַיָּשִׁ֥יבוּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ דָּבָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Assuredly, I will gather you to your fathers, and you will be laid in your grave in peace; your eyes shall see nothing of the disaster that I will bring upon this place and its inhabitants.’” They reported this back to the king.
Transliteration: hineniy osifekha el-avoteykha veneesafeta el-kivervoteykha veshalvom velo-tireeynah eyneykha vekhol haraah asher aniy meviy al-hamakvom hazeh veal-yoshevayv vayashiyvu et-hamelekhe davar {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֶּאֱסֹ֕ף אֶת־כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Then the king sent word and assembled all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe vayeesof et-khׇl-zikeney yehudah viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ בֵּית־יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה וְכׇל־אִ֨ישׁ יְהוּדָ֜ה וְיֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם מִגָּד֣וֹל וְעַד־קָטָ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֣א בְאׇזְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵי֙ סֵ֣פֶר הַבְּרִ֔ית הַנִּמְצָ֖א בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The king went up to the House of the L<small>ORD</small> with all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the priests and the Levites—all the people, young and old—and he read to them the entire text of the covenant scroll that was found in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaal hamelekhe veyt-yehovah vekhׇl-iysh yehudah veyoshevey yerushala͏im vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim vekhׇl-haam migadvol vead-katan vayikera veׇzeneyhem et-khׇl-diverey sefer haveriyt hanimetsa veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֨ד הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ עַל־עׇמְד֗וֹ וַיִּכְרֹ֣ת אֶֽת־הַבְּרִית֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ לָלֶ֜כֶת אַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה וְלִשְׁמ֤וֹר אֶת־מִצְוֺתָיו֙ וְעֵדְוֺתָ֣יו וְחֻקָּ֔יו בְּכׇל־לְבָב֖וֹ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשׁ֑וֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י הַבְּרִ֔ית הַכְּתוּבִ֖ים עַל־הַסֵּ֥פֶר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The king stood in his place and solemnized the covenant before the L<small>ORD</small>: to follow the L<small>ORD</small> and observe His commandments, His injunctions, and His laws with all his heart and soul, to fulfill all the terms of the covenant written in this scroll.
Transliteration: vayaamod hamelekhe al-ׇmedvo vayikherot et-haveriyt lifeney yehovah lalekhet acharey yehovah velishemvor et-mitsevotayv veedevotayv vechukayv vekhׇl-levavvo uvekhׇl-nafeshvo laashvot et-diverey haveriyt hakhetuviym al-hasefer hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֕ד אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַנִּמְצָ֥א בִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם וּבִנְיָמִ֑ן וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֙ יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כִּבְרִ֥ית אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: He obligated all the men of Jerusalem and Benjamin who were present; and the inhabitants of Jerusalem acted in accord with the Covenant of God, God of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayaamed et khׇl-hanimetsa viyrushala͏im uvineyamin vayaashu yvoshevey yerushala͏im khiveriyt Elohim elohey avvoteyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨סַר יֹאשִׁיָּ֜הוּ אֶת־כׇּל־הַתֹּעֵב֗וֹת מִֽכׇּל־הָאֲרָצוֹת֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַֽיַּעֲבֵ֗ד אֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַנִּמְצָא֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַעֲב֖וֹד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם כׇּל־יָמָ֕יו לֹ֣א סָ֔רוּ מֵאַחֲרֵ֕י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Josiah removed all the abominations from the whole territory of the Israelites and obliged all who were in Israel to worship the L<small>ORD</small> their God. Throughout his reign they did not deviate from following the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers.
Transliteration: vayasar yoshiyahu et-khׇl-hatoevvot mikhׇl-haaratsvot asher liveney yisherael vayaaved et khׇl-hanimetsa veyisherael laavvod et-yehovah eloheyhem khׇl-yamayv lo saru meacharey yehovah elohey avvoteyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ יֹאשִׁיָּ֧הוּ בִירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם פֶּ֖סַח לַיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁחֲט֣וּ הַפֶּ֔סַח בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: Josiah kept the Passover for the L<small>ORD</small> in Jerusalem; the passover sacrifice was slaughtered on the fourteenth day of the first month.
Transliteration: vayaash yoshiyahu viyrushala͏im fesach layhovah vayishechatu hafesach vearevaah ashar lachodesh harishvon

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֵ֥ד הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים עַל־מִשְׁמְרוֹתָ֑ם וַֽיְחַזְּקֵ֔ם לַעֲבוֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: He reinstated the priests in their shifts and rallied them to the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaamed hakhohaniym al-mishemervotam vayechazekem laavvodat veyt yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לַ֠לְוִיִּ֠ם (המבונים) [הַמְּבִינִ֨ים] לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל הַקְּדוֹשִׁ֣ים לַיהֹוָ֗ה תְּנ֤וּ אֶת־אֲרוֹן־הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ בַּ֠בַּ֠יִת אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּנָ֜ה שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה בֶן־דָּוִיד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵין־לָכֶ֥ם מַשָּׂ֖א בַּכָּתֵ֑ף עַתָּ֗ה עִבְדוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת עַמּ֥וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He said to the Levites, consecrated to the L<small>ORD</small>, who taught all Israel, “Put the Holy Ark in the House that Solomon son of David, king of Israel, built; as you no longer carry it on your shoulders, see now to the service of the L<small>ORD</small> your God and His people Israel,
Transliteration: vayomer laleviyim (hmvvnym) [hameviyniym] lekhׇl-yisherael hakedvoshiym layhovah tenu et-arvon-hakodesh vavayiit asher vanah shelomoh ven-daviyd melekhe yisherael eyn-lakhem masha vakhatef atah ivedu et-yehovah eloheykhem veet amvo yisherael

Hebrew: (והכונו) [וְהָכִ֥ינוּ] לְבֵית־אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם כְּמַחְלְקוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בִּכְתָ֗ב דָּוִיד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּבְמִכְתַּ֖ב שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: and dispose yourselves by clans according to your divisions, as prescribed in the writing of King David of Israel and in the document of his son Solomon,
Transliteration: (vhkhvnv) [vehakhiynu] leveyt-avvoteykhem khemachelekvoteykhem vikhetav daviyd melekhe yisherael uvemikhetav shelomoh venvo

Hebrew: וְעִמְד֣וּ בַקֹּ֗דֶשׁ לִפְלוּגֹּת֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאָב֔וֹת לַאֲחֵיכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַחֲלֻקַּ֥ת בֵּֽית־אָ֖ב לַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: and attend in the Sanctuary, by clan divisions, on your kinsmen, the people—by clan divisions of the Levites.
Transliteration: veimedu vakodesh lifelugot veyt haavvot laacheykhem veney haam vachalukat veyt-av laleviyim

Hebrew: וְשַׁחֲט֖וּ הַפָּ֑סַח וְהִֽתְקַדְּשׁוּ֙ וְהָכִ֣ינוּ לַאֲחֵיכֶ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת כִּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: Having sanctified yourselves, slaughter the passover sacrifice and prepare it for your kinsmen, according to the word of God given by Moses.”
Transliteration: veshachatu hafasach vehitekadeshu vehakhiynu laacheykhem laashvot khidevar-yehovah veyad-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רֶם יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הוּ לִבְנֵ֪י הָעָ֟ם צֹ֞אן כְּבָשִׂ֣ים וּבְנֵי־עִזִּים֮ הַכֹּ֣ל לַפְּסָחִים֒ לְכׇל־הַנִּמְצָ֗א לְמִסְפַּר֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף וּבָקָ֖ר שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֑ים אֵ֖לֶּה מֵרְכ֥וּשׁ הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Josiah donated to the people small cattle—lambs and goats, all for passover sacrifices for all present—to the sum of 30,000, and large cattle, 3,000—these from the property of the king.
Transliteration: vayarem yoshiyahu liveney haam tson khevashiym uveney-iziym hakhol lafesachiym lekhׇl-hanimetsa lemisefar sheloshiym elef uvakar sheloshet alafiym eleh merekhush hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וְשָׂרָ֞יו לִנְדָבָ֥ה לָעָ֛ם לַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים וְלַלְוִיִּ֖ם הֵרִ֑ימוּ חִלְקִיָּ֨ה וּזְכַרְיָ֜הוּ וִיחִיאֵ֗ל נְגִידֵי֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לַכֹּהֲנִ֞ים נָתְנ֣וּ לַפְּסָחִ֗ים אַלְפַּ֙יִם֙ וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וּבָקָ֖ר שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His officers gave a freewill offering to the people, to the priests, and to the Levites. Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, the chiefs of the House of God, donated to the priests for passover sacrifices 2,600 [small cattle] and 300 large cattle.
Transliteration: vesharayv linedavah laam lakhohaniym velaleviyim heriymu chilekiyah uzekhareyahu viychiyel negiydey veyt haElohim lakhohaniym natenu lafesachiym alefayiim veshesh mevot uvakar shelosh mevot

Hebrew: (וכונניהו) [וְ֠כׇֽנַנְיָ֠הוּ] וּשְׁמַעְיָ֨הוּ וּנְתַנְאֵ֜ל אֶחָ֗יו וַחֲשַׁבְיָ֧הוּ וִיעִיאֵ֛ל וְיוֹזָבָ֖ד שָׂרֵ֣י הַלְוִיִּ֑ם הֵרִ֨ימוּ לַלְוִיִּ֤ם לַפְּסָחִים֙ חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וּבָקָ֖ר חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Conaniah, Shemaiah, and Nethanel, his brothers, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, officers of the Levites, donated 5,000 [small cattle] and 500 large cattle to the Levites for passover sacrifices.
Transliteration: (vkhvnnyhv) [vekhׇnaneyahu] ushemaeyahu unetaneel echayv vachashaveyahu viyiyel veyvozavad sharey haleviyim heriymu laleviyim lafesachiym chameshet alafiym uvakar chamesh mevot

Hebrew: וַתִּכּ֖וֹן הָעֲבוֹדָ֑ה וַיַּעַמְד֨וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים עַל־עׇמְדָ֛ם וְהַלְוִיִּ֥ם עַל־מַחְלְקוֹתָ֖ם כְּמִצְוַ֥ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The service was arranged well: the priests stood at their posts and the Levites in their divisions, by the king’s command.
Transliteration: vatikhvon haavvodah vayaamedu hakhohaniym al-ׇmedam vehaleviyim al-machelekvotam khemitsevat hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁחֲט֖וּ הַפָּ֑סַח וַיִּזְרְק֤וּ הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ מִיָּדָ֔ם וְהַלְוִיִּ֖ם מַפְשִׁיטִֽים׃
Translated: They slaughtered the passover sacrifice and the priests [received its blood] from them and dashed it, while the Levites flayed the animals.
Transliteration: vayishechatu hafasach vayizereku hakhohaniym miyadam vehaleviyim mafeshiytiym

Hebrew: וַיָּסִ֨ירוּ הָעֹלָ֜ה לְ֠תִתָּ֠ם לְמִפְלַגּ֤וֹת לְבֵית־אָבוֹת֙ לִבְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם לְהַקְרִיב֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כַּכָּת֖וּב בְּסֵ֣פֶר מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְכֵ֖ן לַבָּקָֽר׃
Translated: They removed the parts to be burnt, distributing them to divisions of the people by clans, and making the sacrifices to the L<small>ORD</small>, as prescribed in the scroll of Moses; they did the same for the cattle.
Transliteration: vayasiyru haolah letitam lemifelagvot leveyt-avvot liveney haam lehakeriyv layhovah khakhatuv vesefer mosheh vekhen lavakar

Hebrew: וַֽיְבַשְּׁל֥וּ הַפֶּ֛סַח בָּאֵ֖שׁ כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וְהַקֳּדָשִׁ֣ים בִּשְּׁל֗וּ בַּסִּיר֤וֹת וּבַדְּוָדִים֙ וּבַצֵּ֣לָח֔וֹת וַיָּרִ֖יצוּ לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: They roasted the passover sacrifice in fire, as prescribed, while the sacred offerings they cooked in pots, cauldrons, and pans, and conveyed them with dispatch to all the people.
Transliteration: vayevashelu hafesach vaesh khamishefat vehakodashiym vishelu vasiyrvot uvadevadiym uvatselachvot vayariytsu lekhׇl-veney haam

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֗ר הֵכִ֤ינוּ לָהֶם֙ וְלַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים כִּ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן בְּהַעֲל֛וֹת הָעוֹלָ֥ה וְהַחֲלָבִ֖ים עַד־לָ֑יְלָה וְהַלְוִיִּם֙ הֵכִ֣ינוּ לָהֶ֔ם וְלַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: Afterward they provided for themselves and the priests, for the Aaronite priests were busy offering the burnt offerings and the fatty parts until nightfall, so the Levites provided both for themselves and for the Aaronite priests.
Transliteration: veachar hekhiynu lahem velakhohaniym khiy hakhohaniym veney aharon vehaalvot havolah vehachalaviym ad-layelah vehaleviyim hekhiynu lahem velakhohaniym veney aharon

Hebrew: וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִ֨ים בְּנֵי־אָסָ֜ף עַל־מַעֲמָדָ֗ם כְּמִצְוַ֤ת דָּוִיד֙ וְאָסָ֞ף וְהֵימָ֤ן וִֽידֻתוּן֙ חוֹזֵ֣ה הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְהַשֹּׁעֲרִ֖ים לְשַׁ֣עַר וָשָׁ֑עַר אֵ֣ין לָהֶ֗ם לָסוּר֙ מֵעַ֣ל עֲבֹֽדָתָ֔ם כִּֽי־אֲחֵיהֶ֥ם הַלְוִיִּ֖ם הֵכִ֥ינוּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: The Asaphite singers were at their stations, by command of David and Asaph and Heman and Jeduthun, the seer of the king; and the gatekeepers were at each and every gate. They did not have to leave their tasks, because their Levite brothers provided for them.
Transliteration: vehameshoreriym veney-asaf al-maamadam khemitsevat daviyd veasaf veheyman viydutun chvozeh hamelekhe vehashoariym leshaar vashaar eyn lahem lasur meal avodatam khiy-acheyhem haleviyim hekhiynu lahem

Hebrew: וַ֠תִּכּ֠וֹן כׇּל־עֲבוֹדַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֜ה בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַפֶּ֔סַח וְהַעֲל֣וֹת עֹל֔וֹת עַ֖ל מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּמִצְוַ֖ת הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: The entire service of the L<small>ORD</small> was arranged well that day, to keep the Passover and to make the burnt offerings on the altar of the L<small>ORD</small>, according to the command of King Josiah.
Transliteration: vatikhvon khׇl-avvodat yehovah vayyvom hahu laashvot hafesach vehaalvot olvot al mizevach yehovah khemitsevat hamelekhe yoshiyahu

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל הַֽנִּמְצְאִ֛ים אֶת־הַפֶּ֖סַח בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑יא וְאֶת־חַ֥ג הַמַּצּ֖וֹת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: All the Israelites present kept the Passover at that time, and the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney-yisherael hanimetseiym et-hafesach vaet hahiy veet-chag hamatsvot shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נַעֲשָׂ֨ה פֶ֤סַח כָּמֹ֙הוּ֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִימֵ֖י שְׁמוּאֵ֣ל הַנָּבִ֑יא וְכׇל־מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ׀ לֹֽא־עָשׂ֡וּ כַּפֶּ֣סַח אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה יֹ֠אשִׁיָּ֠הוּ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֤ם וְכׇל־יְהוּדָה֙ וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הַנִּמְצָ֔א וְיוֹשְׁבֵ֖י יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Since the time of the prophet Samuel, no Passover like that one had ever been kept in Israel; none of the kings of Israel had kept a Passover like the one kept by Josiah and the priests and the Levites and all Judah and Israel there present and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: velo-naashah fesach khamohu veyisherael miymey shemuel hanaviy vekhׇl-malekhey yisherael lo-ashu khafesach asher-ashah yoshiyahu vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim vekhׇl-yehudah veyisherael hanimetsa veyvoshevey yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁמוֹנֶ֤ה עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְמַלְכ֖וּת יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ נַעֲשָׂ֖ה הַפֶּ֥סַח הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: That Passover was kept in the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah.
Transliteration: vishemvoneh eshereh shanah lemalekhut yoshiyahu naashah hafesach hazeh

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י כׇל־זֹ֗את אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵכִ֤ין יֹאשִׁיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת עָלָ֞ה נְכ֧וֹ מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֛יִם לְהִלָּחֵ֥ם בְּכַרְכְּמִ֖ישׁ עַל־פְּרָ֑ת וַיֵּצֵ֥א לִקְרָאת֖וֹ יֹאשִׁיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: After all this furbishing of the Temple by Josiah, King Necho of Egypt came up to fight at Carchemish on the Euphrates, and Josiah went out against him.
Transliteration: acharey khׇl-zot asher hekhiyn yoshiyahu et-havayiit alah nekhvo melekhe-mitserayiim lehilachem vekharekhemiysh al-ferat vayetse likeratvo yoshiyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח אֵלָ֣יו מַלְאָכִ֣ים <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֩ <small>׀</small> מַה־לִּ֨י וָלָ֜ךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֗ה לֹא־עָלֶ֨יךָ אַתָּ֤ה הַיּוֹם֙ כִּ֚י אֶל־בֵּ֣ית מִלְחַמְתִּ֔י וֵאלֹהִ֖ים אָמַ֣ר לְבַהֲלֵ֑נִי חֲדַל־לְךָ֛ מֵאֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־עִמִּ֖י וְאַל־יַשְׁחִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: [Necho] sent messengers to him, saying, “What have I to do with you, king of Judah? I do not march against you this day but against the kingdom that wars with me, and it is God’s will that I hurry. Refrain, then, from interfering with God who is with me, that He not destroy you.”
Transliteration: vayishelach elayv maleakhiym <small></small> lemor <small></small> mah-liy valakhe melekhe yehudah lo-aleykha atah hayyvom khiy el-veyt milechametiy velohiym amar levahaleniy chadal-lekha meElohim asher-imiy veal-yashechiytekha

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הֵסֵב֩ יֹאשִׁיָּ֨הוּ פָנָ֜יו מִמֶּ֗נּוּ כִּ֤י לְהִלָּחֵֽם־בּוֹ֙ הִתְחַפֵּ֔שׂ וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֛ע אֶל־דִּבְרֵ֥י נְכ֖וֹ מִפִּ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֕א לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בְּבִקְעַ֥ת מְגִדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Josiah would not let him alone; instead, he donned [his armor] to fight him, heedless of Necho’s words from the mouth of God; and he came to fight in the plain of Megiddo.
Transliteration: velo-hesev yoshiyahu fanayv mimenu khiy lehilachem-vvo hitechafesh velo shama el-diverey nekhvo mifiy Elohim vayavo lehilachem vevikeat megidvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּרוּ֙ הַיֹּרִ֔ים לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ לַעֲבָדָיו֙ הַעֲבִיר֔וּנִי כִּ֥י הׇחֳלֵ֖יתִי מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Archers shot King Josiah, and the king said to his servants, “Get me away from here, for I am badly wounded.”
Transliteration: vayoru hayoriym lamelekhe yoshiyahu vayomer hamelekhe laavadayv haaviyruniy khiy hׇcholeytiy meod

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבִירֻ֨הוּ עֲבָדָ֜יו מִן־הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֗ה וַֽיַּרְכִּיבֻ֘הוּ֮ עַ֣ל רֶ֣כֶב הַמִּשְׁנֶה֮ אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֒ וַיּוֹלִיכֻ֙הוּ֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיָּ֕מׇת וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּקִבְר֣וֹת אֲבֹתָ֑יו וְכׇל־יְהוּדָה֙ וִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם מִֽתְאַבְּלִ֖ים עַל־יֹאשִׁיָּֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: His servants carried him out of his chariot and put him in the wagon of his second-in-command, and conveyed him to Jerusalem. There he died, and was buried in the grave of his fathers, and all Judah and Jerusalem went into mourning over Josiah.
Transliteration: vayaaviyruhu avadayv min-hamerekhavah vayarekhiyvuhu al rekhev hamisheneh asher-lvo vayyvoliykhuhu yerushala͏im vayamׇt vayikaver vekivervot avotayv vekhׇl-yehudah viyrushala͏im miteaveliym al-yoshiyahu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְקוֹנֵ֣ן יִרְמְיָ֘הוּ֮ עַל־יֹאשִׁיָּ֒הוּ֒ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ כׇֽל־הַשָּׁרִ֣ים <small>׀</small> וְ֠הַשָּׁר֠וֹת בְּקִינ֨וֹתֵיהֶ֤ם עַל־יֹאשִׁיָּ֙הוּ֙ עַד־הַיּ֔וֹם וַיִּתְּנ֥וּם לְחֹ֖ק עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהִנָּ֥ם כְּתוּבִ֖ים עַל־הַקִּינֽוֹת׃
Translated: Jeremiah composed laments for Josiah which all the singers, male and female, recited in their laments for Josiah, as is done to this day; they became customary in Israel and were incorporated into the laments.
Transliteration: vayekvonen yiremeyahu al-yoshiyahu vayomeru khׇl-hashariym <small></small> vehasharvot vekiynvoteyhem al-yoshiyahu ad-hayyvom vayitenum lechok al-yisherael vehinam khetuviym al-hakiynvot

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י יֹאשִׁיָּ֖הוּ וַחֲסָדָ֑יו כַּכָּת֖וּב בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Josiah’s reign and his faithful deeds, in accord with the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small>,
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yoshiyahu vachasadayv khakhatuv vetvorat yehovah

Hebrew: וּדְבָרָ֕יו הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרֹנִ֑ים הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַל־סֵ֥פֶר מַלְכֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וִיהוּדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and his acts, early and late, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
Transliteration: udevarayv harishoniym vehaacharoniym hinam khetuviym al-sefer malekhey-yisherael viyhudah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְחוּ֙ עַם־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֶת־יְהוֹאָחָ֖ז בֶּן־יֹאשִׁיָּ֑הוּ וַיַּמְלִיכֻ֥הוּ תַֽחַת־אָבִ֖יו בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: The people of the land took Jehoahaz son of Josiah and made him king instead of his father in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayikechu am-haarets et-yehvoachaz ven-yoshiyahu vayameliykhuhu tachat-aviyv viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: בֶּן־שָׁל֧וֹשׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה יוֹאָחָ֣ז בְּמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-shalvosh veesheriym shanah yvoachaz vemׇlekhvo usheloshah chodashiym malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיְסִירֵ֥הוּ מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַֽיַּעֲנֹשׁ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵאָ֥ה כִכַּר־כֶּ֖סֶף וְכִכַּ֥ר זָהָֽב׃
Translated: The king of Egypt deposed him in Jerusalem and laid a fine on the land of 100 silver talents and one gold talent.
Transliteration: vayesiyrehu melekhe-mitserayiim viyrushala͏im vayaanosh et-haarets meah khikhar-khesef vekhikhar zahav

Hebrew: וַיַּמְלֵ֨ךְ מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֜יִם אֶת־אֶלְיָקִ֣ים אָחִ֗יו עַל־יְהוּדָה֙ וִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וַיַּסֵּ֥ב אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוֹיָקִ֑ים וְאֶת־יוֹאָחָ֤ז אָחִיו֙ לָקַ֣ח נְכ֔וֹ וַיְבִיאֵ֖הוּ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃ {פ}
Translated: The king of Egypt made his brother Eliakim king over Judah and Jerusalem, and changed his name to Jehoiakim; Necho took his brother Joahaz and brought him to Egypt.
Transliteration: vayamelekhe melekhe-mitserayiim et-eleyakiym achiyv al-yehudah viyrushala͏im vayasev et-shemvo yehvoyakiym veet-yvoachaz achiyv lakach nekhvo vayeviyehu mitserayemah {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ יְהוֹיָקִ֣ים בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הָרַ֔ע בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; he did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small> his God.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym vechamesh shanah yehvoyakiym vemׇlekhvo veachat eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im vayaash hara veeyney yehovah elohayv

Hebrew: עָלָ֣יו עָלָ֔ה נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֖ר מֶ֣לֶךְ בָּבֶ֑ל וַיַּאַסְרֵ֙הוּ֙ בַּֽנְחֻשְׁתַּ֔יִם לְהֹלִיכ֖וֹ בָּבֶֽלָה׃
Translated: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched against him; he bound him in fetters to convey him to Babylon.
Transliteration: alayv alah nevukhadenetsar melekhe vavel vayaaserehu vanechushetayiim leholiykhvo vavelah

Hebrew: וּמִכְּלֵי֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה הֵבִ֥יא נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֖ר לְבָבֶ֑ל וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם בְּהֵיכָל֖וֹ בְּבָבֶֽל׃
Translated: Nebuchadnezzar also brought some vessels of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> to Babylon, and set them in his palace in Babylon.
Transliteration: umikheley veyt yehovah heviy nevukhadenetsar levavel vayitenem veheykhalvo vevavel

Hebrew: וְיֶ֩תֶר֩ דִּבְרֵ֨י יְהוֹיָקִ֜ים וְתֹעֲבֹתָ֤יו אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֙ וְהַנִּמְצָ֣א עָלָ֔יו הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר מַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וִיהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹיָכִ֥ין בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: The other events of Jehoiakim’s reign, and the abominable things he did, and what was found against him, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah. His son Jehoiachin succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yehvoyakiym vetoavotayv asher-ashah vehanimetsa alayv hinam khetuviym al-sefer malekhey yisherael viyhudah vayimelokhe yehvoyakhiyn venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁמוֹנֶ֤ה שָׁנִים֙ יְהוֹיָכִ֣ין בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה חֳדָשִׁים֙ וַעֲשֶׂ֣רֶת יָמִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Jehoiachin was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem; he did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: ven-shemvoneh shaniym yehvoyakhiyn vemׇlekhvo usheloshah chodashiym vaasheret yamiym malakhe viyrushala͏im vayaash hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלִתְשׁוּבַ֣ת הַשָּׁנָ֗ה שָׁלַח֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ נְבֽוּכַדְנֶאצַּ֔ר וַיְבִאֵ֣הוּ בָבֶ֔לָה עִם־כְּלֵ֖י חֶמְדַּ֣ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּמְלֵךְ֙ אֶת־צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ אָחִ֔יו עַל־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: At the turn of the year, King Nebuchadnezzar sent to have him brought to Babylon with the precious vessels of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, and he made his kinsman Zedekiah king over Judah and Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veliteshuvat hashanah shalach hamelekhe nevukhadenetsar vayeviehu vavelah im-kheley chemedat veyt-yehovah vayamelekhe et-tsidekiyahu achiyv al-yehudah viyrushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֧ים וְאַחַ֛ת שָׁנָ֖ה צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ בְמׇלְכ֑וֹ וְאַחַ֤ת עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: ven-esheriym veachat shanah tsidekiyahu vemׇlekhvo veachat eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הָרַ֔ע בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו לֹ֣א נִכְנַ֗ע מִלִּפְנֵ֛י יִרְמְיָ֥הוּ הַנָּבִ֖יא מִפִּ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small> his God; he did not humble himself before the prophet Jeremiah, who spoke for the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah elohayv lo nikhena milifeney yiremeyahu hanaviy mifiy yehovah

Hebrew: וְ֠גַ֠ם בַּמֶּ֤לֶךְ נְבֽוּכַדְנֶאצַּר֙ מָרָ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁבִּיע֖וֹ בֵּאלֹהִ֑ים וַיֶּ֤קֶשׁ אֶת־עׇרְפּוֹ֙ וַיְאַמֵּ֣ץ אֶת־לְבָב֔וֹ מִשּׁ֕וּב אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He also rebelled against Nebuchadnezzar, who made him take an oath by God; he stiffened his neck and hardened his heart so as not to turn to the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel.
Transliteration: vegam vamelekhe nevukhadenetsar marad asher hisheviyvo velohiym vayekesh et-ׇrefvo vayeamets et-levavvo mishuv el-yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: גַּ֠ם כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֨י הַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים וְהָעָם֙ הִרְבּ֣וּ (למעול) [לִמְעׇל־]מַ֔עַל כְּכֹ֖ל תֹּעֲב֣וֹת הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וַֽיְטַמְּאוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִקְדִּ֖ישׁ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: All the officers of the priests and the people committed many trespasses, following all the abominable practices of the nations. They polluted the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, which He had consecrated in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: gam khׇl-sharey hakhohaniym vehaam hirevu (lmvl) [limeׇl-]maal khekhol toavvot hagvoyim vayetameu et-veyt yehovah asher hikediysh viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֡ח יְהֹוָה֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֧ם עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם בְּיַ֥ד מַלְאָכָ֖יו הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם וְשָׁל֑וֹחַ כִּֽי־חָמַ֥ל עַל־עַמּ֖וֹ וְעַל־מְעוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers had sent word to them through His messengers daily without fail, for He had pity on His people and His dwelling-place.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehovah elohey avvoteyhem aleyhem veyad maleakhayv hashekhem veshalvocha khiy-chamal al-amvo veal-mevonvo

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֤וּ מַלְעִבִים֙ בְּמַלְאֲכֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּבוֹזִ֣ים דְּבָרָ֔יו וּמִֽתַּעְתְּעִ֖ים בִּנְבִאָ֑יו עַ֠ד עֲל֧וֹת חֲמַת־יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּעַמּ֖וֹ עַד־לְאֵ֥ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃
Translated: But they mocked the messengers of God and disdained His words and taunted His prophets until the wrath of the L<small>ORD</small> against His people grew beyond remedy.
Transliteration: vayiheyu maleiviym vemaleakhey haElohim uvvoziym devarayv umitaeteiym vineviayv ad alvot chamat-yehovah veamvo ad-leeyn marefe

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל עֲלֵיהֶ֜ם אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ (כשדיים) [כַּשְׂדִּ֗ים] וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג בַּחוּרֵיהֶ֤ם בַּחֶ֙רֶב֙ בְּבֵ֣ית מִקְדָּשָׁ֔ם וְלֹ֥א חָמַ֛ל עַל־בָּח֥וּר וּבְתוּלָ֖ה זָקֵ֣ן וְיָשֵׁ֑שׁ הַכֹּ֖ל נָתַ֥ן בְּיָדֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He therefore brought the king of the Chaldeans upon them, who killed their youths by the sword in their sanctuary; He did not spare youth, maiden, elder, or graybeard, but delivered all into his hands.
Transliteration: vayaal aleyhem et-melekhe (khshdyym) [khashediym] vayaharog vachureyhem vacherev veveyt mikedasham velo chamal al-vachur uvetulah zaken veyashesh hakhol natan veyadvo {s}

Hebrew: וְ֠כֹ֠ל כְּלֵ֞י בֵּ֤ית הָאֱלֹהִים֙ הַגְּדֹלִ֣ים וְהַקְּטַנִּ֔ים וְאֹֽצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֹצְר֥וֹת הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְשָׂרָ֑יו הַכֹּ֖ל הֵבִ֥יא בָבֶֽל׃
Translated: All the vessels of the House of God, large and small, and the treasures of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and the treasures of the king and his officers were all brought to Babylon.
Transliteration: vekhol kheley veyt haElohim hagedoliym vehaketaniym veotservot veyt yehovah veotservot hamelekhe vesharayv hakhol heviy vavel

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׂרְפוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַֽיְנַתְּצ֔וּ אֵ֖ת חוֹמַ֣ת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְכׇל־אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ שָׂרְפ֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וְכׇל־כְּלֵ֥י מַחֲמַדֶּ֖יהָ לְהַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated: They burned the House of God and tore down the wall of Jerusalem, burned down all its mansions, and consigned all its precious objects to destruction.
Transliteration: vayisherefu et-veyt haElohim vayenatetsu et chvomat yerushala͏im vekhׇl-aremenvoteyha sharefu vaesh vekhׇl-kheley machamadeyha lehashechiyt

Hebrew: וַיֶּ֛גֶל הַשְּׁאֵרִ֥ית מִן־הַחֶ֖רֶב אֶל־בָּבֶ֑ל וַיִּֽהְיוּ־ל֤וֹ וּלְבָנָיו֙ לַעֲבָדִ֔ים עַד־מְלֹ֖ךְ מַלְכ֥וּת פָּרָֽס׃
Translated: Those who survived the sword he exiled to Babylon, and they became his and his sons’ servants till the rise of the Persian kingdom,
Transliteration: vayegel hasheeriyt min-hacherev el-vavel vayiheyu-lvo ulevanayv laavadiym ad-melokhe malekhut faras

Hebrew: לְמַלֹּ֤אות דְּבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּפִ֣י יִרְמְיָ֔הוּ עַד־רָצְתָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ אֶת־שַׁבְּתוֹתֶ֑יהָ כׇּל־יְמֵ֤י הׇשַּׁמָּה֙ שָׁבָ֔תָה לְמַלֹּ֖אות שִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: in fulfillment of the word of the L<small>ORD</small> spoken by Jeremiah, until the land paid back its sabbaths; as long as it lay desolate it kept sabbath, till seventy years were completed.
Transliteration: lemalovt devar-yehovah vefiy yiremeyahu ad-ratsetah haarets et-shavetvoteyha khׇl-yemey hׇshamah shavatah lemalovt shiveiym shanah {s}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַ֣ת אַחַ֗ת לְכ֙וֹרֶשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרַ֔ס לִכְל֥וֹת דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּפִ֣י יִרְמְיָ֑הוּ הֵעִ֣יר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־ר֙וּחַ֙ כּ֣וֹרֶשׁ מֶלֶךְ־פָּרַ֔ס וַיַּֽעֲבֶר־קוֹל֙ בְּכׇל־מַלְכוּת֔וֹ וְגַם־בְּמִכְתָּ֖ב לֵאמֹֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: And in the first year of King Cyrus of Persia, when the word of the L<small>ORD</small> spoken by Jeremiah was fulfilled, the L<small>ORD</small> roused the spirit of King Cyrus of Persia to issue a proclamation throughout his realm by word of mouth and in writing, as follows:
Transliteration: uvishenat achat lekhvoresh melekhe faras likhelvot devar-yehovah vefiy yiremeyahu heiyr yehovah et-rucha khvoresh melekhe-faras vayaaver-kvol vekhׇl-malekhutvo vegam-vemikhetav lemor {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־אָמַ֞ר כּ֣וֹרֶשׁ ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ פָּרַ֗ס כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֤וֹת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ נָ֣תַן לִ֗י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְהֽוּא־פָקַ֤ד עָלַי֙ לִבְנֽוֹת־ל֣וֹ בַ֔יִת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּיהוּדָ֑ה מִי־בָכֶ֣ם מִכׇּל־עַמּ֗וֹ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהָ֛יו עִמּ֖וֹ וְיָֽעַל׃
Translated: “Thus said King Cyrus of Persia: The L<small>ORD</small> God of Heaven has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, and has charged me with building Him a House in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Any one of you of all His people, the L<small>ORD</small> his God be with him and let him go up.”
Transliteration: khoh-amar khvoresh melekhe faras khׇl-mamelekhvot haarets natan liy yehovah elohey hashamayiim vehu-fakad alay livenvot-lvo vayiit viyrushala͏im asher viyhudah miy-vakhem mikhׇl-amvo yehovah elohayv imvo veyaal
